description:
This is my all time FAVORITE boba spot. I have been coming to this location ever since I was a little kid and it was and still is my go to. This boba spot is the only location that is opened until midnight and that is one of the many things I love about it. 

I usually order either the Tapioca Milk Tea ($3.75) or the Strawberry Tapioca ($4.75) and every so often, I'll order the popcorn chicken ($7.50). Their tapioca milk tea is the best Hong Kong style milk tea I've had in the city. It is the perfect combination of milk and tea and their boba is always consistent. However, I do know this type of milk tea flavor is not everyone's favorite (some of my friends and other people I know that have tried it thinks it tastes like coffee). The Strawberry Tapioca has two options: powder strawberry or fresh strawberry. And both options are really good. If you're looking for something sweet and refreshing, I would recommend the fresh strawberry boba. And if you're looking for something just sweet and a little different, the powder strawberry tapioca is great too. Although it's weird (and probably not the healthiest) that they use strawberry flavored powder to make it, it's surprisingly SO good. Lastly, their salt and pepper popcorn chicken is probably one of my top favorite pop corn chickens in the city. It does take a little while to make it, but it's completely worth the wait. The chicken is crispy on the outside, juicy and hot on the inside, and it's also topped with salt, pepper, basil leaves, and you have the option of making it spicy. 

In addition to being a boba shop and having some food options, they also have a wide variety of candy, dried fruits, and they make their own tea eggs. Everything about this shop is very straightforward. No matter how long the wait is, they always make your order within a reasonable amount of time and if you aren't satisfied with your drink or you need adjustments, they'll fix it with no hesitation. In addition, they are open until midnight, which has been very convenient for me when I get those late night cravings. The only down side about this spot is it's cash only. But other than that, I would 200% recommend this location!!
author: Victoria H.

description:
This business claims to have the best boba in town, but this review isn't about that. Their popcorn chicken though.. let's talk about that.

They make some darn good popcorn chicken or on their menu, salt and pepper chicken. Chicken is cooked properly, outside is crispy, fried basil is on point, batter is salted nicely but still has a sweet taste to it. It's good!! But not $8 good. A small little bag was $8, at that price point I need a little more please and because of that I probably, most likely, won't be going back. Except, maybe, for their boba. But like I said, this review isn't about that. 

If you want to try it, go for it, just FYI, it's CASH ONLY. Oh and they have bins of candy at the sides of the store though I don't know how often those are replaced.
author: Christene M.

description:
I love that they have candy here (not that I've gotten anything yet.. but I love all those dried salted/sour prune/plums things)..

I've gotten a real taro shake here.. it was okay.. I guess I like the fake stuff more. So I might get that next time. (they have real and fake taro here).

But, it's my partner's favorite boba spot.
author: Lilian L.

description:
My first impression of Wonderful was nottt super great. The inside is dimly lit, doesn't look very clean, and half of the menu is handwritten. Very hole-in-the-wall.

We got a papaya smoothie with boba and a Thai tea with boba. The smoothie and the tea were actually decent, but nothing really amazing (I thought the papaya smoothie was pretty good in the beginning, but halfway through it didn't taste that good anymore). The boba, however, was very disappointing. It was mushy on the outside, but somehow tasted slightly undercooked in the center; it was also almost tasteless. I don't understand the 1k+ 4 star rating... would not recommend. Probably wouldn't come back here again with i-Tea just down the street.
author: Alice C.

description:
This is my childhood. When you and your friends grew up in SF and have been drinking boba for probably 15+ years and everyone universally agrees this is the spot. Well, this is the spot.

Cash only. Sometimes the quality varies based on who's making it. But, this is the place to go. I wish they had more tables/chairs and made it more of a sit-down place but I guess we'll just loiter outside or in our cars.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Wonderful doesn't need to change a thing!

+ run down, hole in the wall gives it a legit ambiance. there is literally only one table with 2 benches for chairs
+ the sweetener they use is not sugar, i'm not really sure what it is, but it tastes amazing

+ mango smoothie is super thicc and delicious
+ basic milk tea is a classic and can't go wrong
author: Marjo M.

description:
Visited Wonderful Dessert & Cafe once before when I was on my way back home an hour way and wanted something to drink. This was the only place opened at the time and I decided to give it shot. Now that I moved to SF, this is one of my bf's and my go-to spots! 

The appearance of the store is very underwhelming but the drink quality definitely makes up for it. When you enter the store, you will be greeted by an array of candy choices. The store name has "desserts" in it but I don't really see any dessert item on the menu....There's also no seats in the store except for one table.... LITERALLY one table. If you are going to come here with friends, don't expect to be staying long because the table only seats 4 people. 

I've only tried their white gourd tea and that's enough for me to want to come back multiple times. That's how good it is. It's a bit on the sweeter side so just ask the barista to make it less sweet if you're not into sweet drinks. 

Please find a way to add more tables for those who are waiting for their drinks!!!
author: Quynh L.

description:
I never thought I would repeatedly spend $7 on popcorn chicken but I've already been here 3 or 4 times since I first visited in June.

This place is THE best popcorn chicken place in the bay area. No contest. 

The store is lined with a bunch of candy containers - reminiscent of a sweet factory or the like. The old fashioned boba store flavors and menu. 

The popcorn chicken is a work of art though. Perfectly fried, there is a hint of garlic in each bite, it's been seasoned perfectly, and the fried basil that accompanies it is enough to bring tears to your eyes.
author: Mari Y.

description:
This is the og boba spot in sf!!!! It's the best. I've lived in sf my whole like and have been coming here since I was a kid. With boba place popping up all over the city this place is still my favorite. They are a great menu of drinks and use fresh ingredients. The boba is a great texture and they also have pudding and almond jelly that you may not see on the menu. There isn't a drink on there I don't like. My recs: mango, original milk tea, almond milk tea with almond jello, taro smoothie with real taro and Pinapple with lychee jelly and boba! 
This is a must stop by boba place in sf!!!
author: Andrea W.

description:
I love this local boba shop. Ever since I was a young girl, I would come here for their fruit smoothie bobas and admire their collection of candy. They range from your typical gummy worms to authentic Chinese ginger candy. 

What I love most about this place is how they use real fruit! Over the years, they've definitely added more flavors. My favorites are the strawberry mango, plain mango, and lychee. Their tapioca balls aren't sweeten but are super soft. It's not as cheap as other places, but you're definitely getting a quality drink and supporting a local business.
author: Melinda L.

description:
For all the people giving 1/3 stars are obviously The ones who are big fans of Quickly's or big fans of the ultimate hipster hyped up boba spots so don't know squaaaaaat about a legit boba spot. One if you're making popcorn chicken without basil you're not legit. They got basil here. Two if you think Quickly's is better you're like the person going to a legit burger spot and thinking McDonalds is the best hamburger ever. 

This is literally the best boba spot in town. Outside of LA Arcadia area I swear I can't find a more legit spot. Maybe one in San Jose but this is the best one in SF. The only thing I wish they made here in terms of snacks are fried tofu. Ugh if she made fried tofu here my life would be complete.
author: Noelle C.

description:
This is one of no less than 4 boba shops in the neighborhood, but I'm a little partial to Wonderful Dessert & Cafe because of the nostalgia factor. It reminds me of this little hole in the wall I used to frequent as a child before boba became an industry in the US, when all drinks were served in snap lid cups and boba cost $1.75. The good ol' days. (sigh)

Rating Breakdown:

1.5/2 Stars for Taste --
The only thing I get here is the classic boba milk tea...sometimes I branch out and try the boba green milk tea. The reason being that most of the drinks are prepared from flavor powders, which I'm not really into. The milk tea will grow some hair on your chest though, which I love. This isn't somewhere where you ask for 30-50-70% sweet, the most customization I dare venture for is ice/no-ice. The boba here is hit or miss. Most of the time it's great...I even left some in the fridge overnight and it was still the right side of chewy in the morning. Sometimes though, it's overcooked and you just get a mouthful of mush. Those are dark days.

0.5/1 Stars for Value --
A small boba milk tea here is $3.25, which is about $.50 less than you would pay at a more modern boba shop. However some of their other customizable drinks can run closer to $4, which really is no different from other places, though the quality of ingredients elsewhere would probably be higher.

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Workers here are efficient. Pro-tip: if you're a paying customer and you're lucky, they'll let you use the employee bathroom. I've seen them turn people away though!

Bonus star because I always come here when I'm not feeling i-Tea and I always bring my friends who would appreciate a boba blast from the past.
author: Abby W.

description: Yup still 5-stars, this is just the "best in town" OG, tapioca spot. Almond milk tea FTW. If we're ever in the area this place is a no brainer. Parking is hard on Irving so easiest to plan to have someone pop down and grab and go.
author: Melody T.

description:
This was supposed to be the original boba place in SF, though if you went in, it looks more like a candy shop at the front, and a boba place at the back.

I got the passion fruit green tea and it had both good and bad elements. The good elements were that the green tea flavor was strong, it seemed they had soaked it in the tea leaves for quite a bit longer which was quite nice. The boba was also decent, though it was more of just a plain sugary flavor.

The bad elements were that the passionfruit did taste quite a bit artificial, like some so-so syrup was mixed into the boba itself. And while the price was fair at around $4, for the price I don't think the drink was really worth it.
author: Tyler T.

description:
There's so many boba places in the Sunset, yet I find myself frequenting Wonderful Dessert & Cafe quite often. Their milk tea is very good, primarily because you can actually taste the bitter tea flavor mixed with the mild sweetness of the drink. They by default don't add a lot of ice, which is a great plus.

In addition to milk tea drinks, they also have a wide variety of candy lined up to satisfy your candy cravings.
author: Alvin W.

description: I don't understand the 1000 4-Star reviews... maybe because this place used to be the only boba drinks in the area? It's a pretty dingy dive. American candy selections on one side (like the ol' Sweet Factory days) and Chinese varieties along the other wall. Seeing the dried salty prunes brought back fond childhood memories. Their boba menu reminds me of quickly. Tried their pudding tapioca milk tea for $4.75 and didn't find it to be remarkable. Won't be back.
author: Cathrin P C.

description:
Every time I come here, I know I'm in for a dangerous treat. I LOVE the taste of their original milk tea.

HOWEVER, I literally get a stomach ache after drinking this delicious poison 100% of the time (which is why I don't come here as much anymore). 

I also loved getting their fried chicken. They're tasty too.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
My boyfriend introduced me to Wonderful a few years ago and ever since then we've been coming here every so often when we are in the area.

Located in Sunset, parking is difficult throughout the daytime, but evening is not so bad. The store front itself is outdated and as soon as you enter it's candy galore. Decor is nonexistent and there aren't any seating available. In general, the shop doesn't exactly scream boba place.

My favorite drinks includes the Avocado and Coffee/Mocha Tapioca. Both are tasty and the tapioca pearls are soft and chewy.

Service is quick. Prices are average, but they have been increasing it lately and sadly, it is CASH only!

Although the store isn't particularly attractive, I think the drinks are worth a try. They are also open later than other boba places, which is great!
author: Julia L.

description:
My usual is the strawberry smoothie with boba, less sweet! It's not a slush but more of a purée texture which I'm super fond of. It's cold but not freezing cold lol can anyone else appreciate that? Hahahah. I just love how they use fresh fruit here, which is probably what accounts for the slightly steep pricing. The smoothie currently goes for $4.75 for 16oz but boba in the city is pretty much $5 bucks a pop these days. 

Other things to note: 
- Their avocado smoothie is also bomb if you're craving for something creamy and fatty
- Any of their fresh fruit drinks are pretty much a green light! 
- Regular milk tea has a hint of a coffee taste
- They also sell candy & preserved fruits here!!! I love the sweet plums! 
- They also have bomb popcorn chicken & fried calamari!
author: Marny N.

description:
The avocado shake was pretty good. Don't do it with pearls/bobba. It's not necessary. That stuff is bad for you anyway, nothing but powder, artificial flavors and sugar. 

The place smells like fermented eggs and floor wash. They really aren't trying very hard. 

I can imagine the low price, take away food options being a great alternative but when you walk into a place that smells funny, it inevitably give you funny thoughts about your food...I am just saying...
author: Xiu L.

description: A friend told me that this place is really good, knows the owner pretty well and wanted to get me a drink from here for my opinion. I am a total milk tea fan but I'm not a fan of this place.Their milk tea was way too sweet for me and caused me to get sick. I also dislike the toppings to the milk tea. Pearls (boba) were too chewy and I don't like how they cut up the grass jelly to tiny pieces as the size of those aloe jelly.
author: Vy N.

description:
When it comes to boba, I normally choose our destinations, but when the hubby said he found a spot for us to try, I was intrigued and even a little moved that he found one for me. The number of miles we traveled for boba is numerous, but he never complains. (He's the best!)

Traveling to San Francisco for boba is definitely a hassle, from the bumper-to-bumper traffic to the horrendous parking situation, but we were lucky enough to find a spot practically right in front of Wonderful Dessert & Cafe. At first glance, I was VERY hesitant about the boba here. It's a shop that serves Asian "candy" (not all of them are sweet, but people do eat them for fun) and your typical candies, and then boba as well. The menu is written with markers on poster paper and the names are a bit confusing. For instance, one drink was called almond tapioca, leading me to believe it was only a cup with almond flavored tapioca pearls, but it's actually a milk tea WITH tapioca. 

Keeping an open mind, I ordered the green milk tea with tapioca and the hubby chose Thai tea with tapioca. I really dislike cash only policies, but the prices here are dirt cheap, so I suppose it makes up for it. There are two cup sizes, but we just went for the regular small one. I took that sip and felt my eyes grow ten times in size.

PERFECT...I was astonished! It was probably one of the best green milk teas I have ever had. It was herbal, it was creamy, and it was sweet. I went to town! And the tapioca pearls were just as perfect. They had that delightfully chewy texture and was sweet as well, but they never overpowered the drink. I will say they gave us way too much though. The hubby's Thai iced tea had a good bitter undertone that contrasted with the sweet, creamy base very well. He finished the whole cup in no time.

Wonderful Dessert & Cafe is probably one of the most run-down places we've ever been to for boba. Decor is nonexistent and the candy selection is confusing and random. The menu is strange and the cash only policy is annoying, but the boba...my goodness, the boba was amazing. 

Perhaps I should let the hubby choose all of our boba destinations from now on because he clearly knows what he's doing. Absolutely wonderful!
author: Quyen L.

description: They have so many different choices of candy! I had to get some gummy bears and sour gummy worms! 1/4 pound for a dollar! I tried their jasmine milk tea with boba. It was on the creamy/milky side and the tea taste wasn't as strong. Tasted like milk cream with barely any tea. Boba was a bit soggy but still chewy.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I never tried their other drinks but their almond milk tea is really good! Yum! It's pretty sweet but so flavorful. I just wished the boba was honey boba because it's pretty bland. PS: cash only! And there's no seatings to hang out here.
author: Debbie D.

description:
Their avocado smoothies are the most amazing things!! I only get avocado smoothies every single time. I've been coming here almost every day, sometimes multiple times a day for the past few months because I'm so addicted. So smooth and creamy. They make me so happy. They put avocados, milk, ice and sugar I think. They put some brown sauce in it and even when I order no boba, it kind of tastes like boba, so maybe it's boba sauce. They also taste it with a stick before pouring it out to make sure it tastes okay and if not, they add more sugar or something. The boba is also extremely chewy and tender like a mochi. But sometimes I spit it out because I got teeth issues and can't swallow. Not too hard, not too soft. 

The truth is, the smoothie quality is not always consistent. It really depends on who's making it. There are some people who make really good avocado smoothies, like the owner lady and this other young Asian girl. There are some other people who make the smoothie so watery!! It needs to be smooth and creamy. But it's still good though. Maybe they just don't have enough experience. 

They have tons of different bulk candy and dried fruits and Asian dried snacks. Not really seating here. They have machines where you put quarters in and get a plastic ball with a little toy in it. But I think the machines are empty. It's a more down to earth mum and pop kind of place instead of a boppity hipster place. So it's a more comfy vibe. It's nice that it's open until midnight.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Wonderful Dessert & Cafe is a cafe of wonderful desserts!

This place is wonderful! They boast themselves as being "The Best Tapioca in Town" which is a phrase plastered right by their store entrance. Unlike a large majority of newfangled boba places in the area, Wonderful Dessert & Cafe sticks to the basics. They stick to the OG way of boba passed amongst the many generations of boba aficionados and virtuosos. I like the tapioca here as it is consistently nice and chewy whereas many other places are very inconsistent in the matter. They have a huge variety of flavors and drinks such as their avocado smoothie, thai milk tea, and lychee green tea. I've had a good experience with all their drinks and would recommend going for anything that sticks out to you.

Another wonderful thing about this cafe is the variety of candy and treats laid out against the wall. They have a bunch of gummy and sour candies as well as more traditional Chinese snacks such as dried fruits and tea eggs. There's a ton to choose from. They also have fried goodies you can order such as lobster balls and popcorn chicken which I've never tried but look great.
author: Joshua M.

description:
My favorite place to order honey green tea and popcorn chicken! My drink is always pretty consistent here, unlike some other places where the sweetness or taste can be a hit or miss. BEST POPCORN CHICKEN I'VE EVER HAD! Make sure to let them know if you want it spicy/non spicy and they will accommodate! This place also has a large selection of candy and sometimes they have the braised soy sauce boiled egg pot on the table! The only downfall is that this place can have quite a line and you can be waiting for 30 mins! 

CASH ONLY!
author: Mauricia L.

description:
This is the most authentic boba I've ever had in America, hands down. Wonderful Dessert has literally zero ambiance, which I love, because it makes it a hidden gem away from TPumps, i-Tea, and the other more popular boba places down the street. Their drinks are really rich, and if you get any fruit in your drink, you can taste how fresh it is. 

I loved my avocado smoothie, which was creamy without being heavy. The boba was perfectly sweetened, and the perfect amount of chewy. I want to try all their other interesting flavors next time!
author: Denise L.

description:
Whenever I'm in SF I always make a stop here and order the #10 Almond Tapioca with light boba.  I haven't been able to find something like it down in OC and it's been consistently BoGood.  Everything from the almond flavor to the boba quality is great.  I haven't tried the snacks at all but my Dad loves getting some of the different candy there.

Overall: BoGood
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Yummy bubble tea !!! When I first entered I thought it was a candy store but the bubble tea counter is st the end of the room. Very good boba 9/10 and the flavours available for teas and drinks are amazing. I recommend the regular milk tea ($3.75) and the honeydew ($4.75 approx)!! My friend also got the avocado ($5.75), papaya and fresh mango which was excellent, but on the sweeter side. The Thai milk tea is very sweet too so ask about the sweetness content before ordering your drink. 

Note : Ask for the fresh fruit specials and that way you get what's in season hence fresh. You can also ask for almond milk instead of regular milk or even coconut milk. 

Will go back for sure and recommend it to all!!
author: Shivani B.

description: I ordered a popcorn chicken and they asked me if I wanted it spicy, I said no. When I got it, it was spicy. Went to the girl at the register and asked her if she gave me the spicy one and she examined it and took a while to say no it's not spicy. I'm really sensitive when it come to spicy things so I knew for sure it was spicy. Even the bag had a red sauce or powder on it. What I don't get is why is it so hard to just own up to your mistake and just make me a new one instead of lying. I call them back and then she explained to me that they cook the popcorn chicken together and sometimes the spicy mixes with the non-spicy. Why have the option of spicy and non-spicy then if whatever you get it going to be spicy. I get this chicken all the time at sweet hut (exact same place different name) on clement and it's never spicy. Waste of money and my time driving back for a refund.
author: Katie W.

description:
After eating at San Tung, we were looking for a boba place and this seemed like a great option since it was 0.6 miles away and there were 1,000+ reviews rating this 4 stars. 

Upon entry, there's bulk candy you can weigh. Both American gummies and the Asian candies. It's about $1.75 per quarter pound. For the pricing and selection, it's pretty good.

I ordered the pudding milk tea with boba. The tea was pretty bitter and the milk pudding didn't taste fresh. I gave it another star because of the service. They didn't hear my order correctly and didn't add boba to it. Without reluctance, they redid my milk tea. 

I probably wouldn't come back for boba unless my bf wanted to get bulk candy.
author: Anna C.

description:
Finally decided to try this place out, because I saw so many good reviews. I ordered the popcorn chicken (spicy) and a milk tea WITHOUT boba.
 
I don't understand what's so "wonderful" about this place. I saw a review about the milk tea having a slight coffee flavor and mine did too. However, it had a sour after taste and did NOT taste like milk or tea! The amount of chicken doesn't even compare to other boba/snack shops! Yes it was crunchy, but it was a small bag of chicken that was NOT spicy and bland-ish yet a bit sweet for $8.00. Not worth it, please get chicken somewhere else.

I gave this place a 1 star because she was nice enough to take my order when it was almost closing time. But after ordering just once, I don't think I'll come back.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
My friends and I wanted boba and most were closed at the time besides Wonderful so we decided to give it a try! I got the avocado drink without boba and it was delicious! I also loved how they had a candy section to feed our sweet tooth needs! Overall, we'll definitely be coming back. 

FYI it's cash only!!
author: An L.

description:
I love how fresh their boba and fruits are! it was also really cheap compared to all the other boba places around. I got their watermelon boba and it was so refreshing. the inside design is definitely lacking, but I'm there for the boba so it's okay! They are also pretty fast. I'm impressed cause it's just the mom and the son, from what I assumed haha. 

I think this place is cash only. So take note on that. The price includes taxes though so that's nice ;)
author: Jen K.

description:
# 28 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 

I had very high expectations for this place based on other reviews but perhaps I just hit it on a bad day?? They seemed to have preprepared milk tea and the taste of the milk tea and boba was below average to me. This combo of factors caused me to give it a ranking of 3/3 in my milk tea taste/boba taste scale of 1 to 10 and a 2 yelp star reveiw. 

Please see my comprehensive rankings of SF Boba spots below. 

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.

# 24 Quickly *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 25 Plentea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 26 Mi tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 27 Ten Ren Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 28 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 29 Out the Door *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 30 I Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
I would define Wonderful Dessert & Cafe as the epitome of a hole-in-wall boba spot with zero bells or whistles. They're straight Chinese folks slanging good tapioca drinks for a decent price. There is no need for hype, gimmicks, and tricks when the products you're selling are quality. I've yet to try any of their snacks from their not-clean appearing kitchen (which probably means the food will be yummy).

For wonderful time, go to the Wonderful.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I agree this is one of the best tapioca in town!  Wonderful's drinks are always so good and fresh.  The boba is consistently soft and chewy and their fruit smoothies are made with real fruit, so they taste amazing!

My favorite drinks from here are the tapioca milk tea, avocado smoothie, and strawberry smoothie.  The tapioca milk tea has a slight coffee taste to it.  

Drinks are getting more expensive now, but they're still decent ($3-6) and there's lots of options on the menu.  Also, note that it's CASH ONLY!  Though, there are plenty of banks nearby.  Open until midnight for your late night boba runs yaaas
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
I'm surprised I've never written a Yelp review for Wonderful Dessert before, especially since this spot was the first boba shop I've visited in San Francisco! 

They have a huge sign outside that says "Best Tapioca in Town," and it speaks the truth! This is a no frills type of place - boba is perfectly QQ and the tea is delightful. They have tons and tons of different flavors, but you know a boba shop is fantastic when their original milk tea is bomb.com. Cheers! 

$3-5/cup of boba and it's cash only!
author: Christine S.

description: Don't judge a book by its cover because I certainly did when I first entered this establishment. It actually looks more like a candy store than a boba spot since their menu is hidden on the side of the wall. However, fear not fellow Yelpers because their boba drinks deserves more credit than meets the eye. It was a pretty chilly day so I ordered their taro milk tea hot. It was delicious! The tea was incredibly silky and had the right amount of sweetness. I gave my friends a taste and they all liked it as well. They also have fruity drinks on their menu. I didn't get to try any myself, but I didn't hear any complaints from the boo about his watermelon juice. Note that this is a grab and go kind of place. There was only one table inside which seems to be intended for customers waiting for their drinks. Overall, I am pleasantly surprised by this boba shop. I'm glad one of my girlfriends was craving boba after lunch or I would have never found this place.
author: Carmen T.

description: This place is lit yo. I forgot what I ordered but it was a pretty bomb tea. I was actually having a sad day in San Francisco because it was so cold and windy, but whatever drink I ordered from here made me super duper happy. Thanks tea!
author: Anh T.

description:
Walked in on a Sunday night and the place was pretty quiet. From the interior, it doesn't seem that impressive. It looks a bit run down and there's a lot of empty space that could be filled with more tables and chairs. 

However, one look at the menu and none of that matters. The menu is extensive - it covers every flavor of bubble tea (I'm from the East Coast) that you can imagine. There are the traditional milk teas, but there are also fruit flavors and fresh fruit smoothies. The prices are not  cheap, but bubble tea has stopped being cheap years ago. 

I opted for the avocado smoothie with tapioca made less sweet, which came out to be $5.75. I usually don't spend much on drinks, but this was worth it. The smoothie was incredibly creamy, with only a slight hint of sweetness, which I prefer. Nothing beats the taste of fresh avocado and it really comes through in this smoothie. What really knocked me away was how good the tapioca balls were! Perfectly chewy, they bounced back on my teeth. They also tasted like they had been soaking in some kind of malted syrup. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area! Next time I want to try their papaya smoothie with tapioca :)
author: Sophie P.

description: Not good for diabetics or people that have trouble making decisions without having to read entire wall menu. After finally making a decision, I felt like I may have missed a secret ingredient, or an insider recipe. Drink was refreshing. Like that they offer the percentage of sweetener. Would recommend, but not returning, fatso watering hole.
author: Lo B.

description:
I've had the papaya and honeydew smoothies with boba and both were fresh and delicious (slight preference for the papaya). They're most known for their smoothies versus traditional milk tea drinks so I would recommend you try the smoothies for the best experience. 

The storefront itself is not very pleasant though, outdated and not super clean.
author: Claudia C.

description:
This is a pretty small and simple shop, but they are experts at what they do. When you walk in, you're met with options of both Western and Asian candies on both sides. I was recommended this spot for the boba, so I didn't get to try the candy. 

To order boba, you just walk up to the counter and place your order. Their selection isn't huge, but it's pretty diverse. I tried the regular milk tea as well as Thai tea. Both drinks were great, and the tapioca pearls were about as good as I've had. 

I wouldn't rate this place particularly high for service or decor, but I don't think that's why you would choose this spot. It's got good drinks/candy for good prices. 

Parking might be difficult to find, but if you're in the area, it's definitely worth checking out.
author: Daniel M.

description: I've been craving Wonderful Dessert and reminiscing on my experience when I was younger. I went in to the store and it was filthy. The signs were filthy. The floor was filthy. I just stood and looked at the menu trying to remember what I used to order when I was a kid. I started to order and ask if things were fresh or made out of powder. The gentlemen explained the top stuff is made of powder and the below stuff is fresh. I wanted fresh so I ordered a taro and a mango smoothie. We watched the guy wash his hands (no soap) he just rinsed his hands and started making the drink. The ice dispenser was fully opened and he never closed it and it was never closed when we were in the store. The guy then proceeds to make the drink and he doesn't even put a lid on the blenders when they are going. He kept looking over the blender (please don't drop hair in my drink I think). We then get our drinks. I was so disappointed with my drink. I barely drank any of it. I got the mango drink and with each sip I had to spit out mango hairs. Really!?! I was soo mad. I then tried my husband's drink and the taro was so gritty! I don't know what happened to this place. Not how I remember it being...
author: Crissy G.

description:
Wonderfuls is that late 90's early 2000's Asian Sweet Factory and boba shop.

I usually get the peach green tea with boba because it reminds me of the nostalgic flower candy they sell at Mei Wah. It's often too sweet but it's so goooood.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
The condition of the store isn't great. It seems kind of dirty and when you go into the store, there are drawers of candy and other sweets everywhere. Although you would imagine a dream come true in a store where you're surrounded by sweets, that's not the case at all. The candy inside the drawers look disgusting, like it's been there for ages. I wouldn't trust myself to eat anything in the drawers.

Despite the gross candy and uncleanliness of the store, I love the drinks that they make. They're pretty good drinks, especially smoothies. I love watermelon and have been dying to get a good watermelon slush. This place is where I've had the best watermelon slush. Their avocado smoothies are also good. My boyfriend loves their tea eggs as well. So maybe just come for the drinks and eggs but nothing else!
author: Annie H.

description: Wonderfuls and I go way back. I remember coming here as a kid before the whole Quickly's craze started and 10 other boba shops popped up around the block. Something about the candy on the side and the smell of boba here just makes it seem more familiar. I get the regular bubble milk tea and the strong taste of tea is still there. Everywhere else just tastes a little too artificial. Their boba is also nice and chewy, never hard, and semisweet. One of the few boba places I trust.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
I like the milk tea and smoothies here! My favorite is milk tea with herbal (grass) jelly, and the milk tea has a good tea flavor and is not too sweet. I've only had the papaya milk smoothie; I don't think it was fully fresh but it was good too. The fried chicken is good as well.

There is one small table on the side. There are also lots of small jars of candy and other Asian goodies, but I've never bought them before.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Overall: Free street parking on Sunday and after 6pm with fresh fruit smoothies and chewy boba. *CASH ONLY*

To be completely honest, we walked in and the shop and it was incredibly sketch and not very clean. To my surprise, I ordered a honeydew smoothie boba and it was refreshing. We also got the honey green tea boba and it wasn't too sweet and well balanced. Will definitely come back for the other smoothies.
author: Jenny Q.

description: Popcorn chicken cost went up to $8 but the quantity is reduced by more than 50%.  Not a shrewd business model.  The extra star was given for the good flavor.
author: J L.

description:
Wonderful is.. well, wonderful. They serve assortments of candy and milk tea. I've been going here for years and years and it always has the same consistency every time. I always go for the standard tapioca milk tea. $2.75 for a small size of that which is definitely a lot cheaper than most places nowadays. I love how they offer you the alternative small size while most places automatically have the large as their default. 

I like their milk tea here because it kinda has a coffee taste to it. And something about the ice.. I like the ice texture (lol i know you're prolly like huh????) lol! 

CASH ONLY btw!
author: Sydney C.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: parking at night is easy. No wait to order.

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star:  Clean. Candy Ambiance. Fast food service. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: incredibly fresh tapioca even at 11:00pm at night.  Tapioca/Boba is a must try! The strawberry mango smoothie tapioca was great!

_____

Overall Experience

5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Fresh soft tapioca!
author: Elliott N.

description:
Worst taro milk tea I've ever had. Tastes really milky, powdery and fattening. The consistency was super thick as if it was oil fat solidifying. Seriously disgusting. The color itself was super purple, almost neon purple, and that already is a no go for me. Way too much artificial ingredients.

Milk tea: irked that their milk tea isn't advertised as coffee milk tea. One can't assume that theirs includes coffee, what if someone is allergic to it, if anything add coffee to the milk tea menu or warn customers beforehand. People will assume it's regular milk tea hence its name. 

Fingernail girl: she'll clean her fingernails while waiting for your order and its gross cause who knows what she touched or what's underneath her nails. She didn't bother to wash her hands after, and that image was disturbing so I couldn't even finish half of my drink before throwing it out. Unsanitary. 

Pro: cheap milk tea, crispy popcorn chicken, and no lines cause every time I've gone it's been really empty. 

*cash only*

Overall, it's not that wonderful.
author: Angela T.

description: Hands down best boba in the city. I went there around lunch, literally no wait. I was in and out with my drink in less than 3 mins. I got the taro milk tea and although it was a little sweet to my liking the flavor was there. The boba tasted super fresh! They also have a butt load of candy so if that's your think check it out.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
A boba place with candy and dried fruit?! YUM!

I wish this was in east bay because I want to try EVERYTHING.

Must get the salt and pepper chicken - so delicious and flavorful.

I got the lychee juice with coconut jelly tapioca. The lychee is so fresh. My friend ordered the banana smoothie tapioca and he said it was made with real bananas. 

I will definitely be back to try more. Great place!
author: Yvonne L.

description:
The Tapioca Pudding Milk Tea was terrific!
The milk was soft and tender, and the Tapioca was chewy and sweet.
And of course the pudding taste good.
The spicy fried chicken was incredible delicious!
The taste of the spicy fried chicken was just like my hometown style.
I love this restaurant very much.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Criteria for delicious boba:

1. Tea freshly brewed. No hints of anything artificial like powder.
2. Boba balls in their prime. Chewy tapioca that won't break the jaw.
3. Moderate sweetness (debatable). The excessively sweet boba are not as enjoyable after the first few sips.

WDC's boba had stuck together and had hardened at the edges. Tea was most likely not freshly brewed.
author: Cici T.

description:
I often find myself here on my way home or late night (they're open later than a few other places). I love the candy and snacks and too often do I buy candy that I won't be needing, especially with boba. It's definitely the candy store of my childhood, and I often buy more than I actually need.

The boba here is pretty much my favorite! I've seen quite a few complaints about size/price, but I'm happy to pay since they have some flavors not available elsewhere and because it tastes so dang good!

Food: 9/10
Staff: 8/10
Atmosphere: 9/10
Value: 8/10
Overall: 8.5/10
author: Evan K.

description:
You don't know SF boba unless you know Wonderfuls!

Wonderful's is the real OG boba place, I remember ever since I was a kid and even before my family and I would alway go to Wonderfuls for boba, candy and snacks (and that was 20+ years ago). 

You can never go wrong with their regular black or green milk tea and their fruit smoothies are great when the fruit is in season. I honestly don't know how they managed to be so consistent for so long (in price and taste) and I don't see them changing anytime in the future. 

It is cash only but a plus is that they're open late and usually open on major holidays (eg. Thanksgiving, New Years).
author: Victoria C.

description: After getting used to Boba Guys, this place was not good. Not much tea flavor in the regular milk tea and tapioca was mushy. Also, some of the candy looked pretty stale.
author: Erin C.

description: I would come all the way across town for their oatmeal milk tea. They were unique for this. For whatever reason, they stopped making it, but still left it on the menu. Now they're just like any other milk tea joint. There's nothing really special about their other milk teas. You can pretty much get the same stuff at any other spot.
author: MJ E.

description:
This place is the closest thing you can get to non-Americanized milk tea place.  They have more of the Taiwanese style of milk tea which makes it so GOOD.  
They're old fashioned:
- cash only
- newly added drinks/items are written on a paper and taped on the wall
- no need to ask you how sweet you want your drink to be, how much ice you want, etc. What you get is what you get! 

They have a sign outside of their window stating, "Best Boba in town!" and I would totally agree. Aside from having several other boba businesses surrounding them (TPumps, iTea, Teaway, etc.), this place still trumps all those more modern and younger tea places.

I can say their milk tea is more tea than milky. Their boba is really good, nice chewy texture. But if you're really specific and picky about your milk tea, this place isn't the place to be at.  BUT if you're looking for a more traditional boba place where workers that don't speak English very well, come check this place out.
author: Tiffany Z.

description: We got the mango and strawberry tapioca. Delicious!! Will definitely be back. Don't forget, CASH ONLY.
author: Maria B.

description:
I always noticed this place whenever I'm in the area but never tried it until now! Usually I got to T-pumps but wanted to try something new so I went here! The store was very spacious with 2 tables and a assortment of different types of candy & things like dehydrated plums/olives on the side of the walls. 

The menu had so many things on it that I had a difficult time deciding. After a bit, I decided to try the lychee juice w/ coconut jelly and my boyfriend got the honeydew tapioca. I added boba in mine too (+$0.50) because I can't go to a tapioca shop without actually trying it! 

I explored the candy section a little more and noticed a huge rice cooker filled with tea eggs. I was so intrigued. I've probably had tea eggs in my face before at other places but never really noticed it. I looked on Yelp and a lot of people said that it was good so I got one for $1.00! The drinks took about 5-8 minutes and I sat down with my tea egg. I took my first bite of the tea egg and it was sooo good. You can taste the essence of the tea and the egg was smooth and perfectly boiled. 

I drank my lychee drink and it tasted pretty good but it was too sweet. I wish I asked to make it 50% less sweet or my drink would have been perfect! The boba was chewy and sweet which I liked. Coconut jelly made a great addition to the lychee drink. My boyfriends honey dew tapioca drink wasn't bad either. It didn't taste like it was pumped full of syrup like other milk tea shops. It wasn't overly sweet like mine even without the less sweetness modifications. 

Overall, I thought this place was ok but I wasn't really amazed. I would want to come back to try other drinks and fix my sweetness level though. They had lots on their menu to choose from and I want more of the tea eggs! Enjoy and CASH ONLY!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
The Bold Italic calls Wonderful "The OG" of SF boba
(http://www.thebolditalic.com/articles/6638-the-only-boba-guide-you-need)
The 20yo+ history behind this store is evident, but I don't know how much I trust this boba guide because they hail Wonderful's taro flavor as "unusual" and categorize Tpumps as hipster. Anyways, I digress.

Wonderful is very vintage, from its large "Best Boba in Town" storefront poster to the menu written in neon colored paper. They have a wide variety of Chinese snacks and candy in addition to teas and hot snack food. 

My boba go-to is their $3 JASMINE MILK TEA.The tea quality is good and they don't charge extra for boba, but in my opinion their boba is too chewy. It's like a workout for the jaw! I've seen someone order before with a request for "less boba" lol. 

The $6 SALT AND PEPPER CHICKEN is my guilty pleasure. So umami! I usually get it spicy; it's not really spicy but has more flavor. I also love how it comes with basil, though it leaves a bitter aftertaste. Of note, I highly recommend sharing, because I had this for lunch once, and all I could eat for dinner was fruit. First world problems...
author: Edna C.

description:
SF is the place to go for boba. Wonderfuls did not let me down. On the recommendations of the locals I tried the strawberry slushy. 

I am not the biggest fan of slushies because they're so cold, they make the boba hard and it just doesn't taste as good. But this slushy was very different, it was not too ice and the boba kept its texture even though it was so cold outside. I also tried a sip of the green milk tea. Super basic drink, it tasted exactly the way it was suppose to so no complaints!

Wonderful's also has a selection of candy sold by the pound so if you're interest that is available. One down side is they take cash only. Near by there is a bank of america and wells fargo.
author: Kathy N.

description:
Instead of going to the usual Tpumps for boba, my friend and I decided to check out Wonderful Dessert & Cafe since it had a large number of reviews on Yelp. The first thing we notice when we came inside was the fact that this Cafe really resembled the old school Asian boba shops. After going to trendy places like Tpumps, Sharetea, Quickly (why did I even mention Quickly), you kind of forget the hole in the wall style shop with older people working the counter and traditional flavors for tea.

Intrigued by the Yelp recommendations, we settled on the oatmeal tapioca (Damn, you know it's old school when they call boba tapioca). While we waited for our drinks, we checked out the candy/preserved fruits. It really reminded me of home after seeing all those dried plums, dates, and delicious (un)nutritious snacks. 

After about 10 minutes, our drinks were ready. For about $3.50, we didn't get a large serving size, but the oatmeal milk tea was super flavorful-it tastes very similar to brown rice milk tea. I hope that they have a non milk drink because sometimes milk tea does get overwhelming.

All and all, this was a very good experience. The milk tea didn't blow me away, but it was a nice change. I'll come back next time and try their other drinks.

Drink well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
This is definitely an OG spot- been coming here for many many years. The quality is just as as good as when I first had it.

I usually either get the milk tea, thai ice tea, or strawberry. I love that they make everything with real fruit and not powder. It always tastes really good with bold flavor.

The boba is always on point as well. You really can't go wrong at this place.

Remember: cash only though!
author: Jessica S.

description: After several visits to various boba/snack stores, i've finally hit the jackpot for popped chicken (it's called salt and pepper chicken here) the chicken is literally amazeballs, and my quest has finally come to a happy end crispy, juicy chicken marinated in garlic and other spices tossed with loads of fried basil. It's a bit pricey for 8$ but its way worth it then the other versions i've tried that are bland and use tasteless meat like chicken breast.
author: Seira N.

description: Their avocado smoothie is definitely one of the best I've had, and you can tell they use real avocado. They do go heavy on the boba, so maybe ask for light boba if you're not into that. It is also cash only.
author: Tiffany P.

description: This place is great! Super tasty and yummy drinks and snacks. There's not much seating but I don't really mind that. On the day I came there was such a fun crowd of young people and adults. It was cool.
author: Loren C.

description: A quaint boba place featuring many different candies and beverages and preserved plums. I had the papaya milk and my date got the passion fruit green tea. We both enjoyed our drinks; I would say the passion fruit green tea is on the sweet side so if you like milder tea I would get it less sweetened.
author: Ian L.

description: Stopped here for boba drink after having dinner at a place down the street. The store is simply furnished and at 7pm on a weekday night it was empty. There's not much room for sitting if you're planning to stay: they have a total of two small tables and four chairs. In addition to boba drinks they sell some fried snacks/tea eggs and a variety of candy and Chinese dried snacks. Ordered the honey green tea with tapioca- it was okay nothing special. Service is quick. Overall, the boba is decent but not something I would make a special trip out for.
author: Helen J.

description: I had a lychee juice and jelly made to order and exactly what I needed to quench my thirst.
author: Ellen L.

description:
Drinks are good but the girl working there hella pissed me off today 8/25 around 4pm. 

I specifically ordered a Pudding Tapioca Milk Tea and Tapioca Green Milk Tea. And she asks again do you want boba in it? After I said yes she made the first drink as a regular boba milk tea. I pointed out I wanted a Pudding Tapioca Milk Tea. She was kinda like ugh and poured the drink into a different cup with no toppings and was like sorry here you go. -_- I then had to tell her I want  Pudding Tapioca Milk Tea Number 2 AGAIN and then she said oh you want it with pudding, do you want boba? ...........
author: Michele M.

description:
Every single SF native KNOWS Wonderful's.  Located in the middle of Irving's mini-Chinatown, it's an perfect place grab boba after a meal and a stroll.  Despite not being a chain (its owners do own other boba places), Wonderful's is ubiquitous, synonymous with SF boba, and can go head-to-head with any other boba place in the city.

The selection is impressive, and though they've been out of certain drinks (like Oatmeal or Sesame) for a while, they can make Durian or Bittermelon drinks (if you like that sort of thing), to name a few.  I'm a big fan of variety and customization/made-to-order, and Wonderful's is very good at accommodating allergies (they can substitute regular dairy milk with soymilk, almond milk, coconut milk, or powdered milk), and can add/remove toppings.  Furthermore, Wonderful's does use real fruit, so you can taste the difference between that and the powdered stuff in other boba places.  Wonderful's is also open pretty much most of the day and night, so unless you find yourself craving boba at 2 in the morning, you can still make it to Wonderful's.  Though lines occasionally get long, the service is very efficient, so you won't be waiting for excessive amounts of time.

If you're not in the mood for boba, they also have a large assortment of candy, Chinese snacks (dried fruit, cuttlefish, or beef jerky), popcorn chicken, and tea eggs.

Being from the area and having gone to Wonderful's since it opened, I do have a few gripes.  The first is that it's been getting relatively expensive; the drinks have progressively been raised in price to the point where many of the drinks cost around $5 (compared to only $3.50-4.00 when they first opened).  You're much better off getting candy across the street at Walgreen's too.  The second is that there is VERY little seating, which regulars know, and most people either stand and loiter, or simply order and leave.  Lastly, I personally don't think Wonderful's tastes any better than any other boba place (when you're not getting a fruit drink), though most of my boba snob friends see differently.  The boba is slightly better, but the tea flavor isn't something I'd brag about.  

Overall, Wonderful's is what it is: convenient, diverse, and expedient.  If you're visiting SF, try it out.  And if you're from SF, you've likely already been here a hundred times over.
author: Matthew W.

description:
This place can do no wrong... even when they doin' wrong.

Allow me to explain.

I've been coming here for over the past decade, because NO ONE DOES IT BETTER. The perfectly chewy texture and natural flavor of Wonderful's boba pearls, paired with the nuanced flavors in their drink offerings, are unmatched.

My drink of choice is what the café dubs "Mango Tapioca."

Which brings me to the incident that led me here. This past weekend, my boyfriend and I each ordered a "Mango Tapioca," just like any other typical Saturday night. The store was relatively empty, with only two other people inside, so I can't determine any sort of justification the workers had for committing their single act of treason against us. There was no rush, there was time to cut up more mangoes if there was a shortage (don't think we didn't see the twenty boxes of mangoes beside the sales counter), there was the opportunity to ask us if we wanted something different.

We noticed our drinks were taking an inordinately lengthy amount of time to prepare and watched one of the workers make a couple trips from behind the counter to a storage closet, to back behind the counter, to the storage closet, and we knew something was up.

However, without communicating the problem, which we guessed had to do with the depletion of an ingredient, one of the workers called out "Mango" (after we observed her taste-testing the compromised beverage) and placed our drinks on the counter without another word. We walked up to the counter, immediately discerning the pale, off-yellow color of the concoction, and thanked the worker.

It's not that the drink was horribly offensive by any means. It actually tasted okay. It just wasn't what I ordered. I'm writing this review because this place got me fucked up, having the audacity to mix some other nonsense in with my mango drink and thinking I wouldn't know the difference. I want those two workers to know, I KNOW THE DIFFERENCE, and I'm highkey hurt that they would disrespect me like that.

I'm getting heated thinking about how this place did me dirty, but even so, this experience won't stop me from frequenting the café. That's how good it is.

So, I just wanted to say...... fuck this place. I'll be back next weekend.
author: Kristen C.

description:
Okay I came here yesterday night ONLY because they said it was the BEST TAPIOCA IN TOWN... so i was like hey why not give it a gander 

Ordered "tiger milk tea" and well when ordering it they just didn't seem to know what it was.. but we carefully explained and it turned out really good. Now... I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had but it definitely cured my craving lol. 

OHHHHHH and they have TEA EGGS!!!!! I haven't tried them but I really have been wanting too!
author: Genevieve M.

description:
I would have to say this is my favorite boba spot in the sunset. Prices are low and quality is high. I usually get a basic milk tea with tapioca for nothing more than $4. Sip some milk tea and suck up a mouthful of circular soft chewy black balls for a delicious sweet treat.

In addition, I pair my drink with a scoop of chocolate covered gummy bears and strips of sour strawberry belts. It's like the one stop shop to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

.
author: Briana H.

description:
Been coming here for years and glad things haven't changed much besides the location. I've tried something different from my usuals and decided to get the #7 mint green tea w/tapioca. Definitely not natural, but a bit weird at first sip. Maybe it's too many things at once with the tea, mint and tapioca...but I usually go for the honeydew tapioca drink on the white board and the regular milk tea w/tapioca. The honey dew drink is a bit powdery but I liked the taste of it. 

I also tried one of their new drinks they've added recently the fresh honeydew and it was exactly how I've thought it would be. Decent sized and blended honeydew w/tapioca! It was quite refreshing as this place finally gets the real fruit on their drinks!

It's a lot more tapioca than most places that have popped up over the years, and it's still decent. Nice and chewy and not too overwhelming on flavor. So if you like more tapioca in your drink w/o paying extra come here. 

I've yet to try all their new flavors they posted up that aren't on their white board area. Will be back if I've another late night thirst for some tea, fruit smoothie and tapioca.
author: Eric T.

description:
Tip: cash only!

This boba place uses fresh fruit and ingredients. Their watermelon boba is a delicious fresh watermelon and ice slush. Their smoothies use fresh fruit like mangos. 

They also sell candies, gummies, old-fashioned sweets that you put in a plastic baggy and you pay what it weighs. On the other side of the store is choose-your-own Chinese snacks like dried fruits and nuts and things.
author: Leeyen R.

description:
Wonderful Dessert & Cafe sets itself apart from competitors because it makes its fruit drinks from fresh fruit! One of their most popular items is the strawberry smoothie tapioca--I was semi-full from lunch earlier so I got the strawberry slush without the tapioca. In retrospect, I realize you get more of the great fresh fruit blend this way. My friends commented that they had too many pearls in their drinks, so it makes me think that when the juice is fresh maybe it becomes more valuable than the pearls. However, they also noted that the pearls were good quality and we all thoroughly enjoyed our orders. This is my go-to boba place in Sunset for now! 

Note: cash only.
author: Amy G.

description: Finally got to try their popcorn chicken. It's pretty good but not to my taste. The chicken was good as was the breading. The main thing was that it tasted slightly sweet. I prefer my chicken just straight up salty. I did like the fried basil leaves though. I'll probably stick to Quickly in the future.
author: Jean K.

description: I have no idea why this boba has 1000+ plus reviews and 4 stars. It's just very basic. Nothing to pick on but just basic
author: Ming Z.

description:
This place is the reason I must carry cash around (as it is unfortunately cash only). The boba is always cooked perfectly and the milk tea is never too sweet!! *cries* I just love it so much. 

It's more than reasonably priced, at around $2.50-4 per drink. If you're craving something even sweeter, they have two sections of candy goodies to peruse while you wait for your drink. 

Street parking is meh cause it's on Irving but it's worth the hassle. Never change, wonderful foods.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
#55 I had a friend in high school who would always rave about this place. We would have Teaway vs. Wonderful debates daily, since Teaway was my go-to tapioca place at the time. 

My boyfriend was having a late night thai tea craving and we came here because they're always open until midnight. The layout of the store is a bit weird. I was going to get some candy but they didn't have very good choices. 

Watermelon juice ($4.25) - fresh watermelon blended with ice, actually making it a slush. 
Thai tea ($3.75) - good, strong flavor. 

The drinks were good but they cost more than what I usually spend on boba. I'd only come here if it were late at night and this were the only place open. Teaway definitely beats Wonderful Cafe.
author: Kirstie P.

description:
I was having lunner (the meal between lunch and dinner) nearby and decided to finally try Wonderful Dessert & Cafe. I've read so many good things about their teas, I figured a milk tea would be the perfect dessert.

10. Almond tapioca ($3.25), add Grass jelly (+$0.50)

After looking through the menu, I decided to try the almond milk tea. At first, I asked for it with no sweetener. But when she asked me if I was sure, I took it back and asked for it 25% sweet. The almond milk was so good! Just the right amount of creaminess and nuttiness. The balls were great too. Chewy and soft. And the grass jelly was silky. But holy cow, was the tea sweet! How was this 75% less syrup?! I could only imagine the cavities forming as you drink this with the sweetness they intended.

Great almond milk tapioca, but they need to dial back the sugar. Maybe next time I'll get this without any sweetness. I did adore the tea itself. Too bad though, cuz I would have given them 5 stars otherwise.
author: Elena N.

description: Love love love love love love love this place been coming here since I was young and I'm talking about like really Young Elementary Young. There won't the original milk tea people. They have the best tea not like the rest of the other place that have nothing but sugar and water. I would say they are the best of the best when it comes to milk tea. Love the owner love the place love her staff.
author: Michele T.

description: Every time I'm in this area of the city, I stop by here to get my FAVORITE boba drink. Their avocado boba is the absolute best. Super creamy, not too sweet. They have a huge list of boba drinks to choose from but I always get the avocado. They also have a wide variety of candy, I've never actually gotten any but they look good. It's cash only also.
author: Samantha G.

description: The staff wasn't super helpful or friendly, but I got a taro milk tea with boba (1/2 sweetness) and it was so damn good I didn't even care. Will be back again for that scrumptious purple drank.
author: Gabriella M.

description:
Dried Snacks:
The only place I've found that sells preserved chinese bayberries (yang mei) from my fob childhood favorite snacks memories. Price for nostalgia is steep at ~$17 cash dollars for two handfuls.

Teas:
Unfortunately, the tapioca drinks here were far from wonderful. Almond tea was too sweet, matcha milk tea was terribly blended and tasted too powdery, and the avocado milk shake tasted like industrial paint.
author: Tian Q.

description:
I love boba and am on a search for the best boba places. I had high hopes for this place but was sadly let down. When trying to decide what to order, I asked which flavors could be made into a milkshake. The cashier responded "any powder." What does that even mean? How am I supposed to know what powders they have?

Anyway, we played it safe and ordered a tapioca milkshake, mango milkshake, and avocado milkshake. They are generous with the boba, I'll give them that. The boba had a nice, chewy texture but lacked flavor. The tapioca milkshake was very chalky & grainy. I guess that was due to the powder the cashier mentioned. After walking out of the store, my husband threw away the tapioca milkshake. The avocado and mango milkshakes were much better but not special enough to make us want to come back. 

They have a large sign in their window that says "Best Tapioca in Town." Is it really, though? My answer is no. = (
author: Rose A.

description:
I got the #4 Tapioca Green Milk Tea -- you can taste the richness of green tea while still having that milk tea fix. The tapioca balls were the perfect texture, not hard or too squishy. Sweetness was also on point. 

When you first enter, you feel like a kid in a candy store because of the clear candy filled shelves/buckets that line up against the walking --Candy shop and get your boba fix. There's not much effort put into the menu and interior of this place, so you may question the quality of their drinks till you see the candy shelves. 

Also, cash only!
author: Luc L.

description:
Note: CASH ONLY

We drove by this place and I definitely didn't think this place would even have great boba. But boy, was I so wrong. From the outside, this place looks empty and like your typical Asian shop that offers boba and candy (self serve style). But just a simple milk tea was tasty! 

Overall, this is a great spot for a quick to-go drink or even some Asian snacks!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
Driving to SF is a nightmare and finding parking is even more of a nightmare, but I had to pick up some glasses in SF today so I just had to come here and try out the milk tea. 

I tried the regular milk tea with boba and the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly. 

Regular milk tea with boba: 
It's not the BEST milk tea ever but it's certainly one of the best milk teas that you can get around here, which is why I'm giving it five stars. I've tried a lot of terrible milk tea places (iTea, T4, Quickly, Boba Guys, Snow Monster, random places around the Bay Area and SoCal, etc etc.) but this milk tea is easily so much better. I feel like Wonderful Dessert only uses a very small amount of powder (if any) and I really appreciated being able to taste actual tea and milk in their milk tea. I would recommend their MT with no boba, however. It didn't add to the drink at all because it was kind of tasteless. I prefer sweet boba, but that's just me. 

Jasmine milk tea with grass jelly: 
Some milk tea shops have jasmine milk tea that taste very artificial but this one actually tasted like it was from actual jasmine green tea leaves and not powder.  The grass jelly was so good! I heard that they actually make their own grass jelly. However, I would recommend getting very little ice or no ice at all because once it melts, it dilutes the drink so much to the point where it's tasteless. 

If I'm ever in the area, I will certainly come here again. :)
author: Lawrence K.

description:
When it comes to candy and bubble tea this place HITS THE MARK. Endless candy and lots of choices for bubble tea. I thought I had been here before and after coming here I realized that I had about 3 months ago. When I walked in I was taken back by all the candy inside. I mean, there is so much candy that you would almost think that this is a candy store until you get around the counter area. Up near the counter is where the bubble tea menu is located. I am here specifically for thai tea and of course I, "HAD TO HAVE IT", sorry Cold Stone. 

After I placed my order I began to wonder around the store to check out the candy. There was so much candy. I was almost tempted to purchase some but I couldn't because I don't have a sweet tooth for candy anymore. But, thai tea...I could have ordered 4 of those!!!! My drink was prepared pretty quickly so I was in and out in about 5 to 10 minutes maybe. When I finally got to my car I had to take a sip. Deep breath....sip sip sip....PERFECTION!!! I should have ordered the larger size but it was fine. The boba here is also a nice touch to the drink as well. This place is very good. I will have to come back for more thai tea. I might even try some of their other goodies as well. 

This place really is a WONDERFUL WONDERLAND of Dessert's and Cafe.
author: Robert F.

description:
Love this place! Growing up on Judah, this place will always have a special spot in my heart. Sadly, with all the other chain boba spots that have opened up recently, some have forgotten how amazing Wonderfuls tapioca drinks really are!! 

My go-to is their original milk tea. Yes, quite boring but their milk tea is so delicious and nothing like any other milk tea I've tried. I've had their taro, their fruit smoothie tapioca and Thai tea but nothing compares to the original. I think the only reason why I haven't given it 5 stars is the fact that their candy which im not sure how often they restock it is ridiculously priced. That and the service isn't amazing. Sometimes im not greeted when I'm at the register, just stared down until I start ordering... 

Overall, regardless of the cash only aspect, the average service and overpriced candies, this is still a favorite spot for me. Their sign out front says it l:  THE BEST BOBA IN SF!
author: Shelly W.

description:
My friend introduced this place to me back in 2010, and to this day, it is still my favorite spot to get boba in SF. There are so many options for milk teas, smoothies, and juices. I appreciate that they use fresh fruit for their smoothies and juices, which clearly makes their stuff taste amazing. I highly recommend either just a standard milk tea, or their avocado smoothie, ooh, or even their strawberry smoothie! I think all of their staff members are pretty nice, and the cost for their drinks range from $2.25-$5.50(?) I stopped paying attention to actual figures; I just hand them my money. (The addiction is that real). 

In terms of food served there, I would either recommend their popcorn chicken (get it spicy!) or their tea egg. 

The only drawbacks of this place are:
- Their bathroom is no longer available to customers (but have no fear! this is why there's a public library a few blocks down. I'm totally joking! Go to the library and immerse yourself in knowledge, not use them for their bathroom :P )
- they only have two tables that are often merged together to create one bigger table. If you're lucky, it'll be available for you and your friends to chill at. Otherwise, you'll have to just take it to-go, or death glare the current occupants to leave. 
- with any perishable items kept in containers, they tend to taste a little stale. That's just my one-time experience buying candy from here. 
- BIG ONE: IT'S CASH ONLY. But Irving St. has a lot of ATMs nearby. Wells Fargo and Chase are both a few blocks down, with Bank of America being a few blocks down in the opposite direction.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Came here for the boba, was not disappointed. Lots of candies too.

Boba came out within 5 minutes of ordering. Line was long after I ordered, about 5-10 people came in after I did. Came at a perfect time mid to late afternoon.
author: Elijah B.

description:
taro was okay. 
I got the mango pineapple smoothie which was okay. Tapioca was nice and chewy.

Service was ehh as they didn't really call out your drinks or engage with you. Whatevs.
author: Claire J.

description:
Went here on a Thursday afternoon. We were the only ones, which made our drinks made pretty quickly.

Jasmine milk tea - delicious!

Lychee milk tea - horrible! It tasted so funky. I'm not sure what they mixed in there but it does not taste like the typical lychee milk that I always get :(
author: Vanae W.

description:
Cheapest boba you could find!! And good!! Because it's chewy and fluffy 

$2.75 for tapioca milk tea. Kind of has a coffee taste to it...I remember it tasting more chocolatey last time tho. 

Minus one star because they didn't put the crushed ice I used to like. Overall good, fast. 

A little tucked in Irving though and cash only
author: Amy V.

description:
Hmm.... not too sure about the hype about this place.

With a big banner/picture saying "Best Tapioca In Town" - that's a pretty bold statement. This is actually a candy + boba tea mixture shop. Came on Saturday around 1pm and there was no customer in the store.

Everything in the store looks quite old-fashioned, and a lot of line items on the menu were hand written. But I mean, it's the quality of the drinks that matters.

Oolong Milk Tea with Tapioca: B.
First, the tapioca. It's above average, but I definitely wouldn't say they are the best in town. They are on par with Sharetea and Supercue, and not as good as Boba Guys. Better than Purple Kow maybe. But not the best. It still got the honey taste and it was soft, yea. But no, not the best. For the Oolong Milk Tea itself I was actually a bit disappointed. It's bland - no tea flavor and maybe slight milk flavor. I think one of the problems was the amount of ice they put in. The drink was ready in 30 seconds so obviously the tea was not freshly brewed. $3 for regular size is not that much cheaper than other places neither.

I would say this is one of the better boba shops in this Irving-Sunset area. So I would probably still come back whenever I am in this area. But overall I am not impressed.
author: Simon C.

description:
Pricier than other places, but you definitely get what you pay for here. This is definitely some of the best boba in the city. The boba is soft and chewy, just the way it should be.

Green bean slush - Very thick and delicious. I would not recommend getting this if you are thirsty though since it doesn't do a good job at quenching thirst given the thickness.

Honeydew Tapioca - I love how they use actual fruit rather than powder. 

This place also has an assortment of Chinese snacks. Really makes me nostalgic because I grew up on Pretz, dried squid, hawthorne flakes, etc. 

CASH ONLY.
author: Lucy N.

description:
30 mins popcorn chicken with a shittest faces from a Asian girl!!!! I've been coming here for the passed 10yrs+. This is the first time I ordered a popcorn for 20mins and it was not ready yet, and I asked the girl how much longer it's gonna take, she said 15 mins! I checked the time, me and my husband got here, and he made a phone call 2:28pm(5/4/2017)
At 3:52 my husband came in told her we don't want it anymore. You know what? Never go back there!! Keep running your biz like this!!!
author: Jin C.

description:
Best tapioca drink shop in the Bay Area.

Located in Irving Street in the Sunset District, SF, they have been around for over 20 years. The shop is an Asian candies shop but their main draw is their drinks.  

The way to determine if a tapioca shop depends on their most basic drink, the milk tea with boba, and they have some tea which is reminiscent of those which you would find in Asia.  The boba is also amazing. It is chewy and not too soft, giving it a bit of bite. Most other places boba pearls are quite bland, but I believe this place makes them top notch.

The drinks I usually get here are the original milk tea, mango tapioca , or their taro milkshake. The milk tea is a must if you want to try decent milk tea in the bay area.  The mango and taro drinks both use fresh fruits which make them pretty bomb.  It is one of the only places I know that actually use real taro as opposed to that purple artificial powder used at other places.

This place is a bit more pricy than that of the plethora of other boba shops in the area, but what you trade for price is the increase in quality and delicious drinks which are hard to replicate.
author: Jacky C.

description:
When I see a giant sign that says best boba in town, then it must be true. 

I tried their honeydew milk tea. Yup, best boba in town.

I also bought their tea eggs. Might as well also be best tea eggs in town, too.
author: Hina W.

description: I got the lychee drink. I saw the guy before me get the taro drink because it had a deep purple color to it (mental note that I must get that next time I come here). It seemed like it had a concentrated flavor of powdered taro that I love. Heh, back to my drink : it was great. In first sip, I sipped toward the bottom and it was more tea concentrated and it had real tea taste to it...after mixing it a little, you get the awesome lychee taste with bits of real pieces!
author: Scoot G.

description:
First time i've been here was back in 2012. I had a taste of my friend's honey green tea after getting basic Quicklys from across the street. And let me tell you, they give you a GENEROUS amount of boba. My usual for the past 4 years is honey green tea. I go here with my boyfriend, and no dinner date is done unless we make a trip here. I've tried their milk tea, and it's pretty good. My boyfriend's fave is either Lychee Milk tea, or honeydew milk tea. It use to be this one older lady running the place, but the past year there are a few new hires. Not too shabby, still tastes the same. I appreciate their late hours as well. There is rarely a time I go and the boba is tough. Majority of the time it's soft and chewy. Seriously perfect. Both bf & I live in Daly City but we're always up for the drive!!! 

Don't be fooled by the interior, the drinks are great quality. They don't use any syrups/pumps like most places. Never had the candy before though, so can't say much on that.
author: Michelle T.

description: Probably not as enamored with this place because i'm not a SF native. I know all my SF-origin friends all love this spot and hold it near & dear in their hearts. And probably back then, before boba really hit the bay, this was the spot to be. However, now with boba shops cropping all up and down the street, this place has not done much to keep up. Boba textures can be inconsistent - but most of the time good. I like that they have all sorts of candies (and asian treats) that you don't see at other boba spots so that's cool. Boba flavors are the usual that you would expect. the OG regular milk tea is good and so is the oolong milk tea.
author: Josephine T.

description:
A hidden gem on boba street aka irving. The place is not well known but has high quality drinks. When the line is too long at itea I come here. This place is the first boba shop in San Francisco.
