The place is very old fashioned. They still use written signs and prices. They are better than T pumps and quicklys. The drinks take a while because they are quality drinks. This place is known more for their boba than candy. Would keep coming back.
author: Brian C.

description:
Wonderful Foods has been a tapioca staple for decades! :) A favorite and no other place makes milk tea this way! Classic, Lychee Milk Tea, Pudding Milk Tea, Grass Jelly Juice, Almond are the usuals but many others are very tasty. Oh, sesame too!! Makes me want to go out to grab some right now! 

Tea Eggs are also a nice snack. Popcorn chicken with basil with the choice of spiciness is always yummy. It's not like other places where you only can sprinkle the flavor on top either. 

Tip: street parking is metered but side street parking around Irving is available too 
Tip: it's also cash only, so don't forget it on your way over. But if you do, there are plenty of banks near by.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I'm not usually one to write reviews, but I left this place completely appalled. First off, this place is cash only so we went had to run to the ATM before hand. My husband and I both ordered tapioca drinks, his was a taro milk tea and mine was a taro milkshake (I normally order taro milk teas but wanted something more creamy this time). Upon receiving and trying our drinks, I found that mine was white in color and very sandy in texture. My husband's drink was the typical purple color of all taro drinks. Therefore, my expectation was the same for mine. I asked the female employee working at the register why it tasted this way and she told me that's how "real" taro tastes. I explained to her that I could not drink such a sandy drink and I asked her if they can make me something different. She refused and when we asked for a refund we were also refused. One important fact- the menu did NOT specify that the drink was "real" taro. So I ended up waking out empty-handed. 
So please note: don't order something you're not familiar with and bring cash. 
If you're looking for some good boba... try Boba Guys! Best boba in town!
author: Angela T.

description: Every time I visited SF, this is my number one place to go. I brought so many friends here with me over the years. Always my favorite spot for milk tea and snacks!
author: Thuy N.

description:
I like this place because it's unpretentious and most importantly, I can actually taste the tea as in the tea in Milk TEA. Even the container is not fancy, a plain plastic clear cup with a lid. One size. No degrees of sweetness, just the milk tea with toppings. Because of so, I think they still can keep their price of milk tea at $2.75 (50 cents for toppings). This price is hard to find since most milk teas are at $4 minimum. There's not much service and sometimes they can be pretty abrupt. Whatevs, just order the drink and leave.

By the way, just ignore the candy panel on the left. I am guessing it's just for decorations (LOL). Just kidding, except I have never seen anyone buying candies from here. The store is pretty big, too bad they don't know how to utilize the space to get more business. 

I must admit they do have a pretty solid milk tea.
author: Em T.

description:
Well not sure what to rate in my case. 5 and 0, 2.5 so rounded to 3

Boba drinks, 5 stars- this is my go to place for years even when they were at old location in front 22nd produce store. 

Toilet access, 0 star- once in a blue moon that i need to go pee while buying drinks there. Saw the worker walked out and asked "can i have the key please?" Worker answered "no" and kept walking into kitchen
author: Quynh I.

description:
We came and got a honey green tea, honey milk green tea and milk tea with grass jelly. It was $13.50 and I handed the lady  $20.50... she needs to hand me back $7. SHE HANDS ME BACK $6.50...

WTF!! I thought an older asian lady would be able to do simple math... 

I called her out and she didn't even say sorry. She looked all confused and gave me back my money... 

... and they messed up on our order!! I don't know if the girl messed up or if that lady wrote it wrong... but they gave us the milk tea with BOBA and not grass jelly. wtf... so they remade it and made a honey green milk tea with grass jelly... still wrong but at this point it was too annoying to stay any longer...

The poor guy behind the counter was so nice though. He asked if we wanted the drink carrier.. and to be honest it looked like he was doing all of the hard work... Poor guy!!

To make it worse... my honey green tea is too sweet. Not a fan!!! It isn't even cute or anything. My menu is all messy and there aren't that manu

Didn't get that "Wonderful" experience other yelpers talk about. My friend says she comes her ALL THE TIME, and it's usually quick and efficient. She said the workers who were there today weren't the usual workers she sees. But I can't possibly give them a good review considering how HORRIBLE my personal experience here was!!
author: Van D.

description: I love this place! Soft boba, fresh ingredients, and great pricing!
author: WeiWei H.

description: This is for 7/26/2017 cashier at night only. I ordered hot grass jelly with black tapiocas only. I picked up my order and went home to eat it. As i am eating the grass jelly...there is ONLY RED BEANS! I called and the same guy was trying to explained it comes with it. But, i have always ordered it with TAPIOCAS. Can management make sure he is train properly!
author: Jess T.

description:
This is the "shop" to get real boba tea. They make their own boba and use real ingredients--no powders here. They keep ingredients covered and keep them in the fridge. I usually get a bad headache if the straws are made with questionable chemicals, but I have no problem with the straws here. I've been coming here for the past twenty years.

The new employee they hired is a little absentminded. I asked for winter melon juice, she gave me the regular milk tea. However, she made my winter melon juice immediately and gave me the regular milk tea for free! Wow...now I don't mind the mistake!
author: Ce W.

description: Best boba I've ever had. It's fresh, they use natural ingredients (like real taro), and there's not a lot of wait time. My favorite drink and what I'd recommend is the coconut lychee #28~
author: Clara F.

description:
The og boba milk tea! Wonderful foods has been in the outer sunset since forever! I remember coming here when I was 5 or 6 and I still come here now when I'm 24! Lol! I always get their regular milk tea and their watermelon boba! I classify their milk tea more on the heavy side compared to I-tea or t-pumps around the block . Its more filling and I think it's probably because of the different type of milk they put In. Also its more on the sweeter side so I always ask for less sweet. Now on to their boba-- Their boba is really good, they have the perfect chewy consistency that I love! And sometimes it's a hit or miss because I've had times when it wasn't that good. But there's about a 80% chance you'll get a good batch! 
   
   Not only drinks,they also have rows and rows of candy and I love their sour belts and chocolate covered gummy bears! Get someee I can't really find these candies anywhere else!
author: Janet K.

description:
Came here in search of some salt and pepper chicken and that's exactly what we got! The chicken was perfectly fried and seasoned, topped with fried basil... Couldn't ask for a better snack. 

I also had the almond tapioca drink, which was very milky and definitely almond-forward. I appreciated the amount of boba they gave and loved the type of ice they used in their drink. However, the boba itself wasn't sweetened and didn't have much flavor. 

All in all, I'd definitely come back for the chicken!
author: Ashlyn I.

description:
Wonderful is my favorite place to get boba. I frequently order the green milk tea ($2.75) with pearls. The boba is made well so it's not mushy or hard or super chewy. I love the fact that Wonderful is generous with their boba servings. 

This is a cash only place and it's not really a place where you can grab a drink and sit down to chat since there are only 4 chairs available. Drinks are served quickly and I haven't had to wait more than 5 minutes for my drink.
author: Katie C.

description:
I got the tapioca thai iced tea - the tapioca isn't drenched in sugar like it is in many other boba places. Also, it's so soft that it almost melts in your mouth so none of that jaw workout I usually get when I chew boba. The drink wasn't overly sweet either.

There are all types of exotic Chinese dried fruits and American sweets that you can get by the pound.

There's only one table and a couple of chairs inside so most people end up congregating outside.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I tried a lychee drink with boba, and it was ok.  The tapioca quality was good, chewy just enough but it didn't have much flavor.  The lychee juice was good, but I wasn't blown away.  I don't know, maybe I've had too many boba drinks lately that my tastebuds are tainted, but this was my initial reaction.  It was a-ok.  It's cute though how they have candy bins all along the side - the regular sour candies on one side, and more ethnic/specialty candies on the other side.
author: Maile N.

description:
Lychee is my favorite fruit. I am also a big fan of coconut and tapioca. When I saw a combination of those three things as the top highlight for this place I decided to make a stop here after we stuffed our faces with San Tung wings down the street.

I was rather disappointed with this boba drink. I have certainly had better and I am fairly sure that the reason Wonderful gets such high reviews is because it is also a candyshop. Unfortunately that does nothing for me and is misleading in the quality of their boba.

Overall I would not get this again.
author: Mark O.

description: Been going here since I was 5 years old! Love their Strawberry Fruit smoothie with boba and their tea eggs!!! Thank god they are one of the few stores open late on Irving street. Go to place for a late night drink or bite with friends
author: Audrey K.

description:
Cash only - nowhere to sit.  I don't understand why this place has so many high reviews...

I just ordered the tapioca milk tea (a reasonable $2.75) because I only had a few dollars on me.  The environment didn't seem especially clean and was relatively hot inside the store.  The service was fine - nothing great.  Placed my order, handed over the money, and waited for the drink.

The drink was good - but again, nothing amazing.  I'm not very picky when it comes to boba and I think this place could have been a lot better for me if the environment was more pleasant.  The boba itself was chewy and sweet, and the milk tea was thick and creamy.  I don't know if they do customization here, but I would have loved to do a half sugar on my order.  I had a slight stomach ache after from whatever mixture of cream and sugar were in the drink.

Wouldn't come back here.  It's in an odd area with nothing nearby (except a T Pumps which I would much rather visit), and there's nowhere to sit down and relax.
author: Kenna H.

description: Self proclaimed "best tapioca in town" and the drinks cost more than other boba chains. My favorites are sesame, peanut and oatmeal but they're always unavailable :(
author: Sarah P.

description:
I come for the boba and get suckered for the candy. 

Kind of slow service but their boba drinks are good. I get either the watermelon juice or the almond milk tea. Both are great. :) 

The service is alright - not the fastest but not the slowest. 

I still think it's kind of a hidden gem among the T-Pumps, ShareTea, and PurpleKow.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Drinks and candy store. Boba tea flavor is stronger than most places but tasty. The candy selection is decent and price is dependent on weight. They have my cherry bombs...my go to when I'm in the mood to indulge in sugar.
author: Julie L.

description:
This place is pretty big shop for boba! It has a ton of self-serve candy lined up a long the wall. I wish they provide more seating to hang out, but maybe that's the point so people don't linger.. 

Boba here is alright. It's more toward the sweet and milky spectrum of boba. Tea taste isn't too strong here. I think it's super artificial too. Powder, color, whatever they use. Drinks like honey dew milk tea and strawberry milk tea come out looking bright with artificial coloring. 

During our last visit, boyfriend got peach milk tea and I got the strawberry milk tea. It seemed like they used fresh peach puree or something, but the color of that drink was nasty looking. It had a weird after taste for me. He said it tasted fine and wasn't bothered by it after.

Any who, be aware that it's cash only!
author: Tina N.

description:
Mmm I don't know about you but I LOOOOVE places with crushed ice instead of cubes. Walked in and the bf said "this place looks authentic" and I guess that's how I would describe it too bc it really has a hole in the wall feel. It doesn't look the cleanest tbh, they have a wall full of candies and sweets that make me wonder how old they actually were.... 

They really Hustle here and felt bad for the old lady and young girl running around doing everything while the line just gets longer. I saw them actually taste the things they blended in the blender (taro looking drink)  so that's reassuring that they're making sure it tastes right 

I ordered the matcha green milk tea with boba and it was delicious. I usually don't get boba but theirs were perfectly made. 

We will be back
author: Elaine L.

description:
Was introduced to Wonderful by a friend, and as cheesy as it sounds, the boba here is truly wonderful. First off, this place is cash only so you can tell it's really authentic :P Secondly, their boba flavors are really amazing. 

The taro tapioca is absolutely to die for. It is delicious and milky and lovely. Super addictive! Do not get it mixed up with the fresh taro milkshake which is VERY DIFFERENT. I made the mistake of ordering the taro milkshake and let's say I wouldn't do it again.

the oatmeal tapioca was also SUPER DELICIOUS. I've never had anything like it, it was nutty and yummy.

All in all, I've had a lot of boba in my life but Wonderful definitely left an impression on me. If I'm ever in the city, I would definitely go back just to have either the taro or oatmeal tapioca :) A side note though, definitely ask for AT LEAST 50% LESS sugar. Sometimes 20% is still a little on the sweet side. If you remember to order less sugar you will definitely enjoy your order. :)
author: Sarah T.

description: Really good candy and also good boba. Has more of a tea taste than milk taste as a heads up but had great boba drinks and smoothies! It's open until midnight as well which is also really great and convenient. Heads up, it's cash only!
author: Lena T.

description:
After the Alice Summerthing concert in Golden Gate Park, we headed over to Irving to grab some boba. Out of all the boba spots on Irving, we went to Wonderful because my cousin said it was her absolute favorite go-to place. We walked past Tpumps and there was a really long line out the door. When we arrived at Wonderful, there was a really long line here too. 

The cool thing about this place is that they have a huge selection of candies like sour gummy worms, chocolate gummies, and all sorts of sweet desserts that you can buy by the pound. While you're waiting in line, you can definitely be lured into buying a bag of candy on your way to the cash register.

I ordered the Mango Tapioca, which was one of the more expensive drinks for some reason. Turns out, it wasn't like the fruity flavor mango drinks. It is more like real mango pieces blended, making it a thick, opaque drink. I liked the fact that it wasn't made with artificial flavoring. They also add in a generous amount of tapioca. It was a bit overpriced, but they definitely have other more affordable selections. 

Next time, I want to try their milk teas.
author: Regina L.

description:
I've been coming here ever since high school, so for about 7-8 years now. My usuals consist of: 

(1) Avocado smoothie with boba- thick, sweets, smooth. It may sound out of the ordinary, but it's a must try!
(2) Green milk tea with boba or lychee jelly- just slightly sweet and very refreshing. 

Occasionally I'll have their strawberry banana smoothie or kumquat boba too. For something sweeter, try the almond boba. Their boba is different--chewy and with a slight pleasant tea taste to them.

Wonderfuls consistently satisfies my boba needs and cravings, not only because they have delicious drinks but also because they're open later than most other boba shops on the street!
author: Angie Y.

description:
I've heard of this place before and understand that this place is OG. Like come here after Chinese school OG. 

Wall of Candy to your left, boba counter up in front. This place is no frills. Get in, get out, get on with your life. 

I've only tried two things here:
1) Regular Milk Tea + Tapioca: Just the right sweetness. Lots and lots of tapioca. Solid drink. $2.75
2) Oatmeal Milk Tea + Tapioca: Got this on recommendation from the cashier. Oddly enough, it tastes like oatmeal and even more odd is that it was delicious. A little thicker than your standard milk tea, but definitely a unique flavor. Once again, lots and lots of tapioca. $3.25

People are nice and it's a busy street. Stop by if you're in the area and looking for some boba!
author: Andrew C.

description: Fresh, good quality drinks, and great taste! Tried the avocado, green bean, and durian milk shakes with less sweet option and they're delicious.. nom nom. Glad to find this place so I can enjoy fresh milk shake that is a much better alternative to drinking typical bubble milk tea ;)
author: Rowena I.

description: I wish I had this yummines in Marin! Im making sure every time I go across the bridge I stop by for a very good boba milk tea here!
author: corina f.

description: Wow. Just wow how Mike Chen the strictly dumpling guy says it on his foodie tour when eating delicious foods. I ordered the Avocado smoothie with boba and a popcorn chicken. My standard for boba drinks has gone way up. The boba was so fresh and the taste of the smoothie was perfect, not too sweet. Popcorn chicken is worth 7 bucks. Pricey but worth it! The flavor and texture is perfect (not salty) and has a nice crisp to it. I will definitely be coming back when I am in SF again.
author: Janet S.

description:
This is probably one of the few times Yelp has disappointed me when I searched for "best boba" and filtered by highest rating. Wonderful Dessert & Cafe has been on my list of boba places to try for a LONG time, and it definitely was not what I expected. 

The green tea was way too sweet. In fact, it tasted like it was half the drink consisted of condensed milk, which overshadowed the tea (if there was any to begin with). I don't even put that much condensed milk in a Vietnamese iced coffee. Sure, it was cheap, and yes, the texture of the boba was nice and chewy, but the tea was lacking immensely. 

Say it ain't so, Wonderful Dessert & Cafe.
author: Viet N.

description:
Recommendation: Great candy/bubble tea shop. Quick to serve, but the establishment felt a little run-down. I would go back again though!
Tip: CASH ONLY

I went here after a day in the Golden Gate Park with friends. We were looking for a bubble tea place and this was one of the closest ones to Lincoln Street that popped up on Yelp. After a long walk (greater than 10 blocks) we finally made it, and were greeted with a little candy shop mixed with a bubble tea shop. We decided to forego the candy and jump right in to the tea. I ordered a mint green tea with boba, which was ready in about 5 minutes. While most bubble tea shops use a sealing machine to put a seal on the top of the cup, this shop just uses a regular lid. While there is very little operational difference, it does take away from the experience a little. 

Regardless, the bubble tea was okay! The boba wasn't as good as I've had at other places, and they seemed on the small side, but it was still a good complement to the mint green tea.

All in all, I think it was a pretty standard bubble tea shop. There wasn't anything particularly appealing, considering the establishment, presentation, quality, service, or price. However, there wasn't anything terrible either. If I'm in the area I wouldn't hesitate to go back, but at the same time I wouldn't mind trying somewhere else too!
author: John B.

description: I'm not quite ready to crown this place as the best boba place in SF, but it is definitely up there. My absolute favorite drink is the almond drink with boba. It is really sweet but great flavor that I can't find anywhere else. You can also find all kinds of different sweets to purchase by weight. Very reminiscent of the sweet factory's of old. Whenever I'm in the area I stop by whenever I get the chance.
author: Ryan J.

description: Always a solid choice for boba on Irving! I love that they're still here doing their thing despite competition coming and going over the years. My favorites tend to be the fruit smoothies (drinks with real fruit are numbered in red, if I recall) - strawberry mango is always fantastic, as is the watermelon juice and the papaya smoothie. Everything tastes super fresh and they give a lot of boba proportional to the drink, which I'm a big fan of. No frills, cash only, great consistent drinks over many years.
author: Delia Z.

description: Wonderful Dessert & Cafe is a pretty bare bones boba shop. Dimly lit, handwritten signs, little to no seating. But the tea is pretty good. The original tapioca tea is only $2.75 for a 16oz. Boba is a good texture, chewy, but not too soft, and the tea had a great flavor, with a slightly roasted note that made it different and stand out from most shops. I'd be interested in going back and trying some of their flavored tea (I love to compare matcha teas from different places) but am also pretty satisfied with the price and taste of the original!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
This is milk-tea stucked in the 90s

I've drank my fair share of meh milk-teas, but this was the first that I didn't finish. #4 green milk-tea was so bland.Pearls were inconsistent and barely had any taste to it. #2 milk-tea with pudding tasted like chocolate milk instead.The complimentary milk-tea you get from some Chinese restaurants are miles better. 

How this place got 4.5 stars with over 1k reviews and a bold 'best tapioca in town' sign is just nuts, especially in this day and age of fierce boba competitions.

The only redeeming quality is the salt-n-pepper chicken, hence the extra star. Cash only!
author: Minh V.

description:
Similar to what other reviews say--this place is very very simple. They have a counter upfront with a pretty expansive drink menu and a few food items. You can tell the cast isn't exactly what's making this place stick around. There's only 1 table inside, so don't plan on sticking around after you order. 

I just ordered the standard milk tea with boba. Service is pretty quick, they have a ton of tea pre-made in the fridge and the line wasn't too long. It wasn't the best milk tea I've ever had, but it also wasn't the worst. I liked that it wasn't too sweet and the boba wasn't too mushy or hard. I would come back if I have a boba craving while I'm already in the area, but it's probably not something I'd go out of my way for.
author: Trena M.

description: Full disclosure, I've only gotten their red bean drink (no pearls), but it is so good. They grind the red beans so that it's like a smoothie. When I get the chance to go to Irving I always try to get it.
author: Ellen H.

description:
This place has really good fruit smoothies! My favorite here is the papaya smoothie. They actually make it fresh with actual papayas in it, I love that I can actually taste the chunkiness of it. It's not too sweet and always tastes pretty wholesome. Their pearls/tapioca are very soft and chewy- not sweet at all. It's a nice place to come grab a quick drink and maybe some candy! 



CA$H ONLY!
author: Jane N.

description:
I loved this place with a passion. Would go out of my way to stop by all the time. Every drink I tried was awesome. Even the candy was good.

After coming here for over 10 years, they truly disappointed me. They refused to let me use the restroom. Apparently now it's only for employees. That was ok...I wasn't too bothered by that. It wasn't until my cousin and I stepped outside that she found a FINGERNAIL in her drink. Freakin disgusting. I am truly bummed that this happened and now I have to find a new boba spot. They gave us our money back for the drink but that doesn't make up for what they did.

Just FYI it was the young girl that works there. Hopefully you don't catch her on a bad day. Be warned!
author: Camilla G.

description:
I was pretty disappointed with the classic boba milk tea that I got. I had this place bookmarked for the longest time but I don't think the actual drink matched up with any of my yelp expectations. 

The drink itself was a pretty fair price (2.75) and the boba was pretty good. But the main thing was that the milk tea tasted off. My friend and I were trying to pinpoint why it tasted kind of off and I think our conclusion was that it tasted a little watered down in flavor. Maybe it's just the way they do it but I don't think I'll be trying that drink again. Definitely not authentic Taiwanese boba but would be open to trying some other things.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Still the best boba/tap milk tea in SF despite the rapid influx of new boba stores emerging.They always make the perfect blend of mlik, tea, and sugar. Wonderful is the O.G. of boba stores in SF. It has been around since I was in middle school and it was the the first place I drank boba. I remember when they used to be located next to where Quickly is now. That is how O.G. they are and they have been serving boba for 10+ years. That's is how much experience they have making boba drinks. 

The only thing they need to add to make then even more perfect is more indoor seating to encourage m customers to hang around and socialize. It doesn't have a inviting atmosphere unlike other boba places. Also a customer reward system would be nice like a free drink for every 10 drinks. 

TL:DR Wonderful is a staple boba store that's been around for a decade. Its only caveat is its need to modernize to accommodate new needs.
author: Jude N.

description: My fave milk tea place on irving.....However the owner lady NEVER charges me to switch lychee jelly for the tapioca but the employees charge me an extra 75 cents.
author: Linda L.

description:
All balls are not created equal.

You have your big balls, your micro mini balls, your firm balls, your soft balls, your bouncy balls, your saggy balls, your wrinkly balls, your lop-sided balls, your deformed balls and your stanky balls.

I've had them ALL.

Good balls are very hard to come by and Wonderful Foods Co makes some damn good balls. Perfectly round, firmly soft, yet bouncy with a delicious toothsome chew. Ohhh, so f*ckin good!

Lick 'Em, Slurp 'Em, Suck 'Em, and Devour 'Em. However you eat them, a mouthful is never enough.

Hey, I know what YOU are thinking but I was talking about these balls, you pervs: http://bit.ly/Wr4DPa

OTHER NOTES:
*The BEST Boba Milk Tea in SF hands down (better than Tpumps in San Mateo in my opinion)!
*Fast service but a smile would be nice too.
*Over 50 Boba drinks ($2.75-$4.25): Almond Milk Tea Boba is my absolute fav!
*Boba drinks are super high in calorie and high in carbs: http://www.myfitnesspal.com/nutrition-facts-calories/boba-tea (Yet most aZn beezies are still a size 0? WTF!) 
*Chinesey Snacks ($1-$4): Tea Eggs, Salt & Pepper Chicken, Fried Rice Cakes, French Fries, etc.
*Sweet Factory Galore ($1.75-$2.50/quarter lb.): Tons of Candies, Gummies, Chocolates, Chinese Preserved Fruits, etc.
*Two small tables for chilling.
*CASH ONLY.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Mmmm...I love that they do a large size now for $1 more!!! Yummy PHAT boba!!!! I love this place compared to almost any boba spot...other places water down their drinks or at least it sure seems like it so every time I'm here in SF I stop by if in the neighborhood!!!
author: Austin C.

description:
There are two things you need for a great boba-drink. 1) Good boba 2) Good drink. Unfortunately, I only got the good boba side of the order. I was really excited to try Wonderful Dessert & Cafe after seeing all of the raving reviews from other Yelpers. Being a total Boba-Head myself, I put them up for my own personal test: the Classic Green Milk Tea. 

The Tapioca Green Milk Tea ($2.75) had wonderful honey boba. Springy, chewy, sweet, and it was just the right size. However, the drink it was sitting in was bland, and felt watered down. Maybe I ordered the wrong drink, but Green Milk Teas are one of my favorites, so this just didn't do it for me.

Besides their drink menu, they have a bunch of candies by the pound and an assortment of dried and wet Chinese plums/prunes that I actually was very interested in. They go really well with hot unsweetened tea. 

This place is CASH ONLY, so don't forget to pick up some dollaz from the bank before coming in. 

Maybe it was just a bad night, but it'll take a while for me to try it again.
author: Cara O.

description: Out of all the boba places popping up in the city, this one is my favorite so far. I got their taro flavor (apparently one of their flavors they're best known for) and thought it was so good.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Tried a good selection of goodies from here. Though the pearls are good, they're not as amazing as most reviewers are saying. They're just fine. I like that it's not a chain store, but it is definitely pricier in general. It's a pretty grungy place with a couple tables, lots of self-serve candy... They offer a pretty extensive drinks/snacks menu.

The stars are probably the smoothies -- avocado, banana strawberry... They don't always use FRESH fruit though, the strawberry was definitely this syrup with strawberry chunks but they did use a whole banana. The hot grass jelly took awhile to prepare, and it comes in a sizable container with mung bean paste, red bean paste, and tapioca pearls. It was pretty good but I would have liked other fixings. The oolong was meh.
author: Vivian H.

description: This place doesn't look like much but bubble tea is very good here. Milk green tea used a good green tea that tasted like one of the better green tea mil teas I've had and I've had a lot. I also had a fresh watermelon juice that was blended watermelon and nothing else- not watered down, and it was made right in front of us. Friendly lady served us.
author: I S.

description:
Ughhhh, yesssss. Finally, a place that doesn't use any powder or syrup in their fresh fruit boba.

I ordered the watermelon juice tapioca and it was veryyyyyyy fresh and very good. It tasted exactly like watermelon if you were to eat it. I'm not a big fan of tapioca balls, so next time I'll order it without. I will definitely be back in this place next time I'm in the area!
author: Sunny O.

description: The Mango Tapioca drink tastes so fresh. I felt like I was literally eating slices of a mango every time I took a sip. The tapioca balls were also perfect! I usually avoid getting tapioca because some places make it too soft while other places make them too hard. This place makes them just right!
author: Xe X.

description: I really like their jasmine milk tea. I prefer milk tea here than any other place on Irving street. There's never a line and the prices are decent. They're also open late (12am) so that's a plus :)
author: Lushi Z.

description:
What else needs to be said about Wonderful Foods Co that isn't already mentioned in their 680+ reviews? Their name says it all! However, it's not very original name for a tapioca place.

I've been going to Wonderful Foods Co for my tapioca drink fixing since I was in elementary school. I must admit I had a Teaway phase, when they were first introduced in 2009 and monopolized Irving St. with their cheap prices, but Teaway's  tapioca quality has fluctuated a lot, always inconsistent in texture and taste.

Wonderful Foods Co has always been consistent with their drink and tapioca quality. Tea-based drinks are always refreshing and delicious. Tapioca balls are always mildly sweet, firm, and slightly chewy without being overly mushy or undercooked. I usually order a regular milk tea, green milk tea, or Thai iced tea here. I don't consider myself very adventurous with trying new flavors because I'd hate to waste a large drink if I dislike it.

In addition to drinks, Wonderful Foods Co has "food" items as well, from 30+ overpriced and different types of sugary candies to a more limited selection of fried snacks such as fried chicken, fries, etc. However, people usual go to Wonderful Food Co for drinks. They might as well change their name to "Wonderful Drinks Co".
author: Priscilla W.

description: Absolute fave boba place in SF. Almond boba is where it's at! Service is quick and flavor is consistently perfect everytime.
author: Jee Mee H.

description:
This is a mom-and-pop boba place that my girlfriend recommended. I didn't even look at Yelp before she pulled me into this shop for the first time. The first time I was here I got an Almond Milk Tea with boba. The almond flavor was strong, and the boba was chewy. Unfortunately it was a little too sweet for my liking. I guessed that the almond ingredient they used was already a little on the sweet side to begin with. My girlfriend had her usual milk tea with boba and she's very happy with it. 

Second time, I was there at around 11 pm for some late-night boba. I got grass jelly tea with boba (with less sugar) while my friend got lychee milk tea with boba. Both drinks were fantastic! The lychee milk tea contained real lychee bits, which was a pleasant surprise to both of us. The grass jelly is legit; from all the boba places I have tried so far, this is the only place that serves the real, bitter (yes, original grass jelly is made with very little or no sugar and tastes bitter) grass jelly. 

The shop also sells candies in individual containers and reminds me of my childhood. Overall, 5 stars for the drinks, legit grass jelly and late opening hours.

Oh, and cash only!
author: L L.

description:
First timers... at this location! But not first timers to Candy & Boba tea
 This spot is quick, moderately priced, and tasty!
My boyfriend got the Milk Tea & I the Taro milk tea... the milk tea was sweet... the taro milk tea was overwhelmingly sweet... kinda wished i got the smoothie to balance the sweetness...
Btw- I noticed customers purchasing the Chicken... so that'll be my next purchase when i come back
author: Regina R.

description: Don't be fooled by the sign in the front! Go inside and try their tea! The milk tea was very strong and perfect milkiness too. Only thing I would have liked is to adjust the sweetness which you don't have an option to like most of the other tea places. Their spicy chicken was also delicious! There may be a bit of a wait since it looks like they are made to order but it was worth the wait.
author: Yoomi C.

description: Love this place, I always order avocado drink without sugar . Today I also ordered taro drink , they made with real taro, not the powder mix !!!
author: Yan C.

description:
Every trip here never disappoints! This place doesn't get as much hype as it deserves but I guess that's a good thing since I never have to wait in long lines :D. Half of the place is a candy shop - which makes the whole place smells amazing - and the other half is the drinks portion. The place is very low key and simple but it doesn't need any fancy decor to announce how good their drinks are. 

Almond tapioca:
Not a big fan of almond tea UNTIL I tried it here. It taste like the asian almond powder drink without the powdery taste. It has a good mix between sweet and milky which is a good combo for those who doesn't have a big sweet tooth.  Never too overcooked or undercooked, the tapioca was on point. 

Mint Green Tea Tapioca:
This isn't a common order for me but I wanted to try something minty to change things up. The minty portion I believe comes from a syrup so it wasn't bitter. The green tea flavor isn't as strong so the drink was more milky. 

P.S. One thing that I really like about this place is that you're drink isn't 70% ice and 30% milk tea. They really smartly portion the ice to milk tea ratio so your drink won't be too watered down or room temperature.
author: Annie V.

description:
Havent been here for a while. Its a good local place if you want to buy candies or get  smoothie and any tapioca drinks.

I had the passion green tea tapioca drink for $2.75 or 3. Decent price for a medium size drink. I enjoy the drink. Its refreshing. It has good amount of sweetness and somewhat bitterness after taste of the tea.

I also had that flat long sour candy (forgot what it is call). It cost about $2+ per pound for the candy. Kind of expensive for the candy so i decided not to get a lot. Just enough for my craving. The candy that i got was good but looks a lot smaller than the usually size like sweet factory candy store.

Luckily my brother and i were lucky enough that it wasn't busy so the worker was able to make our drinks quick. I believe that if we had came after 3 or 3:30 pm, it would have been pack since it was a nice day on the day we went and thats the time when all kids get out of school. 

Parking can be bad if you go during peak hours since theres so many restaurants and milk tea drinks. Mostly meter parkings. But if you want to park thats not meter, you'll have to park far.
author: Julie N.

description: I've had milk tea here and a lychee smoothie here. It's not bad. The place is not decked out to be fancy at all. It's kind of like a clean, whole in the wall, Asian place. It's also a candy store and sells all those Chinese dried snacks as well. This isn't my favorite place in SF, but if I was in the area of this place, I'd go back if I was craving it.
author: Julie L.

description:
I was craving a drink one night and decided to try this place. I know wonderful foods have been here for a long time and I heard good reviews from this place.  I was craving honeydew, so I decided to come in and order it.

Upon entering, the place seems a bit empty but then again it was a bit late at night.  At least there wasn't a long wait.  They have lots of different snacks and candy available around the shop, so you can get both your snack fix and your drink fix.

Upon ordering the honeydew, I found the drink to not be too bad.  Although, I thought it was a bit too sweet.  My friend had the same drink previously that I tried awhile back, but it wasn't as sweet as it was today.  It seems like the drinks may be a bit inconsistent.  I heard they use real tea though and not just powder, which is a plus.

I think I will return again next time, but try a different drink.  I couldn't finish all of my drink because it was way too sweet for me and normally I like sweet.
author: Teresa W.

description:
Stopped by here after dinner. They have a bunch of candy, and a small snack selection like tea eggs, and other asian street snacks. I may have to come back and try them sometime. On to the drinks...

The taro milk tea is made primarily with powders. Just FYI. It's sweet, but not overly sweet, and pretty good. 

The passion fruit green tea is overly sweet. Ask for less sugar... unless you like it super sweet!

The lychee green tea (I asked for it without milk, and less sugar), was good. Not too sweet, because I asked for less sugar, and it came with bits and pieces of lychee in it!

The highlight of this place is definitely the pearls/tapioca (please stop calling them boba... they're not boobs). 


BTW, in TW, the common chinese name for tapioca milk tea is "zhen zhu nai cha" which translates directly to pearl (zhen zhu) milk (nai) tea (cha). In my experience, it is rarely/infrequently referred to buo ba nai cha. Most menus in TW use the characters for "zhen zhu", rather than "buo ba".
author: Kaje Y.

description:
This place is an old childhood favorite. I remember coming here in my elementary school days with my grandparents after we finish grocery shopping. The quality has remained the same throughout the years. 

I'm a fan of their:
1. Milk tea with lychee - it comes with real lychee bits and not lychee jelly 

2. Mango tapioca - which I usually get without the tapioca so it's just a mango smoothie that taste very similar to a mango lassi

3. Durian tapioca - ~$9 for this drink is what usually steer me away from getting it but when I'm really craving it, it is worth every penny! They use the real fruit so there's a really strong durian smell and taste - just the way I like it! I like to get this drink without the tapioca so I can really enjoy the durian without the tapioca getting in the way. 

4. Honeydew tapioca - sometimes it's made too sweet for my taste, but it's still good. I think you can get it made with honeydew powder or the real fruit, and I prefer the powder a lot more because the real fruit had a really weird grainy texture. 

Their tapioca are cooked too soft to my liking sometimes, but sometimes it's perfect. So I usually get my drink without the tapioca. 

When it comes to their candy selection, I'm a fan of their chocolate covered gummy bears and sweet and sour dried prunes.
author: Michelle T.

description: There are many places that serves Tapioca. But this is one of the few places that does it right. We ordred Taro milk teas and it is heaven when you take your sip. Boba is done right, nice and not overly sweet. They have a nice chew to them and its not brittle and fall apart or are they too hard. Flavors are fresh and always cold drinks. Overall, we love this place a lot. There are a few drawbacks. Cash only, parking is street and VERY limited. And the standards of the store has gone downhill throughout the years. Other than that, prices are still good, flavor is awesome. And they also sell candy, even though I don't think their fresh.
author: Tony G.

description:
3.5 stars but rounding up. Skip the long lines at TPumps with their awful milk tea that tastes fake and powdery, and come to Wonderful Foods Co instead! I don't understand why people like TPumps so much other than their low prices. In any case, back to Wonderful Foods Co, where I got to try some good milk teas:

-Coffee Milk Tea ($3.25) & Lychee Tapioca Milk Tea ($3.25) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wonderful-foods-co-san-francisco?select=VO4CwqxJbjF32n0nf9oYyg#VO4CwqxJbjF32n0nf9oYyg): The coffee was ok. There was a strong coffee taste, but you could tell its instant. The lychee milk tea was delicious, although on the sweet side. However, I loved that there were pieces of actual lychee in the milk tea! The boba here is also soft and chewy, but still manages to have some texture.
- Papaya Milk Shake Tapioca ($3.75) & Tapioca Milk Tea ($2.75) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wonderful-foods-co-san-francisco?select=VO4CwqxJbjF32n0nf9oYyg#5QavYjbTI--arWVmWMHYXw): The papaya was a bit weird, so I wouldn't recommend that flavor. The regular milk tea was good, but again, a little sweet. However, it was once again redeemed by the soft/chewy boba!

The service isn't the friendliest, but they are pretty efficient there. They also sell a large variety of gummy candies, and you can scoop out however much you'd like. Overall, their milk tea isn't that expensive (especially for the regular milk tea), and their boba is one of the best I've had in a while. However, I will definitely ask them to make the drink less sweet if I come back. Also, if you like lychee, make sure you order the lychee milk tea! Parking here can be a little crazy, but there is also a good amount of street parking available.
author: Amy D.

description:
WHAT THE EFF HAPPENED TO THIS PLACE? I was craving TPumps but there was a longass line, so I came here instead since I remember they had really good taro boba.

There was no line (which is pretty typical of this place, I just figure it hasn't gotten big with hipsters yet), but we got our taro milk tea and it was disgusting. Literally tasted the cream which left a weird feeling in your mouth and it barely tasted like taro.. and HALF our cup was filled with boba which wasn't even sweetened or soft..

Disgusting. I've never thrown away boba before, but I guess there's a first for everything.

I'm hoping this was just an off day since this place still has good reviews but I don't think I'm returning for a while, because that was pretty scarring (and a waste of $4).
author: Emily C.

description:
Pretty solid boba drinks. I've had better in SoCal, but this place is the best in SF. 

They make their drinks a little too sweet, but when I ask for less sweetened, it's perfect. I tried a few drinks, and I think my favorite is the Passion Green Tea Tapioca. The Mango Tapioca comes at a close second. The bf always gets the chocolate tapioca, and he never gets sick of it. It tastes pretty good, it's a hybrid of a hot chocolate (iced version) and chocolate smoothie. And their ice consistency is perfect. 

Prices are really good. Everything is under $5. 

They have two tables and like 6 chairs, but most people just take their drinks and leave. 

They also have various candies but they kinda look old and seem like it's just been sitting there for a while.
author: Nari C.

description:
Probably one of the best and stable boba place I really dig it here and would always come back here regardless of the cold weather..
Just try the milk tea with boba! 
The bobas chewy and the tea is really flavorful.
Not too sweet but its the right sweetness with small crushed ice. 

The people there is attentive and theres chairs to sit down. Limited but pretty good for a place to just come by.

Definitely coming back soon.
author: Aya H.

description:
They no longer make the Oatmeal tapioca. Which is weird because I thought that it's what they were famous for. And they still have it on the menu. But every time I come they just say they don't make it anymore.
Without that flavor really not much reason to come to this old run down place.
author: Norman P.

description:
I've been coming to get boba drinks here ever since I was in the 5th or 6th grade I believe?! Their very first location was pretty run down and looked very plain/hole in the wall-like. But their ambiance now is so much more friendly and welcoming, and I enjoy the occasional whiff of sugar smell whenever I pass by.

This is what popped my boba cherry. "Boba? Whats boba?" I thought. My aunt got me the lychee boba drink to share with my sister. It was so goood! I was still thinking to myself like "what is the point of the black balls in my drink?" Anyways.. years later, I still come back here for the best quality boba drinks in San Francisco. Service has always been great and friendly,  drinks are still at its best quality (I really like the banana milkshake smoothie&pearls!! And their milk tea) And there isnt much I can complain about this place.

Ok it may be an extra dollar or two more you would usually pay at a boba shop (like if you were to go to teaway or quicklys) but you are definitely getting great quality drinks. Plus in most of the $4ish fruit drinks, they use real fresh fruit which is a plus. However.. if you get the honeydew or strawberry or taro drinks that are like $3.25 .. you are most likely getting powder.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Not quite the best tapioca in town, or in the Sunset, or on Irving St.  Both times I've been here the tapioca has been overcooked and mushy.  We all (3 others) weren't that impressed with the drinks, either.  Papaya smoothie was kind of bitter tasting.  Classic green milk tea was alright, but again the mushy boba will always be a negative you can't ignore.  I wasn't unhappy with my avocado smoothie, but I've had better - it was above average.  Their dried squid is pretty good, but really far too expensive - you can find it for half the price (packaged).  

I'll be trying other places in the area before I come back - I know further south in the Sunset you can get much better (Taraval St).
author: Ben K.

description:
This is more of a 3.5 than a 3.

I ordered the pudding milk tea with tapioca with half sugar. It was the perfect amount of sweetness for me and I really liked the pudding. However, the tapioca was pretty firm and kinda broke apart into chunks in my mouth...
author: Leesur S.

description:
Awesome old school tea shop! The inside of this cafe is no frills, just a bar in the back where they make the drinks. They also have a whole assortment of candies and dried plums that they sell by weight. SO hard to resist!!

#1 tastes like ROASTED milk tea. Even though it's not explicitly tasted, you can also request less sugar. The boba was perfectly chewy and sweet. Most of the drinks don't use powder except #16-24. My kind of bubble tea!

No seating whatsoever though (remember I said no frills). Take your tea and candies to go.
author: Audrey L.

description:
The best boba ever. I always get the Strawberry Mango Smoothie with boba and it is SO GOOD. I guess it's not really boba in the sense that I don't get the tea but this is a very traditional boba place! 

Their popcorn chicken is also very good :D 

REMEMBER: CASH ONLY!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
5 stars for their tapioca smoothies! I haven't tried their milk teas yet...probably because I'M TOO IN LOVE WITH THEIR SMOOTHIES. The strawberry mango smoothie is my favorite, but the plain mango and strawberry flavors are delicious as well. 

Their boba is pure perfection! It has good flavor and a nice chewy texture. 

To top it off, Wonderful has affordable bulk candy ranging from $1.75-2.50 for a quarter pound. They even carry the ever-so-hard-to-find chocolate covered gummy bears (milk AND white!). Whenever I'm here I HAVE to get candy. Even if it's just a few pieces...or a pound, I can't help but start digging into the bins. 

I've never encountered a long line here and they fulfill your order pretty fast. Wonderful has held its own despite Quickly and the 3 Teaways that opened up across the street.  They're a little more expensive, but hey who said quality came cheap?
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Have you tried their popcorn chicken? If not, you are definitely missing out. 
The popcorn chicken is very juicy and flavorful which it's hard to find the same taste anywhere else. Also, don't forget to try their Lychee Milk Tea!!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Solid place for boba especially on Irving, where boba spots are literally everywhere down the street.

By far, this place makes the best tapioca I have tried in the area. It's nice and chewy - not too soft or hard - and has a slightly sweet taste. 

The drinks here are also pretty good. They use powder for all flavors here, so don't get your hopes up too high. However, they put the right amount of flavoring and mix it really well. I never had to drink powder before. I'd recommend getting the almond tapioca here!

Service is really fast. Drinks are done in like a minute or two. They sell candy and various snacks here as well. 

NOTE: cash only!!!
author: Gabriel N.

description: It's an okay place. There are plenty of other options in SF, but I just came here because my SF friends kept recommending it. It does give me a reminiscent feeling of Oakland Chinatown where I often frequented, with its handmade signs and cheap prices. I don't always get boba, but when I got it here, it was actually good.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Prices have gone up. Quality isn't as good as it used to be. I don't really care for the competition either, i-Tea or T Pumps doesn't really do it for me... Now.. if they can modernize this place with bright lights, fresh paint, comfy seating, and digital menu displays like a real taiwanese tea place, but keep their authentic style and fresh flavor, their business would be off the charts...
author: Chris H.

description: I came here a couple times before and have always gotten their fruit smoothies and never tried any of their milk teas, so I can't say anything about them. My faves include strawberry, strawberry mango, and avocado. I came recently with friends and they ordered a pina colada with almond jelly that apparently was not all that great, so I miiiight recommend against that, though I haven't tried. But yeahhh, the smoothies, try those.
author: Sara T.

description:
Let's see...first that that caught my attention was...THE CANDYYYYYYYYY! :D

For candy that cost the same you can group it in the same bag. Makes it easily to do calculation. 

Boba, really quick and is yummy. I got the Almond flavor and my boyfriend got the Taro. They were both great and took turns drinking each of them.
author: Corie L.

description:
When my love for jasmine milk tea first started, I thought this place was really good...BUT I got spoiled with all the authentic tea spots in the South Bay. Don't get me wrong, Wonderful is pretty good, but the tea flavor isn't as prominent as I like and it's a little too sweet for my taste. 

I would definitely choose this over TPumps, Quickly's, or Teaway whenever I'm in the area. However, I never find myself craving their milk tea. 

The service is great here and the workers are friendly, so that's definitely a plus, but other than that, this spot is just an average tea spot for me,
author: Jamie A.

description:
This place has some really great boba and I love how they crush the ice instead of you having tons of ice taking up too much volume in your cup. In addition they sell gummy candies and asian dried plum/orange peels that I'm a huge fan of! 

It's a small place with literally one table inside so don't expect to be able to sit down!

P.S. this place is cash only
author: Victoria C.

description:
I'm so intrigued by the fact that all of their drinks have tapioca in them by default. And yes, I'm calling it tapioca rather than boba because a few non-Cali kids have called me out on it -__- HAPPY NOW?

So I was torn on what to order because I like sesame and oatmeal but wasn't sure I could commit to those flavors in liquid phase, and other reviewers had said the longan tea was no bueno and that the mint green tea was devoid of mint flavor. I was considering the honey green tea or the papaya milk tea, but my indecisive mind finally settled on the PLUM GREEN TEA with TAPIOCA, $3.25, $3.53 after tax.

Don't get the plum green tea -___-

I was hoping that they would be gentle on the sugar. Alas, I was disappointsed. I guess I should give them credit for staying true to the sharp sweetness of Asian dried plums. But I would rather have the plums in solid phase then.

I will say that their tapioca is quite good. A bit petite in size, with a pleasantly consistent chewiness. Getting the drink warm probably helped with pliancy too.

My friend got #22 ALMOND JELLY with TAPIOCA  and HONEY, $3.75 I think. The almond jelly looks like it was cut up from this big almond jelly block (imagine something that looks like a block of tofu...but it's almond jelly...here, look at Trishya M's picture: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wonderful-dessert-and-cafe-san-francisco-2?select=ywy4Rxr0pi4xANS1a7Jw4A#i5Zs8LjFkBq7K5F9MxHDww). The drink was sweet, but definitely not as sweet as mine.

Will have to come back to try something better. Maybe the red bean or green bean!

Or maybe I should just try my luck with more normal flavors, haaaa.
author: Adele F.

description:
I like this candy store, they have a blend of American favorites, including lots of "gummy" (sour, sweet, etc.) candies in all types of shapes and flavors.  

They also have chocolates, and other sweets here too.

They also have Asian / Chinese treats too, like preserved dried plums, moy, etc. 

They have pricing by the 1/4 lb and are reasonable compared by how most bulk candy confession stores price and sell.

It's CASH ONLY but there's ATM machines at the many banks located on Irving Street.

Parking isn't easy if you expect front door spaces, but those are expensive meters and if you're buying candy by the LB, chances are you might want to get in a little exercise to work off the guilt and calories n' avoid getting diabetes... so, it's not too hard to find parking a few walking blocks away for free in the Sunset District residential neighborhood streets.
author: Rick S.

description:
The Black Milk Bubble Tea was okay: a bit too tart (very coffee-like) for my tastes. I can see why some people might be put off by it. 

But if the bubble tea doesn't impress you, this place packs another one-two punch. Their fruit smoothies and candy selection is awesome. My Blueberry Smoothie (made with REAL blueberries) was awesome. My friend's Papaya Smoothie (made with REAL papaya) was equally awesome. And I was able to get some SWEDISH FISH!
author: Mark C.

description: I really like their fresh fruit smoothie, avocado, kiwi and blueberry are my top three favorites. Also salt and pepper popcorn chicken is a must try.
author: Fiona C.

description:
My standard is purplekow over in the outer Richmond, so I had to see what sunset had to offer! And they didn't disappoint. 

The tea here is mainly fresh or with fresh ingredients, it seems! That is, most of them are not powder. I got the pineapple with coconut boba. It was quite good, and it doesn't bash you over the head with sugar content like purplekow does! 

I also got the spicy salt and pepper chicken, too. That's one of my frequent orders at any bubble tea place. Theirs is really quite delicious, although slightly less spicy than I expected (if I'd eaten it there, they probably would have had extra spice they could add). 

The place is not fancy but is definitely charming. A couple small tables is all they have, but it's a good neighborhood to walk around in anyway.

Next time I'll try some of their candies!
author: Chris S.

description: Got a large jasmine tea milk tea. It was $3.75. Go to Quickly for cheaper prices on boba milk tea.
author: Denise C.

description:
Came here last night and was very weirded out. It was not really a boba place as much as it was an old candy store. The decor was very lackluster as in there was no decor and had one table for four. A homeless person came in and tried to talk to us (to which the cashier and Boba-making girl ignored). 

As for the actual Boba, I got the tapioca milk tea, which was overly sweet and not very good. My boyfriend got the winter melon milk tea and had them remake it because it was too sweet. It was still not very good afterwards. We were deceived by the numerous good reviews. The other 2 friends who came with me were just as surprised. Don't let the reviews/4-star rating fool you. We still have no idea what happened. It feels like we stumbled on the Yelp twilight zone with this place.
author: Angie N.

description:
Solid asian drink place. I like how this place was open late and fast. There are a lot of asian candies in containers all along the walls. I found that very interesting and unique. The menu on the wall is a little flustered and can get confusing to read, but you will find a drink that you want. There are also minimal finger/snack foods available to order. There is also 2 small tables that you can enjoy your drinks, but typically people just grab and go. Customer service is not the best; typical asian place where it is straight forward and done.

Drinks: 
-Milk Green Tea w/ boba: Great milk tea flavor. Not the best ever, but it was good. Boba was great, melted in your mouth and it was not too chewy. 
-Iced Passion Green Tea: Refreshing and not too sweet. Great balance of flavor and tea. I would recommend. 

Con: The focus on one customer at a time, from ordering to receiving your order. This method is convenient when its your turn to order, but if you are stuck behind someone with a big order it can get annoying. 

CASH ONLY
author: Jacqueline P.

description:
AMAZING BOBA!

Driving back from Daly City I had a craving for some boba and decided to swing by and grab some from Wonderful. Thankfully my BF was with me because there was no parking, so I dropped him off so he could order while I drove around for a bit to kill time. After 5 minutes he was back so I picked him up and we had our two cups of lovely boba tea (around $3 each).

I had the almond milk tea with boba and he had the thai tea with boba. Both were delicious and SWEET! These drinks are not for the faint of heart. And they don't skimp on the boba which is amazing =) Almond milk tea is my go-to drink but never have I tasted a drink like this one: it truly tasted like fresh almond milk! It wasn't an artificial, syrupy taste at all, it was the real deal. The drink also had a beautiful, white color to it that I loved looking at haha 

I wish this place wasn't so far from my apartment because it's delicious!! It is still definitely worth the trip though so I'll be back soon for my almond milk tea =D
author: Sam F.

description:
Friend brought me here for drinx. While the watermelon was otherworldly, the taro boba tasted like it was made from powder. Whether true or not, I was not terribly impressed... i miss the other place on Clement that is no longer.... 

waaaa
author: Jana C.

description: The salt and pepper chicken was good -- different from any other places that's I've tried. There's a tint of sweetness to the chicken. Boba was okay. My friend and I got the milk tea and Thai tea tapioca drinks. My friend liked his Milk tea because it had a good balance between the tea flavor and sweetness. I wasn't a big fan of the Thai tea tapioca -- it tasted a bit watered down. Overall, I may come back to try other drinks.
author: Kei V.

description: This is a hidden gem on Irving Street, as It is a small candy shop easily overlooked. I always get their milk tea, requesting less sweet. Their milk tea is heavy on the tea flavor, the closest one to authentic Hong Kong style milk tea I have tasted around the area. It is very strong too! sometimes I get the milk tea instead of coffee, and it works very well. I have only ordered this one drink, but I highly recommend their milk tea!
author: Karen C.

description: One of my favorite boba place in SF. Parking could be hard to find during the day since it's on Irving. But I love the watermelon juice with boba and the milk teas here. It's to die for. I'm a watermelon lover so this place is the best place to go for watermelon juice boba. It really is bomb.com! The wait usually isn't long either. Oh, just remember to carry cash, they don't accept cards! Love this place
author: Monica W.

description:
Not sure what I'm missing out about this place, but I don't think it deserves 4.5 stars. I would give it more of a 3.5. Sure, the service is quick, but I don't think people were noticeably friendly. The employees weren't mean, but they didn't exhibit exceptional customer service. I don't know if I could easily strike up a conversation with them-- maybe because it was a long day and they weren't really up to talking to a complete stranger.

The boba, by far, is one of the chewiest I've ever tasted. The milk tea, however, tasted sweet. It's interesting how they don't ask to adjust the sweetness level. I read in other reviews that you could really taste the tea, but I'm not sure why I wasn't able to taste it because it was masked by the milk and sugar. Next time, I might try the passion green tea because I've been to two places so far & both places have hit it  out of the ballpark for me (Purple Kow & Ten Ren Tea). Overall, the tapioca milk tea wasn't anything all too special (aside from the boba). At, $3.25-$3.75 each, I might give another flavor a try next time. On a side note, this place is CASH ONLY. 

The store itself is small. They also sell candy in plastic containers, just like what you would find at a Sweet Factory or It'Sugar at the mall. It's $2.50 per quarter pound as of 5/12/14 (who knows? prices may increase). There's metered parking just outside (free after 6PM). It's $2/hr anytime before 6PM. If you're looking for free parking around that time, there's always free 2 hour parking in nearby residential areas, but you may have to walk a small distance. I definitely want to come back and try another flavor to see if it can redeem itself & I may follow-up with a higher rating.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Been disappointed the last three times I've come here. All three times, I wasn't able to order my beloved popcorn chicken because the cook wasn't there. Why even have it if your customers can't even order it?? 

Note:I did not go near closing/opening, etc. that would've been understandable. I went around 9:30-10 pm, 2 whole hours before they close.
author: Kay A.

description:
My sister, dad and I use to come here EVERYWEEK for boba back when they were at their old location. She'd get mango, I'd get chocolate, and my dad would get almond. Although Irving is cluttered with dozens of boba shops, Wonderful foods is by far the best in the area, if not in the city.  Their tapioca is the perfect texture (not too hard or to mushy) and not overly sweet.  They have countless options, and I've tried many and was never disappointed. My new favorite is the almond milk tea and my boyfriend LOVES their honeydew as well as their fresh watermelon juice. 

P.S. They have rows and rows of candy!! Sour belts and coca cola gummies are the best combo.
author: Linz C.

description:
The first time I ever had a tapioca drink was at Wonderful Foods as an 11-year old. Raised in the Sunset, I remember weekly treks to Irving with my dad after being picked up from my volleyball and basketball games, and Irving was always a stop before we went home. Back when WF was merely a cart inside Tam's Laser, before mainstream got a hold of it and white people decided to call it "boba"...those were the days. 

Despite newer, Instagram-trendy boba places popping up throughout the Bay Area, Wonderful Foods will always have the top spot in my heart. Sure, they don't have those cute cups that don't fit into your car's cup holders, they don't ask you how sweet you'd like your drink, or if you want green tea or black tea. Wonderful Foods doesn't need to ask me these questions because my regular order always comes out tasting the way it has for the past 14 years. Call me sentimental, but that's good enough to keep me coming back for more.
author: Olivia V.

description:
Ambiance: Very quaint and cute. Street parking is relatively limited so thank goodness someone was backing out when we arrived! Once you enter the store, you'll notice that on the left there is an array of delicious, mouth-watering American candy like strawberry tape, watermelon gummies, chocolate, gum drops, gummy bears and soooo much more. On the right, you'll notice an array of Chinese sweets like dried fruits, dried ginger, candied citrus peels, and more~! There are a few tables (maybe 2 or 3) and a bathroom in the back that you'll need a key to access. 

Service: Service is so quick and definitely VERY friendly! :) I didn't know that it was cash only and I only had my card on me. Instead of giving me a hard time, the lil ol' cashier lady just smiled at me and said something along the lines of: 'Ok no worries. I'll be right here. I'll keep your candy on the side.' Such a sweet sweet lady. :) So I ran back to the car and thank god i dug a 20 dolla bill. 

Food: - Almond milk w/ boba: BY FAR the BEST almond milk with boba I've ever had. It's literally just almond milk + boba. way better than almond milk tea w/ boba. I went to this place on New Year's and I'm still dreaming about this drink. 
- Mini gummy bears: Favorite candy in the world. So rare to find. this store just earned major points for having it in stock. WOOO!
- Raspberry/Blackberry gummies: First time trying these here. Meh these are okay. Haven't gotten use to the outer shell part. It's like I'm biting into a thin, sweet plastic before I get to the gummy middle. 
- Strawberry tape: Yummmmmmmm. Reminds me of the movies~ 
- Rock candy lollipops: Didn't try these because i don't like rock candy but the bf loved them. :P

Price: We spent about $16 for 2 drinks and 4 bags of candyyyyyy. Awesome sweet splurge to start the New Year's off right. ;)

Tip: - Almond milk with boba!
- CANDYYYYYY!!!!! is a must

Conclusion: Ohhhhhh hellll yes I'm going to be back here when I'm in the city. If only traffic getting here wasn't so crazy and if only this awesome boba shop was located closer, I would be here every day! BEST BOBA STORE I'VE EVER BEEN TO IN MY LIFE!
author: Cindy M.

description:
For the longest time I'd been hearing about this place across the street from Tea Way that had superior boba and teas.  My friends would rave about how much better it was so I of course had to try it.  After a nice dinner with the lady, we decided to cruise by for some dessert.

I ordered the almond milk tea with boba and was surprised to see that they made it using the powder.  I never was a big fan of that method because it often comes out really gritty, but they did a great job of mixing it together so that there was no grittiness whatsoever.  The sweetness was just right and the drink was silky smooth and definitely higher quality.  The boba itself was ok and I actually prefer other mix-ins these days.  Very good overall!

Prices are totally fair and affordable and my drink was only $3.25.  It is about a dollar more than Tea Way so that's obviously got to be taken into account wen choosing.  I don't know if I'd choose it over my go-to place all the time but once in a whole it's nice to have a superior treat.  Unfortunately there's nowhere to sit inside so it's almost always a togo situation.  Oh well, it's still great!

Food: 8/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Here on yelp I shall write this rhyme,
Because Wonderful Foods have stood the test of time.

They've been serving drinks and selling sweets,
for a very, very long time, on Irving Street.

I used to always drink their Lychee Tapioca,
for when I watch Boy Meets World and the girl Topenga.

Now that I'm older, I drink number thirteen.
It's not as sweet, but it's crisp and clean.

So don't buy into the hype with all that 'Boba' craze,
and enjoy your tapioca at this Wonderful place. 

: )
author: Ringo M.

description: I love Wonderful.  My family and I - and most of my high school friends for that matter - have been coming here since I was a teen.  Many tapioca places in this city don't pay enough attention to the quality of their tapioca and tea.  The tapioca at Wonderful is actually done well.  It's pleasantly chewy, very subtly sweet, and even textured.  No soggy, bitty, or hard boba here!  The tea actually tastes like tea.  The fruit drinks are made from actual fruit cut and blended in store.  It's classic tapioca done fresh and well.  The milk tea, Thai tea, grass jelly, watermelon, and papaya milkshake are my faves.
author: Tracey L.

description: Omfg!!! Best popcorn chicken I ever had in my life. It's the salt and pepper popcorn chicken but order it spicy! Don't worry, it's not that spicy. It definitely adds a kick of flavor. Before even finishing the bag, I went back to order more but the kitchen was closed :( also, the thai tea here is good and it comes with free boba
author: Tony V.

description: The Boba is okay but the tea is bad....i don't know why there are so many 5 stars review but they probably didn't try other better Boba places before....
author: Chad L.

description: Okay, an update and an upgraded review is definitely warranted. Wonderful Foods Co has the best hot grass jelly I've tried in the Bay Area so far. Now that I've moved to Inner Sunset, I have a feeling I'll be coming here a lot and getting me some hot grass jelly to warm myself up during these cold SF summer nights.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I had a jasmine milk tea and I tried the regular milk tea and pudding tapioca milk tea. 

Looks can be deceiving! The outside looks a bit dingy and the inside is spacey but a little barren looking. A lot of mangos lay in the corner. 

My jasmine milk tea was good. It was very light and I haven't really had jasmine milk tea before so I'm unsure how it compares. It's also not on the menu I don't think.

However, the original milk tea was SOOO good. It far surpasses any other regular milk tea I have had before. It tastes a bit like mocha or maybe even vanilla and it's fantastic. 

The pudding tapioca milk tea was the best. It's more expensive but dang is it worth it. 

Overall, if you're looking to spend a little less get the original milk tea ($2.75) because it's SO GOOD and if you don't mind shelling out a bit more get the pudding tapioca milk tea. I would only get the jasmine if you enjoy jasmine milk tea or are looking to be adventurous.
author: Carina M.

description: The boba is alright.  It was kind of firm and the texture was off. But we did come at 11:45 at night, so that probably explains it.  The tea was made from powder and there is a lot of sugar.  So, if you like that, this is the spot for you.  I'm sure that this place is better in the middle of the day when lots of people visit.
author: Alexander P.

description:
I wish there was one of these in my neighborhood in South City. Probably a good thing there isn't because I heard somewhere that Boba was Chinese for boob, because that's what you end up with if you drink too many Boba drinks :) (Ping Pong Playa)

You can get a durian smoothie at this place. Durian! 'Nuff said. At a hefty $8.50, the durian smoothie is a once in a while treat that is worth it in my opinion. Their smoothies are tasty and made using actual fruit. There is also a pretty good assortment of candy at the store.

Cash only
author: Jose U.

description:
I've been here a couple of times. Apparently its known for it's milk tea, but I'm an iced tea kinda girl! 

I got the passion fruit iced green tea ($3.25). You can really taste the passion fruit and it wasn't too sweet. The boba was nice and chewy. I like that all the times I've been there, there wasn't muchnof a wait. The downside, they barely give any ice and I like a lot of ice, personal preference. The staff is not friendly at all, but I don't care, I just want my drink. The store does have a funky smell...I'm pretty sure it's from the tea eggs on the side.
author: Thuy N.

description:
I have absolutely no idea why this place has such high reviews. I may be from SoCal where all the Asians and best boba places are but this place just sucks ass. None of the milk teas appealed to me so I just ordered a regular boba milk tea. It was okay, the boba was good enough but the milk tea was overpowered by what tasted like coffee creamer.

I only came here because it was a Sunday night and I don't know much about SF so I chose this place just because it was open. Also when I was walking around looking at all the candy, the mangoes had 2-3 bugs crawling in them, ew.
author: Diana C.

description:
Greetings!
The tea is definitely "best in town". The tea place is family owned; some would say it is "a bit sketch" but the owners were very friendly and service was swift. I would not be turned off by the boring exterior; the tea here is, as mentioned earlier, best in town.
author: Angelo C.

description:
Honeydew Milk Tea with Tapioca tasted like grains of sugar that weren't melted in my mouth.  After trying that, I haven't wanted to return to check out their other flavored boba tea drinks.  I'm pretty sure there are other decently made drinks and this was a slip up.  

They have other boba tea shops near this one, so the competition to choose where to get my boba fix is quite a toughie.  I'll come by to try their drinks once again, but not anytime in the near future.  Not much of a seating area, either. 

Cash only spot.

They offer side selections of delectable sweets if you feel like boba and more sugar.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Tried this place for the first time because I read an article listing the best places to get boba in San Francisco. I got the tapioca milk tea, pretty standard drink to try at a new place. I personally liked it. The condensed milk did outweigh the tea taste. 
The atmosphere did look a little sketchy but it did look like it was family owned.
author: Kelly O.

description:
This place used to be my go-to spot for avocado smoothie, but they raised the prices. Another thing that stopped me from going? 

On my last visit, I ordered my usual "large avocado smoothie with grass jelly", and I was given a regular sized drink. When I complained, the girl told me she only charged me for regular size. Well, my total was ~$8. A regular-sized smoothie costs that much? Well, I've been going there for a long while, order the exact same thing,  so I'm pretty used to how much my usual order costs. Even with a price increase, the regular size shouldn't cost that much. Another issue I have is that they charge extra even if you opt for grass jelly instead of boba. They charge you for the boba (which is part of drink already) and then for grass jelly. Shouldn't you just replace the fee? Sometimes, you'll get a nicer (smarter) cashier who will charge for only 1 add-in
author: James S.

description:
Maybe I didn't order the right thing but this place didn't live up to the expectations that were set by the good reviews. 

I came here after dinner to satisfy my sweet tooth, and I'm a huge fan of taro so I decided to order the taro milkshake (the one made with real taro). When I got here there was no one else here, which made me a little wary as to why there weren't more eager customers. Cash only payment, and I received my drink very quickly. However, I was not a fan of the taro milkshake. I generally love taro and artificial taro flavor but this drink fell flat for me. It seemed like there was absolutely no sweetness added and it may have been almost pure taro because the consistency was very starchy -  kind of like paste and a little grainy. For me the flavor wasn't really there especially since I was looking for a dessert type treat for after dinner. I prefer artificial taro smoothies to this drink. On the plus side, I thought the bubbles were cooked perfectly. I probably won't be back because I really struggled to force myself to finish my drink. But who knows, maybe some of the other items on their menu are good.
author: Johanna H.

description:
I came here on suggestion of my co-worker, and my drink was good. I ordered the ginger tapioca, and it was delicious. It was like an uncarbonated ginger beer. The tapioca was a tad too chewy. 

But the service wasn't that good. After my drink was done being made, they never called me. I had to walk up to the counter and ask the girls 3 times if the drink on the counter was ginger.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Im terribly addicted to this Sweet Shop! They've ALL the best Sweets you could possibly want! SO delicious. Really keen on their Sour sweets!

They are open LATE..... just wish they'de gift wrap cos I initially came in to buy sweets for a friend & ended up showering myself with piles of SWEETS!!!!

I ought to STAY AWAY or get banned cos at this rate the people that own this shop are going to end up having to either roll me out or spread Crisco around the Edges of the bloody Entrance!

Yummy, this tempting place!
author: Julian I.

description:
