He's quite the masochist when it comes to sour belts and the sensitive teeth ailment that follows.  Now you know his kryptonite.  Plan accordingly.

Me/Gold Gatsby/Ryan's #1: I was torn between a lychee milk tea, watermelon juice and grass jelly juice.  My childhood hankering for grass jelly won and I was happier than a fat kid with a Twinkie.  Tonight my fellow Yelpers, the watermelon juice is getting turned out and life will continue without a hitch.  Your welcome world. 

SF adventure reviews to continue.  Catch y'all in the Bay.
author: Angie N.

description: i can actually taste the tea when i order my milk green tea. doesnt taste artificial. I've been coming to wonderful ever since i was a child. Their milk tea and strawberry banana smoothies have never failed to put a smile on my face :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
Rather than simply continuing to mourn about how the only good milk green tea in the Bay is down at the Ten Ren in Cupertino, I figured it was high time I actually went around and tried the other milk tea joints in the city.

In the area, and having just eaten at Underdog's, I dropped in with some friends to try a milk green tea without boba. And while it's still got nothing on Ten Ren (it's hard to beat a place that's known for their actual tea), it's certainly among the better ones I've had: not overly sweet, with tea that you could actually taste, for a reasonable $2.75? I can't keep asking for TOO much more right?

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Don't expect any issues getting inside or navigating, as both the doorway and interior are quite spacious (the doorway even has an automated opener, albeit unnecessary since they keep it open most of the day). And while the counter where you order is low, the pick-up counter is fairly high - however, the past two times I've been here, the owner has given me the drinks directly.

Bathroom - A single private bathroom for the shop, which requires a key to open. Plenty of space inside, with handrails as well.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Drink of Choice: Original Milk Tea (to be safe)
Variety: 3/5 
Ambience: 2/5 (small, would consider this just a drive-thru boba joint)

Walked down to this area with my cousins after our thanksgiving lunch and with the really high yelp ratings I was excited to see what the hype was about. 

I was pretty disappointed though. I don't know if I just ordered the wrong thing or what.  I decided to try something unique and ordered the Lychee Milk Tea and it tasted so off that I couldn't even finish it. I think another one of my cousins ordered the Honeydew Milk Tea and wasn't that happy with it either. 

The second star though is for their boba because their boba does have a fresh chewiness to it.. so maybe i'll just order a cup of boba instead? heheh. 

Just cause there have been so many positive ratings I might give this place another shot and order something else, but yeah, for now, not so wonderful ):
author: Christiana C.

description:
Satisfying your urge to have boba is similar to finding the nearest restroom.  When you need to do the deed, you'll usually settle for the one that is closest and least grotesque/revolting (this of course, is highly subjective).  On Irving, Wonderful is the 5-star hotel bathroom in a location saturated with less desirable alternatives.

Do not be discouraged by the neon green menus that could pass off as pre-K arts and crafts projects or the wide array of seemingly unfamiliar candies that compose the store front, as this place is the real deal.  The black milk tea and boba are as close to perfection as you'll get outside of Chinatown, in my honest opinion.  If you are into the other drinks such as flavored tea or smoothies, your mileage may vary.  The staff is friendly and I have yet to have a bad experience while ordering my drinks (no 30 minute waits while being surrounded by Snapbacks and Vans).

There's a lot of boba hype around Irving, but this place is definitely one that I hope stays low-key and maintains its quality.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
UPDATE: They have officially discontinued almond milk tea, sesame milk tea, and oatmeal. Noooooo.

I wanna know what they put into their milk tea because there is something magical about it. 
Finally tried the lychee milk tea and, although pudding milk tea is still by far the best, it also tastes heavenly, not as sweet as other people complain it to be, and while it's not freshly blended like other fruit/veggie(bleagh for green bean) drinks, there's still pretty clear chunks of lychee in it. Also, ginger is my new favorite after oatmeal & pudding. It's like ginger candy crystals melted into a milk tea format. There is a veeery mild spice to it, but the sweetness definitely overpowers it.
author: N N.

description:
Wonderful foods is one of a few decent bob a options in the city. But compared to the south bay or elsewhere it is lacking. I always judge a place by its pearl milk tea, and oddly enough theirs always tastes like coffee. 

On my last visit though, we also tried their watermelon icee, which is made from real watermelon, and can be quite refreshing
author: Vince E.

description: I went in June 2015 and was not sure why this place has so many reviews.. is it because it has been open for a long time and had reviews since 2005? I ordered the banana milk tea, and it was good, but the boba was just boba. I like sweetened boba, and this boba was not sweetend, just chewy. Not sure if they used a real banana, but they have a lot of boxes of fresh mango outside their counter  I will definitely have to give this place a second try because I didn't see the wow-ness factor in their drinks or why they are so highly rated on yelp.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Cash only.
Decent boba but not worth trekking back to unless I'm in the area.
Lots of candy to choose from. 
Tea eggs are available if you like that sort.
author: m l.

description:
Childhood memories overwhelm me whenever I am here. This was probably one of the first places that started the tapioca trend in sf and it's still one of the best! 

My friend and I wanted to get tapioca and we reviewed our options-tpumps, teaway, quickly? Nope- gotta go with wonderful foods co.

They just always are consistent in great flavors, service and price! I know what I'm paying for it'll always be delicious! 

I always go for 2 things - the taro milk tea which is not powdery or watery like some places. And the lychee juice with lychee jelly - good if you like sweet and love lychees. 

My friend likes their pudding Milk tea. Everything they have must be good since they are still here ;)
author: Christine W.

description:
The awning doesn't say "Wonderful Foods Co" so just look out for the building number 2035.

MILK TEA:
There's a hint of coffee taste to it! I first tried a sip of my friend's iced milk tea and quite liked but I have to have my own drink to have a real opinion of it. So I ordered a hot milk tea with boba and yup, it's good. And that slight hint of coffee was a nice subtle twist on a classic drink. It was very nicely done. Though it was on the sweeter side for me, it's still much better than the sugared up stuff you get from other places. 

PASSION GREEN TEA:
There's fruit bits or jelly in here! I couldn't tell exactly what it was but it tasted much better than the boba. I absolutely love the boba here but this drink already comes with fruit bits so the additional boba was a bit overwhelming.

HOT MINT GREEN TEA:
Excuse me, but is this the mint green tea? "Yes." Hmm...are you sure? I didn't taste any mint flavoring at all. I can definitely taste green tea but mint? Nope. Had this drink twice and still never tasted it. Perhaps it's time to head back to the drawing board for this one. 

PEACH GREEN TEA:
There's peach bits! Can ya say yumm? If ya like subtle fruity green teas, this perfectly hits the spot. It's refreshing and not overly sweet. 

OATMEAL MILK TEA:
I just don't get it. I like oatmeal, I do, but as a breakfast item and not in drink form. People say that this is a true hit or miss and boy, did it miss for me by a mile! Why do people drink this??? It doesn't make sense to me and I make fun of my friend who actually quite enjoys it. It's different and if it's peeking your interest, definitely give it a try. You may not know what you've been missing out on. Or you'd regret spending $3 on it. If the latter, can't say I didn't warn ya! 

There's candy, lots and lots of candy. And a slow cooker filled with tea eggs. Interesting combination, I know. But I've seen people get it so these guys know their target customers!

There's two small tables and about 5-6 chairs. Sometimes it's easy to get a seat but other times, just forget it. If it's not readily available when you're there, there's no point in waiting. The bathroom requires a key and you have to ask the staff for it. 

Cold drinks are usually pre-made and comes out of a container in the fridge. Hot drinks are usually cold drinks put in a mug and microwaved in the back. Kinda saddened me in the beginning but it still tastes delicious and the boba is always fresh so no complaints here!
author: Sandy T.

description:
SO much better than the other boba places of irving. Definitely doesnt taste like a large cup of powder mix. The milk tea and pudding is sweet and flavorful without tasting too artificial. The tapioca is amazing and sweet, not like the soggy, oversoaked boba at the other places nearby. Definitely will be back with all my milk tea cravings.
The service is great and the wait isnt long!
author: Veronica L.

description:
I was drawn into this place because of the name: Wonderful! There was no reason to buy anything but to browse around looking at the goodies including the cold drinks and candies. 

While resisting to buy some sweets, I noticed a bin for pork jerky ($22/lb) that was screaming my name. Back in the day, I heard it was popular in Taiwan (I think it's called bakkwa) and it had this indescribable taste. My friend explained this delectable which is not available in the US and therefore became my challenge to find it. Was it an urban legend or the Holy Grail of Asian jerky?!? I purchased one slice (about $2) and redeemed it to the jerky expert. I'm still waiting for the verdict but in the meantime, if anyone knows another place who sells it, please let me know. Mahalo!
author: Santi T.

description: This is my favorite boba spot! It's authentic in my book. I ordered the green milk tea. The tea is brewed and not powder. The boba is always consistent. It is slightly sweet, has the perfect chewy texture, and they give a decent amount.
author: Linda P.

description:
Best boba tea ever. 
You know when you make strawberry nesquik milk and it tastes good but when you drink already made in a bottle it tastes AMAZING? Think of every other place you have had boba tea as your home powdered stirred strawberry milk, and this place as the professionally made to perfection strawberry milk in the bottle.
author: Dulce O.

description: This place is anything but wonderful. Found a fingernail in my boba drink earlier. Don't ever ask to use the Employees Only bathroom or that young girl with the ponytail will slip a disgusting fingernail clipping in your drink. Gross workers. Zero stars. This is real and it is disgusting.
author: Rocksy C.

description: I have to give this place four stars. Although their customer service isn't the greatest. I love their tapioca drinks. Their tea eggs aren't the best, but they're okay. I really really like their tapioca drinks. Legit. I stay on the East Bay Area, and I drive to Irving, when I'm craving it. I love it.
author: Morna T.

description:
No tables to sit down

Tea Egg was dry

Jasmine tea boba was extremely plain.

Sorry...looks like a nice mom and pop shop but they realllllly need to step it up. 

Service was good.
author: Phillip P.

description:
After following my boba cravings all around SF, it's always Wonderful Foods that tops the rest. Why?

+ Almost no line any time of the day, unlike some places (looks over at Tpumps & Purple Kow)
+ Open late - until 12am? Score for late-night snacking!
+ No frills ordering - see the menu board, order from there and modify as you wish. Simple as that! 
+ Consistency in milk tea (not too sugary), and soft & chewy boba. Every. Single. Time.
+ Quick service

Mix your drink, take a sip, and indulge in that sweet tooth of yours at Wonderful Foods. Just take note that this is more of an in-and-out you go kind of boba place (only two tables in the entire store), and CASH only.
author: Loriel L.

description: Love their milk teas. I can taste the tea very well, it's not watery or powdery like most boba places. They are very generous with the amount of boba they give. It's a bit too much for me but you can always ask for less.
author: Tina S.

description:
Another update ~~~ this time for the food. Recommended by my sister's bf. 

Green Onion Pancake is a win. (:

I know good green onion pancake and theirs is yummy. 
Takes a bit of time, but definitely very yummy. The texture is different and they season it with salt and pepper? Wow. That's awesome. ^___^
It's a little pricey but it's worth trying if you've been curious~!
author: Susan Y.

description: I use to like it alot. But feels like lately the quality of the tapioca is going down, the all stick together. And the they make wrong order too... we call the items by number too. Get the quality better please
author: Hao L.

description: I love this place. The owner also owns Sweet Hut in the Inner Richmond and the now closed iCrave (which I miss dearly). I love their regular milk black tea and their oolong milk tea. The regular milk tea is the real deal! The tea has that tea/coffee flavor profile that is rare to find. The boba texture is great and has just the right amount of chew. They are better than their competition on Irving Street because they don't have insanely long lines and their tea and boba are great. Bonus points for having a kick ass candy selection. I go here for my chocolate covered gummy bears :) I WISH they had ice cream milk tea :(
author: Alice H.

description: Boba or bubble depending on where you're from are chewy yet not sweet.  Thai tea, ummm, I asked for less sugar so I don't know if that's the reason why it tasted watered down.  If they couldn't adjust the sugar content they should have said so.  But if that's really how their regular drinks are then this place sucks.
author: J W.

description:
BEST TAPIOCA DRINKS IN THE WORLD!!!

I've been going here since late 90's when they were across the street. They were one of the first ones to serve Tapioca drinks in SF waaay before the chain shops started to open. Drinks are a perfect balance of tea and milk and the tapioca has always been cooked al dente.
author: Ron R.

description:
Their RED BEAN TAPIOCA is the most bomb tapioca drink I've ever had.  I've had tapioca drinks from Socal area including 626, Westminister, Garden Grove, Irvine, etc. and in the Bay Area, however, maybe it's because I've been coming to Wonderful for nearly 10 years, but this drink still destroys all.  No contest.

Food: With 2 whopping dollops of thick, sticky red bean paste, coconut milk? (I'm not quite sure what they use, but next time I'll ask), and some ice and boba.  It's so simple, but somehow they make it just right.  The only close second I've had was surprisingly at the horrendously-serviced Guppy's in Irvine.  However, that's if you're willing to wait 10-15 minutes in a crowded, cramped, and loud area for your drink or stand outside obliviously. Rather than a milk drink with red bean, it's has more of a smoothie consistency and is ohh-so-good.

Service:  Always fast and friendly.  When you have to wait, it's more often than not, less than 5 minutes.  As the store is fairly spacious, you don't have to worry about an early onset of claustrophobia or being cramped, in blocking anyone's way, or dodging other customers.  Basically no seating though and cash only.  No problem.  Store owners are either Mandarin or Taiwanese.

Verdict: Go here.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I've heard about this place from a friend so I decided to give it a try. 

The place itself isn't a typical milk tea place that's set up to look super cute or whatever. It doesn't even look like it would sell milk tea. From first glance, it looks like a candy store. When you get to the front, you start seeing the various papers on their wall that tell you what kind of milk tea they sell. That day, I chose to get a taro milk tea to test things out.

It didn't take too long to get my drink. The price is a bit more expensive than other competitors on the same street, but the quality is definitely different. 

The drink itself is creamier and has a stronger flavor. It's very delightful. I would recommend going here for milk tea rather than the other places. I personally think it tastes better and it's more local.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Wonderful?? It's OK. I would not come back here for boba if I were in SF.  I definitely don't understand the 4.5 stars for mediocre boba.

The milk tea boba (according to staff is most popular) tasted like powder and even had a bit of a grainy texture. I wasn't a fan. The boba was chewy though.

If you MUST come here though, maybe get the almond milk tea. My friends liked this, although I again wasn't a huge fan (but also because I don't enjoy almond milk). The watermelon drink is apparently good, as per friend.
author: Lils Y.

description: $3.25 for milk tea boba, lots of flavors to choose from, great customer service and barely any wait! I appreciate the crushed ice instead of cubes. There's also a bunch of candy including dried ginger and plum stuff. Will definitely be returning!
author: Noji N.

description:
Went here on a Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday afternoon. The owner was very nice and smiling. Her son (I think) working seem very nice as well as we exchanged eye contact. 

This place is cash only. I forgot one time and had to go back to the car to get cash so be prepared as they won't accept plastic or Apple pay. 

I got three different drinks on the three days I went there: Mango Tapioca, Durian tapioca and Lychee with coconut + tapioca. All were delicious. It was very good and the tapioca was perfectly done. Prices were reasonable and the drinks were made quick. 

BTW, there are only two tables inside this cafe.
author: Daniel M.

description:
My favorite place to get boba drinks.  The boba pearls are fresh and do not get dense after an hour or so like other places.

Hot or cold, my favorite place to get boba drinks.

Too bad I don't live closer.  Or maybe it's a good thing because I would gain so much weight from getting drinks every day.
author: Aura J.

description:
My wife loved Boba, so I am forced to drink it from time to time.  
I can take it or leave it.  There is one flavor that I really like that I've only found at Wonderful Foods.  It's the Oatmeal Boba.
It's delicious and I actually enjoy drinking it. 
If my wife wants to get a boba I always try to make her pass the other 5 boba places on Irving and head to Wonderful foods.
author: Rob S.

description:
This place is definitely something else.  The drinks at this place are disgusting.  You can really tell they do not mix their powder well.  Every sip feels like I am drinking sand particles.  

The "Sweet Factory" setup is nice.  I have actually gotten candy from here before.  However, their candy tastes old, stale, and overly chewy.

Some of my friends like this place. I can sadly say, I would rather walk down to Quicklys.
author: Victor L.

description:
After a very cold day out in the SF Zoo - I told my GF that I wanted boba! She fortunately... took me to her fave spot. And for that I'll be thankful!

We managed to find parking on Irving... yes shocking even for us! A couple of coins later... we were  inside and wow, they do really specialized on milk teas! Talk about varieties! 

Plus they also have a whole lot of candies! The highlight: they had milk and white chocolate gummi bears! 

I managed to fight the cravings to get candies again... so I just ordered my usual: honeydew milk tea.

First sip: damn that's good!

It doesn't have any powdery taste to it... the tapioca was soft and chewy... plus my drink wasn't filled with ice so that's always a good thing! 

I'll definitely be back! $5ish for the two drinks!  

**CASH ONLY**
author: Cath M.

description:
Thank god my friend from SanFrancisco told me about this place, otherwise I would've never guessed it had such great boba tea. 

Being from MN, we have the very non-authentic chain stores of Tea Garden which uses powdering for every flavor. However Wonderful Foods uses real fruits in almost every drink. I got the avocado boba tea and mom the durian (I know what most of you are thinking: Yuck). 

The avocado was probably one of the best boba teas I've had. I could definitely tell they used real avocado since the consistency and taste matched an actual avocado! And it was a beautiful avocado-ey green color :). The pearls were the perfect consistency: chewy, light, and not too sweet. My mom's durian, well lets just say you could smell it a mile away. However I tasted it and although not being a huge fan of durian, it was so fresh and good. 

Coming here the next day (couldn't help ourselves), my mom got the watermelon boba tea and I the red bean. Her's was very refreshing and they actually used real red beans in mine; so good but a little thick. 

Definitely come out of your way to try their boba tea, but might want to plan some sort of workout afterwards to burn off all those calories ;). 

Only thing a little strange were the random rows of candy. Are you guys a candy store or boba store? I don't see those two things mixing...
author: Sunny T.

description:
Boba at its finest!

Just walk in. Look at the menu. Throw down a number. Pay. Step aside.Wait. Pick up. Drink.

That's how simple it should be. None of this 5 pumps this and 4 pumps that with lychee mango jelly light sweet stirred not shaken. Good lord. 


Plain and simple. Do it. You'll like it. I promise. Maybe...
author: Anthony L.

description:
This side of Irving is out of control when it comes to boba. There are literally three Teaways, a Tpumps, two Quicklys, and likely some other lesser known boba joints that I'm unaware of.

But, why on Earth would you brave an hour+ wait in line, (Tpumps) or, put up with subpar quality (Teaway, Quickly) of other neighboring boba shops for a similar price? Because Wonderful Foods is right there, there's virtually never a line, yet their product stands as far superior compared to the rest. 

Wonderful Foods is not only my favorite boba shop on Irving, but in San Francisco. I'm not even a boba fan, but even I can't resist the lure of their delicious taro milk tea -- it comes in a delightful creamy purple concoction, with their perfectly cooked, fresh tapioca balls (firm, soft, chewy, slightly sweet) underneath a thin, refreshing layer of crushed ice. Order this. Pay (with cash only). Mix with your straw. Let it settle for a few seconds. Drink. Enjoy. Repeat.

It's also fun to peruse all the different types of candies they have - sort of like an Asian-ized Sweet Factory. When available, their delicious tea eggs have been simmered for hours and are a great, cheap snack.

Other places may be cheaper, yes, and some may have far more hype, but Wonderful Foods is the only one that is synonymous with satisfaction.
author: Betty W.

description:
HANDS DOWN, BEST BOBA I've ever had! Ok, maybe top 3. The reason is that they grind real fruits, not some syrup or powder. A bonus, the price is cheap, so, so, so, so cheap. I ordered the lychee boba and ONLY because I was assured that it was actually the fruit that they grinded up. I refuse to drink boba that is flavored or powdered. 

On any given day, I will have boba at least once a day, if not twice a day... No tables or chairs. Parking is a bit hard to find... But boba here is awesome.
author: Zar A.

description:
I'm physically incapable of passing by anyplace that sells jellied sour grapefruit candy.  I ran in, loaded up my plastic bag, checked out the other offerings: 

white chocolate gummy bears
swedish fish
malted milk balls
dried mango
tapioca drinks
and lots more

Nice, clean place; Great selection.  

I said I was going to give that bagful to Weffy, but really?  I ate most of it myself, within the hour, and it was pure deliciosity.
author: Tracey A.

description:
The green milk tea was just average. Maybe slightly better than most places but still not as creamy as I'd like.
The boba was just Ok.
They have a lot of snacks/gummies that you can buy.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Best bubble tea I've had in San Francisco on my last trip! 

Heads up: Cash Only
author: Arthur C.

description:
I've got a soft spot for Wonderful Foods, this was the first place I ever had boba tea seventeen years ago, my Taiwanese roommate took me here and I was kinda in love with her. Or maybe she was in love with me, it's hard to remember anything except the tea and all the savory candies in tubs and the dried squid.

As good as it was, there are much better places now that I"m turned onto it, places that mix in fresh fruit instead of powders and syrups. Still, not bad. I would say average boba tea, which is a good thing.
author: Gil S.

description:
I've walked past this place many times thinking that it is just a candy store, but IT IS NOT JUST YOUR AVERAGE CANDY STORE.....

It's a place where incredible boba is made, and delicious almond milk tea that isn't too sweet (juuust right) is served too. Come here for the spicy chicken bites too. I love that it closes at 12AM and serves the best boba that I've had so far in the Sunset :)
author: Lillian N.

description:
I got the red bean milk tea and OMG it was so damn good. 

Very VERY minimal seating, which I don't quite understand because there is so much space. They have a wall of candy that you can buy, probably buy by the pound. 

This place kind of looks like a hole in the wall so you might even walk past it a few times. It is down the street from TPumps, so it might be hard to compete, but I definitely recommend that you give this place a chance.
author: Cathie N.

description:
Ordered the lychee milk tea with tapioca!!! $3.25.   Theres chunks of lychee in there and plus the syrup. I've never had real chunks of lychee in here. It tasted refreshing and yes, I'm coming back again next year!!!!! They didn't put a lot of ice in here so it wasn't that cold so good thing I had a cooler full of ice in the car waiting.

I also ordered the salt & pepper chicken that was made to order. Hot, fresh, spicy, lots of wonder spices!!!!! $5.00 a little pricey but delicious !!!  I rated this plus a 4 because of the chicken. Chicken had like a calamari chewy texture. Not sure if the chicken was freezer burned, old, or it was cooked too long?????? The outside part of the battered and chicken was yummy but inside was odd! 

They have a lot varieties here such as kumquat milk tea, durian milk tea!
author: Ivy N.

description:
Why wait at TeaWay when you can get your drinks for faster and cheaper here?! :) :) Especially when that line is ridiculous and never ending.

Seriously one of the best Tapioca Milk Teas. They also sell a great selection of Asian snacks and candies. Wonderful was around before all the other Boba joints and is still one of my favorites.

- Jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description:
I really wish I felt the way everyone else did about Wonderful...
Supposedly, I hit it up on a miss night according to the SO whose go-to for boba had been Wonderful since his HS years.

But the milk tea was not very milky, too sweet and overall just not made well. I have probably had better at Quickly's...

I'm tempted to try again because of its high ratings but you guys know Super Cue opened not too far away, right?
author: Winè C.

description:
Cheers to Irving St. providing the dranks and balls for all the boba junkies in the city. Wonderful Desserts never fails to help with that boba fix.

Their drinks are pretty sweet, potent in flavor, with good chewy boba. Everyone hypes over TPumps, but I really like the quality and the lack of line at Wonderful Desserts. The best I ever had? No, Drake. But a solid purchase. Some of the drinks can be a little pricier than at other boba places around, bit I will not complain on the goodness. 

Also, they have snacks and bulk candy. I haven't had their savory snacks yet, but yes on the white chocolate gummy bear bin. 

Cash only as well! and may I suggest more seating?
author: Kristine T.

description:
When a Chinese chef gets a request of using a heavily reduced amount of salt, oil, and on top of that no MSG, he should be sweating like a mofo if he doesn't quite have the skills. Because now his stir fry needs to be put to the test (alongside his choice of ingredients). It's sink or swim now. For the masters, gods of stir fry, this is child's play.

Likewise, when an Edoko (those who can proudly trace their lineage to Edo period in Tokyo, aka true OG $hiznit Tokyoites) sits at a sushi bar, and the first thing he orders is kohada (gizzard shad), it means he is not to be taken lightly. If the sushi chef is not careful, he will fall into a trap he can never get out of. Those who worship Jiro Dreams Of Sushi and Ono Jiro's impeccably high standards, will know he takes certain preparations very seriously. Kohada is a very difficult fish to prepare right, particularly the salt rub, vinegar marination. All in the timing and technique, in addition to years of experience to know how to control this through the seasons, since one cannot judge fat and moisture content by visual inspection of a fish at any given time of the year.

Now those standards don't really apply to tapioca milk tea and it is really hard to judge for those who never have had the real stuff in Taiwan (particularly at the places that claimed to have invented the drink). But for me, if you can brew a good cup of tea or milk tea, you have earned my respect. Or take brewing tea, tea leaf selection, maybe some honey (time, temperature, technique)....if you can turn that into a delicious drink where there is a natural balance, you should be put on a pedestal where people would be willing to lay down on the tracks and die for you.

Unfortunately in most cases of tapioca milk tea in all of NorCal, you take away the sweetness, and suddenly you can taste a bunch of weak spots.

Wonderful Foods.... not sure how I never came back before, but decided to drop by earlier to see what is the fuss all about. It's pretty obvious they know their way around the balls....tapioca/boba, that is. Texture wise, this is quite decent, but the buck stops here. Unfortunately a simple request of asking for the rest (aka the milk tea) less sweet, unmasked quite a lot of undesired qualities

The milk tea was basically uninteresting and very lacking. Not in a watered down kind of way, but obviously not brewed to order. It wasn't bitter, oversteeped, or acidic....but it had a slightly malty earthy texture that wasn't anywhere close to a good roasted barley or roasted oolong (e.g. Tea Era in Mountain View, which has suffered a decline as well). I have to say Fantasia Cupertino was more enjoyable (and I'm not a huge fan of Fantasia but respect the boba for the South Bay).

Didn't even finish my cup. It was that bad, despite the ok balls. A boba drink is not complete without a good milk tea, and if you have to rely on sweetener to make it palettable, you have failed (but perhaps not with the hipsters).

Sunday night, circa 7 pm and empty storefront. No ABC hipsters lining up for 45 mins for a drink, as many reviews as this place got.

Tpumps 2 is coming soon up the street, which I am predicting will roll into town like Godzilla and destroy all the WATTE shops in its path like a Tsunami (if LATTE = milk with a shot of coffee, WATTE = water with a shot of tea). Wonderful Foods better be trembling and step up its game to fight the Godzilla (maybe send in Astroboy to make the drinks!), even if I prefer WF over Teaway and Quickly Bento (which is not saying much).
author: Ken K.

description:
I don't know what they do here, but their stuff here just tastes better than every other place I have been to. I have been coming to this place since I was a kid, and since they were at their last location. Stuff tastes better than every other boba place on Irving, don't know why, can't explain why, but it just does. I think everything is made with love, because that's the only thing I can use to irrationally explain my love for this place. 

Spongebob must be secretly making the drinks.
author: Wells Y.

description: This is the best candy store in SF. Good prices, high quality sour belts. The only reason I'm writing a review about a candy store is because it's that good. And because I love candy.
author: Samantha T.

description: This place is the most simple/basic tapioca drink place I've been to. When you walk in, theres different varieties of candies on either side of the store which is sold by the weight. The selection of drinks are on the wall and there's not very many compared to others I've been to. I opted for the almond tapioca drink for $3.25 which was surprisingly really good! I asked the girl if it was a milk tea, and she said there was "no tea, only milk" which I assume is coffee-mate powder creamer and almond flavoring of some sort. Whatever, it works.
author: Nicole D.

description:
Wonderful Foods is just what three stars stands for, A- OK. Not quite sure what all the amazing 5 star reviews were about. Maybe I ordered one of their less amazing drinks? I got an original milk tea. Nothing was wrong with it and nothing was amazing about it. Just plain average. Would I come back? Meh.. probably, since it's close and cheap. 

Perhaps, I'll try a different flavor next time. Also, this place is cash only.
author: Priyam D.

description: The best part of coming here is the candy. I love being able to pick whatever I want and fill up my bag with all kinds of gummy candy treats to enjoy. Usually when I make a stop here I'll also get a Honeydew Milk Tea. It's never failed me before and I doubt it will ever fail me.
author: Michelle C.

description:
My BF and I were in the neighborhood grabbing take-out Indian and I really wanted a refreshing drink. There are many tea places in the 'hood but they were all really crowded, and I just wanted something fast. I searched on Yelp and found this unassuming spot. 

There wasn't anyone in there and the menu was really limited. I ended up ordering watermelon juice with light boba. The cashier and gals working behind the counter were VERY friendly. The juice was not too sweet and tasted like chilled, pulverized watermelon. The boba was perfectly chewy and a nice addition to the drink. You should definitely stop by here if you're looking for something simple and quick.
author: Grace C.

description: 5 stars to the Popcorn chicken. I have tried popcorn chicken everywhere I go and it's the best one I had so far. Chicken is very tender not dry, crispy skin is just perfect not over fried. I like my popcorn chicken w basil and it's just way they served. Some popcorn chicken were just too salty, too dry or too much flour/starch, but the one they have just perfect to me.  I have tried few times and the quality and flavor are always consistent, never disappoint me.
author: Pam T.

description:
I'll always refer to Wonderful Foods Co as the OG boba place! Even with Quickly and Teaway competing to dominate Irving street, this place still manages to make good business which means they must be doing something right! 

The price can be a little high, but you can REALLY taste the difference. There is definitely a quality to their milk tea and delicately chewy tapioca pearls that can't compare to other tapioca chains. Not to mention the variety of different flavors to choose from, they even have real durian~ YUMMM! My all time favorite is the almond milk tea. It's mind blowingly sweet and nutty and has that distinct smell that drives me wild. If I wasn't on a college student budget and could fufill my weekly dose of boba here, I'd be set for life !!
author: Tina O.

description: bubble tea is great and they have a nice selection of candy andn all the dried prunes, plums, etc. service can be a little slow but this place is a classic
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
I don't care if you're somehow allergic to tapioca, if you're here, you're ordering it. Squishy perfection at it's best. Some places have the hard boba that you just don't want to eat at the end, and I definitely remember playing with those in high school by shooting them out of my straw. Doing that to these balls would be BLASPHEMOUS.

Enough on that, they don't powder / microwave everything in front of you like the other chain stores. I heard that they prepare all the fruits themselves--such dedication! 

There's a large selection of candy too! At first I thought this was weird, but it just makes sweets shopping so much more convenient! :)
author: Christine L.

description:
I've been a customer here for over 14 years and for that this place deserves 5 stars. While many boba places come and go, Wonderful Foods will always be my first and holds a special place in this native San Franciscan's heart. 

The texture of their boba balls are always consistent. There is probably a few times in all the years I've been here where the balls are not good. I can't even count how many times on one hand. That's how rare of an occurrence it is.

This is the place you go to if you just want the basic milk tea without all the fru-fru trendy add-ins.

#1 and #4. Can't go wrong with regular or milk green tea. You can even substitute the balls for almond jello.

Watermelon slush is perfect for a hot day and if you're craving something really sweet, go with the honey & almond jello drink.

There are no crazy lines, no different size balls and no hype. The customer base is a loyal one. Its the people who have known Wonderful Foods as the first Boba place on Irving who always come back.

You should also try their salt & pepper chicken. Super yummy.
author: Terry D.

description:
Like everyone else, I decided to check this place out due to the fantastic reviews. I ordered the passion fruit tea(#24 on their menu?) and it tasted like pure concentrate. The drink was extremely sweet where I could only drink half of it and threw the rest away. Shortly after, I started to feel sick where I wanted to throw up.

Perhaps I got a person who over did it with the flavors? I don't know, but It's hard for me to come back and order something else when there are other places that serve the same thing.
author: Brian H.

description:
Came here yesterday for the Tea Leaf Eggs, which were delicious! strong with flavor. 

The milk tea was pretty good.  The tea was strong enough, but the tapiocas i think were cooked for too long.  It was a bit mushy. 

I love tea leaf egg!
author: Emi K.

description: I ordered an almond milk tea and it was really powdery and WAY TOO SWEET! I didnt like the tapioca either because it wasnt chewy. Maybe it was just a bad day? Who knows. I'll come back and give it another try.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
The first Boba tea place in San Francisco. Before Quickly, Teaway, and all these hipster places showed up. Wonderful is .... WONDERFUL. Their Jasmine Green Milk Tea is amaaaaazzzzing. They also have candy. Good candy. Yay candy. Their regular Milk Tea has a bit of an espresso taste ... Not my forte. So I switched to Jasmine Green Milk Tea.

Growing up, I use to drink their Sesame Milk Tea. But they took it away. Sad face.
author: Iris L.

description:
I've been going here for a couple of years now & they never disappointment me. 
- Their boba are always very flavorful & chewy. 
- The customer service is great. 
- the wait isn't too long for a drink.
- there's a variety of candy to buy 
This place is definitely my favorite tap place in San Francisco!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Exactly what the sign in the window says "best tapioca in town "
Ever since stumbling upon this place a while back I come here at least once a week now and my girlfriend probably comes here more often than me . The staff is nice and even give good suggestions on some of the more interesting flavors they have . 
The selection of flavors is not that large but the flavors they do have are excellent and tasty all around .
My favorites are almond tapioca and honeydew (served fresh or with powder - both are great ) tapioca .
Also have a crazy selection of candys and pockeys ! 

Basically awesome place all around , if your a boba lover you have to check this pale out .
author: Angelo G.

description:
A great alternative to the sweeter, less authentic options for boba along Irving street! Wonderful Foods is stocked with a wide range of candies and sweets along with a great selection of boba drinks. You can purchase candy by the pound and pick and choose amongst different sweet ranging from peach rings to chocolate-covered gummy bears. 

Best part about this place is for sure the boba drinks! What's great is that the milk tea drinks here actually taste more authentic and contain tea unlike the more powder-tasty drinks you'll find at Quickly's or Teaway down the street. Of course that also means you might be paying a $1 or so more. With Tpumps in the boba competition here on Irving street, Wonderful Foods will always be the veteran and go-to spot for those of you looking for authentic boba drinks without the overhype of Tpumps. Lychee milk tea with tapioca, regular milk tea with tapioca, honeydew tapioca, and mango tapioca are all great here! The milk teas have just a hint of bitterness as tea should and the flavors used to make the drinks are good. The boba itself is also a definite plus - not too chewy and sweetened. Wonderful Foods is here to stay so go!
author: Cheston W.

description:
I used to hate on this place but I have to say I am a changed woman now. I love Fantasia but they only have it in San Jose which sucks. When I found out that I can pretty much recreate the drink I get at Fantasia here, I was hooked!

Must get: green tea (NO MILK), boba, grass jelly & lychee pieces. Make sure you say lychee pieces and not the jelly! You can thank me later.
author: V L.

description: Been going here for years whenever I happen to be running errands around the area. I killed a large strawberry mango smoothie which only lasted me up to Quintara street. Damn me. Damnnnn meeee!
author: Leo L.

description:
I got the winter melon tea and it was sickeningly sweet. It tasted like burnt sugar but not similar to caramel. I can't quite put my finger on it. The drinks didn't live up the hypes on Yelp.

They had a good array of snacks. A bit pricy but I really like their dried plums.
author: Olivia C.

description:
what makes the boba milk tea here good was that they take your order and makes each one individually with the cocktail shaker and your preference. that blended bubbly foamy taste is what makes them unique.

unfortunately today, the only young girl thats there now intended to pour me what was already in the shaker, who knows how long its been sitting there?

AND whats worse, since she was the only one there, she started take the 6 orders behind me and was intending to take more. 

what happened to this place. there are so many other options. sad
author: Food Is L.

description: I've been coming here for years and been a loyal customer...NOW all of a sudden they don't let me use the restroom anymore, not a good sign, might not be coming here anymore...jk. I'll still come here, but NOT AS MUCH.
author: Q W.

description:
13 years ago (not sure when they opened but when I was aware of this place) we didn't have Quickly or Teaway or TPump or even Purple Kow.  We had this place.  A Taiwanese family who brought tapioca drinks and sweets to the people on Irving St.  As a little girl then, my favorite would be the mango.  They use fresh mango, I am sure they still do.  13 years later they still serve the same things, and with so much competition still seem to be in business.  It kind of surprises me because they are never that busy, at least not like how they were back in the day.  What they do bring is just good, wholesome yummyness in the form of a cup.  

With all these new places that have mixed flavored drinks, customizable jellies it's hard to remember about the old-fashioned milk tea.  To be honest, I have only came by once in the past 3 years.  When you have a boba addiction, it can get quite expensive and you sometimes opt for cheaper alternatives.  But rest assured -- this place is a place to visit more often.
author: Leslie L.

description: My all time favorite boba place! My go to is always strawberry mango and milktea. The smoothies are made with fresh fruits which always is a plus
author: Sherry H.

description:
I tried the Honey Green Tea and the Lychee Milk Tea here. The Lychee milk tea had pieces of lychee in it and that was really good. The honey green tea wasn't super impressive but it was ok I guess. I thought both drinks were a bit too sweet for me, but I'm a light weight when it comes to ingesting sweet foods so you might want to take my review with a grain of salt. 

I liked how the place had extra random candy and snack foods that you can buy in bulk/by the pound! The prices were not that expensive either!
author: Amiee H.

description: It's only fitting that my first Yelp review should go to this excellent establishment.  Despite the popularity of variations of tapioca shops exploding all over the city, I've maintained loyalty to Wonderful Foods Dessert & Cafe since they were located across the street from their current location.  They know how to make tapioca right, the majority of their fruit drinks are actually made with real fruit, and their selection of American and Asian sweets is comparable to every child's dream.  Lastly, where else do you see firetrucks and 5-0s double parked outside to get their tapioca fix?  Tapioca shops come and go but one thing remains the same - Wonderful Foods Dessert & Cafe.  Mic drop.
author: Erika W.

description:
Don't judge this place by the outside, or you're missing on THE BEST BOBA IN TOWN. No joke.

From the outside, you wouldn't know it's a boba shop at all. It has a bright neon awning, first of all. Second, the front glass walls weren't covered with "boba specials" or anything like that.

From the inside, the first thing you see was not the usual barista area, or seating areas. Instead, you find...

...candy

Yup. Candy. Like Sweet Factory candy -- drawers of candy where you can buy in bulk ($1.75/lb). I was so excited I almost forgot my main purpose was to get boba -- I wanted all the Peach-O's, sour gummy worms, and strawberry belts in the world! They also have a variety of chocolate goods, Japanese snacks (i.e. Pocky), so take your pick!

On the right side of the store, they have more drawers of snacks, but this time it's your dried Asian snacks, like sour plums (white, red, sweet, sour), dried squid, etc.

Now FINALLY, when you get over sugar heaven, you can finally walk to the back where they make your boba drinks. The menu is on the left wall. They have your usual milk tea and almond teas, but also interesting flavors like durian, avocado, etc. Prices are pretty good (a little less than $3 for a regular). 

And VERDICT? Freaking delicious! I got the regular milk tea. I was so happy because:

1) They didn't add that powder non-sense. They actually poured tea and milk into a martini shaker and made my drink by hand.
2) The boba was SUPER soft and chewy. The middle of each boba was NOT hard at all! 
3) They didn't try to jip me and fill my cup with pretty much all ice. Instead, the ice was shattered and created a slushy feel.

Wonderful Foods, your name is truly what you are: WONDERFUL.

Till next time, XOXO.
author: Evelyn S.

description: I think the tea shop is okkkkkk....milk tea tastes isn't good. Its milk tea is not authentic Taiwanese milk tea! Also I feel they use the cheap ingredient to make milk tea, so when I tasted milk tea I want to throw it up! I am from Taiwan. I really suggest that do not drink their milk tea....But hot herb jelly is good.If you don't like herb smell, don't not eat it.
author: Angela D.

description:
This is more 3 1/2 stars than 4, but I'll round up because of the quality of the taste. I ordered an almond milk tea, and I must say the consistency and quality of the drink was spot on; I was impressed! What really turned me off, though, was the boba was too soft and chewy. Maybe I'm picky, but I always enjoy the boba from tea era or fantasia, where the texture is just right (not too hard or soft, and still chewy! This boba didn't come quite up to par, but the taste of the milk tea more than made up for it.

Definitely give this place a try if tpumps is lookin way too packed.

Remember: bring your cash!
author: Eric N.

description:
Currently obsessed with the honeydew milk tea with boba!  So amazing.  I also really like how the ice is in smaller chunks than normal.  I don't know why, but I swear it makes the whole drink taste better. :)

After having boba here, you'll never want to try boba from anywhere else!
author: Caroline K.

description: Great milk tea: taste was really of milk and tea. My friend got the taro smoothie and there were chunks of real taro in there. I think this is the most legit place I've ever been to for milk tea. 3.25 isn't too bad for the quality. Would definitely recommend less sugar though.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Best Boba Milk Tea in SF. Friendly quick staff and if you have a sweet tooth tons of candy!

Price is average
author: Matt T.

description:
WONDERFUL FOODS IS THE BEST TAPIOCA IN SF!
(taken from my friend "Kenny L.") 

A friend of mine once went her for about 30 days in a row i believe and got the same drink everyday. although i don't come here that often, i try to come here whenever i can especially since they're open till midnight.

Green milk tea is my go to drink and it's delicious!
author: Tiff C.

description: This shop is cute .. There's a assortment of candies!! It's like candy heaven lol One person working at this place. They only accept cash. The boba taste good!
author: Stacy S.

description: Came here because it was the only place open that was nearby. It was my first time here so I asked my friend what he usually gets and he ordered a green milk tea for me. It came really fast and it tasted AMAZING. It was sweet and the boba was amazing. And it was cheap. I would definitely come back.
author: Kevin L.

description:
One of the top boba places in SF-hands down. This mom and pop shop is a go to boba place for any SF native. 

Surrounded by delicious restaurants you walk to Wonderful Foods and are welcomed by wall to wall containers of bitter, sweet, and sour candies! 

If you make past all the sweets you are welcomed with an array of boba drinks! I normally get a honey green tea with boba of course! Take a seat or stand by and watch them make your drink from scratch from freshly prepared fruits.

Wonderful is the perfect place for an afternoon snack, post-dinner sweets, or even that occasional boba urge :)

Remember to bring cash since they don't take credit card!
author: Jon K.

description:
THE place to go for your tapioca milk tea fix!  I think I've been coming here since high school, back when they were at their old location.  Like a loyal puppy, I inevitably just followed them to wherever they went.  Thankfully, it was just diagonal from where they were.  Haha.

Prices run a little higher than what you might find at like TeaWay or Quickly's across the street, but this is one of those times where you get what you pay for.  Their tapioca balls are definitely better in consistency and taste, and they have a pretty good variety of drinks and ingredients to choose from .  Admittedly though, I think their competitors might actually have more to offer, so they have Wonderful Foods there I think.  However, if you tend to stick with the usual suspects, then it doesn't really matter does it?

Over the years, it seems that they've also added food items to their board, but I've never actually ordered any of them so I have no idea how they are.  Generally, I usually end up here after a meal somewhere on Irving, so there's hardly any room left for more snacks.  Maybe next time, although that might just lead me to buying more than just my usual drink.

As for service, the workers (tapioca baristas?) are all really nice, and they do a good job of getting drinks out in a hurry.  BTW, they also sell a bunch of candy and treats like how Sweet Factory did (man, do people still remember that place?).  In all my years though, I've never bought any of them, just like the food items.  Don't really have much to say in a negative way about the place to be honest.  Wonderful Foods, don't ever do me wrong and I'll never do you wrong.
author: Mike L.

description:
Bubble Tea!! An unusual but delectable Asian Treat. Growing up in the East Bay I really don't think we had anything like Boba but since it was introduced to me a year ago I have a new found obsession with trying one wherever I go. Out of all the little shops in my area this is the best one. They have a huge assortment of flavors and they are so refreshing. From Mango to Strawberry to Coconut. Coconut Milk Tea is my favorite followed by Strawberry Smoothie as a close 2nd!
Who would have ever thought scary black tapioca balls and fruit would be soooo good!!
author: Jessica M.

description: The drinks are pretty good. There's also no wait and I'm pretty satisfied with it. A little pricy also.
author: Vernice T.

description:
When you get the cravings for Chinese dessert, this is a great place to come.  My favorite is usually the hot sweet soups with papaya.

It's usually full of people, a great place to hang out at night
author: Tony T.

description:
Likes: tapioca balls were pretty good, honey milk tea was ok, milk tea with pudding was also ok (I've had better pudding), thai ice tea was good but I would personally add more sugar ;)

Dislikes: A lot of other places you can choose to add tapioca balls for an additional 50 cents or whatnot.  But here it's the same set price regardless if you have it or not.
author: Karen M.

description: Sucks that they are cash only, but well worth it for the best boba in the bay area. Id say wonderful & boba guys are the two best places for boba. I always come here for the almond milk tea and it never disappoints !
author: Nick M.

description: Lychee Milk Tea with boba!
author: Elise T.

description:
My favorite place to get tapioca drinks! #10- Almond milk tapioca is the best!! I love how they use crushed ice... the drink is blended perfectly each time. They also have yummy chicken in a bag that's really basilly and garlicky. They make it fresh, so it usually takes about 10 minutes, but it's worth the wait. Ooh- they also sell candy by the pound. yum!

What I don't like is the "out of order" sign on the bathroom all the time. I swear it's BS and they only allow the staff to use it.  : /
author: sophia l.

description: Oatmeal milk tea is delicious!! I've been going here for years, ever since its original location.
author: Diana H.

description:
Best boba I've ever had.  There is no other place that I've been to that is comparable to the quality and how delectable their drinks are here!  Love it! 

Downside;  no seating area really.  They only have one table.  You just need to buy your drinks and go!
author: Sylvia K.

description:
Me and Wonderful Foods Co. go waay back. In the 90s when I was in middle school, they had another store location in San Mateo. I used to love getting my #1 milk tea after a long hard day at school dealing with typical middle school girl drama. This was when the boba drinks were fairly new to the Bay Area, before all the chains started popping up everywhere. Eventually a Tapioca Express opened in the same shopping center, and the San Mateo Wonderful Foods closed. 

I still stop by on Irving when I can, and the #1 still tastes just as good! Brings me right back in time...The tapioca is always fresh and the drinks have a different kind of taste than the usual chains.
author: Elyse N.

description:
Best boba place ever. Their almond milk tea is fantastic, and their boba is always the perfect texture.

The ambience is a bit strange, but the drinks are top notch!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Holy crap.  My good friend has been trying to persuade me to go here for milk tea for the past 2 years, but every time I pass by, the price always turns me away, usually to the Quickly or Teaway across the street.  Finally decided to try it out last week, and BOY IS IT WONDERFUL. Their almond tapioca might just be the nectar of the gods, and I'm not even exaggerating.  NEVER GOING TO CHEAP QUICKLY OR BAD TEAWAY EVER AGAIN

The candy looks hella expensive though, but who goes there for that? :p
author: David G.

description:
This place was alright. I'm always on the hunt to find a milk tea place that has a bomb taro drink. So I tried the taro milk shake tapioca. I thought it was gonna have the consistency of a milk shake.. but it didn't. I think the title was pretty misleading.. The pearls were nice and chewy. 

Their salt and pepper chicken was SUPER DELICIOUS!!! I added the spice cause I like the kick. I highly recommend this for sure. But while I was waiting, I asked how long it would take. The person working behind the counter just said "it's coming".... k, I guess but you didn't really answer my question lol.

They either need more workers cause it took about 20 mins of waiting in line and I was like the 5th person in line.

CASH ONLY.
author: Ashley D.

description: I love this place!!! Came here tonight with my boyfriend and our friend and we got honey milk tea, two strawberry boba drinks and a mango boba smoothie. They were all the right sweetness and the tapioca was really chewy which I love. They also have a wide variety of candies you can get as well. I'll definitely be coming back here for boba and candy.
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
I don't have a sweet tooth, as far as candy is concerned.  Chocolate, ice cream, and cake is a whole different story.  If I cared, the plethora of candy choices at Wonderful Foods would lift me to instant euphoria.  Fortunately for the health of my teeth, my dentist, and my gut, I can walk pass the halls of candy in this shop and not get tempted.  My Bun on the other hand, I cannot comment for her.   
  
What I do have is a weakness for tapioca milk tea drinks.  The hard part is finding a place that makes a mean tapioca milk tea.  Certainly the amount of choices won't excite anyone.  Nor would one expect a good boba drink from a candy store, but the drinks are pretty darn good.  Usually everyone has their preferences; mine are almond, regular milk tea, and taro in that order.  Most if not all drinks come with boba (those tapioca balls).  Of the people I know, it boils down to you loving 'em or you hating 'em.  There's no middle ground.  If you don't know, try them here.  The boba is actually one of the better ones.  

Don't know what flavor to choose still?  No worries, I suggest picking the regular tapioca milk tea and working from there.  Indecision with a tapioca drink is a normal thing.  I always wanted to try every choice at once.  While most folks that step foot into Wonderful Foods will have that sweet tooth since the first thing in sight are the candy.  For me, I come for the WONDERFUL drinks.  (Harhar...don't know why I keep ending reviews like this)
author: Arnold T.

description: The best boba in sf!! CASH ONLY! Their boba is always good! Never clumpy or overcooked or hard and chewy! Wish they accepted card though. $1 more to upgrade from regular to a large!
author: Jessica W.

description:
I do and don't get why there aren't any seats here.  I get it because it's a half-store and if there were seats, it'd be difficult for people to navigate through all the Chinese snacks.  I don't get it because you get the boba and you just don't know what to do with yourself.

I do like the pearls... they're really quite perfect, not too chewy or hard.  I do like the milk tea but it isn't my preferred style.  It's more like coffee and less like tea so it's really up to you to decide.  

That's it!  It was good but not my style so I wouldn't drive all the way out to get this.  What I would drive to get is Fantasia in Milpitas.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I wanted to try this place because I've heard so much hype about it, and boy, it was disappointing! 
I ordered the taro milk tea and it was so watery that I didn't even finish my drink.....and I ALWAYS finish my drinks. The place is really ghetto and dirty, and it's cash only, so leave your credit cards at home ppl!
author: Vu T.

description: This place used to be better, at that point in time, I would've given a 4 or even a 5 star rating. But the quality of their bbt has really gone downhill. I order the lychee milk tea, it was super bland and I could barely taste the lychee. Oh, they also forgot my order so I had to wait 15 minutes for something they literally made in 20 seconds.
author: Davis W.

description: Honestly I am not getting the hype over purple kow, or Tpumps or whatever else, I am sticking to Wonderful foods as their tapioca drinks are to die for (even though it might be a place one may call a "hole in the wall".)  Everything is on the sweet side, and everytime I go I always intend to ask them to make my drink less sweet, but in the end I dont drink tapioca drinks too often so when I do maybe its good that it is a sweet sweet indulgence! My favorites include the coconut tapioca, avocado tapioca, and papaya! Avocado has to be my favorite though, it might sound gross and uninviting but trust me its delicious!
author: Eleana H.

description:
Big fan! Can't go wrong! Don't expect fancy packaging or decor but its what's in the cup that matters!  The boba is always perfect and you can get all the hard to find asian snacks here while you are at it!

I recommend:  strawberry milk tea with boba, Avocado shake with boba
author: Jenny C.

description:
Good Taiwanese candy and snack selections. There are some weird stuff in there but for some, that's exactly what they're looking for. (e.g. dried fish strips...)

Didn't know they had Tapioca drinks here until I read the reviews. Will have to try them out.
author: Anthony W.

description:
BOBA NAI CHA! FTW
Their milk tea is ridonkulous. its made with actual black tea that was actually brewed, and milk, you can even see them make it! it tastes SO fresh and the tapioca is ALWAY soft and chewy! unlike some of the tapioca places across the street...

ALSO the watermelon juice is Delicious. 

Prices are a little bit higher then Ye Olde milk tea chain. but IT'S WORTH IT!
author: Antonio W.

description:
The boba is so soft and chewy-- better than Tpumps & way better than quicklys. The cashier wasn't stingy with the boba either, which is a plus. Nothing it worse than having tea with no tapioca.

& theres no long line! You can be in & out of the shop in less than a minute if you know what you want to order.

Minus one star for sanitary purposes. The tongs and the candy were in the same tub. People touch the handle which comes in contact with the candy... which other people eat. No thanks.
author: Catheria S.

description:
A hidden gem. I'll much rather go to this place than the more surrounding popular places. No line, awesome drinks. There's really not much more you can ask for. 

Oh wait, there's candy too, for those of you with a sweet tooth.
author: Stacy C.

description:
The main selling point of this place is that it makes really good tapioca -- nice chewy consistency along with the slightly sweetened taste of being cooked in sugar water. A lot of the drinks use powder, but you can pay extra to have the more premium ingredients (e.g. real honeydew, durian, avocado, etc.). The popcorn chicken was surprisingly really good -- not oily, crispy, fresh, and a huge portion. They also have a lot of dried things and candies that you can pay per pound for. 

CASH ONLY.
author: Wendy S.

description: I like the drinks at this place but they don't blow you away either. They are definitely above average though and they have a good menu. Overall it's a good place by itself but there is a lot of competition around.....
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
It always a disadvantage when you go to a tea house where the worker only speak Chinese to you, but you don't understand a word they say. The lady who was taking my order confuse me, but we got what we needed that all it matter. I got the jasmine milk, almond milk tea, and honeydew milk tea. All our drink is very good. For the honeydew milk tea the flavor is super strong. 
Cash only
author: van t.

description:
I can't believe this place is still here. Used to come here with my mom when I was younger to get tea eggs, watermelon juice, and choco covered gummy bears.

Glad to see that after 15 years this place hasn't changed :) Same friendly service by the asian lady working there.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
Yelpers claim that this joint has 4.5 stars...unfortunately I have to disagree...

The pearl milk tea was $2.75 and was okay. The pearls were pretty chewy but the tea had some weird taste to it...

...sorry to pop anyone's pearl tea bubble...but Yum E. thinks that Fantasia or Tap Ex in Union City is much better!
author: Derek S.

description: I've been going here for 15 years. Drinks haven't changed. Price has gone up but what hasn't? If people say Socal milk tea is better, they are crazy and rich because drinks cost $4-5 dollars down there. A business doesn't stay around for this long because of bad drinks, so stop at wonderful foods!
author: Brian C.

description:
It took me more than 2 years to return for that 2nd try, but tonight I did and boy, did it change my mind about this place!

I opted for a hot mint green milk tea this time. It's chilly out after dinner at PPQ adjacently down the street, and this hot boba tea sure warmed up my hands and tummy. 

The tapioca balls were as delightful as I remembered. This time, the milk tea was light and refreshing! I also tried the chocolate-covered gummy bears my friend decided to pick up - delish also!

I'll be back! Want to try the almond milk tea next time.
author: Jing D.

description: Really good boba. I don't particularly like boba unless it's extremely springy and chewy (not rubbery), slightly sweet (not flavorless), and light (not dense). The boba here satisfies all those requirements and I really enjoyed my drink. I default strawberry milk with boba and it was great!
author: Brian C.

description:
This place is a hidden gem for boba addicts!

Recommended by a friend I decided to try this place out. I must say Wonderful Dessert & cafe is probably the best Boba place in the sunset. It is very "mom-and-pop" kinda shop and the owner is always super nice! The staff as well is pretty friendly. I usually order the Iced Jasmine tea with lychee bits (no milk, no tapioca), and it is sooooo refreshing and delicious! BTW one time, they did get my order wrong but I got to keep it (thx u!). 

Drink taste: There is a good amount of ice, sugar, and jasmine tea flavor...nothing overpowering. Drink cost about $3 or $4 bucks so it's a little on the steep side and I believe it's cash only (not sure). Anyways, everyone should try this place if you haven't already. (skip the line at t-pumps..and come here!)
author: Julia K.

description:
My friend Cindy T. introduced me to Wonderful Foods after I expressed my crazy cravings for boba! 

Wonderful Foods is down the street from T Pumps. They have a wall of candy, and a couple of tables + chairs. I decided to get lychee green tea (been trying to cut out milk tea) with pearls. I liked that my drink came with real lychee bits, and it wasn't overly sweet. I could still taste the tea flavor. 

I'd be willing to come back and try some of their other flavors!
author: Carole Y.

description:
Best boba / bubble tea joint I've found in the city so far.

Why?
The tea is perfect -- not watered down, not too sweet. 
The tapiocas are the perfect texture and in ample quantity.
Their fruit drinks have actual fruit in them (that's right, there's mango in your mango smoothie).  
Somewhat pricier than the chains, but 2-3x as good.  

Marks of authenticity: 
- "Tapioca" spelled wrong (looks like it was either "tapiouca" or "tapionca") on signs and hand-corrected over, and over, and over again in handwriting that anyone with a Taiwanese mother will recognize 
- Minimalist decor, mostly outdated flyers/posters advertising local Chinese events
- No A/C, to keep costs down
- Small statues/statuettes of Buddha/Buddhist figures on the counter
- The shop sells treats out of bins by the pound.  Western-style treats include gummy candies, chocolates, jawbreakers.  Eastern-style treats include dried plums, fish snacks, and dehydrated squid.    
- Rice cooker in one corner contains simmering boiled (tea leaf) eggs for sale 

Seating: 
Off to the side there is a small rectangular table that seats roughly four.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Wut. I don't get it. 

My posse rolled in (ok, I can't do this... *back to normal English*) and we ordered the Lychee Milk Green Tea and the Passion Green Tea. To start, they messed up on our order and gave my friend a Green Milk Tea instead of the passion one. So we end up getting a free Green Milk Tea, which was bleh. 

-- Lychee Milk Green Tea: The most decent out of the bunch. Appreciated the tangy bits of lychee, but pretty bland otherwise. 

-- Passion Green Tea: Ehh, was not memorable. 

-- Green Milk Tea: Bland bland bland. 

The pearls were also overcooked in each drink so they were way mushy. :( And the price! Are you kidding me?? As we were perusing the menu wall, some drinks climbed past $5. I could get 2 and a half drinks at Tea Way for the price of one here.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
uh. HOW COULD I NOT HAVE YELPED WONDERFUL FOODS YET!?

This is my favorite place for boba!! Green milk tea with less ice, please! AND their fruit drinks are made with real fruit. How can you say no to that?!

Parking is not so great during the day, but at night (like after 9), it's a breeze.

I'm a fan forever.
author: Leslie C.

description: BEST MILK TEA EVER! The tea always has a lot of flavor and you can tell it's high quality. Unlike Tpumps, this place doesn't need hundreds of flavors to make their tea taste good. AND UNLIKE TPUMPS, THIS PLACE ISNT STINGY WITH THEIR BOBA. The only downside is that it's cash only, but it's totally worth it. And if you don't feel like getting tea, there's also fresh fruit smoothies. My favorite is the watermelon with boba.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Their tapioca is delicious. Not the place to be if you want to sit and hang out, but if you're the type to get in and get out, this is the tapioca place for you. Their drinks are so yummy! I always get their regular milk tea because it tastes just like the ones in Taiwan! Large menu to choose from and simply the best tapioca drinks in the city.

For all you people with a sweet tooth, there is candy lined up all along the walls. Have fun selecting because there is A LOT to choose from haha.
author: Gallen W.

description: I love this place.i love milk tea and boba so much. Everybody so nice, i will be comeback everyweek.
author: Thy B.

description:
Hands down, best tapioca in the city. The sign does not lie. 

#3 with tapioca and grass jelly for me please. Though it does cost more than other tapioca stores out there, you get what you pay for. I actually taste the tea and the pearls actually taste fresh to me. Also, there's a huge selection of candies & dried chinese snacks. They're also one of the original tapioca stores out there.
author: Tina S.

description:
I'm not a big fan of boba drinks, especially the mixed fancy ones.  
But I really love the oatmeal milk tea.  
If I have to take my wife anywhere else for a boba I always pass on the drinks when she asks me if I want one.  Not at wonderful foods though.  I cant resist the oatmeal boba.
author: Robert S.

description:
I swear this was the first boba place in Sf.  My love affair started with this place when a friend showed up to class with a yummy looking purple drink with bubbles in it.  I found out that he was drinking a taro boba drink.  I tasted it and was hooked.

 Wonderful foods has always been my first choice for boba and has always been consistently delicious...not like Quickly, Tapioca Express, etc.  I've been going here for 14-15 years and I've never found any thing as good for boba in Sf. :) Tons of flavors and the tapioca balls are always fresh - soft and chewy.  Yum.
author: Cheryl L.

description: Milk tea is extremely sweet, I don't know why this place is so well liked. Not that special although they do have a bunch of varieties of tea but the flavor is mostly sugar and no tea
author: Vi C.

description:
- good strong flavor in the milk tea 
- boba is cooked to perfection: soft and chewy
- ALMOST as good as Fantasia [cupertino locaton]
- reasonable prices at $2.75 and up

a much better alternative to the quickly's across the street
author: Tina A.

description:
UHmmm, i would not wait in line for purple kow and come here instead. The drinks were very delicious. I just randomly got the wu long milk tea and my person got jasmin milk tea. We also ordered the fried chicken thingy (basically popcorn chicken). It was very delicious. every single piece of the chiken was juicy and well marinated. The amount of batter was perfect. The basil leaves enhances the flavor...Finger licking good but u dont have to use ur finger cuz they got wooden stick. Aniwayzzz. The drinks were very delicious. I wish they have more variety. 
       Also they sell candy by pounds but since there was no beach belt, we didn't buy any. I will definitely come back here.
author: Gwen L.

description: best boba smoothie in the Bay!  I tried the taro smoothie with tapioca (boba) and it was much thicker than a typical boba drink and the taro flavor actually tasted like the real thing.
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
BEST. TAPIOCA. EVER.

My friends once told me to meet them at Quickly's. Needless to say, I met them up...with my Wonderful Foods strawberry smoothie tapioca in-hand. 

-1 star for their lack of seating
author: Denise L.

description:
My favorite tapioca place in SF! I don't know how or what? They do to make their boba so soft and to the right consistency. Whatever their secret is... Is making come back for more. I rather spend the extra dollar here to get a consistent made to perfection boba! :) 

My all time fave: Almond milk tea tapioca!
Can't go wrong with that order!
author: Nicky C.

description:
In the cutthroat business of Pearl drinks, Wonderfuls has endured the test of time. Between Quicklys, three Teaways, and two Tuitimelons, competition for a cold refreshing beverage on this devil's playground they call Irving is fierce. This Ma and Pa shop has survived several attempts at corporate take over's during this recession, an incredible feat if you knew the bloody history behind the neighboring tapioca turf wars. 

Many locals can recall the attempts at Quicklys trying to buy out Wonderfuls, discounted drinks to steal customers, and other chains popping up like wild flower. Despite all the hostile competition, Wonderfuls stood it's ground and continued to sell the best Strawberry Smoothie Tapioca this city has to offer. It's no coincidence this store is still in business competing with multi-million dollar franchises. 

So if you want the best boba drink in town while retaining a piece of San Francisco history through an amazing family oriented store, you know where to go. But if you're into that corporate watered down, chemically enhanced toilet water with a hint of child labor sweat, Quicklys is across the street.

Now if they would only do something about those hoodrats always loitering outside the store...
author: Andrew A.

description:
I call this place the ORIGINAL sf boba place!

The drinks are always " made-fresh-right-when-you-order" and none of that unsanitary laddle-spoon scoops they do down the street and most nasty chains.

Sometimes I do feel bad for spending twice as much here as I would at any other boba place but when you want the BEST BOBA in town, this is the place to go! 

Go-To-Drinks:
Milk Tea + tapioca
Green Milk Tea + tapioca
Papaya milkshake + tapioca
Strawberry-banana milkshake + tapioca
author: Patricia K.

description:
i have a love-hate relationship with wonderful foods... 

LOVE: the candy selection! it's like a sweet factory, but also with asian candies!
HATE: overindulging in too many sour belts and chocolate covered gummy bears.

LOVE: the machines with the little winnie the pooh keychains
HATE: the fact that, while in that trend, i probably spent $15 at that machine trying to get that bumblebee winnie the pooh. (does anybody need a winnie the pooh, i have a drawer full...)

LOVE: the tea eggs!!! they're in a huge rice cooker thing by the register.
HATE: that they're so good i once ate 3 in one sitting.

LOVE: the milk tea! the boba!
HATE: NOTHING!!!

love it. don't really hate it as much as i say i do. but definitely one of my favorites on irving :)
author: Caitlin C.

description:
Came here because my friend raved about how good it was. Unfortunately for me, I was disappointed. 
Ordered a lychee green tea, and that an average lychee green tea was what I got. Not terrible, but definitely not mind-blowingly wonderful either.  

At least there was a lot of candy for sale!
author: Ashley N.

description: I've only ever gotten the candy here, but this is one of the few places I know where I get White Grapefruit Gummies in bulk since the place in Serramonte that sold it closed :(. Prices are reasonable and there are a lot of candy choices. This is a cash-only place so be prepared (or go to the Walgreens across the street and get cash back after buying a pack of gum).
author: Ghia G.

description: Service was a little slow on a Saturday night since there was only one worker. But that's okay. The sour patch watermelons are really good here. I noticed they're bigger than the ones I buy from Walgreens across the street.
author: Jess W.

description:
Driving down Iriving, I noticed a green sign. Was it Chaaba? Nope, as we got closer, the sign read, "Wonderful Foods Co." Confused by the name (sounded like a grocery store), we pulled up and parked. 

As we headed inside, I was like a kid in a candy store, literally! All of my favorite types of candies, such as gummy bears, sour patches, gummy worms, pretty much all the sweet fruity kind of sweets were available. I remember filling up the bags at Sweet Tooth as a child and getting a lecture after paying for it at the cashier, since it was quite expensive. Every since then each time we walked in, Bunny had to tell me to contain myself and would pratically need to pull me forward to the front counter to order our drinks.

Upon our first visit, while looking at the menu, I noticed an extensive amount of drinks, with no extra charge for tapioca. At other places, my usually order was Strawberry Green Tea. However, I hadn't noticed that listed so I decided to order Passion Green Tea Tapioca. Ever since then I would order the same drink. Occasionally, I'd ask to have it without the tapioca.
