I know, it sounds kinds of weird. It's like getting a cheeseburger and asking to hold the cheese. Hahaha. Typically I do not get tapioca in my drinks and it's rare that you will see that. However with Wonderful Foods, I don't mind. It goes well with the green tea and makes the drink less sweet.

On on occasion, Bunny and I are here near closing time. One time we actually ordered chicken. When this happens at other milk tea places, we often hear, "Sorry, the kitchen is closed." To our surprise, the cashier had started making it right away. She was very nice and didn't seem bitter about that as all.  Affter getting our order, we walked back to the car, which was right in front. Unlike other places, parking is easy to find and usually there are a few spots available right outside. 

The only downside is that there are no stamped cards. Otherwise, good drinks, food and sweets. What more could you ask for?
author: Doris W.

description: Got the salt and pepper chicken, it was pretty good, nothing special.
author: Catherine U.

description: I love how they have crushed ice! Their boba is so chewy and the milk tea is on point. One of my top boba places in town.
author: Michelle S.

description: I ordered the almond boba and it was excellent. The tapioca was chewy and perfectly cooked. My friend ordered the avocado smoothie and to our surprise it actually tasted like avocado!  This place is a definite go to place if you're craving some good bubble tea!!
author: Jonathan K.

description:
The best avocado smoothie in town , nuff said .

Haha just kidding ! But seriously , to me the best avocado smoothie in the city of San Francisco ! 

I love Wonderful Dessert & Cafe ! I think it is funny that I do not actually go here as often as I do other places but I have yet to be let down on my visits ! 

If you are looking for a delicious avocado smoothie then definitely check this place out !

They also have a bunch of candy and other asian goodies for sale if you like having a variety treats that you pay by weight .

If avocado is not your thing then their are many other choices you can choose from so you should check them out if you have not yet !
author: Josh M.

description: This place is truly amazing.  No frills--just serving the best bubble tea in the Bay Area.  They have a WIDE VARIETY of flavors, including the Coconut Tapioca (which is my all-time favorite!).  They also have a great section of different types of candy I used to find in the mall (sour patch cherries, strawberry belts, etc.) that I pick up while I'm there.  They are cash only, so be prepared!
author: Shirley W.

description: I'm giving them 5 stars because the other drinks on the menu: watermelon slush, honeydew tapioca, mango tapioca etc are so amazing! My sister works at Tpumps, so I always find myself in the neighborhood stopping by Wonderful Foods Co to give them another try hoping that I've changed my mind after a scarring experience (hot longan tea was disgusting) It's safe to say that my recent visits have not disappointed me one bit and I thoroughly enjoyed my drinks. 5 stars because their drinks have been consistent, the service is super fast, and prices are reasonable but most importantly their drinks are refreshing.
author: Joyce E.

description: I didn't find the tapioca as anything special but I really liked how fresh the drink itself tasted. It wasn't all powdery and didn't need to be mixed every sip. The pudding drink was awesome and the coffee boba actually tasted like strong coffee! And I couldn't help but buy 3 bags of candy. So much variety!
author: Jaclyn N.

description: Forget about nasty Teaway and Quickly's when you got Wonderful on Irving! I used to come here as a kid and buy candy by the lb. Who knew their boba and drinks were so tasty? I've tried taro and honeydew so far and even though honeydew is my favorite fruit, it was too sweet. But taro is drop dead delicious, and I don't even like actual taro! Creamy and the boba was chewy but not over the top chewy (which I like). Spend the extra few bucks to get Wonderful over the other milk tea places around, it's well worth it.
author: Julian Y.

description: I don't understand how this place has such high reviews... It's honestly not that good.  This place is definitely better than t pumps, but it's not great by any means. Super sugary and the boba was kinda gross. Try boba guys or sharetea instead
author: Lisa H.

description:
After I tried Purple Kow and was drooling over it. My foodie friend smirked at me and said I had to try this place. And wow...just WOW.
She drove me here and I was a little lost and confused at first. It a real hole in the wall. It doesn't even look like the typical tapioca place. It's a candy store that sells the best milk tea ever on the down low. 
They don't have any specialty milk tea and their variety isn't as big as the other chains, but man, is it just worth your dollars. 
They have the standard flavors such as green tea, milk tea, fruit flavored milk tea, etc. I've tried their honeydew, milk tea, and lychee milk tea. I like all of them. Everytime I come here, I stand in front of the menu undecided of what flavor I should get.
My roommate loves their taro milk tea, but I don't like taro so I can't vouch for it.
If you really want good boba and milk tea. I recommend coming here. I just wish it was closer to where I live. :(
author: Stephanie L.

description: Always fresh, quick service, good quality boba.  A little pricey, ($4.75) for a strawberry-mango shake w/ boba in Irving but our favorite place in a good location.
author: Sean S.

description:
With Teaway around the corner for $1, I didn't think there was a point to going anywhere else for boba. But, Wonderful Foods has changed my mind completely.

Whereas the boba at other places will taste like water, Wonderful Foods' boba actually tastes like tea - with just the right amount of sweetness. 

Also, you might be tempted to go to T-pumps nearby, but - for the price - I think Wonderful Foods may be better.
author: Kevin C.

description: I really like this place because I grow up drinking their Boba teas. However, I noticed the people who works here have changed.  I don't know why but whenever I see young Boba workers who looks barley 20, I automatically ask them to make it less sweet. I dislike overly sweet drink and refuse to drink it if it taste so sweet.  I'm probably scar for life because I noticed the trend of overly sweet drinks was always made by younger people.  This is just me though, use my observation as your own discretion.
author: Aylee G.

description:
Boba will never be the same when I go back to L.A.
 
This place served me the freshest boba I have ever had before and I come from the land that has boba shops with two at every corner.  

When you order here say "FRESH" so you wont get the flavoring powder stuff that is usually used in boba but you will get fresh ingredients, in my case, real watermelon. After running a half marathon this drink hit the spot. My only regret is that I went with the regular cup instead of the large one. The other people in my group had the banana strawberry and the lychee bobas which were oh so gratifying. I could drink those all day, marathon or not.

Damn it, I want some now. 

Would I be back?
Yes sir, its on my to do list when I come back up into The City.
author: James S.

description:
3.5

I came here on recommendation from my roommate who is an SF native - she said this is her favorite place for boba! 

My first impression of the place was that I thought I was in the wrong place...the store is pretty empty on the inside except for a wall full of candy by the pound that you can grab and buy. This is not what I expected from a boba place, since most are bustling with young people and have asian music blasting everywhere. 

I settled on the lychee milk tea, a typical favorite of mine at any boba place. It was a bit pricey for the size ($3.50 I believe) but I liked the taste. It wasn't very sweet and had small pieces of lychee inside. The boba balls were soft but nothing spectacular to me.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Originally, I wanted to try T-pumps but the line was ridiculous. I have heard so many great reviews from WFC. So why not. 

The line and service was quick. I got the regular milk tea with tapioca. It caffeine/tea in the milk tea taste a little strong. Strong enough for it taste a bit life coffee. I would say it taste similar to Fantasia for you south bay folks. Not bad for $2.75. I would come back if I am in the area. 

They also sell candy! Parking is cray during evening hours since its free so beware! Beware, drivers in this area are jerks. I blame it on the tapioca...
author: Phuong V.

description:
Wonderful Foods serves great bubble tea, which unfortunately has sustained my crack-like addiction to bubble tea. Their health score is in the high 90s; compare that to the mid 80s of the neighboring bubble tea shops. I occasionally get bad tea here, so they are not consistently perfect otherwise I would give 5 stars. The new guy made tea that was way too sweet and 1/2 of it was tapioca pearls- I want to be able to drink my tea without it being a choking hazard.
My favorite is the lychee green tea; they use real chopped lychee, brewed tea, and crushed ice shaken in a cocktail shaker- and usually appropriately sweet.They sell chocolate covered gummy bears!
author: Carrie H.

description: We are hooked to their oatmeal tapioca drink ever since our good friend, Gary, introduced it to us.  We always get less sugar or no sugar.  Hot in the winter and cold during the hot days.  Took my mom and niece there today.  My little niece and mom love it, too.
author: Grace T.

description:
We have been going to this place pretty regularly since moving to San Francisco.  Along with its new location, Sweethut, they are the most consistent bubble tea we have found in the Bay Area, and definitely the best option on Irving.

The main draw is the freshness and strength of the flavors.  All the teas we've tried are very strong and deep, and not to be confused with the powdery flavors you might find down the street.  My favorite flavor is the oolong milk tea.  The regular black milk tea is even a little strong for me, so normally I dilute it down either by asking for extra milk or mixing it with a green tea.

On top of that, the boba here is always top notch, chewy -- not hard, not soggy -- no matter what time of day or night you come in.  They close pretty late -- around 1 or 2 -- so it should satisfy almost any kind of pearl milk tea enthusiast.  Add in the dried candies around the store, and you have the best milk tea (boba or no boba) in San Francisco.
author: Jeff Y.

description: This is a basic tea place with nothing spectacular about their drinks. The boba texture was average, not the best I have had. I got the honey green tea and they added milk to make it a honey green milk tea. I felt it was heavily concentrated with green tea and lacked some balance in the drink.  The lychee coconut boba drink was good but it was fairly sweet even though we asked for no extra sugar.
author: Debbie M.

description:
The BEST boba place in the Sunset and my fave (even though I would drive out of the way to get Purple Kow for their special drinks)!

Everything is made fresh, not out of powder. The milk tea is relatively strong and tastes a lot better than Quickly's or the worst of them all, Teaway. Their boba has the perfect consistency between firm and too soft so it never tastes old. I'm a fruity kind of gal so I always go for the passionfruit green tea... try this and you'll never doubt Wonderful Foods. I was able to convert some nonbelievers with this drink! Sure you're paying more for these drinks than at Teaway, but opt for QUALITY people!

Their popcorn chicken is extremely flavorful although it can come out on the soggier side. Tea eggs for $1 are ok... not always as flavorful as it could be. They also have a ton of asian and american snacks/candy they sell by the pound (kinda like a mix between Sweet Factory and Aji Ichiban).
author: Liana L.

description: I've always loved the boba from this place.  I think it was in another location before, but my dad used to always make a stop here when we were in the area, so it brings a lot of great memories as well.  They are pretty fast and efficient with the drinks.  Between the three of us we had the coconut boba, red bean boba, and a thai iced tea boba... the boba has great texture.  There are so many boba places in the area, but I still choose to come here.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
This is a review of the Tapioca Milk Tea.

Definitely "meh" - I've had better boba and milk tea could be more flavorful. There was also a coffee taste to my milk tea, which is definitely a bad thing to me. They were also inconsistent - my bf's milk tea had a much stronger coffee flavor than my cup.

Service is good and drinks are made quickly. Good as a quick boba fix, but nothing good about the actual milk tea.
author: Monica T.

description:
BEST TAPIOCA BY FAR.

I like T pumps too but this place is so much better and fresh. 
Love my usual honey green tea with tapioca 
Love the candy, not so pricey either :)
author: Karen J.

description:
Tapioca: They cook up the best tapioca balls and they've prepped it correctly! They're chewy with the caramelized sugar fragrance and sweetness. LOVE IT! 

Drink: I love they have fresh taro and Avocado for your milk tea/shake (the milk shake is not made with ice cream- it simply means it has milk inside).

Food: We also got the salt and pepper squid heads and while I was worried they'd be too salty, they were just perfect blend of spice, saltiness and crunchy coating. LOVE IT!
author: Amy Y.

description: Recommend #28 and popcorn chicken. This place is the best place for tapioca even when competition stores are opening up across the street. The pricing and sweet additives at stores like Quicklies or T Pumps work to draw me in but I always find myself coming back to Wonderful for the best original drinks and snacks.
author: Allen T.

description: They have the most amazing salt and pepper chicken ever! It's marinated in the store overnight, and the spices are perfect. It's even better with the spicy powder. The chicken is so much better than all the other pearl milk tea places like Verde, Quickly, and Tapex.
author: Lydia H.

description: I really tried to force myself to like this place because of so many good reviews on Yelp. However, I've been here twice and there was nothing really special with my milk tea. Maybe it's because I've ordered regular Honey Milk Green tea both times but I've definitely had better milk tea. The milk wasn't as creamy as I wanted and there was nothing special with the Boba. I could definitely taste the tea though so that was good. I definitely think I'll give this place another try next time I'm in the area and I'll definitely try something difference than my regular green milk tea. UNTIL NEXT TIME.......... (hopefully my rating for this place will be better than 3- stars)
author: Tram N.

description:
i ordered the avocado with durian..taste average...i guess they need to use condence milk to improve the taste...

CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!
author: Aris L.

description:
This place opens late and is in an area that I am at fairly enough,
but I'd prefer tapioca at Quicklys (diagonally across) now.
This place always give me tummy aches since they use powder for their drinks. Ehh... I don't know about you, but I've definitely experienced better.
author: Linda K.

description: First time experience the other day and it was really good! My bf ordered the Mocha Tapioca and he loved it. He described the flavor as "milky, and rich with coffee". I ordered Thai Tapioca and it was really good. Their drinks are NOT powdery at all and their tapioca is very chewy and not sweet (which fits our preference!)
author: Cleo C.

description: The green milk tea was good and kind of tasted a bit like condensed milk for some reason to me :o but it was still decent and will look forward to trying other flavors and some of the candy^^
author: Tina W.

description: This is the BEST place for boba drinks! I've been drinking these drinks for years and from many many different places. They are the most consistent in flavor and they have a great menu to choose from. Best milk tea flavor. Best Almond milk tea. Sesame milk tea and grass jelly. If you are looking for more "fun" contemporary flavors that use torani syrup, this isn't the place to go, but Wonderful Foods hands down is my favorite boba tea place and I don't even live in the city, but will drive by there if ever in the area. They have a great selection of candies too.
author: Jeff W.

description: Great place and delicious milk tea! Ordered an almond milk tea with boba. The staff was really friendly and the milk tea was smooth!  The boba had a good texture with the perfect amount of density. The only gripe is the price..which is about a dollar difference compared to neighboring tapioca places such as teaway, quicklys, tpumps, etc. Despite the price, this may be my new go to when i'm around the area! Thanks fellow yelpers for the recommendation!
author: Estella L.

description: I got the taro milk tea. The boba was cooked perfectly and the milk tea was smooth and not too sweet. And it was only $3 mmmm
author: Flor C.

description:
I don't get what the hype is. Maybe I'm just stoops and didn't know what to order. I ordered the lychee milk tea with boba. I've never had milk tea that had so much pulp in it. Is milk tea supposed to be pulpy? If I wanted pulpy, I would've ordered......something else. I. HATE. PULP. I think I also had some undercooked boba in my drink too. Or maybe it was the pulp. Someone tell me what to order next time. Something with no pulp. NO PULP.

On the bright side, I had a few pieces of their popcorn chicken, and it was really, really delicious. Made up for my pulpy milk tea. I didn't know they had tea eggs until later, will definitely try next time! With no pulpy milk tea. Ugh, that pulp.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: The almond tapioca flavor boba was not very good, but maybe some of the other flavors are. They have a ton of different choices. It's nice that it is open until midnight.
author: Sasha W.

description:
Still love this place. I literally have been going to this place for about 8-9 years, WHOA I literally just counted the years. I did not realize how long its been.

I am still a big fan of the Jasmine Milk Tea. I also like their watermelon slushies and their avocado shakes. Both these are made with real watermelon and real avocado, which are just 10x better.

I don't like their taro milk tea though, too powder-y for me (they make it with taro powder like most places). But to be honest, I haven't really found an absolute great taro milk tea besides the ube pearl coolers at jollibee, if that counts.
author: Liana D.

description: This is where my tapioca obsession began! I've been going here for YEARS, and by that I mean at least 10 years. My siblings and i are probably their biggest fans, we go there everyday rain or shine. It usually does not take long for the new workers to start recognizing us :P. I used to get their classic black milk tea all the time, but i feel like there's too much caffeine in it now so I've been switching off between their green milk tea and the honey green tea. These drinks are not too sweet and their boba is perfectly chewy. Aside from their drinks they also have a huge selection of candy. I used to buy one big bag each time I drove back to socal for school.
author: Joey F.

description:
The 700+ Yelpers who collectively rated this place 4.5 stars are liars!! We specifically seeked out this place after 30min of trying to find parking. 

We ordered the peach pearl and the lychee milk tea pearl drinks and received our orders about 5 seconds after sitting down-- super speedy service!! 
First sips: Horrendous!! Why was it super quick? They just pumped a bunch of syrup into some water with a little ice-slush!! Under all the sweetness of pure sugar was a hint of artificial peach taste!! It wouldn't surprise me if we got diabetes from just that one sip of "peach pearl". The lychee milk tea tasted like coffee with dried up bits of supposed lychee (or possible coconut shreds) at the bottom. Worst $7 spent on boba drinks!! I thought the bay (SF) was supposed to be known for their boba drinks.

So did we toss this grossness away? No way were we going to throw $7 in the trash. We diluted the pure sugar "peach" with roughly 2 bottles of water before we can even begin to consume it--of course it didn't have any peach flavor and simply tasted of less concentrated sugar water. The "lychee milk tea" made us super thirsty as well. Too much artificial powdery/syrupy crap in the drinks!! 

On another note, the boba itself was good; not hard nor too chewy, plus it didn't have a funky texture. So one star for that.. too bad there wasn't a drink that complemented the boba for us to enjoy them.

All in all: why must you lie to us, fellow Yelpers!! Instant boba drinks from a packet might have tasted better. We will never everrr return to this place!
author: Julie K.

description:
Their boba is cooked very well with nice consistency. However, the drink literally tastes like sugar water with no flavor... 

So disappointed since I trusted all the positive yelp reviews.
author: Darla C.

description:
A simple, no frills spot, this place is one of the best milk tea places in the city. They don't use the powders you expect from Tapioca Express/Quickly, and they have plenty of flavors to choose from. The milk tea tends to run on the sweet side, so make sure you indicate you want less sugar (if you're that kind of person).

The large Oolong iced milk tea without pearls always hits the spot.

I ran into the founders of Foodspotting grabbing some candy on one of my trips, so they seem to like it here too.

Other things to note:
-Cash only (bring those Washingtons and Lincolns)
-They have a large assortment of candy (Western and Chinese)
-They serve tea eggs and various other snack foods
-There's only one table with a few chairs--this isn't a place to sit in

Go here now.
author: Joseph D.

description: Hands down the best place for tapioca drinks, in my opinion. There's never really a long line when I go so Wonderful already won me over with that. They make there fruit slush/juice drinks from fresh fruits rather than processed store bought juices from cartons. My go-to drink is the lychee juice with coconut jelly for $4.25 and you can add boba for no extra charge (well at least I've never gotten charged for that). And the consistency of the boba is just the way I like it. It's chewy and not mushy like other places. Every time I'm back in the Bay, I have to stop by Wonderful for a drink. Just be aware they only accept cash.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Best place for my favorite drink: Milk tea with tapioca. 
You can find this in so many other places on Irving, but you can't go wrong with Wonderful Foods! Definitely better tasting than Quickly or Teaway. Although it's a bit pricier, I think the quality is worth it.

I also recommend the Passion Fruit Green Tea!
author: Mary X.

description:
Half boba, half Asian candy store place. Only came here once, but the red bean boba milk tea was good!

I've heard people deem this one of the best boba places in SF. Only time and more samplin' around town will tell.
author: An Y.

description:
Oh, Wonderful Foods is my new favorite to-go spot for bubble tea.

They make a strong, delicious milk tea, and the tapioca is spot on chewy as well. Who wants to wait in line for an hour for a drink when this place does the basics justice? Not this girl. I'm definitely coming back for the milk tea, but I'll make sure to check out their other variations too.

Finally, I like that they do indicate on the menu which drink items are tea, flavored (some form of mix, I assume) or juice. It's helpful to know what to expect.
author: Ines C.

description:
The ORIGINAL boba spot before any of the chain places opened up on Irving. If you think Quickly's or TeaWay or whatever cutesy-sounding-colored-animal-place came first, GTFO, because they didn't. FACT: There is no other place that can compare.

I remember when WFC sold random stuff on the side like tea-flavored eggs and herbal shizz. My sisters and I would come here all the time to order lychee, almond, red bean, honey dew, and whatever adventurous flavors there were. No one could ignore the strong boba aroma that leeched out into the streets. Their boba has the best chewy texture, size, and taste compared to all these wannabe places that serve some nasty, grade F crap. It's no wonder I don't even drink boba often when I go somewhere else. Call me a snob/b*tch/stupid-fanatic, W/E, I don't care; Wonderful Foods Co has never done me wrong and will always be my fav milk tea spot!
author: Cristal G.

description: Grew up buying tapioca from here since high school days, which is almost 10 years now! I usually order any of the fruit smoothies because they are fresh, yummmmm! They never fail to satisfy my fruit smoothie tapioca cravings. The tapioca  balls are sweet and chewy. My favorite orders would be: Avocado (thick and super flavorful!), Strawberry, Mango, Papaya, or a warm Milk Tea. Always leave super satisfied. Sometimes I would even buy their tea eggs which is located between the cashier and candies. One of the go-to places I love returning to and bringing visitors from out of town to.
author: Amanda C.

description: I have been going to this place for a long time.   It is the best milk tae place.  lychee pearl tea is made with real lychee not power and you can really taste the tae flavor not just sugar.  I live too far away now in walnut creek so sad but everytime we go to that side I go get my pearl tea even though sometime is not on my way.
author: Tae C.

description:
This is my favorite place for boba, I don't understand why anyone would go to T-Pumps. I've tried a lot of their drinks and love the ones with fresh fruits and the passion green tea. The ice is also am azing. It can get crowded at times but the line moves quickly.
Cash only.
author: T D.

description:
Five stars for the boba itself. The boba quality here is perfection! It is soft, light, and just melts in your mouth. I love to get blended drinks here because I think their teas are just ok. My favorite is the strawberry smoothie. Yummy! 

Drink it. Love the Boba. Repeat.
author: Jenna s.

description: The best place for real and fresh chewy tapioca. Hands down, have been going since I was small every week.
author: Timothy W.

description:
I got a Lychee drink from here. I don't like real lychee fruit in my drinks because they are always so gritty My friend said his passion fruit tea was really good though. 

Prices are kind of high here for what it is.
author: Eric M.

description: The milk tea here is good! I also tried the lychee juice with coconut jelly no sugar added and it was refreshing. I will be back next time to try their green tea drinks!
author: Jennie W.

description:
this is by far my favorite boba place! 
The people who work here are super nice, the boba is perfect! (not hard or too mushy)
They use real milk and tea! Wonderfuls green milk tea over Tpumps green milk tea any day!
author: Jia Yi Y.

description:
Looking for the best tapioca in town? look no further! 

This is the most authentic tapioca in town. Here since the getgo, before all that "Quickly" garbage. All that Tapioca Express. All those chains.. And they're still running strong! That has got to say something about their quality and downright deliciousness! Enough reviewing... The more I write, the more i crave my favorite and the classic: number 1 (Tapioca Milk Tea).

Cheers!
author: Warren L.

description:
Wonderful Foods has a unwelcoming, somewhat dingy appearance. And there's no seating. There are several other superficially more attractive boba spots in the immediate neighborhood. Well, you know what, the place is called "wonderful foods", not "wonderful ambiance". As others have noted, Wonderful Foods is the best place to get boba in San Francisco. So go there. Don't go to the other places.

Get:
Avocado boba
Banana boba
Oatmeal boba
Salt & pepper chicken
Mini gummi frogs

Avoid:
Honey almond boba

UPDATE:
There is now a small amount of seating there.
author: Kevin L.

description: I may have been a tad too severe in my previous review. I tried this place again and while I'm still not a fan of their drinks, the candy bins look better-tended than last time and full of tantalizing goodies.
author: Jenny J.

description: This place has been around for ages, and there's a reason why it's still around in the midst of all the competition on Irving Street. This is no peasant boba. This is the real deal. All the drinks I've had are creamy and delicious. The sweetness level is perfect. The chewiness is perfect. Everything's consistent. I've tried at least a fourth of the menu, but my go to drink would be the almond tapioca drink. And if you're ever wondering about that massive rice cooker in the corner with brown stains, do yourself a favor, open the lid and inhale. Those tea eggs smell and taste so delicious!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
One of the best tapioca places in SF! This was one of the originals on Irving before the Tea Ways and Quicklys came along with their cheap and low quality drinks. 

Their milk tea with tapioca is so awesome! I wish I wasn't a cheap college student so I can afford to buy drinks from here instead of the $1 drinks from the competitors :(

I recently tried their avocado drink and it was pretty bomb too!
author: Daniel S.

description:
Super delicious!

This is definitely a go-to place when I'm craving some tapioca! Mostly I just love their fruit tapiocas because it taste like you're sipping on the actual fruit. So flavourful and so delicious! My favorite is the MANGO. Absolutely MUST TRY. I also really love their red bean tapioca!

This place is spot on with their drinks. They've also got candy all over for those having an extra sweet tooth. I think the decor could use a bit of work and it would help if they had places to sit....

Prices are a little higher... but it's worth it to pay a little extra for better tapioca.

But taste (because this IS a review on food) over decor any day!
author: Angela K.

description:
I started coming here when I was still in high school and their small little shop was next to double rainbow ice cream with the words "best tapioca in town!". Well eight to nine years later with all these tapioca shops popping up on Irving they are still .... THE BEST TAPIOCA IN TOWN!! :))  
With real authentic milk tea recipe and the most delicious chewy tapioca nothing can knock this place down and I really hope this place keep staying in business to satisfy my milk tea cravings! 

mmMmm approved!
author: Ubb S.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped here for boba yesterday. The boba was good but my Thai Tea had no flavor. My boyfriend said that his Taro Tea was pretty good. We didn't know that they came over ice. We are going to try them again and get it blended. They  also are CASH only. We didn't have any cash on us and were going to leave, but we didn't drive around for 10 minutes looking for parking to not get boba. We walked down to the US bank Atm and pulled a few bucks out.
author: Mandy M.

description:
I'm picky about everything... especially my boba balls.  

That sounded really gross, but it was meant to be harmless.  I like boba to be a certain consistency, not too mushy and not too hard... so it's nice to find a place that makes my balls right. 

I typically get the lychee boba milk tea, and it is always delicious and refreshing.  I know that right up the street there is Tea Way and Quickly which both offer 99cent all the boba you want drinks, however I am willing to shell out an additional $2 to get what I want.

The reason that I am not giving 5 stars is because this place is on the expensive side.  I think that they could lower their prices by 50 cents and would get more business.  I also think that the place doesn't have great customer service, and does not let you charge anything below $10.  With all of these cons... I believe that they deserve more of a 3.5 star rating -- but the product that they produce is legit.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I tried their tapioca milk tea, and whereas I'm not a huge fan of boba, I enjoyed my drink enough to come back a second time when I was in the area. Most regular milk teas I've had are more on the creamy side, but I could definitely taste the tea flavor more here, which is what I prefer.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
This is still my go-to-spot for tapioca! And I started back in 1998.. or was it 1999?

Their drinks and tapioca are fresh. And because they're consistently popular, the quality of the food stays that way! Ahh :)

Also, they offer grass jelly-- one of my personal favorites. And fresh watermelon juice.

Does anyone else like tea eggs? You can get those here as well. Along with other sorts of (exoctic) Asian snacks like dried fruits and veggies, variety of beef jerky, etc.

The more I think about this business, the more I feel they have been well named. They're quite wonderful.
author: Tammy H.

description:
Hard and unsweet.... That's what I drank at a tapioca store in Shanghai. 

When I came back to the 415, I had to get something delicious like Wonderful Foods which saved me from my misery of never drinking such a terrible plastic container of milk tea again. 

#4 Extra Sweet - With tapioca is the wayyy to go! 
$2.75

Home Sweet Home!
author: Tony C.

description: Best boba in town!  I especially love the watermelon boba in the summer made with fresh watermelon, the almond jelly tapioca with honey, and the passion fruit tapioca.
author: Romina K.

description: Originally I was gonna give this place a 3.5 star cuz the boba is a little to the sweeter side, but I guess it was my fault for not asking less sugar. Also...the young lady making our drink was such a sweet person, very friendly and nice, even when talking to tough customers! So I think the 4 star is well  deserved! Looking at all the other boba places right around the area, I would definitely come back to this one!
author: Ruo Yuan L.

description: We did not get the boba but the almond milk tea and the honey milk (green) tea were refreshing and delicious. IMO, the almond milk tea was yummier.
author: Susie S.

description: After seeing the impressive yelp reviews, came here a couple of weeks ago to grab some bubble teas for watching a movie at home. First impression wasn't too good. This place looks like a dump (sorry!) However, their drinks are authentic and has many ingredients you would only find in bubble tea shops in Taiwan/China. Their pearls lived up to the hype, and I would definitely come back.
author: Bill S.

description: A lot, if not all, of their drinks are made with real fruits. Their price is pretty much the same as most other boba places so I think its a great value considering they make theirs with real fruit. They have very chewy boba that tense to stick together but they do give a generous amount.
author: Amy Z.

description: Passion fruit green tea! The boba here is really soft and chewy. The passion fruit flavor is pretty strong. For the price paid, this is comparable to the tenren's in NYC. Definitely better than tea way and quickly's in this neighborhood.
author: Virginia Y.

description: This place is the worst. Don't come here!! That was my lame attempt to keep the TPumps folks at TPumps. This line isn't nearly as long as TPumps which I love. Good boba without the long wait and annoying youngsters. And they have candy. Definitely winning.
author: Rachel A.

description: This is terrible I order milk tea without Boba The lady give me a leftover milk tea that's been order wrong from a customer that been sitting there for a While. And I asked her to make a new one she thought I wasn't looking she still poured the same all Boba in and there's still one Boba in my cup. They don't deserve any stars
author: cookie c.

description: Wonderful!  Fresh strawberry smoothies.  Fresh mango smoothies.  I'm a fan of the chewy sour candies in the bins.  This is still my favorite boba place in the neighborhood, and I've been to all of them.  What stands out is the fresh fruit, the perfect boba and no wait.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Usually the service and drinks are very good. But based on my just recent past experience, I had to grade it lower. 

We had ordered about 200 drinks for a school fundraiser and we had told them we would come by to pick it up at 11:45am on a friday. We show up maybe 5 mins before and thinking the drinks were packed in boxes and set, ready for us to pay pick up and leave. But that wasn't the case. The drinks were all over the table in the usual cup holders and NOT in boxes for us. So we stood there while they were trying to put drinks in some random boxes that weren't gonna hold up with the drinks stacked up about 5 drinks high in a box. So not only were the drinks not ready packed for us by the time we got there, they told us we had to wait longer because they weren't done making the drinks!!! They said they had another 60 cups to make. 

We told them what time we would be there, and thinking that everything would be ready and set, nothing went well. Drinks weren't all made, and nothing was packed for us.
author: Anita W.

description:
I've been here so many times already but I just had to update my review since I have recently discovered their candy selection! 

I had always walked past it but I never bought anything just because sometimes those public candies scare me... as in you never really know how long it's been there for. But my sister got their chocolate covered gummy bears the other day and they were super fresh and delish!

So now aside from their nommy green milk tea boba, I'm probably also gonna have to bring a few pounds of those gummy bears home with me too. NOM.
author: Constance C.

description: I ordered the Honey green milk tea and I am not sure what changed from the last time I ordered this to when I ordered yesterday, but it was not as good as I remembered. If I ordered the same drink from last time, the price has gone up to $3.50 and the quality has gone down. The service is still as friendly as I remember it being, and the service speed is good, but I definitely didn't like the drink that I ordered. If I go back, I will be choosing something else to drink. Especially when I could have gone to Teaway for cheaper green milk tea. I am not going to not come back to. Wonderfuls, but I can get better tasting green tea elsewhere.
author: Alex T.

description:
If you're from the Sunset, you already know.. this is the best boba/tapioca spot around.

fav's:
- avocado (real) smoothie w/ tapioca
- iced honey green tea
- milk tea w/ pudding
- salt and pepper chicken (spicy) w/ basil leaves
- sour belt candy (strawberry, apple and strawberry banana)
author: Brian C.

description:
I JUST CANT
IT JUST

I CANT

I love this place. I've been deprived of real boba for way way way way too long, and with advice (read: forced by) from my cousin, got some boba here after a long boba hiatus. We ended up chosing this place over Teaway and the other chain-esque stores because of their authenticity - and wow, this really shows up in flavor. 

I got the red bean tapioca (a risk to me because I never know how different boba places make this flavor) and asked them not to make it too sweet. You could see the workers putting in large chunks of red bean paste! Yum! The tapioca came out perfect - every sip was like eating a red bean bun and good lord, is I in heaven????

Needless to say, I drank this stuff up. I will be back, even if they are a little pricey.
author: Ruoxi Y.

description:
Wonderful Foods offers some wonderful...foods...ok that was too easy, I'm sorry. But seriously, their milk tea is quality. I give them a lot of credit. Even though their milk tea is $2.75 and Teaway Express has a similar product down the block for $1.00, you really get what you pay here. $2.75 gets you fresh milk tea, not the watered down stuff at Teaway Express. $2.75 gets you a spacious environment where you're not being groped by high schoolers while waiting in line (no offense to all you high school gropers).

Just think of it this way. Teaway has taken over Irving Street. Quickly's has panicked and clearly changed their entire business model to compete (self serve, $1.00 milk tea, etc.). But Wonderful Foods hasn't budged at all. They know what they offer will stand the test of time.

My tummy gives Wonderful Foods Co...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: Impressive shop selling American candy, Asian herbs/spices/dried fruits, and putting out some of the best milk tea and boba I've had.  Only downer is there's nowhere to sit.
author: Derrick C.

description:
I come here for one and one thing only-- their Strawberry smoothie tapicoa. Whether its frozen strawberries or strawberries in syrup, it still tastes good and doesn't have that fake powdered strawberry taste you get from other chains like Quickly's or TapEx. 

I've tried other flavors but have sadly been disappointed, so I stick to my go-to now.

I'll occasionally pick up some cola bottle gummy candy from here as well.
author: Jenna H.

description:
I LOVE THE TAPIOCA HERE! 

I'm a very simple tapioca milk tea kind of girl, and even though i could get that anywhere, Wonderful's is definitely THE BEST. They also have a good variety of candy, and I love my candy so this was my fix when Sweet Factory closed at Stonestown.

-1/2 star because I came here 4 times within one and a half weeks and they didn't have Chocolate Covered Gummy Bears. Which means they lack restocking of their candy! 

-1/2 star because my friend ordered hot milk tea here once and it was a mistake! They microwaved it.. wtf. 

All in all, even though their drinks are pricier than Quickly's and Tea way, they are definitely worth it !
author: Taylor C.

description: A high school friend and I were on the lookout for a good boba place in SF that wasn't the usual Purple Kow or whatever, and we stumbled upon this place. At first, we were surprised because this is like an Asian dessert/snack place... you can't even tell it's a boba place if you just walked by. But boy, were we blown away by how great the boba was. Perfectly chewy and not too hard; the milk tea is to die for. I got the green pearl milk tea and it's probably one of the best cups of boba I've ever had. Highly recommend.
author: Stephanie S.

description: My favorite boba place in SF. Beats all the other places tea pump, quickly, shared tea and tea way. The boba has always been consistency chewy. Love their lychee milk tea. Prices are reasonable.
author: Vivian N.

description:
I tried their Avocado Boba (which is my FAVORITE type of smoothie).  Um, huh-low, why didn't anyone tell me that they use REAL FRUIT?  I've clearly upped my rating..

...now if only the money fairy would cut down the prices.
author: Diane N.

description:
One of the best boba places in San Francisco!

I'm sorry, Teaway and Quickly's do NOT compare.

I almost always get the Almond Milk tea here and it's never powdery, therefore a testament to the materials Wonderful Foods Co uses in their tea drinks.

A plus: candies, galore-- all over the store!
author: Mary C.

description:
Best tapioca on Irving, hands down. Dont settle for chain run places like teaway and quicklies that add ridiculous amounts of sugar and water in your drink and make them all taste the same. Go to wonderful foods, buy yourself a refreshing milk tea and taste what milk tea and tapioca should taste like. 

They also have a wide variety of chinese snacks and regular candy that you can choose from if you have a sweet tooth. Try their chicken as well if you have $5-6 to spend.
author: Tim M.

description: Sells candy and cash only bubble tea shop. If you need to use their restroom, you have to buy something. The avocado smoothie is made fresh.
author: Kelly L.

description:
I've been a patron since the late 90's. I prefer to give my $ to small local businesses rather than large chains like Quickly. 

What I like is that, there's a strong taste of the milk tea rather than syrup... 

Salt and Pepper chicken is yummy and so are the tea eggs.
author: Angelica C.

description: ive been coming to wonderful since i was like 10 !! when it was across the street my fav boba ever theyre always quick i love that theyre open late and they make the best durian shakes nom nom nom i love the consistency that it hasnt changed over the years  either
author: Justynne B.

description:
Best boba in SF.  BEST!  Been coming here for years.  I grew up an hour outside of SF, and during senior year in high school, when I had a three-hour lunch break (two free periods and lunch hour), I would drive up with a friend, get Wonderful Foods Co boba and Yum Yum Fish sushi, and drive back down.  

It's that good.  

Have I had better, cheaper boba?  Yes, in Ximending in Taiwan.
author: Erika C.

description:
This place is SO good!!! I think I've probably tried all (if not all, then most) of the tapioca places in SF, and I don't think any of them beat wonderful food's. 

I tend to stick with the original ($2.75) because the milk tea has a really unique coffee taste in it. The tapioca balls are chewy and not too hard or too soft like a lot of other places. Other flavors I would recommend are Taro, Milk Tea with Pudding, and Cantaloupe. Wonderful Foods truly makes quality drinks, not too diluted or too strong. 

They also sell candy there, where you pick up a bag and fill it up to be weighed when you pay. 

As for parking, it's not plentiful during peak hours (10-8), but if you drive around the block a couple of times, you are bound to find a spot. At night (9:30pm and after), parking is available almost anywhere. 

Overall, this is the place I always take visiting friends and family. It cannot be beat... *ahem* talking about TeaWay down the street...
author: Gelene V.

description:
Hands down my favorite tapioca store in the world. Here are the reasons why...

1. Tapioca balls. Almost incomparable to any other boba place. The best part is, they are ALWAYS consistent with their boba. Some places are better at certain times of the day because its fresher or something but this place ensures that the boba is in your drink when you buy it. 

2. Milk Tea. I have not tasted a place that has the same flavor milk tea as Wonderful. I tried quite a variety of teas... from Taiwanese style to the Hong Kong style. I personally think it should its own type of tea. Not exactly sure how to describe it... typically you have your HK style where it is milkier and than you have Quickly with what seems like powdered milk tea, and then you have some sort of Ten Ren variation and it has the stronger taste of tea. Don't get me wrong, I love HK Style and Ten Ren too but Wonderful's milk tea pops up because you can only get it here. 

4. Cups. Quite silly but they don't serve those flimsy cups with the sealable tops. It's more "sanitary", but I hate holding them and sometimes I feel like I can easily squirt it everywhere. To be real, how often do you buy a tapioca and save it for awhile before drinking it. That is the only other pro I see to those cups... when transferring a cup to someone else and you don't want to open it yet. 

3. The atmosphere. This place isn't a chain.. (well the owner does own Sweethut but it doesn't associate it's name with Wonderful). You kind of grow up with the store if you're a local and I think which is why it remains standing even though you have other chains around (three Tea Ways on Irving and one Quickly). There are many loyal customers and there is a reason why we are willing to spend the extra dollar here: it is consistenly good. I mean there are occasional times where a new person is being trained and it's not AS good but eventually they get the hang of it. 

I'm not sure what I'll do without this place but I think they make too much profits to be shut down anytime in my lifetime. :)
author: Jenny L.

description:
One of the best bubble tea experiences in my entire life. Better than or equal to hong kong.

The regular milk tea was so-so though ... 
The Taro was freaking divine.  Try Taro or the other flavors
author: Terry B.

description:
The old mom & pop tapioca place that I have been coming here since high school. Nothings changed I think, other than the location which is only a few blocks up. They still carry their wide variety of candy, from chocolate gummi bears to jawbreakers (even the jumbo sized one) to packaged Japanese candy. They also have tea eggs, jerky, and dried cuttlefish and squid. It reminds me of an Asian Sweet Factory. 

As for their drinks, they have delicious flavors. I usually get the honeydew or watermelon juice, most of the time without tapioca because it gets too filling. Their Thai iced tea is good and so is their regular milk tea with pudding. I recently tried their green apple with lychee jelly and that was SO good but probably tons of calories from the syrup. My brother let me try his green milk tea which is bomb too. 

Parking is never really that difficult unless you chose to come during a Sat/Sun afternoon then you have to battle with everyone else that are grocery shopping or something. 

Credit card transactions over $15 only so remember to bring enough cash unless you want to buy $15 worth of drinks and snacks. With all the competition on Irving, you would think that they would lower their drink prices down a notch (Teaway $1.99) but they seem to be surviving for now. I seem to be pretty loyal to this place so I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Before the fro-yo craze me and my friends would grab these "pearl drinks" and try out new flavors and see who picked the better flavor. Sometimes I'd win and sometimes I wouldn't but it was a great way to taste every single flavor, especially since their menu is disturbingly large. 

Trust, I've searched low and high, from the Bay to LA, from the Sco' to San Jo, and I've got to say that this little mom and pop is by far my favorite. The texture of the tapioca balls, the quality of the milk tea itself, it's just quality. 

After years of research here are the favorites I came up with. 

1. Taro - Not to sweet, but surprisingly good - My alltime favorite
2. Almond - Nice change of pace from Taro. 
3. Coconut - A little Malibu and some pineapple = Pina Colada pearl tea

Now stop cheating and create your own top 3. 

Plagiarism
author: Earl G.

description:
I've only ever had the red bean tapioca drink here, and it's...wait for it...wonderful!  (har har)

Seriously though, it's something that I've gone back for again and again.  First off, they blend all the red beans together which makes it nice and smooth.  Secondly, the boba is nice and sweet and chewy, just the way it's supposed to be.  They also seem to have a lot of unique flavors (green bean, for example), which I hope one day to try, if I ever get over my red bean phase.  If you're looking for a unique (and chewy) drinking experience, definitely give this place a try!
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
Okay, so I was never a huge fan tapioca drinks. I barely go to Quickly's and when I do, I find the drinks to be mediocre and bland (except for their strawberry milk tea). 

But Wonderful Foods Co has made me fallen in love with tapioca drinks, wow. I got the coconut tapioca and it's so good! They give so much tapioca, like 1/3 of the cup!
 
I'd definitely come back, even though it's $3-4 bucks for a drink, I would rather spend that money here than at Quickly's, especially since more high school kids are cluttered around there.
author: Vicki L.

description: Awesome place to get tapioca here,  I come here with my girlfriend all the time she loves the almond milk tea here without tapioca.  The lines are usually not that long as well too bad they have so many tapioca places around like quicklys teaway and trumps, I would say out of all of them this place is he best.  Don't follow the hype with tpumps they are honestly not that great it's a try once thing and the lines there are insane.
author: Danny C.

description:
Relatively cheap but still able to satisfy boba tea cravings!  The actual boba itself is very soft and not chewy like other places.  I personally like the green milk tea (#4). This place is definitely worth TRYING on your quest to find your favorite boba place in SF.  This and Tea Station are the only 2 I like in Outer Sunset. 

As for the candy that's just been sitting there for who knows how long.....
author: Kenny L.

description:
I used to come here a lot. Wonderful Foods has been around for a long time and I have always enjoyed it.

Yesterday, I was with friends and we were craving some tapioca drinks. We went and it too forever. I think the people making the drinks were all new. We ordered six drinks and must have been in there for over half an hour. One friend ordered just green tea and they messes up on that. Two of us ordered lemon jelly with our drinks and they accidentally gave us almond jelly. They forgot about my cousin's tapioca drink and we had to remind them. At the end, the quality of the drinks weren't that good. We ended up wasting the drinks....
author: Carol K.

description: I frequented this place while growing up near SF and I'm glad to see on a recent trip here that it is still the same as I remember. I especially like the fruit smoothies - you can see the cases of mango on the side so they must go through a lot of mangoes. Boba was just right the day I visited - I hate when it's too soft.
author: Estella H.

description:
I've only gotten the candy here and it's always nommy.
They have a ton of gummy candies, rock candy, those tiny chocolates that are shaped and colored like rocks, my fave!, etc.
Slightly pricy candy but isn't it always when it's by the pound?
Definitely need to try the milk tea by all the raving reviews.
author: Lauren L.

description: Yummy! I think I finaly have a favorite Tapioca spot in sf. It always tastes good and it seems like they use fresh ingredients instead of powder like most other tapioca spots.
author: Diana s.

description:
Wonderful foods has the best best Thai tea in SF (that I have tried at least). As far as I know, wonderful foods is not a chain and is a mom-pop shop, therefor their drinks probably are not made in bulks. And if their Thai tea is made in bulk, they do a good job! The Thai tea has the perfect balance of tea bitterness and sweetness from condense milk/half-n-half milk. They definitely brewed really strong Thai tea for the Thai tea boba drink to be so good. I never ordered the milk tea (bc Thai tea is so good) but it seems like they would have good milk tea as well. 

I have been here multiple times and most times I get perfect Thai teas, but there are times when the tea was not brewed strong enough and/or not enough tea was added into the drink making the Thai tea drink too sweet. But overall 5 stars!
author: Shirley M.

description:
Been coming here since 2000, man thats loyalty! (12 years thats three different tiers of schooling!!! and then some)
They have the best milk tea ever.  Thats what new comers should start off with.
The tea has the true tea flavor, none of that watered down stuff you get elsewhere.
Tapioca is usually pretty on point and the staff always treats me super nice! I always come here for my tapioca fix!
xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo
author: Steph Q.

description: This place used to be really really good. I Remeber coming here just so that I get the taro boba and hubby would get the Piña colada. The drink tasted thick and with real taro. Today I came in here to get taro and all I tastes was syrup water with fake purple color for taro. I pretty much didn't want to waste my body feeding sugar water in me when it doesn't even taste good. I mean if it tasted good I would have totally not be so mindful to splurge once in awhile. Anyways long story short. I will never come back
author: Julie L.

description: The OG of Milk Tea places in San Francisco.  Really enjoyed the strawberry smoothie boba.
author: Joshua P.

description:
My sister brings me here seemingly every time I come down to visit her. So I guess I cannot say this is the best bubble tea in the city...because it is the only place I've been. 

What I CAN say is that Wonderful Foods makes the best tapioca pearls I have had, anywhere, hands down.

Every single ball is perfect in flavor and consistency. No random mushy or hard ball there. I have no idea how they do it.

I'm always drawn to the milk tea which is delightfully strong and milky at the same time. I've also tried the almond which has a mellow yet strong almond flavor.

The space is huge, especially for not having any tables/seats to enjoy your boba there. The two walls on the sides of the space are filled with all sorts of candy for an ultimate sweet-tooth indulgence. And there are always tea eggs to give the store that tea-eggy-aroma.
author: Leah H.

description: This is by far the best boba drink in the world for me!! Got hooked cuz of a friend. Now I gotta have my fix whenever I'm in SF. I loved their avo juice boba, durian boba and regular milk tea boba. Will try their lychee bubble milk tea, mango,  and almond milk tea next time, along w the pop corn ck super spicy =)
author: Wendy T.

description:
If you have a hankering for candy -- the selection is ok -- but how fresh... is suspect -- They do have Asian preserves and desserts here, which is probably why they are still in business.

I remembered the made to order food and drinks here were not that great and decided its been a while and maybe, just maybe they've improved? 

You have been warned! DO NOT get the avocado smoothie from here. They should really take a short walk down the block to ETC Cafe to test out what a good avocado smoothie actually tastes like ($3.75) They do not know what a fresh avocado is. My avocado smoothie had all the brown tendrils and tasted like old eggs mixed with sugar. When I told the girl behind the counter that the taste was offensive, she tested it out and said it tastes fine to her. She offered to make me another one from a "fresh container" of avocados -- I was curious about what she meant. She rummaged though their refrigerator and there were large containers of precut fruit like watermelon and papaya -- more than what they would ever finish serving in a day --she pulls out the same large sized container full of avocados precut, pitted, turning yellow and brown... rotting. 

I commented that the avocados do not look fresh and that they should really cut them when an order is placed... She insists that they had only prepared it up an hour ago. I shook my head and said, no thank you -AND instead of refunding me the full $4.75, she gave me back $1.00.

Two thumbs down.
author: Dorothy M.

description:
While in SF, I still need my bubble tea fix!  This place has lots of flavors to choose from.  Not to mention, lost of candy snacks and crack seeds.  Way cheaper than Vua Koh Bo!  And they don't push you to buy snacks, or anything!

Since I already bought all my crack seed stuff, I just went straight to the counter to order my bubble tea.  I ordered the kumquat green tea with lemon jelly.  Similar to the kumquat with aiyu jelly I get back home at City Cafe.  My BF got the lychee green tea with lychee jelly.  Lychee jelly was really good!  I liked that!

We also got the squid balls for snack.  It's just deep fried squid balls with salt and pepper.  Although basic, and plain, still pretty good.

Not bad.  Price pretty good.  I'll be back when I'm in SF again.
author: JME C.

description: My boyfriend took me here a couple of times mostly to buy candy since I'm a sweet tooth! If you haven't tried the chocolate covered gummy bears here YOU MUST. So good. I have also tried a couple drinks here. My favorite so far is the Lychee Milk Tea with tapioca. It's not too sweet like how some other places make it AND it has lychee bits inside it! The tapioca pearls taste fresh and aren't hard like most boba places. There are quite a bit boba places around here such as Quickly's (which I hate), Teaway, and TPumps, but if you are trying to look for a good boba place where you don't have to wait in a long line like Tpumps then this is the place to go!
author: Nancy T.

description:
What can I say? Wonderful Foods Co. is one of the best boba places in the city!! Their drinks are always freshly made and their boba is at just the right texture and consistency!

A strong selling point for this boba shop is that it is located in a prime location...right smack in the middle of busy Irving street....which is frequently visited by Sunset residents and students (UCSF hollla)

This place gets really good business, and the owners are really nice. Sometimes the owners are at the shop, and when they are, they usually bring their 2 little doggies with them. All they (the doggies) do is just sit there and look pretty. =)

Anyhoos, just about any drink here is good (cold or hot), but I usually get taro (real taro, not powder), almond, or watermelon boba....and they all taste good!

Although this boba shop is great, I'm still biased and I must say that the boba shops in socal are still better.

But if I'm ever near Irving, I always make time to stop by and pick up a boba drink ;)
author: Albert L.

description: Strawberry mango smoothie is my favorite! This place makes their boba well, soft on the outside with just the right amount of chewiness on the inside. Their popcorn chicken (incidentally called salt and pepper chicken not popcorn chicken) is so good, it's a little more than you would normally pay for at say a quickly or a tutti melon, but they have the flavor down. My favorite place for boba in SF and their chicken is up there too, I'd prolly go with the tuttimelon in old chinatown based on price.  But if you're already in the sunset...
author: Alison T.

description:
I really like their almond tapioca. 

The only boba place I go to in the city. Their regular milk tea is not that good but i've found a winner in the almond milk tea. Tapioca is soft and perfectly sweetened. Sometimes it can be a little bit too sweet but i think if you wait 3-5 minutes for the crushed ice to melt, it tones down the sweetness and is perfect.
author: J D.

description:
Straight up best taro root boba I've ever had. [clarification: best fake taro -- they have the purple taro which is the sort I like. Real taro tastes like a potato] 

If you like your boba uber sweet, uber rich, uber creamy and filled with dreams and sunshine --) this is your place. 

Next time I need to see if they have a strawberry blended drink that rivals Fantasia. 

If so, I'm in troubles.
author: Heather W.

description:
If you get anything other than their milk tea, it's good, and even great.  They have good tapioca balls too.  Yummy squishiness between my teeth.

If you try their milk tea drinks, be prepared for heavy condensed milk.  No, not your usual amount but super thick!  

Dried fruit and candies = good selection. Typical pricing.  They also have tea eggs for $0.90 each.  All self-service.

Service = craptastic.  They are not friendly.  They are quick though.  *shrugs*

I stop here if it's on my way home from something after 9 p.m., you know, when other stuff is closed.
author: Fannie S.

description: WAY BETTER BUBBLE TEA THAN T PUMPS. I don't get why this place isn't more popular. T Pumps is horrible and these guys step it up with really good boba.
author: Michael S.

description:
BEST MILK TEA!

I wish it was closer to me, but then again, I'd probably get diabetes from drinking so much of it. But I love this place! anytime I am around that area or pass by on 19th ave, I would think about getting milk tea from them.

Any drink from here is great! My top favorites:
-regular milk tea
-taro milk tea
-thai tea
-lychee milk tea

I also tried their strawberry smoothie and it's so good! I have not tried something that I did not like yet. or anything that would make me think ehhhh. 

A bit expensive when your drinks are more complicated, like the smoothies are like 4$ something? 

This place used to be super crowded, that's why they moved to where they are now, but everytime I have gone, there was no line. Not sure what happened. 

They also sell candy, which is why they are so AWESOME lol.
author: Erica L.

description:
Let's put it into some perspective for the new boba places popping up all over town... Wonderful has been in the neighborhood since ten- fifteen years ago for as long as i can remember. It use to be located diagonally across the street next to the hair salon. We use to drive across town to come here for their drinks.

We've been back recently and ordered my favorite HK milk tea w/tapioca and egg pudding and a fresh strawberry smoothie w/tapioca. Let's just say my Caucasian husband commented highly of it (and he's had a good share of boba drinks). The drink itself was flavorful and bobas were nice and chewy. We do recommend...
author: chiisaikori C.

description:
Get: Tapioca Milk Tea

This seems like a duplicate business listing as Wonderful Foods Co but that boba was so damn good that I'm reviewing it in both places. :D

This is by far the best boba I've had in the states. And the only reason I can't say it was better than Taiwan is because that was a long time ago and I don't really remember and I might have been wasted. The boba was so yummy and soft and the tea was really good and REAL tasting. No powders here.

The biggest problem I have is I don't know whether or not I want to get regular Tapioca Milk Tea or try the other things on the menu next time I go...oh wait, I'll just do both :)
author: Vickie D.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place... my best friend's aunt actually owns it :) 

BUT that does not make me biased. as a regular buyer of Quickly, TapEx, Teaway, AND Fantasia [so pretty much everywhere] and this is hands-down the best place to get your tapioca milk tea craving fulfilled! :D

everything here is fresh, from the tea to the perfectly-textured tapioca to the jellies and the fruits or syrups that they put in your tea. you can see them prepare it yourself and TRUST ME it's really as fresh as it gets! :)

mmm... now i want some really bad... my fave drink is tapioca milk tea with lychee jelly. YUMS!
author: Jane S.

description: Generally Fantasia is my gold standard for boba.  Then a good friend of mine said this place is better than Fantasia..how could that be possible? I knew I had to check it out.  I got the lychee milk tea, and my bf got the red bean milk tea.  The tapioca was really good, not overcooked.  This place costs slightly more than fantasia.  The tea is a bit stronger, I almost want to say it taste more like coffee.  The red bean was blended, which was different.  Thicker, not as sweet.  Overall a bit different, but they use real tea which is a win in my book!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
There's many things to like about Wonderful Foods. Parking is generally pretty easy to find (for a place in the city), service is quick and they open late. 

I usually get a lychee green milk tea with pearls. The tea is not too sweet, and there are pieces of lychee in it which I really enjoy. The pearls, on the other hand, can be a hit or miss. Generally, they are pretty chewy, although there were a few times where I've experienced mushiness. Some people may like it mushy, but I'm definitely a fan of chewy boba. I've also gotten their thai iced tea (really meh) and their regular milk tea (pretty good). I have to say their lychee green milk tea is the best I've had so far.

I really like how they have candy and snacks that you can get while waiting for your tea to be made. Many times I have gotten a bunch of sour candy, gummy worms, malt balls, etc. SO BAD FOR ME but SO GOOD. 

Overall, best boba place I've had so far in SF! Definitely a must try if you're in the city.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
Simply the best milk tea boba in San Francisco. Always fresh, always consistent. The prices raised since I was last here in 2010 but it makes no difference to me, I'm still willing to drive across town and pay a couple cents more for some awesome bobes.

There hasn't been a drink I didn't like. All ingredients are fresh and nothing is pre-made. All their scrumptious drink concoctions are made right before your eyes. The tapioca pearls also taste fresh from the boiler, or oven, or wherever the hell they make them. It's SO GOOD.

Definitely try these flavors: 
Milk Tea: rich, strong, mildly sweet
Almond: very much like almond milk but very sweet and less creamy Taro: a taro drink in its most literal form though the purple color is unappealing, it's super rich in taro and so addicting if you like the taste
Green Milk Tea: perfect if you want something lighter than a milk tea but with the same amount of caffeine, kind of like choosing green tea over coffee
Avocado: this made me a believer in consuming avocados in drink form. It's quite thick and filling but it's so pure, milky and just the right amount of sweet

My one con would be that there is NO seating. Really just a stop and go kind of place. I'd also refrain from buying candy here because it's a rip-off.
author: Colleen V.

description: Great for their boba drinks.  Pass on their popcorn chicken.  Lots of candy alternatives though!
author: Jane N.

description:
There's a reason this place sells boba for $3.00 when their competitors a block away (Quickly) sell for $1.00 and teaway for $2.00. Because it's DA BOMB (like Chris tucker said in Rush Hour 2). It tastes so good and mostly all of the drinks use fresh ingredients. The almond is my favorite and I have converted many a non-almond drinker with this delicious concoction. 

The tapioca balls here are fairly good, I usually don't get boba but here I ask for a little bit because I know it won't be days old like at some other cheap knock-offs. 

Also, it's overrated to get your own boba people, and not only that but it's easy for people to get/cough/sneeze their germs into those shared containers... just FYI.

Wonderful foods is like In-N-Out to me. Can't live without it.
author: Wilson T.

description:
They should really stick to what they know.

The boba is wonderful. Great texture, cooked right, not slimy, and not too firm. We had a taro milk tea (I wanted hot, but was made an iced one), a banana, and an avocado. All were delicious!

The part that gets me is that it almost feels like they are trying to do too many things. Candy bins line the walls-- similar to a Sweet Factory. I dove in and had a few jellies and filled my little baggie. But all the candy was stale and uneatable. :( I cried until I got my boba.

There are no places to sit, and people obviously want to sit and hang out. If they nix the candy bins, get some tables and chairs for people to sit and chat, then this place would be legit. For now, I think I'll keep it in my back pocket for when I have cravings for good boba.
author: Mar A.

description: I got milk tea with boba and pudding. The tea had good tea flavor which is so hard to come by now a days with all the budget boba shops opening up with that sugary, powdery crap that overpowers the tea flavor. It's milk TEA people. Get it together society. Anyway the boba is fresh and it has a good texture to it and the pudding was tasty as well. Overall a good boba drink if I am in the area. However, my favorite continues to be Fantasia in Cupertino. Have yet to find an option closer to home that comes close.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
My mouth is salivating just reminiscing about this place! It was my ex who introduced me to the world of boba and I've been hooked ever since. Now I have my favorites in San Diego- but NOTHING, even my go-to's in SD can compare to my beloved Wonderful.

I remember back in the days when my BFF and I would do 1day trips to SF and we'd visit this place 5-6x/day just to get our fix AND grab some to go before we headed back to SD.

I also remember moments where if ex and I would get in an argument over the phone, he'd fly down with a thermos full of milk tea from Wonderful and he knew that he would immediately be forgiven.

So why am I telling you stories? Because my stories should already tell you why I'm giving this place is 5 (hell, if I could give it a 10 I would!).

But then again, it's just my opinion..
author: Christine M.

description:
One of the few places in town that has real taro smoothie. A bit on the pricy side, but quality is good and (for some odd ball reason) there's no long lines.
Jasmine milk tea with real lychee bits is awesome
author: Meimei M.

description:
This store is so cute! They have all kinds of candy lined up along the wall! Chocolate and white chocolate gummy bears?! Rarely do I find those two together anywhere! I only wish I had gotten some at the time but that just means i'll have to go back!

I got the almond milk tea which was mediocre. My boyfriend got the taro milk tea which he got sick of halfway through and he said the tapioca was hard and did not taste good. My mom and brother both got the hot ginger drink. And ... they both did not like it. Maybe this place isn't our kind of place for milk tea/drinks. I'd like to come back to get those chocolate gummy bears and to give this place another shot though and try their avocado shakes and their strawberry shakes. Please don't fail me!
author: Syd T.

description:
This is where you get your fix of smooth, sticky, black balls... Tapioca balls. You can call it Boba tea or Tapioca Tea, or Bubble Tea with Pearls. However you like to call it, I can't help but purchase a cup of this delicious treat every time I pass by this place. It feels like a party in my mouth and everybody is invited.

Wonderful has a variety of different flavors and drinks to choose from, for you adventurous types. I usually stick with the original, the #1. I know what I want and I get it. I love the flavor of the tea and the balls are not overly sticky or gooey. Eww what a mess, the balls can get. But not here.

They also sell many types of preserved fruits and candies. But I just come here for the drinks. One cup is usually not enough for me. Maybe next time I will try double fisting it.
author: Sam T.

description: Hands down the best boba place in town, if not in the Bay Area !! I've been to Wonderful for years, since I was in school.. Oh those nostalgic moments :) My fave is taro milk tea and honeydew milk tea. It's perfection. This place is a must try and I guarantee you won't be disappointed!
author: GeekyDino S.

description:
SOOOO GOOD!!!!

Quickly's is for broke high school/middle school kids

Teaway is for broke high school/college kids

Wonderful Foods is for those who like the finer things in life! You are paying more for REAL fruits! REAL FRUITS! That taste better than the drinks made with syrups at Quickly and Teaway!  I like the mango tapioca with no milk....Its like a jamba juice tapioca! SOOO GOOD! When my sweet tooth is kicking into overdrive they have candy too! I especially like the sour stuff....Watermelon, peaches, cherries!!!

Their popcorn chicken is pretty bomb too but a bit pricey. 

Only dislike is, it is a loiter spot occasionally for smokers...and they love having their spitting circle and sometimes you might step in it...disgusting...
author: Brendan L.

description:
Tried this place today cause I always hear my friends say how much they love it.
Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but my matcha tapioca was nothing special. Not as wonderful as I thought it would be. 
Kinda pricey for the size I got. Might come back if I got with one of my friends who are huge fans of this place.
author: Victoria D.

description: I've only gone here a couple times.  First time I got the basic milk tea with boba which was alright.  I got the almond boba the second time which was much better.  The only issue I had was the size of the drink (there might be larger sizes I'm unaware of).  The cups aren't large to begin with...and they put a bunch of ice in mine.
author: Kelvin S.

description:
Best Almond Tapioca! I don't think you can find any one better then here! This is the place to go if you want just a beautiful original tapioca with the boba. 
Not only is ALmond the best! They also have many other flavors to choose from, so you'll never get tired of it! hehe
author: Victoria L.

description:
This place is enough of a reason to get me out of my SoCal habitat and travel to SF. They have the best jasmine milk tea I've ever had; it's not too sweet, just the perfect amount of tea flavor, and omg their boba...just the right combination of soft and chewy. The only other drink I've tried was a HoneyDew slush which was also good and made with real honeydew--also made me careless to my allergies of melons.

The shop also has a variety of Asian candies and munchies :]
author: Tessa C.

description:
Simply the best. Period. Just stopped in here after having lunch at Kevin's noodle house. What an excellent one two punch.

I had the milk tea with tapioca. There's something about the texture of the tapioca here that makes all the difference--it's soft and chewy all the way through. The tea is light, not to creamy, not to sweet. And they crush the ice, which does make it a little harder to pick off the leftover tapioca.

They also serve a variety of sweets here if you're looking for some Taiwanese candy to satisfy your sweet tooth. Despite the difficulty in finding parking, Wonderful Foods is definitely a solid second or third destination when you're on Irving Street.
author: Tony L.

description: My absolute boba place. An ordinary black milk tea here is EXTRAORDINARY! The flavor is rich and plain delicious. My mouth waters whenever I drink the milk tea here!! a MUST-TRY when you are in the city. Don't be turned away by the plain exterior of the store... they have the best milk tea.  Parking is difficult, I've seen people leave their car running while they run inside to order.  Cash only.
author: Kristina N.

description: Wonderful Foods is by far my favorite milk tea place. I've been going here since 1997 and I am happy to say that this place has survived all the milk tea shops that have popped up around town.  The tea is the perfect blend of milk and tea, not too sweet & not too bland.  They have been consistent and I always know what to expect when I order my usual, #1 - regular milk tea with pearls.  I don't live near the city anymore, but whenever I visit, I have to stop by here!
author: Amelia L.

description:
Had I read these Yelp reviews, I would have tried the drinks here... Damn.

But anyway, my cousins and I use to buy candy here after visiting the temple a few blocks away. This past Saturday, we decide to have a nostalgic moment by buying candy here again! For most of the sour candy I like, it's about $2.25-$2.50 for 1/4lb.... kind of expensive but there's such a large variety to choose from and I take the amount I want! There's also different dried prunes that I love! 

Apparently, there's more stuff on the menu that I overlooked...guess I'll have to come back again!
author: Pansy L.

description:
The best!  Quickly doesn't even compare.  I love the Taro, Milk Tea, Thai Tea and Honey Dew!   ( I haven't tried them all)  Great candy selection too!
