Wonderful customer service!  One day I witness this crazy man, just down the street, push this little girl, because he was in a hurry.  Her strawberry drink fell and she was in tears! 
 I went back inside to tell them what happened and I was going to buy her another drink, but they gave her another one for free.
author: X D.

description: Been going here since i was young. I never get tired of the tapioca! Delicious balls, delicious drinks & reasonable prices! Open late tooo! Such nice customer service& they always greet you w/ a smile! Will always be #1 place for tapioca for me! Yum!
author: Nisha C.

description:
They have one of the best boba drink here in San Francisco.

Definitely, best salt & pepper chicken ( popcorn chicken)
author: Michael C.

description: This is THE Original Boba place.  This place was a popular Asian spot before boba was even a known thing to everyone else.  Boba here is what real boba milk tea is suppose to taste like.
author: K T.

description:
I've been a loyal customer for over a decade now.  My favorites:

-Green Milk Tea
-Fresh Watermelon Juice
-Fresh Carrot Juice (new item)
-Salt & Pepper Chicken
-Tea Eggs
author: Stacey L.

description:
I was first introduced to the delighfulness of Wonderful Desserts about 6th months ago from a friend who used to live in the neighborhood.  She swore by this place and at first i was intrigued at the style and everything about this place, then i took one sip and i was astonish with the quality and taste of my drink.  

The people working here were friendly and i was quite impressed with their speed of their service, i was able to double park on a beautiful Sunday on the corner of 20th and Irving, run in and get my smoothie.

The two time that i have gone here, i ordered the strawberry smoothie with tapioca...   Not only does it taste delicious, it looks cool too.  I have always been a little frightened by tapioca, but the tapioca at this shop is supper yummy and soft.  
I am going to make it a tradition, that whenever i am in the neighborhood that i have to stop and have a smoothie at Wonderful Desserts!
author: Skyler W.

description: HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE PLACE FOR MILK TEA. It has a slight coffee taste to it but it is delicious. I love their boba balls too, they're super chewy and sweet. The only downside is that it's cash only. They also sell tea eggs and candy! They only have 2 tables for people to sit and chill with their friends.
author: Marlene H.

description: Good milk tea and tapioca. Tapioca had a nice, chewy texture. Perfect drink to tapioca ratio. Quick service. Thanks Alex C. and Mike L. for the recommendation.
author: Sophia B.

description: Being a temporary resident of SF has exposed me to boba more than I ever was before. I have even come to the stage where I crave the taste and always have cash on hand just in case I get a craving. I had high hopes for Wonderful Foods. I shared a Black Milk Tea ($2.75) with my mom and both of us weren't very impressed. I usually opt out of getting pearls because I don't love the chewiness and I hate how they get in the way, but my mom enjoys them so I usually get pearls when we share a drink. The pearls here were really tough and they didn't break down well when I chewed them. I felt like they were stuck in my throat. They didn't seem fresh at all. Also my tea was a lot sweeter than I hoped for. I usually like more tea flavor and it lacked the creaminess in the milk.
author: Britney L.

description:
Anybody who knows me knows I'm an absolute BOBA ADDICT and this is one of my favorite places to hit up when that addiction is calling. My favorite drinks to get here are the taro tapioca (I always get it less sweet) and the pineapple-coconut smoothie w/almond jelly and tapioca (yum!). Although, pretty much everything I've gotten here has been to my liking. Everything just tastes so fresh and delicious! Besides the tapioca drinks they also sell candy and some food here. Never gotten the food but I do get chocolate covered gummy bears on occasion =]  Whenever out-of-town friends come visit me, I always bring them here and they've all become fans too. 

Although prices may run a little higher than other boba places, I think it's because they use fresh ingredients as opposed to a bunch of powders....so it's worth it. This place also opens late which is a plus for me as I'm kind of a night owl. My only complaint is that they have no seating area. One of my favorite things is catching up w/friends over a big cup of delicious tapioca milk tea. If only this place had some seating it would be perfection. Oh well....5 stars anyways!
author: Natasha H.

description:
I really enjoy the refreshing tapioca drinks (other wise known as bubble tea, bobba, balls, etc.) because their tapioca is, to use an Italian term, perfectly al dente: chewy without being mushy.

I usually get the coconut or Thai Ice Tea but have heard good things about their coffee flavors.

On a side note:
It was sad to see the original location close down because of (what I think was unfair) corporate competition.  But you can't keep a place with awesome balls down.  *did I actually write that?*

Their re-opening at this new location marks a victory for local business.  Why don't you chain places suck on those balls.  *sorry yelpers I don't know what's wrong with me today.*
author: Dan B.

description:
I got the avocado smoothie with tapioca - don't hate, it's delicious and does NOT taste like what you'd think it would (guacamole. I know you were thinking it). The boba was awesome, I'll be back for the pearl milk tea!

But at $4.25, it does not only break the bank, it breaks my pants. A little too sweet and too pricey for my taste.
author: Jess C.

description:
It's quite unfortunate that Wonderful Foods Co is on a busy street and in the vicinity of the growing business of Teaway. 

I have been a customer of Wonderful Foods since I was in grammar school and it never fails! The boba is tenders and always tastes fresh! It should not even be a comparison to Teaway and Quickly's because the tastes are just on a different level. Everything is made in front of your eyes and the aroma of the shop smells just like the delicious street carts and shops that are scattered all through Asia. 

What's even nicer and more convenient is that you are also able to purchase all sorts of candy. Even the candy you can only find in Chinatown! (Nevertheless, it is a little more expensive) 

They have a great selection, and definitely a place worth trying!
author: Johanna T.

description: Before I start to express how I like this place, I have to admit actually I am not picky to boba tea. I can be easily satisfied with any boba tea places when I was still in Taiwan, where boba tea places are everywhere. Anyway, this place is still awesome. I have already tried some boba tea places in SF and just didn't want to go back. But the boba tea here really fits my taste and reminds me the boba tea in Taiwan! The boba tastes sweet and not like the one in other places, which is flavorless and bland. Well, the only shorts here is that they only have few table and chairs. For people who want to chat with friends and enjoy yum boba teas, they probably would have to find other places.
author: Jia-Ying X.

description: Got the honeydew flavored milk tea.  Nice honeydew flavor, could still taste the tea, and milky (just the way I like it).  Tapioca pearls were soft and chewy.  Only bad thing about this place is the parking is limited.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
It was a cold foggy night. A normal SF night. My friend decided we had to come here since I've never been. Tapioca milk tea on a cold summery night? Why yes, please.

We ordered and within a few minutes, we got our drinks? It was AMAZING. I've been through a fair share of boba drinks. I've experienced the great and the disgusting. This was fantastic. The milk tea wasn't super sweet and didn't leave a weird aftertaste. The boba delicious and it was chewy in a good way.

Yum.
author: Viola L.

description:
Let me start by noting that I have tried pretty much every major tapicoa/ dessert cafe. This is the BEST tapioca place in San Francisco. Sure, it's not 99 cents like Quicklys or Teaway down the street but you can really taste the difference. If you want a speciality drink other than green tea, this is the place. The drinks are consistently well-made. They always taste GOOD, like they have crack in it. Trust me, once you've had tap from here, you will definitely come back! I can pretty much guarantee it.

1. My Go-To: Lychee green tea, no tapioca -- it's a great drink for those who are lactose and calorie conscious. No extra charge for lychee, which serves as a healthier alternative to the tapioca. It's green tea with a extra tang of lychee sweetness. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

2. Milk tea- simple, affordable and delicious. Its a perfect mixture of milk and tea. A great drink for those who are craving something not too sweet and safe.

3. Cash only.

4. Cleansy facility. 

I really appreciate the one table with seats that they added, it really nice to sit instead of freezing in the cold after you buy the drink.

5. Other great items:
 Taro milk tea
Thai milk tea
Passion fruit (pretty sweet, great for children)
Avacado milkshake/smoothie (great thick consistency made from real avacadoes)
author: Sue T.

description: Milk tea was pretty good but their boba is tasteless. Milk tea wasn't too sweet, so I liked it. Got some of their candy too but it was so expensive! Didn't realize it would come out to $10 for our bag.
author: Amy T.

description:
Now that I've found myself on this new boba drink kick, I had to take my co-worker's advice and try Wonderful Foods.

OMG!  The strawberry tapioca made with real strawberries was an absolute experience.  The taste of fresh strawberries perfectly blended into a slightly thick and slushy consistency and perfect tapioca balls that tasted like tapioca balls made this the best boba drink I've ever had.  

After reading Ed M's review on the streetcar ride over there I had to try the Salt and Pepper Chicken.  Take a whiff of the chicken while it's still hot in the bag and the scent from the slightly spicy popcorn chicken with the aromatic fried basil vines will clear your sinuses completely.  The chicken itself is quite tasty, but you do experience the MSG dilemma shortly after you've finished your boba drink and there is no liquid to wash away the MSG aftertaste.  Not sure if I'll ever order this again.

I will return, however, many times for the fabulous fresh fruit tapiocas.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Best Tapioca in the city. Drinks are not powdery like all other chains. Costs more than places across the street but you get what you pay for. $1.99 across the street for crap or ~$3 for deliciousness. 

I love the avocado milk shake with tapioca, mmmm!

New favorite: almond milk tea with pudding, no tapioca!

Love their selection of candy. They have American candy like Sweet Factory & asian candies & snacks!!! 

Also love the cripsy chicken here. Guilty pleasures!
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place was alright. 
When I walked in, I thought I was going to pass out from the weird smell of eggs boiling with black tea (soy sauce?) in a rice cooker. It made me want to buy a drink and book it.
The drinks here to me were just average, nothing more and nothing less. So I give it a 3!
author: Jay C.

description: Best Milk Tea in the bay. Actual tea and milk flavor. None of that quickly's syrup junk. They mix with a martini shaker too. I skip Tpumps, Teaway, and Quickly's just so i can get my Milk Tea from this place.
author: Dustin T.

description: I ordered a green milk tea with no tapioca but when I received my drink, there was tapioca in it. I let the girl know which seemed to irk her. She scooped out the boba and added stuff to the drink and set it on the counter without a word. When I drank it, the drink tasted extremely watered down. I was hesitant to ask them to remake it again because I felt bad for bothering the irritated girl. I finally decided to ask again and went back to the counter. At this time one of their friends (a guy) walked in. He saw me at the counter and asked me how he could help. I let him know that the drink tasted watered down and he went to the back to let the girl who made my drink know what happened. She peeked her head out, saw that it was me, and went back in. He came back out and apologized on the store's behalf and asked a new girl to make it. The new drink was better but it didn't satisfy my milktea craving. Overall I would give one star for the service, two stars for the milktea and five stars for the nice gentleman who helped me out.
author: Graff H.

description: When teaway fails me (which they're starting to more and more lately), i come to wonderful for a mocha tapioca. So good everytime! A little more $ but it's definitely worth it. Fav boba place on Irving!
author: Rachel C.

description:
This place has never let me down. Damn you Quickly's for opening up next door! Quickly's has more flavors than Wonderful Foods but most of them are made out of artificial syrups or powders.. Oh what the hell, boba isn't healthy anyways. 

I will always have love for Wonderful Foods. I love the hot almond milk tea with tapioca. They also have awesome tea eggs that have been cooking all day. The smell may throw you off but oh man, I love those dam things.

4/05/07 UPDATE *************************
Wonderful Foods has now relocated directly across the street from Walgreen's. WOOHOO! It is at a bigger and better location, more modern, and they will have chairs and tables! This is soooo awesome. I have been supporting this place for 9 or 10 years now and all of you should too. Why? Uhhh HELLO, avocado tapioca!! SO GOOD. Watermelon tapioca is delicious as well. Forget Quickly's. The staff is rude. Down with the big chain!!!
author: Susy C.

description:
This is probably the best place to buy milk tea in the bay area.  The flavor is so distinct that nothing will come close when you try it.  You will definitely notice the difference between this milk tea and others you've probably tried.  The pearls are always soft and chewy.  If you try any of their other flavors, you won't be disappointed!

They don't only sell milk tea and drinks here but lots of candy.  If you have a sweet-tooth or happened to be in the area and are craving milk tea, then this place is for you.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Ok, thank you for saving my wallet 3 years ago and I'm thankful and all. But enough, is enough. 

These people keep raising their prices! Why should I pay you $5 for a shake, when I can waltz over to Quickly and get one for $3? 

PS. They now accept credit cards. $10 minimum, maybe they raised their prices to help you meet the minimum easily. *eye roll
author: Jane N.

description:
Great boba place, their drinks are always consistent every time i go here. I would go to this place over quickly or tap exp. 

Negative: Parking is hard to find.
author: Anthony V.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. This place will forever be my favorite tapioca joint.

I've been coming here ever since 7th grade, and almost everyday or every weekend. Back then, I used to order 8 tapioca drinks each day for my family and I. And this was before they moved across the street. They used to be next to the Chinese video shop, which is now Verizon... (Wow, how things have changed...) With that said, the workers always recognize me when I walk in. They are all extremely nice. And recently, the owner of this place loves to start conversations with me while I wait for my drinks. 

Anyways, their #1 Milk Tea Tapioca always hits the spot, especially one nice warm days. I usually get it with small tapioca, and a little more sweetened. And sometimes, I even get a large, if I'm really wanting it. What else is good about the milk tea here? It's basically fresh. They mix all the ingredients right in front of you. You can see what they put in it, and how it's made. (Unlike Quicklys & Teaway, where it's pre-made...)

I used to order their Honeydew tapioca too. It was pretty good, but recently it kind of tastes like bananas... Haha. It's the powdered Honeydew drink though. I've tried Green Apple, Peach, & #28 Lychee Tapioca throughout the years. All of them are pretty good. My mom always gets #28. Even my grandmother likes the blended red bean drink. 

And I'm sure there's more things to try, it's just that I'm always addicted to their milk tea, I can't stop drinking it every time I go there. 

And about a few months ago, they added a little small menu of snacks. I was kinda disappointed with that move. It seemed like they just added it to compete with Quicklys and Teaway, but I was wrong. I finally tried the popcorn chicken recently, and I think it's better than Teaway's and Quicklys. And I'm not even being biased... i think... Haha.

Overall, if you haven't tried this place, you definitely should. In my opinion, if you haven't tried a tapioca drink from here, you haven't really tried good tapioca at all.
author: Derek T.

description: I can safely say that this is one of the places I will miss most when I leave for LA for college.  I have yet to have tapioca that beats the ones they sell here.  When Quickly opened right next to it, I felt a sense of dismay and a newfound loyalty for Wonderful Foods.  I hate Quicklys simply because of my devotion to Wonderful Foods, and come on, what kind of tapioca joint charges you extra for the pearl??  I usually get the Thai tea or green milk tea tapioca.  You can't find anything as good as this anywhere.
author: Vivian H.

description: This is still my favorite tapioca place.  Years ago there was a Wonderful Foods in Foster City (but it's gone now), and I liked their drinks, and the Papaya Milk was one of the items that I frequently ordered because I didn't want to risk getting a drink made from powder.  Since then I've tried not all, but many tapioca places such as Teaway, TPumps, Quickly, Tapioca Express, Verde Tea Cafe, etc., but I think Wonderful Foods is still my favorite.  Recently I had the Papaya Milk using soy milk and it tastes great.  I went back a couple of days later and had another one.
author: S Y.

description:
I should mention this...I don't like boba, those brown balls just don't do it for me. (Well, except maybe on Ed M. heh heh.)

I do, however, like their Almond with Almond Jello (#10 on the menu, minus the tapioca).  And depending on who rings me up, it will cost either $2.75 or $3.00.  I would like to think they should be charging me less because I don't want their balls.

I've tried a few other flavors, but nothing else stood out like #10, and so that's the only thing I ever get when I go in here.

I think it sucks that Quickly had the 'balls' to open up right next door too!  Hooray for the mom and pop type places!  Let's try to make sure they remain in business!
author: Teri C.

description: Get the milk tea with tapioca and forget everything else. Whether or not you're indecisive or adventurous or whatever, you won't regret getting the milk tea because it's that good. It's so sweet and not watered down and you can ask for no ice. The tapioca is great too, just the right hardness. The floor space is relatively large for this little sweets shop, so I wish they had a few small tables in the middle or some counter space at least.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This place is this the place to go for tapioca. Their drinks are always good and the line is always quick unlike tpumps with the hella long line and wait time for a drink that takes a minute to make pretty much. I'm always satisfied with wonderful food co. I recommend this place for tapioca on Irving street.
author: Kevin E.

description: Not the best I've had, but not the worst either. I ordered the pudding boba milk tea. Their pudding was good, it would've been better if they were bigger chunks instead of cut into tiny pieces. The boba had a salty aftertaste to it, it was sour. Not the sweet taste I'm used to. The milk tea was good, I'd probably order something without the boba next time or maybe have them add caramel to it.
author: Lucas N.

description: Favorite boba spot in the SF, although it will definitely have some competition with TPumps opening across the street pretty soon! I almost always order green milk tea with boba AND almond jelly because I'm indecisive and they're both so good. I've tried their black milk tea too-- it was good, but it tasted a bit too strong for me. Also, they don't make their drinks hot enough so I would either ask for it extra hot, or just avoid hot drinks from here altogether. Besides that, this place is awesome. I love that I can come here anytime to get good boba and not have to wait in a ridiculous line.
author: Stephanie G.

description: I ordered the honey green milk tea, and it was standard, not the most amazing boba I've ever had. I'm still a Lollicup girl (and sadly it's only down in SoCal.) Maybe I should've got the regular pearl milk tea people rave about. The workers are really nice though and the shop is cute, they sell candies too!
author: Christine C.

description: Im not sure why people give this place high ratings. No real tea; artificial powder.  Charged me $4 for a passion fruit tea with aloe jelly.  IT WAS SO SWEET.  I threw it away.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Truly is the best milk tea place in the city. I like the fact that I can actually see over the counter and watch them make the drinks: legit! The shop is clean and tidy too. Can't beat the prices- bought 3 for $10. My recs:

Almond Milk Tea
Honeydew Milk Tea
Taro Icy

I never get tapioca, it makes me too full and I'd rather enjoy the drink itself. More bang for your buck too! if you're on Irving don't bother with any of the other places on the street. Wonderful all the way.
author: Geralyn Y.

description: Tasty, big selection of flavors, the two ladies at the register were nice. Wish they had more than two tables, though? An older guy and lady took up ALL the space at the only two they had, which was rude but definately not the cafe's fault. (To clarify, the two people I mentioned were in the same group, but sat at separate tables for some reason?)
author: Tara P.

description: I always get the coffee tapioca. Cannot get this anywhere else that tastes as good.  I went in there today and the girl remembered me because I always ask for less tapioca balls. The last time I was there with my sister, she asked for exactly ten tapioca balls. So when I placed my order this time, she looked at me and said, " you want only ten?" I laughed and said, "no, that was my sister." She was very accommodating because she also remembered that I prefer the coffee strong and made the effort to cater the drink to my taste.
author: Carrie W.

description: I've had boba everywhere and I just wanted to say it was my first time here last night and I had the best milk tea i have ever had in my lyfeeeee
author: Prabisha T.

description:
Best tapioca drink in SF Bay Area.  I drive all the way from Millbrae just to get Papaya Milkshake Tapioca, Watermelon Juice Tapioca and Mangio Tapioca.  I finish all three in one sitting every time.

Better than Tapioca Express and Quickly.  'Coz they use real fruit and not artificial powder. 

And friendly people.
author: Una H.

description:
My favorite tapioca spot. Sure, it's more expensive than Quickly, but I'd rather pay a dollar or two more for QUALITY tapioca. The boba is soft (not hard and stale like some aforementioned places), and the liquid isn't powdery at all. My go-to place for Thai Milk Tea Tapioca or good 'ol plain Milk Tea!! 

Only con: Wish they had seating. Sometimes it's too freakin' cold in the Sunset to walk around w/a cold drink! Grab a napkin to use as a self-made cup sleeve! =P
author: Diane G.

description:
wonderful dessert  is a few doors away from tuttimelon. while it looks like a candy store with chinese candies on the right and american candies on the left in large bubble bins, the main atttraction here is the boba drinks, a taiwanese hot drink phenom consisting of sweeten syrup, boba pearls made of tapoica starch , and sometimes milk tea.

forget what flavoring i  ordred (2.75). nevertheless, it was a lot better than quickly and tapoica express.

consider getting a boba  drink here if you ever can find parking.
author: Victor G.

description: It really breaks my heart to give this place two stars  - but something is seriously wrong right now with Wonderful Foods co. I've been here 5 times in the past few months and my drink has been terribly watered down. The boba is still good - grass jelly still the same, but the teas has been horrid. From milk tea to jasmine tea, to jasmine milk tea - there is something wrong! I'll keep on going back and trying and hoping it'll still be good because they've been so trusty with me the past two years, but my heart is breaking!
author: Christine B.

description: My boba tea was on point. The consistency of the boba was so good and my milk tea amazing. Will be returning to try other drinks.
author: Ella P.

description:
I think it's safe to say that this is my last stop for bubble tea/boba/tapioca tea.

While I've read over the 300+ reviews for Wonderful Foods Co (well, ok, not every one of them) and most everyone has said how wonderful the place is for the tapioca drinks, I think I hyped myself up too much for the goodness promised here.

I'll get to the point: Yes, the tapioca pearls are pretty consistent and chewy. The drinks however are too sweet. I came here with my cousins and my brother in tow; my brother didn't even have the tapioca in his drink and he said the Thai Tea was too sweet. 

One of my cousins had the Chocolate Tapioca, which...although it sounds enticing and a kind of "best of both worlds" dream, he said the drink tasted like Ovaltine mix. Yikes.

Meanwhile, I had Sesame Tapioca and my other cousin had Honeydew. The Sesame seemed fresh and not made out of powder, but it all comes down to...the drink was just too sweet for me.

Service can be a little confusing here, but seems like the regulars have it down: just shout out your order once you make eye contact with one of the ladies behind the counter. The candy displays were fun to ogle at while we waited, and the drinks did come out fairly quickly (maybe faster than Quickly's, haha, bad pun). 

But yes, I'll sadly have to say that Wonderful Foods Co basically ended my Quest for Boba I've had these past few years. All's well that ends well.
author: Helene K.

description:
I love milk tea tapioca. I usually get it from Quickly's, but that place is just too rude. Staff here are pretty nice. 

So now I prefer to go to Wonderful Foods Co when craving some milk tea tapioca. I saw them make it, and it seems rather real, unlike the powder they use at Quickly's. I rather support this mom and pop shop than Quickly's. 

I plan to try other drinks here and see what else they have to offer. 
Prices may be higher than other tapioca places, but definitely worth it.
author: Winnie L.

description:
Stopped here the other day for a taro boba while in the avenues after work and discovered... THEY HAVE CHOCOLATE COVERED GUMMY BEARS!!

Does this place get any better?! Hahaha.
author: Miyako L.

description:
A very solid place if you want some milk tea. The milk tea is pretty equal parts of tasting like milk tea and tasting like whatever flavor you added, so it's not the most "milk tea-y" as you can get, but it'll still taste consistently good. I don't think I've ever had an only OKAY drink here, it's all pretty above average and consistently good. It's definitely one of the best milk tea places in the area.

They also sell A LOT of candy on the sides of the store, so if you feel like treating/abusing yourself, there is a very wide variety of candy to shovel from.

Service is fine and the people are nice.

I think what tips this place from a 4 star to a 5 star is that there is NEVER a line and NEVER a wait. If you just tried going to T Pumps recently, that is a godsend. No one wants to wait 30 minutes just to get a milk tea. They want their boba fix and go somewhere else

Also, they do have Chinese marinated tea eggs, if you happen to be soulless and enjoy that gross stuff.
author: Tom H.

description:
I usually am not a boba tea drinker but after my friend took me here I am addicted! I usually order honeydew bc its my fav fruit and like magic it TASTE exactly like a honeydew. I do not like boba bc of its squishy bland texture but at Wonderful Foods boba is so fresh, sweet tasting and yummy. I have since retired the honeydew drink and opted for the honey green tea with no boba. So refreshing after a salty meal. YUM! Minus one star for the doggie in the store. It freaks me out :( But the cashier was nice enough to meet me at the door and take my order :) Great service! 

Also, check out the WHITE chocolate gummy bears...nom nom nom.
author: Rose L.

description:
Mom and pop shop that has me hooked.

First impression from the outside is that this place is a candy shop and you smell the different dried meats causing you to be puzzled. However, don't let this confused you because there is a large drink selection that is to die for. 

Their salt and pepper chicken is an automatic hit, it taste marinated, breaded and fried to ultimate perfection. The tea eggs are located in the pot are decently flavored on the spot.

One gem from this place is the hot milk tea with Boba (pearls) that takes longer to make but makes those balls so warm and chewy in your mouth (that's what she said). They use real fruit in most of their drinks. So be warned if you're order taro, avocado or even durian! Yes, real durian and its smell can blow people away if they are not accustomed to the smell =). 

The price is higher compared to chains and other competitors, but the quality of this place is what has me coming back for more and more.
author: Casey L.

description:
Hands down THE best place for tapioca drinks in SF.

I went here for tapioca drinks back in the day...  went through a Quickly stage for a little while... but found my way back home again.  I haven't strayed away since I've discovered this place again.
author: Jonathan B.

description: After seeing its overall ratings and reading its positive reviews, I decided to check Wonderful Foods out myself. After entering the facility, which is a dark, drab, and uninspiring "candy store," my expectations weren't set too high. Menu looked somewhat promising, as it has a variety of eclectic flavors. Upon inspecting their kitchen facilities, I noticed a single hot tea container and a very large bag of instant cream powder, which seemed to be the extent of their boba operation. All except their fruit drinks is made from powder, so if anybody is a fan of blended fruit bubble tea, this place may be better suited for you. Ordered the taro tapioca. Flavor tasted artificial, resembled Robitussin (cough syrup) and lacked any rich, creamy consistency. Two stars for its boba - nice consistency and not oversteeped - cheap prices, and late night hours. Overall disappointing, considering this is one of the highest rated boba places in San Francisco. Thanks for that one, Yelp.
author: Andrea D.

description:
I love their Watermelon with Boba.
Slushy and they use real watermelon. 
I love their Boba here, the texture is just right.
This place is always open and I am always loving it each and every time I come here.
author: Angela D.

description:
I would come here if I wanted some good, flavorful tapioca, but then it's kind of hard since Quicklys and Tea Way are down the block. I have to admit that Wonderful is pricier compared to other places, well mainly because you can really taste the quality in their tap. 

If you want something flavorful, like watermelon, honeydew, durian, red bean etc.. then go to Wonderfuls.

But if you want something more simple, like milk teas, green teas, slushes, then go elsewhere.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Best tapioca drinks ever! I highly recommend getting the Lychee Tapioca Drink, Red Bean Tapioca Drink, Passion Fruit Tapioca Drink, Strawberry Tapioca Drink, and the Cantaloupe Tapioca Drink.

Favorite Tapioca Drink place
author: Michelle C.

description:
One of my favorite boba places in sf. 
The tapioca balls are always soft and not hard or super chewy. 
I love how the tea flavors have a stronger tea taste and how they put real fruit in their boba instead of powder. 

Plus they're open late and they have the mini gummy bears, ribbon and the cola gummy I love.
author: Katie M.

description:
I always stop by Wonderful Foods Co. for a wonderful cup of tapioca milk tea.  While $2.75 for a cup seems a little pricey compared to Quickly across the street, I found it to be a relatively good deal considering the tea they use is actual tea rather than tea powder.  This creates a rich flavor that Quickly fails to do.  They also have a seemingly ever-expanding inventory of treats lined up against the walls, though candies are usually a cardinal no-no for me.

The only thing that bothers me though is they have a lot of unused space but choose not to provide seating.  I think they could easily add in some tables and chairs without detracting from its current state and I'm sure it would enhance business as well.
author: Alex L.

description: Taro milk iced tea with boba is my favorite! Yummm. Too bad I dont live in SF. If I do, this would be a regular spot for me. This is the only place I would come to get boba Pearl drinks whenever I crave for one. The candies and dried fruit/herbs are good too. I especially like the dried Ginger candy. Delicious!
author: Amy H.

description:
This place is truly a classic and BETTER than all the others in Irving easily. This logic is so stupid.....

In the beginning when only this place existed, everyone came here and talked about how good it was. 

Quickly's moved in and everyone moved there and talked about how cool Quickly's was.

Tuttimelon came in then everyone went there instead because milk tea from Quickly's is suddenly "fake and sucks."

Then Tea Way comes in and everyone goes there because suddenly, artificially flavored "green" and "black" tea is more popular than yogurt, milk tea, and all the others combined. Their popcorn chicken is better than Quickly's also, suddenly.

All the while, Wonderful Foods Co continue to maintain her dedicated patrons who resist to the "trend." Or maybe I don't like change. -_-
author: Calvin D.

description:
It has its good and bad days, but this place is simply my favorite. I've been going here since high school. I tend to order drinks that require them to use fresh fruits (vs powder) like mango, papaya or avocado. Support local shops!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: 5 star!  It is really really rare to give a 5 star but this place definitely deserves it.  Absolutely the best boba tea in the Bay Area!  I am a boba fan and I have lived in other cities (LA, NY, Chicago...) and this one is definitely one of the best if not THE best.  I went there since college when they were in their old locations and after moving around the USA for the last 10+ years and tried many boba around this is still my favorite. I always get #1 and #28 (lychee slush).
author: J L.

description: Best tapioca in the world! :) Watermelon with a green straw please!
author: Tina L.

description:
The only place I've found so far that sells Mango Strawberry Smoothie! The smoothie is $4.25 and rather pricey, but still good, especially on days when the Sunset actually gets nice sunny weather. 

The store also sells a variety of candies and dried fruits. There's a lot of options of drinks to choose from here that you won't find at Teaway or Quickly's.
author: Connie C.

description:
I trust that my friend knows what he's saying when he says that this is the best place for boba drinks. So, it was time for him to take me and allow the depths of my taste buds explore what it never has before! and... I will never doubt what my friend says again!

This is by far hands down the best boba place i've ever had (milk tea, that is)! The tea tastes so real... something that other stores don't use for their milk teas. It has the perfect mixture of milk and tea and whatever else they put in it! Im guessing the third ingredient is crack because I can't help it but to crave more...
author: Jamie Y.

description:
I came here after recommendations from friends and reading the Yelp reviews.

It was good, but it wasn't as good as the reviews make it sound.  My boyfriend got the milk tea with tapioca.  It had more of a coffee taste than a tea taste.  The tapioca balls were good though, perfect texture, not too chewy or soft.  I got the yogurt tea with tapioca, and it was ok.  It's made of the little yogurt drinks (which I love) mixed with tea - it sounds good, but really wasn't that great.

I do love that they sell candy and I do appreciate the extensive menu.

I have not found a good place for tapioca drinks in SF yet :(
author: Amy L.

description: Good service and fast. I am in love with their taro shakes (smoothies?). Their milk tea is delicious. Coconut is real coconut and extremely creamy and rich. The yummiest! Their thai tea is a eh though, I've had much better elsewhere. Anywho, love this place! I've yet to be really let down. Good prices and especially no long ass wait like Tpumps or Purple Kow! :)
author: Kerri S.

description:
Walking along this stretch of Irving, I observe what seems to be a boba price ware.  Most places are advertising $1.99; it's all about the cheap.  Wonderful Dessert was advertising a higher price.  So, I thought that I'd give it a try.  Yeah, I'd previous been to one of the cheaper places and was not impressed.

Wonderful was pretty empty and it really didn't seem that Tapioca Milk Tea was their primary business.  I ordered up my fairly pedestrian usual they went to work creating it.

Now, I'm not a boba expert.  I was first introduced by some Taiwanese born co-workers back in the 90's; Fantasia in Cupertino may have been the only place in the Bay Area to buy it at the time.  More recently, I had a Macedonian co-worker who insisted that Fantasia was the only place to get it because they made it from real tea (not a mix) and you could ask for "less sweet".  So, he used to drag us there and find fault with others. 

Near as I can tell, Wonderful's boba is not from a mix (maybe someone can verify).  Tastes good.  I'll rate it 4 stars for boba power.
author: Jice E.

description:
I came here last night with my sister after dinner and we were pretty full already, so we decided to share a drink. She had tried the red bean tapioca ($3.75) recently after her friend recommended it, and promised me that it would be delicious. Even though it was around 10:30pm, Irving St. was bustling with the Outside Lands crowd from Golden Gate Park. We were afraid that we might have to wait a long time, but there actually weren't too many customers inside. We requested to have our drink split into two cups and our order was made fairly quick. There's candy in the front of the store that you can buy by the pound and also 6-8 phone key chain vending machines. If you want to sit down, there's also a couple tables. The drink was fairly thick and resembled milkshake consistency more than your normal milk tea liquid-y drink, but I didn't really mind and it was definitely the perfect amount. They actually blend real red beans into it, so it tasted very natural and it wasn't too sweet either like other places make sometimes. The boba texture was very chewy and soft, so that was a plus. I'll probably come again next time I'm in the area and try the sesame tapioca or one of their fruity drinks!

This place is cash only, so make sure you bring money!
author: Jessica C.

description: Best almond milk tea in the city! I shared my almond milk tea with my friends and it made their eyes light up when they had a taste! The pearls itself aren't too sweet, but aren't tasteless. I rank this up at the top - above TPumps and Purple Kow, forsure.
author: Kristin K.

description:
My favorite Boba Place.

However, this time, I have to rate it average. Ordered a Thai Iced Tea with boba and a Honey Almond drink with boba.

Both were too sweet. The boba was good. Normally, this place gets a 4 or 5 from me, but since both drinks were way too sweet, I give it a 3 just this time around.

Typically, the Thai Tea has a better "tea" flavor, for lack of better explanation. The tea is more pronounced and it typically isn't too sweet, though I think the lady behind the counter put more sugar than she anticipated.

Same goes for the almond/honey drink, which was also a lot sweeter than I'm normally used to from this place.

Still, this place to me has the best boba in the city. The prices are also fair. I wish they didn't make it sweet... gah!
author: Marc T.

description: love this place and their original store on irving, get the fresh taro without added sugar, DELICIOUS...and their popcorn chicken is always great
author: Long C.

description:
I love their boba here! Much better than the water downed Quickly's boba. My favorite is probably their taro flavored boba. So sweet. 

Their drinks compared to Quickly's are much thicker. They blend their drinks along with the ice so it's a bit frothy.  I also think they are better because they use real fruit for some of their drinks. If you order the strawberry boba, ONLY get the real fruit one. It's worth the extra money. I don't really like their nestle's strawberry boba. 

The service there is nice too. Not much talking, but just to the point. 

There's also maybe like 2 chairs in there. So unlike Quickly's, this isn't really a place to sit and drink. 

Even so, I still like this place way more. Great boba and tons of candy  and treats!
author: robin w.

description:
Definitely one of the best tapioca places in SF and not a dumb chain either. Drinks are always made with fresh and real products not powder and other fake flavor enhancements. Tapioca balls are the perfect sweet and chewiness.

My favorite is the lychee milk tea (has real lychee bits in it) and the watermelon slush.
author: A. Z.

description: Try the salt & pepper chicken if you want a nice snack to go along with your tapioca tea purchase. I just tried it out myself and it's great.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I seriously haven't gone to Wonderful in over half a year because I've been going to Teaway. The line at Teaway today was ridiculously long so I went to Wonderful instead. The best thing at the menu there is the milk tea. I've never had better milk tea anywhere else. So of course, that's what I got today.

I remember when the bottom inch of the cup was filled with tapioca balls. HELLO?! WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED? There was only enough tapioca balls to line the bottom of the cup. I mean damn, I know you're probably cutting back because all your customers left you for Teaway, but don't cut back on the tapioca balls. They are the essence of the drink!
author: L M.

description:
This place ranks Top in my quest for boba.  The almond milk tea by far the best I have tried so far.  Its milky and the sweetness is not overpowering.

The salt and pepper friend chicken is AWESOME and they give you a full bag full for just $5.  Be careful when and where you burp after you eat them because everyone around you will know that you did. True story.
author: Kinman H.

description:
I'm so thankful that I live so close by! I've been here three times within a week. The first time I had pearl milk tea, it was okay, had some coffee taste. WHEN I WANT TEA I WANT IT TO TASTE 100% LIKE TEA. 
So the next couple of times I ordered Thai Milk Tea w/pearls... 3.25 I think?
That was good! the pearls were good!  yumyumyum. 
Excited to come here next timeeee

cons: expensive candy for a candy-crazed person
author: Emily K.

description: This is the place to go when you're in the neighborhood of sunset. It will forever be my usual spot to get tapioca.Everything here is all about quality. My two main dranks that I always get are jasmine milk green and honeydew milk tea. Hands down, those are my two go- to drinks. Everywhere else in the neighborhood that sells milk teas are doo doo. Love this place and yall must try it!!!
author: Jenny W.

description:
Tried their milktea for the first time a couple days ago. OMG IT WAS SO GOOOD! I got the Wulong Milk Tea Tapioca. The sweetness is .. almost perfect. I would prefer it to be a little less sweet. Though the drink still tastes really good. Also, they gave me a lot of tapioca (about 1/3 of the cup!) and it's free!! Lastly, there is not much ice in the drink either. 

I will definitely come back and try more of their drinks!
author: Pui L.

description: I had the best boba ever yesterday! I got the honeydew smoothie with tapioca, which were fresh and none of that nasty stuff i've tried at other places. I hope to go back there someday soon!
author: Nikki S.

description:
We love the Avocado Lychee Jelly, also the Thai Milk Tea with tapioca.
Also they open until midnite. Awesome!
author: Joice K.

description: The only place I get milk tea in the US. And that is saying a lot since I've had milk tea all over San Jose, LA, OC, and San Diego. The others are decent, but Wonderful Foods is the only one that I feel is worth giving into my cravings. One of the first original stores to make milk tea in the city. Tapioca balls are always soft and chewy, not too sweet. Also, they stick very well to people, street signs, windows, if you ever need ammo...
author: Leslie Y.

description:
Their milk tea is EVERYTHING besides generic! LOVE IT!

Milk tea with lychee  jelly please! =)
author: Natalie L.

description:
Best boba in town, period.  Forget about the ambiance and other crap, they serve the best boba.  Most items are blend with fresh fruits, and their boba is chewy and flavorful.  I almost want to take a peek in the boba can to see if they're marinated.  

You can't go wrong with the regular milk tea, lychee is great too.  Just skip the almond milk tea, it taste like water and almond powder..  Watermelon freeze is wonderful too, with true watermelon juice.  

There're also lots of knick knacks on the sides, candies and traditional chinese snacks with sour plums, ginger, etc.  Also a hot pot of tea eggs on the side.  Doesn't really matter, their boba drinks are still the best.
author: Carina N.

description: This place probably has the best boba in the hood. Their taro boba tea is as "real" as it gets. They use lots of taro (not powdered) and I am officially a fan. The balls are always chewy and fresh. Lovesss it!
author: Carmen A.

description:
This dessert shop has been around for as long as I can remember. They have an extensive assortment of sweets (candy like sour belts, fruit gummies, etc.) and dried asian goods (dried mangoes, salty/sweet plums, etc.) which is hard to find in a lot of dessert shops now. 

The only downside to this place (for some people) is the music they play. I love the classic mandarin/Cantonese songs but others may find it to be a place where old peeps hangout...not the case though!! 

I just came here the other night because I was frustrated with the people at TeaWay. I ordered a watermelon juice tapioca & I was very pleased that the quality of their drinks hasn't changed since I was last there almost 2 years ago. Because of experiences lke that, I definitely will be coming back because it's a "mom & pop" shop that I would never want to see disappear.

They have a simple menu but with a lot of good choices without having to use a  ton of syrups & powders to mix up a concoction of tapioca goodness!
author: Carol L.

description:
The Best Almond Flavored Pearl Milk Tea!!!

I've been coming to Wonderful Foods for many many years and I can still say that it is my favorite place to get tapioca (boba) drinks. I'm not 100% sure, but this place was one of the first or could of been the first store to have brought boba to San Francisco. Once I tasted it for the first time, I was hooked ever since. The original location use to be diagonally across the street, but due to some issues with a certain political person Wonderful Foods was forced to move. Perhaps the move was for the better because it now looks a lot more cleaner and the prices hasn't changed much. Good job Wonderful Foods for the great boba drinks, keep up the good work.
author: Michael J.

description: I really like the customer service from the chubby boy with glasses. He is so nice. If you guys ever come here, tip this gentlemen (:
author: Marvin C.

description:
#4 Extra Sweet, No Tapioca, Add Grass Jelly. Once in a while, I'd like to make it a large.

Please and thank you
Milk Tea, Strawberry and Almond Tapioca are close seconds too :)

Oh the guy who works there at night, I think his name is Kevin (?)... omg HAWTNESS hehehe
author: Helen Z.

description:
Mmm. Yummy coffee tapioca. Mr. Green Bubble in Oakland is my probably my favorite boba place in the bay area, but this is a close second.

Plus, they also sell plenty of junky candy and weird dried fruit.
author: Rachel F.

description: I had the kiwi tapioca boba milk tea and it was excellent. The boba was the right size and consistency. My drink was made with real kiwi, which is admirable. I will definitely come back.
author: Austin P.

description: Mediocre tapioca. Standard prices. No line and no frills. Ingredients aren't special. I can see people coming here if they live in the area and have nostalgia from childhood, but having this for the first time today, I decided to write a review to remind myself to not come back. I think boba is a treat (an expensive habit too), like all other unhealthy beverages, so in a world where boba is everywhere, this one is forgettable. So much that I have to remind myself.
author: Lars B.

description:
I LOVE YOU, WONDERFUL FOODS! Hands down the best milk tea I ever had! Authentic milk tea and perfect tapioca. It's heaven in a cup. 

They also have a huge selection of candy and dried snacks that you can buy. One downside is that there is no seating in the store.. but who cares! The moment they give me my tapioca milk tea, I'm floating on cloud nine and nothing else in the world matters.
author: Emily C.

description: i was really craving boba when i came here and it didn't quite meet my expectations. The milk tea was good, but the boba wasn't sweet and didn't have the consistency I was looking for. Disappointing.
author: Christina L.

description:
omgggg the BEST pearl tea EVER! super fresh tasting AND you can have almond jello in your drink?! omg... 

my boyfriend introduced me to the place and ordered me a lychee green tea with almond jello and coconut jelly. omg it's pure heaven. the taste is SO much better than any other tapioca place out there...

HOWEVER... you will shell out more money for pearl tea than other places... like $5 after the add ons. but hey WHATEVER! it's worth it...

makes me sad i don't live in sf... i only can have this once in a longgggggg while.

oh yeah and the candy they sell is such an added bonus! :]
author: Dominique L.

description:
This has got to be my favorite place to get milk tea in SF! I try to come here whenever I can even though there is there is a Quickly in my area. 

Their milk tea has good balance in flavor of tea and cream/milk as the drink should be and it's not super sweet either! It is SO delicious! :)

I usually stick to their milk tea, but if I'm ever in the mood for something fruity, I always get their strawberry smoothie and ask for "less sugar".
author: Am Y.

description: Omg!!! This place is terrible! They have a sign says best tapioca in town... So under serving. I ordered 2 drinks for my kids, both pre teen age. They both took 2 sips and threw it out. Tapioca did not taste right. Ive had many tapiocas and this one did not look right. All bunched up and stuck together. Can't even taste strawberry as it was super watered down. Stay away!!! T- pumps is a block away.
author: Connie C.

description:
Wow, their tapioca drinks are delicious and refreshing! The tapioca seems to be cooked just right to get that nice chewiness and the various flavor options is pretty superb. It is well worth the price. The secret to their sweetness is a whole lot of coffee creamer (I watched the lady make it).

Do I recommend this? Heck Yes!
author: Ryan L.

description:
This place is the best for milk tea tapioca. It's my favorite place because I grew up a block away and this was one of the first tapioca shops that opened when tapioca became popular. Their milk tea tastes so much better than quickly's or other variations of it stores. It has a great tea taste unlike quickly's where it tastes like powder and leaves a funny milky taste. 

It's delicious and fast. Walk-in, walk-out. They also have candy and dried goods but I usually never get anything but the drinks.

Also good is the fresh strawberry milk tapioca and watermelon.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Ugh, are y'all serious?! Not sure how this place has such a high average rating, and how anyone can claim this stuff is good..

I ordered a hot ginger milk tea ($3.25) today and it was definitely made with powder that I could feel on my tongue with each sip.. While it wasn't the worst ginger milk tea I've ever had, it was surely far from being anything above two stars. C'mon, there DEFINITELY has to be a better milktea place than this!!
author: Alice C.

description: The tea flavor is stronger than so cal but its still good. Prices are decent. I like their lychee milk tea, it's refreshing.
author: Oanh L.

description: Ordered a Regular Milk tea with tapioca, it def tasted more like iced coffee. Supposedly ordered a side of popcorn chicken, and waited for about 20mins. Went to go ask about the chicken, they said "what chicken?"..wtf??..the one you asked me if i wanted it spicy or not, lol...so dumb. They said we didn't even charge u for it. Then why did u ask me how i wanted it??..Lol..will not be coming back here.
author: Coraline J.

description:
Use to come to this place all the time everytime I hit up SF (that is until they moved across the street...then...not so much..dunno why).

Great boba drinks here...I always get the Passion Fruit. MMmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

One thing though is that they put wayy too much ice in their drinks. After about halfway through the cup it just tastes very diluted because all the ice is starting to melt.
author: Alex C.

description:
Hands down the best boba drinks in San Francisco! So much selection & fresh. I like coming here at night time as they close late till midnight. 

In addition to the excellent boba drinks, they also have huge selections of snacks.
author: Mark A.

description:
Tapioca stores have been moving around an awful lot over the past years. Since my favorite one on Irving is now gone, Wonderful Foods is the next step up. 

The balls have always been pretty good - not too hard, not too mushy, pretty chewy, so it's just right. 

What I usually get:
- Regular milk tea tapioca
- Green milk tea tapioca
- Taro tapioca -- This place makes the best (and most purple) taro ones out of any other tapioca places I've been to, though sometimes it's a bit sweet. 

Food-wise, I've heard good things about their popcorn chicken, and their tea eggs are always very tempting. There's also a crap ton of candies and sweet snacks lining the walls of the store, but we all seem to walk right past that to satisfy our sugar cravings with their sweet drinks. Indeed, it is very satisfying.
author: Julia L.

description:
When my sister was visiting me, she made me come back here EVERY. SINGLE. DAY. I'm pretty sure I gained 5 pounds in a week from all that sugar, milk, and tapioca, but it's so hard to say no to their teas!

I've never tried anything but their regular tapioca milk tea, but I also don't feel the need to try bc as soon as I sip that delicious milk+tea mixture, I can't even remember what "new" drink I wanted to try in the first place...
author: Min H.

description:
There are, what, like 80 boba places on Irving, but Wonderful Foods Co. is a really good one. My favorite drink there: thai iced tea with grass jelly. In second place: regular milk tea with tapioca. The BFF gets taro with tapioca. The ladies are always very generous with the boba or grass jelly & the drinks are never watered down.  Cash only. Two drinks will run you about $8.50.

P.S. I hope they don't move again because that really confused the BFF & I & I guess we get confused easily.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
This place still has the best bubble tea I've ever tasted since it first opened. I've tried all the supposedly good tapioca places in the Bay Area and NYC and none can even compare. The tapioca always taste fresh and have the perfect texture to them. 

The flavors I order usually are red bean and banana milk shake because I know they use real, fresh ingredients, not the powder stuff you find in places like Quicklys. You can see them make it in front of you by blending real red beans or a whole banana as they make these drinks.

Quality stuff. Highly recommended!!
author: Daniel L.

description: Lychee milk tea with boba!! This place uses fresh chopped up lychees, not just the powder stuff. It makes a world of difference in flavor.  I always pick up some gummy candies when I come in here, and try to ignore the fact that they've probably all been sitting there since the first day the place has been opened...
author: L W.

description:
Hands down the best tapioca in town! How do I know that? 

Blind taste test baby!

Some friends and I compared Wonderful Foods with the very popular Tea Way down the street.  And of course when it comes to the tea, Wonderful Foods kicked Tea Way's ass.  Side by side, you can taste the REAL tea flavors vs the powder crap in Tea Way and Quickly's.  BLECH! Shame on them!! Sure, Wonderful Foods costs a little bit more but you get what you pay for.

My new favorite is the Green Milk Tea with Almond Jello! BOMB!
author: Helen V.

description:
For this review I would have to follow the trend of 5 star reviews because this place really deserves it.  A quick history review Wonderful Foods has been around since I was in my teens. I have so many pleasant memories of hanging out with friends on Irving with boba drinks in hand and conversing for hours only to continue our lengthy discussions by purchasing another boba drink and talking more. haha They were one of the first stores to introduce boba milk tea drinks to SF long before Quicklys and Tea Way came into town. This was years back like mid 2000. Since then they have continued making quality boba drinks that other stores just cannot compare with. I'm glad to see this store is still around in my neighborhood and business is thriving because even with a down economy people can't get enough of tapioca. 

Me and my friends joke that they put something "special" inside these drinks to make it taste so good you want to keep coming back for more. I'm no drug addict nor have ever been one but i can imagine the yearning and craving for another  tapioca drink at Wonderful Foods comes close. Its really THAT GOOD! Not a day goes by I don't crave for the tapioca drinks at Wonderful. Just no other place i found has been able to make boba drinks like this place.
author: Jude N.

description: I came here for the Milk tea since everyone was raving about it. It was all right it wasn't mind blowing. The tapioca is definitely what people say it is, chewy and just right. The tapioca is definitely how it should be. The people really have to use more communication skills, though. They didn't say whose drink belonged to who so some of us customers looked at each other and decided on our own.
author: Lyra c.

description:
I discovered this place one night after having a late night craving of tapioca right when everything was closing. I rushed down Irving and saw how other businesses had already closed their doors. 3 minutes before official closing time. Wonderful still had their door wide open so I walked in and ordered an almond milk tea with tapioca. It was wonderful, yummy and delicious. The tapioca was soft on the inside yet slightly more firm on the inside. It was great, not too mushy like other places around. 
The menu on the wall is big and has plenty of flavors to choose from, although by personal preference go between only two.
author: Yesenia G.

description: I've been to a lot of the novelty Boba places but most of them don't have Thai ice tea Boba.  (You would think it's a pretty standard drink!). So I was on a mission for one and thought I'd try this place out. I was a little skept-tea's-mo at first just by the looks of the place. But figured, hey, don't judge a book by its cover right? It's for sure not your typical Boba joint... In fact it's a little nitty gritty hole in the wall that sells a medley of random crap. From eggs to candy to sour dried fruit to Boba. Don't expect friendly smiles or welcoming greetings... Just your typical Asian owned get-in get-out style of business. (Needless to say "cash only")  But whateves, I came for one thing and one thing only. They did not disappoint. I swear their Thai ice tea Boba has crack of some sort because I drank it for 3 days straight. On the 2nd day I discovered the "upgrade large" size for $1 more and just cannot imagine going back to regular size ever again. Go big or go home!!  One day I'll venture out to try their other flavors but in the mean time, their thai ice tea is my fave in the city.
author: Annie S.

description: The boba milk tea is pretty good. Very potent too! I had it at 9 pm! I was up until 5 am watching saved by the bell reruns!!
author: Arnold W.

description:
The only time I venture to this side of town is for boba and asian food. I'm a fan of Purple Kow but their throughput is horrendous. Last time I waited 40 minutes to order, and it took an additional 15 minutes for them to make the drink. How hard can it be to assemble and pre-mixed drink?

Coming into wonderful foods reminded me of how a boba experience should be. $3 for a honey green tea with grass jelly. Ordered and got my drink in 5 mins.
author: B Y.

description:
The original tapioca drink store on Irving.  Was here long before Quickly's opened up and even longer than Teaway.  Used to be at the location right next to Quickly's, but I like this location better as it is cleaner and bigger.

This place is my go to place for tapioca drinks in San Francisco.  I only go to Teaway when there is no line and all my friends want something from Teaway.  Milk Tea is the best here out of the 3 stores.  This place also offers snacks that they make and a lot of candy on the inside (chocolate covered gummy bears ftw).

Things to get:
-Milk Tea Tapioca
-Thai Tea Tapioca
-Honeydew Tapioca
-Salt and Pepper Chicken (popcorn chicken)  The popcorn chicken is like $4.99 here compared to $2.99 at Teaway, but this place makes it so much better.  And I'm also iffy about how Teaway even fries their food seeing as their store is so tiny.
-Tea eggs (I haven't tried them yet, but I hear from everyone else, that their tea eggs are to die for).
Don't remember all the other things I've ordered here, but will take a picture of the menu next time and try to remember.

This place puts together milk tea and thai tea there on the spot rather than having a giant premixed container like elsewhere.  They also have fresh tapioca all day.  It's always soft and sweet.  Other places have this bland and tough tapioca that makes me either pour the drink into a separate cup, or just pull my straw up so I avoid all the tapioca.

Service:
The lady that works here is always super friendly.  She's always smiling and greets you when you walk in.  Whether you go when this place opens during the day, or late at night, they always greet you happily.

This store doesn't have seats, but is very spacious where you can hang around inside. THEY HAVE A BATHROOM OMG! AND ITS CLEAN!  

This place beats out Teaway and Quickly in my opinion.  I've got a lot of concerns about Teaway, and really only bad things to say about Quickly's, but I'll write a review for those locations.  All-in-all, pay just a little bit more for much better quality and service and go to Wonderful Foods Co instead.
author: Kevin K.

description:
The BEST milk tea ever. Seriously.

I've tried a lot of milk teas (TapEx, Tea n More, Tea Station, Ten Ren, Quickly, Lollicup) and nothing compares to the milk tea at Wonderful Foods. There's just something about it that makes me want it every day I'm in San Francisco. When I'm in San Diego, I'm definitely longing for it. Some might say it's a bit strong and not sweet enough, but to me, it's perfect. I usually get it without tapioca because I'm not a huge fan of tapioca, but every time I do get it with boba, it's good.

I'm also a huge fan of the red bean tapioca. They blend red bean, ice, and condensed milk? It's freakin' bomb. It tastes like those red bean ice drinks you get at HK-style restaurants. Delicious. It's on the expensive side so I only get it once in a while but it's worth it! I also go for their milk tea with pudding and milk tea with lychee when I feel like mixing things up a little. The honeydew and taro is also good.

Aside from tapioca drinks, they have a huge assortment of candy and dried fruit. It's like a mini Sweet Factory in there and the candy is freakin' good. They also sell tea eggs which makes the store smell delicious. I haven't tried the eggs yet, but I think I will one of these days.

I've been going here since I was a kid and I'm glad it's still around. It's a nice little family-owned and run shop that hopefully will stick around. Go here and try the milk tea at least once!
author: Annie C.

description:
With all the boba places that keep opening up in SF, I find that I still end up back here to get my fix.  Always consistent, and it just seems to taste better (less sugary/powdery)  than places like PK and T-Pumps.

Favorites are the lychee milk tea, wintermelon milk tea, papaya smoothie, and the always delicious popcorn chicken.
author: Felix W.

description: Delicious boba (i like jasmine green milk tea) and YUM salt & pepper chicken. I go here every time I'm in the area.
author: Allyson S.

description: Top of the line boba balls got Thai tea it was average. Will try another flavor sometime, I like how it's not extra for boba. Overall 4/5
author: Barry H.

description:
It was a beautiful day in the Sunset and I wanted something cold to drink. So I ordered one of their tapioca drinks. Which flavor? Taro...

The worker asked me: "Do you want powder or fresh?" 

::: I'm thinking Whaaaat?? I have options?! Sweet!::::                       

Me: "Fresh."

Worker: "What kind of taro?"

Me: "There's different kinds of taro?? What kind do you have??"

Worker: "White or Purple."

Me: "Purple."

Worker: "Do you want it blended or regular?"

Me: "Hmmm....can I try regular?" 

Worker: "$3.29."

WOW! That taro drink was sooo good! But the balls start to get annoying after a while.  At one point I had so many balls in my mouth I almost choked. Yes, "That's what she said."  And I'm talking bout  tapioca balls.  =) 

Must. Avoid. This. Place. Its also a candy store! You know, kinda like Sweet Factory... 

I try to stay away from this place as much as possible.  Its dangerous! They have all of my favorite candies! Chocolate covered gummy bears, sour belts, apple o's, Pocky, and tons of other candy that I love! The more I go here, the more I'll end up with a billion cavities! =(

Daniel L., you should definitely hit this place up! I'm sure you'll like it. They even sell taro mochi!
author: B B.

description: I got the papaya milk tapioca. For $3.75, it was the best drink I've ever gotten. The papaya milk had a nice consistency and it wasn't overly sweet. Their tapioca was also sweetened and very soft and chewy. Definitely will be back; need to try more flavors next time!
author: Irene T.

description:
As someone has said, there are a billion boba places on Irving.  There is Quickly down the block, one across the street, another one around the corner -- it's nuts! But this place stands out.  Simple, no thrills location without seating (meaning, get in, get the drink and get out).  There is a HUGE assortment of various candies on the left side of the wall and herbs on the right side (honestly, not the best smelling).

Very simple boba menu (not like the 500 item menu at Quickly).  Quick service and friendly staff.  The hot white milk tea with boba is what I normally get and it's just right.  Not too sweet, not too bland.  The tapioca balls are always tasty.

Cash only.  $2.75 for the drink that I get.  Can't go wrong.
author: Serge S.

description:
Wonderful foods is just well wonderful!!

I very rarely drink the tapioca drinks but I do love the self serve candy!! I always get sour coke bottles, frogs, and cherry sours. Love it. Everytime I come all the candy is filled and fresh (meaning no hard candy). They weigh it out by the pound and the bags they have are similar to those Sweet Factory bags (remember that candy store in the malls)... Cash only.
author: Julie F.

description:
I cannot even begin to describe how happy I am to find this wonderful place. 

As a native Taiwanese, the lack of decent boba in SF is quite infuriating. I used to go to Teaway, but I should be kicking myself for doing so for the past few months. 

THIS PLACE IS THE SHIT. It's nothing fancy, no plush chairs, no "DIY" station, but man, they get their shit done like nobody's business. The place is run by a Taiwanese family, and I'm always very comforted by the fact that I can rattle off an order and have them understand. 

So come here and get some authentic boba, cuz there's no place in SF like wonderful foods!
author: A Y.

description:
Absolutely hands down the BEST boba I've ever had.  I've been coming here for years and it has been consistent since day one.  I have had boba literally everywhere (all over Asia and in the U.S. from SF, LA, TX to NY) and this is still my favorite place.  

They ALWAYS use fresh fruit and have the best consistency in regards to the texture and chewiness of their boba. 

You will not be disappointed.  Now this is a place I would wait in line for an hour for (luckily that's never the case). 

Do I consider myself an expert in boba? Absolutely.  Do I consider this the best boba ever? Absolutely.
author: B T.

description: Boba is decently chewy but too syrupy. The tea itself is a tad too sweet, with that weird artificial tea taste similar to Quickly. You can tell it's made with a tea mix, as opposed to fresh tea. Blech, won't be back.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Mmm... tapioca pearls / boba are indeed good!  Thank you for the recommendations! 

Durian boba - so good.  so expensive.  i think they put in frozen durian, but it's still fruit not powder $5.75 
avocado boba - yum.  i saw them put in a real raw half avocado  $4.25

the mlik tea is a bit strong so i suppose this signals real tea?  

i'd drink / eat the boba right away.  i saved one in the fridge and the bobas got hardened over night.
author: Alias A.

description: This place is not bad but not the best either. I only come here to buy their candies, lol. But when i do come, i usually get their milk tea with tap. It's not my fave, but hey i'm not complaining. Their tapiocas are usually pretty good, though i would say that their milk tea tastes more like coffee milk tea than regular milk tea.
author: Verdina P.

description:
I never considered myself a huge Boba fan.  I could never tell the difference between "good" and "bad" boba.  But after living in outer sunset for 3 years and testing out the waters.  People are right, there IS a huge difference between Quigly and Wonderful.  Not only is the boba perfectly chewy at Wonderful, but their quality of teas are definitely noticeable. 

In the winter time, I always get their Green Milk Tea WARM which is not too sweet and a perfect study companion to keep you up late or to curl up in the couch and watch a movie.  Their tea eggs are always a hit.
author: Shirley W.

description: I got the fresh taro milkshake with grass jelly instead of tapioca, friend got red bean tapioca (real red beans blended with crushed ice yum). Both were very good! I've been trying to find a place with decent grass jelly in SF and it's been a LOT harder than I thought it'd be. I've been to other places in the area and near Chinatown in the city as well. The texture, taste, and amount of this place is on point! I've had other places where the texture was off, taste was bad, or all of the grass jelly was stuck at the bottom so I couldn't get to it until I finished my drink (the most annoying!). The drinks from here weren't too sweet either which I really appreciated! Overall, a great place and I'd definitely come again.
author: M K.

description:
DRINK:
Milk Tea = They do make good boba drinks

SERVICE:
Order pickup at counter. 

ATMOSPHERE:
Chinese candy store that sells boba haha... Complete with things like that sour dried up plum. No place to sit though.
author: Angela L.

description:
Read the reviews here and had to try the place out.  It's quickly become my regular stop after working out around the corner.

I've had drinks there 5 times or more now and every time the boba has been perfect.  The pearls are soft in texture, chewy with just the right amount of gummy firmness.  The boba is never runny, hardened, or overcooked.  They also do not charge extra for boba in any beverage. Score!

The drinks are very fresh and never too sweet.  If you want a sugary beverage in the style of Quickly's, you may be disappointed. The lychee juice drink is pieces of the fruit blended up with ice, (not powder!)- very light and refreshing.  The lychee, oolong, and plain milk teas are very lightly sweetened.  I especially dig their oolong milk tea.  The milk and light sweetness brings out the floral flavors of the tea and it's only $3!

The walls are lined with a cool selection of gummy and sour candies on the left and Chinese style dried fruits and treats on the right.   They get extra points from me for having sour cherry cola gummies.

I wish they'd put in some tables and chairs to make the place more homey and a place to hang out, though it occurs to me that the wide open space all the way to the counter makes this shop very wheelchair accessible and friendly.
author: Aya S.

description:
Stopped by here the other day and got a pearl milk tea (yum!)  Tea flavor is fantastic (tastes almost like a sweet coffee drink) and pearls are chewy but soft.  I will return, and may even go out of my way to do so.

Prices are also very reasonable, $2.75 for a small.

Interestingly (if you've never been here), Wonderful foods is actually a glorified candy store that sells Boba and deep fried foods.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I came here after dinner so I guess I'll start with a review for this place like the saying, dessert first!  A SF native brought me here saying that this was the first boba place to make boba popular in the city.  I got the almond milk tea (brown), which is different from almond milk (white).  It was good but I should've gotten the regular milk tea since you can tell a lot about a boba place based on their staple milk tea.  The almond milk tea was very good though.  It was a little sweeter but still very delicious.  I would definitely come back here for boba again.  Happy for this treasure find!
author: Tori Q.

description: I love love love Wonderful Foods Co! I have been a loyal customer since I was an elementary school student! Fell in love with the boba instantly. Now in college, no boba place can top my love for Wonderful! The boba here is definitely the best of San Francisco, with as much authenticity you can get to Taiwanese boba. My favorite drinks here are milk tea and avocado smoothie with boba. Definitely worth the bang for the buck.
author: Olivia B.

description:
my spot of tapioca.
i dont want to try any other places.
mom and pop store, so yeah, no to quicklies, purple cow and all the other chains for me.
great selection and they do their balls right
always coming back for more.
they have some treats for sale on the side of the walls.

will always come back here for tapioca fix
author: Andi I.

description:
Wonderful has WONDERFUL bubble tea. surprise.. forreal though. i put all places through the "milk green tea" test and theirs was light, refreshing, and not chalky/powdery. perfect. couldve kept drinking it for days. the tapioca was arguably the best i've had too. soft & chewy practically tender, and not overly mushy or slimy. prices are good and the menu has options, but not overwhelming (like quicklys can get).

they also have self-serve candy, which i thought was awkward at first... but it works.
author: Yui K.

description: This is the place to be at! Been coming here since I was a small child. Regular milk tea for me w/ less ice. Yummmmm, better than Teaway & Quicklys.
author: Emily L.

description:
For those who DONT know about this place, yet LA LA LA LOVESS milk tea and tapioca, THIS IS THE PLACE to go to! :D 
Not only does the milk tea w/ tapioca tastes like PERFECTION 
they make it really really quick! so if ur ever in a rush, u know where to goo! :)
i recommend this to EVERYONE!
author: Anne C.

description:
Here I am, the Prince of Taiwan, and once again I must bestow my blessings upon another great business run solely by my Taiwanese brethren. 

This place is an original place among a sea of imitators..like those god awful chains like Quickly or Tap Express. Their number 24, the Passion Fruit Juice with Jelly and Tapioca is the most authentic I've ever tasted other than Tea Station in So Cal and Tea Era in Mt View. 

Now get off your fat ass and go to this place and have the best tap drinks in San Francisco, bar none.
author: Jerry C.

description:
There are a few candy and tapioca shops on Irving, and this one does not have 100 items like Quickly to sell, but it has good stuff! 

I had the sesame tapioca and it's rich, creamy with the perfectly done tapioca that is firm in the middle and soft but not soggy on the outside. I think a lot of places have soaked too much tapioca for too long and always have leftover so it's mostly too soft.
author: T L.

description:
oh wonderful foods yes i will admit that your tapioca and milk tea is is wonderful
and theres plenty of wonderful things about wonderful foods 

LIKE
- open till midnight every night even on sundays!
- also sells candy and other foods 
- a pretty large selection of drink flavors

BUT like any place they're 

DISLIKE
- Price & Size...yess i feel bad about making complainants about the price and the size but i guess ive gotten so used to tapioca drinks coming in a large sizes for cheap like at Tpumps and Purple Kow. to get the large size of a drink is about $4  
- This isnt really a dislike but just a forewarning to people, that the location where Wonderful Foods is located can be pretty busy during the daytime and hard to find parking 

BUT besides from these lil dislikes Wonderful Foods is a great place to get tapioca specially late at night!
author: Matt F.

description: MMMMmmmmmm. I love their lychee milk tea! It's not watered down and there are actual bits of lychee in the drink! Their tapioca balls are perfectly cooked, nice and chewy. My time here was great, but my friend who got the red bean tapioca was not so lucky. I had a sip of her drink and it was almost like eating red bean paste.
