It was super thick and just tasted like red bean. Nothing special about their red bean drink. But so far everything else that i've tried was great!
author: Mina K.

description: Favorite tapioca place. Quick service. Consistent taste  .  Their tapioca milk tea is the best!
author: Aljun R.

description: I Loveeee their almond tapioca!! It's like heaven in a liquid form. Also, their candy selection is awesome!
author: Celene D.

description: I've been coming here ever since middle school , and I still come here from time to time , its been over 9 years! I've always love this place , This was the original tapioca shop on Irving before Teaway and Quicklys opened. In my opinion #28 is their best drink , lychee tapioca with coconut jelly! I recommend it!  but I also get honeydew here too! Its great! and better quality than Teaway or Quickly's. Only down side is , its a little more expensive than the current tapioca shops :( There's no 1$ specials like quickly's or add you own toppings in your drink like Teaway, but I do like this place a lot better. They also sell candy here haha.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I love their mocha bubble milk tea! It's nom nom nom. Several times i got the milk tea with aloe vera...do not get it. It's not fresh. Their boba is just okay. I'm happy with just their Mocha milk tea with nothing in it =)
author: Ella A.

description:
Wow this place is getting more expensive. Still good tapioca, but now with some drinks nearing the $5 at the 4 something range, I have to really limit myself. I really wish they'd kind of keep tabs on their preserved stuff though. A long time ago, one of my favorites was the chili mangos, but it just looks ewww... whenever I see it now. Kinda stagnants in those containers for who knows how long. Some of the other salted stuff is not so bad. 

PROTIP on the drinks though. Tell them you're sharing the drink and ask them to split it into two cups. That way they'll give you leftover which you'd miss out on if you just ordered it regularly. When I share with my friend, we're stilling getting like 2/3 a cup each!
author: Peter W.

description:
Unparalleled tapioca balls.

Pure, refreshing milk tea.

Best of San Francisco.
author: Andrew M.

description: When I crave boba, this is my go-to spot. Lychee Milk Tea. Strawberry Smoothie. Mango. Kumquat. It's all soooooo soooooo sooooooo DEEELISH! It almost makes me miss living in the Sunset District. Suck on this, Quickly!
author: Natasha P.

description: I would have expected better from San Francisco when it comes to tapioca, but so far I havent been to one that's better than the places I go to in Chicago. I ordered the taro tapioca and it was watered down. I could tell it was all powder. In Chicago, they at least blend the taro powder with ice and coconut milk for better flavor.  I also tried the almond tapioca here. Also watered down. What a disappointment!
author: Janet E.

description:
As the first tapioca store that I was introduced to as a child, their drinks are top quality. Even after all of these years, I still drift towards ordering the red bean tapioca, no matter how many times I tell myself otherwise. They use a handful of *gasp* real red beans along with ice and other goodies to make a wonderfully textured "slush". The tapioca is also cooked perfectly. Red bean tapiocas at any other establishments disappoint me to no end...

To top it all off, they serve you as quickly as their blender can work (in the case of my slush-like drink).
author: Christina L.

description: Some places can get their drinks right, but their tapioca balls stay hard like rocks; or overcooked and mushy. At Wonderful Foods, they mastered the art of making good tapioca balls that compliment their well blended drinks. I prefer their Avocado tapioca drink over everything else.
author: Bonene G.

description: I have to say that their tea is legit.  the green apple is a bit sour, but the honeydew is made from real fruit, and tastes so good.  They also have a large assortment of candy, like the old school peachies, apple o's and cola bottle gummies
author: M C.

description: Good stuff. Some of the best boba I've tasted. It's all about the chewiness level and this place has it just right. A lot of their stuff is also made with real ingredients vs. the places that have all powder flavorings. My friend ordered the durian shake once and they have a whole separate blender for it so the taste/smell doesn't contaminate anything else haha. I make sure to stop by here whenever I'm in the neighborhood and craving boba.
author: Sannie L.

description: Came here with my girl, super late one night. Honestly, I've had better. I think Quickly is better hands down. Not sure what it was, I ordered a #4, (hot) Green milk tea with tapioca. It was alright, but I thought the boba/tapioca itself wasn't chewy or soft, at all! UGH. It was somewhat hard to eat, but on the upside the service was super fast. There's hardly anywhere to sit down too, so that's no fun. Would I come here again? Most likely not.
author: Jade D.

description: I think I came here once at their old location. They were always busy, but now that they've moved down the street and another bubble tea place has horned into their territory they don't seem to be as busy. There's way too much to choose from, but came here and was told the coconut bubble tea was good. Ever since my first sip I've been craving this on a weekly basis. I don't know what's in it, but whatever it is it makes me want more!
author: Adelina W.

description:
HANDS DOWN, THIS IS THE BEST MILK TEA I'VE HAD SO FAR in the Bay Area.

After coming back from Taiwan not too long ago... I was having milk tea/drink withdrawals... milk tea in the Bay Area just wasn't comparable. 

BUT thanks to Yelp, we were able to discover this place.

There definitely is minimal seating, and it's not as visually alluring like a Quickly's, TapEx or chain boba joint. But whatever! You can't judge a book by it's cover, right?

We loved all of our drinks! My friends got the Melon Drink, Original Milk Tea, Yogurt Green Tea, and I got the Winter Melon Milk Tea (a drink that I really liked in Taiwan.) I had sips of everyone's drink and they all tasted so amazingly close to the milk tea I had in Taiwan.

Definitely will be coming back!!!
author: Margaret C.

description: I highly recommend this place to grab drinks and snacks. They need to make the  lychee drink #28 with salt pepper chicken a combo. If you have room also try the tea eggs, so good! The service here is also fast so don't worry about starving. And if you were wondering the gummies here are really fresh. I always get a bag to complete my meal.
author: Julie L.

description:
The place looks better at this location than at the previous location (where Tapioca Express is). The pearl is always fresh (or at least tastes fresh) and the service is quick.

Been going here for the past 9 years and still continue to patronize them as they have the best service and flavors around.

FYI, they sometimes have their bichon frises is the store (no where near the food, of course)...super friendly little dogs.
author: Mike K.

description:
One of the best tapioca drinks I have ever had. They have quality tapioca balls, and they are always or most of the time have the right amount of chewiness. Rarely are they hard and stale. Also the milk tea is great, and the honey dew drinks are just as good. The place also offers a wide variety of candy, but I never get that. 

This is a must go to place for tapioca in SF.
author: Nick L.

description: Tea is way too sweet. It's flavorful and boba portions are generous, but make sure you really like sweet drinks if you come here.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Visited SF a week ago and was craving bubble tea as soon as my best friend and I landed. I found this place highly rated on Yelp and decided to check it out.

1st Trip
* 2 papaya milk shakes with tapioca + salt/pepper chicken + fried tempura + 4 hard-boiled tea eggs = $20
* My papaya milk shake was perfect, but my best friend's was too sweet (we guessed that maybe they added my sugar to hers cuz mine tasted like biting into plain papaya, which I love).
* The tapioca was perfectly chewy. Unfortunately, they put entirely too much tapioca for drinks of this size.
* Salt & pepper chicken (with spice) was OMG-delicious...Fried tempura, although in the exact same seasoning, was not as good.
* $0.90 for a hard-boiled tea egg is a bit steep (we get the same thing in Atlanta at 3 for $1)...it had good color but was very lacking in flavor =(

2nd Trip
* Me - plain green milk tea: it has good tea flavor but sadly, toooooo sweet.
* My friend - yogurt milk tea (she asked for low sugar because of her previous experience with the papaya shake). It seemed to be made with Calpico or another more diluted yogurt drink because it wasn't very yogurt-y. This drink was very disappointing for my best friend, who has had this drink in Taiwan. I thought it tasted okay since I have no reference of what it's supposed to taste like.

I'd probably visit this place again next time I visit SF and give them a chance to redeem themselves by ordering the green milk tea again.
author: Amaryllia L.

description:
Wonderful Foods Co truly is wonderful.  

Sorry that was lame.  But really, they are good.  Even though a couple of their candies and snacks can get a bit pricey, their real specialty is in the tapioca drinks.  

They have half a wall full of different tapioca drinks.  I've had their milk tea, thai tea, and the almond jelly/honey.  All three are satisfying treats that give me a little kick in the late afternoon.  The almond jelly and honey is very sweet, so just be warned.  The tapioca is, in my opinion, very well made.  Very chewy, yet they don't all stick to each other at the bottom of the cup.

The service here is very efficient.  The cashiers make tapioca faster than any other place I've ever been to. 

Delicious + Efficient= WIN
author: Andrew T.

description:
BALLS, BALLS, BALLS!!!

LOTS OF BALLS!

...Tapioca balls, that is.

The tapioca here is superb compared to other places that sell tapioca/boba drinks. It's nice and chewy, but not overally chewy as if it's been sitting in cold water for too long or it's not boiled enough.

I'm not a big tapioca drink fan, but if I were to ever crave one - this would be my first choice without a doubt in my mind.
author: Annie S.

description:
I like this place a lot better than quickly's... I just wish it had some tables so you can sit down and chat. Their teas and balls are much more to my liking =). Their teas being not grossly sweet and balls being a nice chewy consistency.
One time i ordered the taro milkshake... it was distrubingly not good and they were nice enough to switch it out for what i really wanted... a taro milk tea - yum. My friend also really likes their jasmine milk tea. 

Also, sometimes they have their cute little dog out - a bichon frise that is amazingly mellow =)
author: Tim B.

description: Mmm...got their salt and pepper chicken today.  I haven't had it in about a year and was really craving it.  I forgot how spicy the regular spicy is so I ordered the extra spicy.  Whoa, baby - that thing had a really good kick to it.  My boyfriend couldn't handle it though so we'll just stick with the regular spicy next time, haha.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
I love this place. This place made me despise Quicky's. Not because Quickly's is awful but because they had to move right next door to Wonderful Foods and basically force them to another location. Anyway, back to the food.

The boba here is excellent. Perfect texture. Not too liquidy nor too chewy where my jaw starts hurting. I am a fan of their fruit drinks (as opposed to their syrup based ones). My favorite is the mixed fruit one. Mango is good, too, if it's fresh. Another nice feature is that they can make most of their drinks hot upon request. They have another assortment of snacks lining their walls, both Asian and American kinds.

They are open very late which is great when you have random night cravings. Bonus points for some cute servers. 5 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I've been craving milk tea boba and after looking at the reviews for this place I decided to try it. I ordered the coconut milk tea with boba and it is delicious! It's a bit on the sweet side (which I enjoy)  and the boba is soft and chewy. 

This place also has a candy section where you can fill a bag with candy for $1.75 for a quarter pound. Yum!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Ever since the Sweet Factory went bye bye, I came here for those sour belt thingys. I love thosee. They have alot of choices of gummy candies and chocolates, and asian dried snacks too! Some of that stuff looks... really funky though. I wonder how often they change out that stuff. 

Their drinks are more expensive than Tea Way and Quickyls, but it's definitely worth it.The quality is SO much better. I don't like their milk tea though. It tastes like coffee. I like their thai tea, honey green tea, strawberry smoothie, and some kind of yogurt drink. The tapioca is almost always perfectly cooked!
author: Christina X.

description:
WFC drinks are too sweet so I didn't finish my drink. Seriously, are you kidding me? I'm assuming 1/4th of the drink is condensed sugar.

The only good thing this store has is the chocolate gummy bears and $1 toy capsule machines. They have quality ingredience but thats only cause they charge about $4 a drink.

Sorry, never again.
author: Keit K.

description:
I haven't [yet] tried the tapioca drinks, but the candy selection here is AWESOME. I'm a not-so-secret candy fanatic, and Wonderful Foods totally delivers. They have a great selection of gummy candy (fruit-flavored belts, gummy fruits/rings, and (most importantly) crunchy bears), and also the more difficult-to-find chocolate orange sticks. 

Let me just say that, after yesterday's trip here, I was the envy of every five- to seven-year-old on the bus.
author: Kate G.

description:
Nothing in the world compares to juggling warm, silky balls in your mouth.  Fro-yos and cupcakes, please take a seat.

Known as "boba" tea, originated from Taiwan in the 80s, this drink has gelatinous balls the size of marbles.  You can distinguish other smoothie or tea drinks apart by the fatter straws that help you suck large black tapioca balls from your cup.

Wonderful Dessert does a fine job in cooking their balls well. Connoisseur boba drinkers desire them to be fresh, not clumpy nor slimy, in their mouths.

If you have never tried their warm Lychee Boba Milk Tea, you are missing out on one of the joys in life.  For $3.25, you will experience a sinful, sensuous treat.

Elite Yelper Monica R from Brooklyn, New York confessed, "There is something about sucking large tapioca balls out of a straw that leaves me very unsettled. I think that drinking "tea" and then unexpectedly sucking up something edible would (have) the same level of weirdness."

After reading my review, I hope she and other curious Yelpers will try this "concoction" at least once.

Most consumers order their boba drinks cold, but I recommend it warm because the balls are softer to chew on.  Plus, the lychee fragments add a natural sweetness and rough texture to the bitter taste of the creamy milk tea.  As a variant, the avocado and the almond (no powder) bobas are yummy too.

Some of you may still think tapioca drinks is just an Asian thing.  You are sadly mistaken-- it transcends ethnicity and gender.  

Know this:  The next time you walk down the street and catch a smiling PYT, holding a warm cup of Lychee Milk Tea Tapioca, there is a high probability that she is fixated on her own oral pleasure. 

                //
======//====
|            //          |
| ~~~~~~~~~~|
|         //             |
| O   // O O  O  |
| O // O O O O |
| O OO O O O |
-------------------
author: CT L.

description: As much as I try to stray to new tapioca places, I always find myself coming back here.  Grew up walking to Irving with my sister & we love this place because of that.  Better than Quicklys, Tapioca Express, or Lollicup.
author: E G.

description:
5 stars for their FABULO-SO Milk Tea!! --I personally don't care for them boba balls though.  

Anyways, I wish they had a "frequent sippers" stamp card, I would be so down for that!  Definately, their $2.75 milk tea is worth it.  I mean, doubt my boyfriend would mind driving me 2-3 times a week (just for it) if it weren't THAT good.  

Thank You Wonderful Foods!

Milk tea addictions are THE best!!  *nom nom nom*
author: Lynn S.

description: I always get the Almond or Green Milk Tea from here. Occasionally, I like the fruit smoothies, like Strawberry Banana. The tapioca here is really good! My friend who was a tapioca fanatic always said this place gave you more tapioca than others lol. Anyway, one time I ordered a Strawberry Banana tapioca for my boyfriend and he ended up bringing it home to his mom who has never had tapioca before and she loved it =) I love the tapioca here and it's nice that it opens til midnight so that we can always come here late after dinner or something.
author: Connie Y.

description: This is my all time favorite tapioca place ! I've been going to Wondferul Foods since it was first open till now. I lovee their drinks and my favorite drink from them is the original milk tea. I love how their milk tea tastes and I feel like it's not cheaply made like some other tapioca joints. They mix your tea when you order it, unlike other tapioca places where they make a big bucket of it and just fill your cup with that. This place to me tastes authentic and the quality is there even though it's a little pricier than the chain tapioca places. But you get what you pay for and I definitely get the satisfaction from the drinks here ! I always recommend this place to people who love tapiocas!
author: Lucy C.

description: One of the best tapioca drinks...I love the mango and red bean,the green bean is good too.. I remember back in high school when they first open,still as good... :)
author: jonathan h.

description:
You must try the almond jelly tapioca drink with honey. 
Sweet love.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
BEST TAPIOCA in SF by far!!!! definitely authentic! They get most of their ingredients from Taiwan themselves.  I love their Green Milk Tea Tapioca and their Almond Jelly with Honey.  Tapioca balls itself are decent, it really depends on the day I swear.  

Pretty Pricey but iI guess because they know they are good. 
They have really good pork Jerky but it costs soo much more here than it does at other stores, especially ones in Socal. 

The tea eggs are pretty darn good but too pricey for those.  Share it if your on budget hehe.
author: Helen Y.

description: Not sure I can add anything that others haven't already mentioned but it's the best boba place I've been to. Drinks are consistently good and that's what I absolutely love about this place. How many times have you gone to a place that can never get the drink right because someone different is making it? The service is pretty quick even if there's a long line. At times, they've forgotten a drink from our order but they're quick to remedy that so I can't fault them. There's only one table in this whole place so be prepared to take your boba to go (this is super smart on the owner's part).
author: Halona L.

description: my friend introiduced me to their taro milk tea, and i honestly have to say it kicks quicklys butt for taro milk tea. it doesn't taste as powdery and has more taro kick in it. but its too far for me so i usually just settle for quicklys taro milk tea near my house! but definitley will be back here!
author: Stella J.

description: Am I just being paranoid or did this place taste better when they were across the street from where they are now? The place does look a lot cleaner and more organized with their usual bins of gummy candies lining the walls. I used to come here all the time in high school to get boba in all sorts of flavors. I particularly fancied the almond and coconut, but occasionally tried the the honey dew and some others. I had to revisit my favorites so I went for the almond with boba. Same almond flavor, except it was a little too sweet. I also ran across a chunk of sugar while drinking it. Otherwise, it was fine. Wonderful Foods has the best tapioca balls. They are not too big or small and have the perfect firmness in texture. I hope none of their other flavors changed too much in taste.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Before i thought quickly drinks were good Until my friend introduced me to this place!!! this place is in no comparison to quicklys.I usually order my favorite honey dew with tapioca. Yes the tapioca balls are nothing like quicklys!! very good and consistent.  My friend always order her usual Milk tea with tapioca and it is absolutely funny when she comments on her drink. Sometimes she says this is soo yummy some other time she says.. ahhh its okz.. lolz.. This tapioca store has new workers and sometimes new workers are not adequate.. soo definitely revise u guys for another shot at this store =]. 
       The price is worth the pay... 2.75 XP and the candies are always temppting to look at!
author: Alice C.

description:
There milk tea is good....totally recommend drinking it hot. (It's not super hot though, more warm.  I think they boil the water in the microwave). When it's hot, the tapioca doesn't get hard.  Even when the drink is cold, the tapioca has a great chewy texture.  

A ghetto version of a sweet factory and some random things like jerky and eggs.  I gave it a four cause this place truly lacks ambiance.  There is no seating...

I just go in and out to get my "warm" milk tea and my sour blue coca cola bottle candies.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I'm writing a review just because I'm craving some tapioca right now.

This is probably my favorite tapioca store! Their tapioca is chewy and fresh, compared to the soggy, half cooked tapioca they usually serve in Quickly's chain stores. 

Watermelon, thai tea, lychee, honeydew, green milk tea, hot or cold, anything on the menu is just simply.. "wonderful!"
author: Tina C.

description:
Wondeful Foods really never fails me. I always pick this place for some boba even if there is a Quickly boba and snack food place nearby. 

I usually get a Honey Green Tea with Tapioca. The tapioca balls are chewy and don't fall apart after just chewing once. 

I haven't tried their snacking food, but have been told by others that it tastes good. They're also pretty quick about making my drink.
author: Kelly C.

description: The best pearl tea drinks EVER. I love that their fruit drinks are made from REAL fruit...none of that power crap. Yuck. My favorite flavors are strawberry and blueberry. Mmmmmmm!
author: Margaret R.

description:
I always come here for my Avocado Tapioca!!!! Tiffany and the staffs are really friendly!!!
Love this place.
author: May N.

description: Supreme. The tapioca here is so much better than the ones at Quickly. Over at Quickly it's sometimes a little too rubbery. At Wonderful Foods it's perfect. And the tea is perfect too. Blows Quickly out of the water
author: Paul M.

description:
I'm very averse to change. Nothing irked me more than when I walked past Tam's Laser and BAM - it was a Verizon Store. 

I thought all was lost, when suddenly I turned around and saw the bright green onning. It could only be Wonderful Foods! 

So I ran in, got my HoneyDew tapioca and happily had the powdered sugar goodness. The only downside is that now this place has no chairs.
author: Alexander L.

description:
I'm a boba-devouring-fiend and Wonderful Foods is as good as it gets! 
Everything's fresh there. You pay for the quality you get and this place is the bombdiggity! I'd come back weekly if this place wasn't so far away from me. 

Ugh, and now I'm craving...again...
Wonderful Foods needs to stop being so darn wonderful.
author: Rebecca N.

description: If you are a durian fan, get the durian shake.  I was a little hesitant at the price (almost $7) but it was well worth it.
author: Victor C.

description: I have nothing to add, just an affirmation that this is the best damn milk tea for miles. My favorite to order here is hot mint jasmine milk tea. Yum yum yum yum!
author: Thlel Yan D.

description:
Large selection of dried plums, candies, gummies, etc..

I love their tea eggs..I am a tea egg guy..

yo yo tea egg guy here...ok no it doesnt sound as cool as
fro-yo girl (Lolia S.)....hmmm i think its starting to sound like 
tea bag guy..ok not good..

anyways..i love their tea eggs, tastey and reminds me of Taiwan. 
Other than that, their milk tea is good~ O yea I forgot to mention the owners of the store are my lil brother's friend's parents. I always saw the mom fly on China Airlines when I used to work there..shes nice, always ask me how I am doing~  ^_______^
author: phillip w.

description: Best boba in the city!!! The boba balls are nice and chewy. Their ingredients are freshly mixed and not powdered. Its real fruit! I always get their mango boba...sometimes their watermelon boba. But always always delicious!!!
author: Jean T.

description:
With boba spots that do it right you have staff that care about delivering a solid product that many heads like i rely so heavily on.  I mean cooking the tapioca to the right texture where it has that squishyness to it and still soaks up the flavor of your choice-- this is serious shit we are talking about.

A vast, deep menu to choose from.  Usual picks really depend on my mood-- i tend to favor the taro or honeydew- and tho it is made from powder the authenticity of how it tastes when it all comes together is just a thing of beauty!  I truly relish watching the kids mix the drinks...they all show seriousness and precision when balancing between the syrup, hot water, powder, ice, and balls.

If you love ginger-- you gotta try the hot ginger boba here.  Perfect for a cold, gloomy day or just regular overcast SF weather.  It feels like a sauna in my throat and tummy-- while the shoga flavors are just...wonderful.

Yeah...i know..no flat-screens to watch your HK pop videos and all, just go next door to the Quickly and watch from outside...then slowly enter, snatch a seat and have your friends order some fried gizzards to snack on!!!

Oh yeah!  The balls here are natural-born projectiles ready to be spat at ur friends-- one time a friend shot the shit out of a car window like 50 feet-- a fucking swear!
author: omar b.

description:
RAD. NARLY. SUPER. COOL.

Other than Ice Cream, Boba is my second choice for dessert.

I came here after what I thought can't be better than Quickly. 

Lately I haven't had any good service or friendliness from Quickly so I ask a friend, and suggested I should give this place a try. 

Thank you friend, I am hook! 

I love their Passion Fruit drink. And if you are in the candy mood, they have a wide variety of awesome goodness!
author: Stanley K.

description:
TEA EGGS HERE ARE SUPER GOOD
but the milk tea...sigh its so disappointing. all their millk teas are so watered down.... teaway is still better
author: Cindy L.

description:
I am never down this far (I feel like one of those new yorkers who never goes above 14th street) so being at 22nd & Irving is so exciting & fresh & new.  It's this heaven of inexpensive foods & Shiseido products. The honey green tea boba at this joint was great and it kept me up all night (not such a great idea)! I love fried anything, so I loved the "popcorn chicken" aka "salt & pepper chicken" and I can't wait to come back when I haven't already eaten 4 meals. 

And yeah, fuck Quickly, especially when they come on here and obviously write faux reviews (see Michelle W. & Jenny W.). Coincidence they both have the same last initial? I think not. Not to be trusted, especially when every other review is gushing.
author: Maria D.

description:
Best buoba in the city. It's my first stop whenever I am in the city if I have time to stop by. I've tried all the other places on the street, and certainly all the big chains out there now.

The people there are friendly, too. And the place is clean.

The buoba here is chewy and not too soft, unlike what you get across the street at places like Quickly's. But most importantly, their milk tea (nai cha) is actually made from real tea, and not from concentrate which is what you get again, from places like Quickly's. I believe their prices may be a bit higher than Quickly's, Tapioca Express, and Lolicup, but for the quality that you get, it is well worth the extra cost.

If you buy the sour apple one, it will be extremely sweet. I usually prefer extremely sweet, but the last one I got was very loaded with syrup. The passionfruit with jelly is what I usually get, and it's not as sweet, and has tasty jelly that comes with it. And of course their milk tea.

I would not know about their dried foods or candies, since I am usually hesitant to buy from bins, but their tea eggs are also very good.
author: Diana Y.

description:
THEIR MILK TEA SAVED MY LIFE LITERALLY. 

HERE IS THE STORY: One day I was depressed. I was hoping to see that  "crazy lady" talking gibberish on Irving to make me feel that i've got it good. But I didn't see her unfortunately and the only place that was open was WONDERFUL FOOD CO.  I decided to treat myself to a lychee milk tea.  After one sip I became high.  For some reason I became friendly and got out of my character and started to have a conversation with the man next to me.. well it turns out that man (named Bernard Wong) sells LIFE insurance upstairs of Wonderful Foods Co. and the next morning he sold it to me at a great price.  

Then when I walked out guess who showed up?  The Crazy Lady!   Life is good my friends. I got it good.

So this milk tea saved my life.  If i'm in the hospital hook this milk tea up to the I.V. please - no tapioca balls cause that will just clog the flow.
author: Jon F.

description:
The tapioca pearls here are perfect (soft and chewy), and they use what I think is a very good combination of tea and milk.

Though the Thai Tea here sucks, the Jasmine milk tea is AS GOOD AS IT GETS. I usually order it with less pearls though, since they will typically fill 1/3 of your cup with pearls.
author: Chris D.

description: Love this place! My sister first introduced me here about a year ago, and now I am an avid fan. What sets Wonderful Foods apart from other boba places is its consistency and tea taste! I always order their jasmine milk tea with pearls, and one time I ventured out to getting the coconut with pearls which was also amazing. I've tried their regular milk tea before, but this drink actually has more of a coffee taste to it. From reading all the reviews below, it seems as if no one has truly sought out on how good their.. DUN DUN DUN-----FRIES are. Yes. They are sooooo good. They add the hot chili pepper seasoning to them and oh my god. They are just. Delicious. I really can't believe why no one has mentioned that item on here yet, but maybe because people mainly come here for their boba? Or the selection of candy that they also offer. Anyhow, quick tip on that is if you like spicy food and want to try out their fries, make sure you ask them to make them extra spicy. You won't be disappointed!
author: J L.

description:
I've been going here for YEARS and their drinks are ALWAYS spot on!
My favorite is the fresh watermelon tapioca. YUMMERS!!!!
author: Christina S.

description: Possibly the best tapioca milk tea in San Francisco.  Better Teaven and Teaway by far.  Infintely better than Quickly.  Powder vs. real ingredients, I would rather use the real stuff.  You can actually taste the milk and (shocking!) the tea here, rather than some watered down tea and dairy creamer powder.  I even sucessfully converted many friends to leave Quickly.  Like everyone else, I too hate Quickly with a passion.
author: Nicholas L.

description:
This is definitely the best tapioca drink store in town. I only go here because nowhere else can meet the tastiness of their tapioca! They have tons of tea and fruit flavors, extras like grass jelly and lychee to put into your drink. The tapioca itself is undeniably wonderful! Chewy and just a little sweet, not too much, but just enough to be super tasty. You can ask for a larger size; I've never had any of the workers tell me I could order it, so it's kind of a secret.

Recommended flavors, that DON'T come from powder (stab at Quickly's drinks): Lychee, Thai tea, honeydew, taro, and watermelon.

They also have candy! One side is Chinese candies usually older people like. There's tons of sour patch kids, blue gummy sharks, Pocky, and Panda cookies to buy too!

To be totally honest though, it seems like the younger generation of workers in this family-owned store aren't doing as great of a job here as their elders. I've been coming here since I was in preschool, so I know how delicious everything is. The younger generation that works there don't make as good drinks. One of the young ones even overcharged me almost $5. Luckily I was checking the math and the father or uncle or someone gave me my money back. So just note that the older workers make the tapioca taste a little better. Don't judge by one time you try it here. There are always those few off times.
author: Stacy G.

description:
They've been having new workers recently that are really bad at making drinks... My milk tea was extremely sweet and they just didn't seem friendly at all.

Miss the old people, they knew how to make things perfectly.
author: Lily L.

description:
I love, love, LOVE their tapioca here. I always get either the Taro tapicoa, which taste like oreo milkshake for the people that has disgusting written all over their face after reading taro, strawberry, or honeydew melon tapioca.

 Prices are fairly reasonable and I love all their variety of candies!

**Update: 1/20/08
Tried their Pina Colada Almond Jelly Tapioca. Pretty good. Lots of almond jelly.
author: Juliane N.

description:
This is my favorite place for boba. I'm so hooked on the almond milk tea that I don't get a chance to try anything else. All the times I've been here, the boba has been consistently good, soft and gummy. 

The tea itself is fresh tasting, strong, and not watered down. They must put a good amount of milk in there too because I'm lactose intolerant and I trust me, I feel it. But it might also have something to do with the fact that I usually order 2 milk teas, one I finish by the time I leave the store and the other for the road...haha. Yes, it is that good.
author: C C.

description: By far the best tapioca in the city. Came here & ordered the honeydew w/ boba. One word, Delicious! The boba here is on point; chewy, just the way I like it. & on a good note, the girl that made my drink is pretty cute!
author: Alex T.

description:
I've been coming here for over 12 years now (at least once a month... during the summer about once a week). The tapioca balls are PERFECT. They are not cheap on the durian and avocado they put in there shakes too (and they use the real stuff instead of powder like some other places). 

The majority of the staff is nice but could use some work. I kinda get the attitude they're like.. ehhh we have so much customers already, don't need to make an effort to give the customers a warm fuzzy feeling. Obviously not a deal killer for me though =)

Will always be loyal as long as they don't change their drinks!
author: Chowmein P.

description: Boba is ok, a bit on the sweet side.  Definitely had an interesting taste.. Will try out Tea Way for comparison.  Not sure it's worth the extra price over Tea Way.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description:
I've been coming here for 10+ years and I've NEVER been to a better tapioca place. Their milk tea (original) is a classic, it's absolutely delicious. The tea is stronger and more flavorful than anyplace I've ever had. Quickly's down the street (and the new teaway) does NOT compare. They aren't even on the same page. The passion fruit green tea is good, too. The tapioca is extra chewy, it's the perfect consistency. 

LOVE THIS PLACE.
author: M B.

description: Very good, reliable quality, and can make drinks perfect each time.  I normally order the papaya milkshake or the watermelon - they use fresh fruit!  I never leave disappointed.  They've expanded into the Richmond district - Sweethut, also very good.
author: LovesToEat S.

description:
before i ever went to Wonderful Foods, I didn't believe that they had the best tapioca ever. Before I ever went to WF, i always went to tapioca express, quickly, or lollicup and now that i think of it, WTF was i thinking?

This is the best place to get tapioca EVER hands down. NO i am not bullshitting you. This place hits the spot especially with their #4 Green Milk Tea Tapioca and their Strawberry Smoothie Tapioca, yum. i'm glad that they moved a block away from Quickly especially since theres more parking in front than before anyways. Not so happy about the 25 cent price changes on all  of the drinks but I don't care anymore especially.

A friend of mine once went her for about 30 days in a row i believe and got the same drink everyday. although i dont come here that often, i try to come here whenever i can especially since they're open till midnight.

it would be great if that got some tables and chairs though, but besides that i will never stop going here!

btw, the owner's son is one funny ass dude haha
author: Kenny L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was in high school. I discovered this place when my friend Monica brought me here. I've always loved their honey green tea and watermelon juice. I haven't been to a tapioca place who made these 2 specific drinks where the taste even comes close to this place.

And what I found most shocking is that one of my friend's relatives own this place! how awesome is that?!
author: Tracy A.

description:
I have really fond memories of Wonderful Foods. When there was a location in San Mateo way back when, my best friend and I used to scrounge up change and walk over there just to buy one cup of tapioca milk tea to share. (Just to clarify, we were like, 11. We weren't in high school or anything.) The lady thought we were cute or something and would end up giving us each our own cup. 

Now that the boba trend has died down/off and the Wonderful Foods in San Mateo has closed, I drive all the way to Irving every once in a while just for their grass jelly tapioca. It's the only place I'll go when I get a craving for tappy. No one makes it quite like they do. 

Their tapioca is consistently good. Also, for fruit lovers, they don't use that powder shit in their drinks, but real, fresh fruit. And their drinks don't give me the runs. (I'm talking to you, Tapioca Express!)
author: Amy H.

description: Yum! I got some lychee milk green tea with boba and he got some mango strawberry shake with boba, Both were delicious and the woman behind the counter was very patient and nice. They need more seating though.
author: Misty M.

description: The store is very clean and the employees are very nice. The almond milk tea tasted as expected. Unfortunately, i've also had their coconut slushy and it tasted very powdery and fake, it was inedible. I took a few sips and threw it away.
author: Stella C.

description:
I originally came here due to all of the high ratings and was hoping try the BEST milk tea with tapioca in the city!!! Unfortunately my expectations were way too high. Their regular milk tea tastes like coffee and chocolate mixed together which wasn't too appeasing to my taste buds, or shall I say milk tea palette. On the brighter side of things, their tapioca has good texture, but not good taste. I mean, the taste isn't dreadfully awful but it isn't super, awesome, fantastic tasting!  I really like their candy even though it looks *kind of* old, ahaha. Most of all, I love the hours of this place! It's open really late and it's pretty clean inside! Just a note though, there isn't any seating whatsoever so you're gonna have to take your goods to go!
Sometimes if you go around 10 or 11 pm, you'll see the owner's cute dog running around outside. Over all I guess I would only come back for the candy if I happen to be in the area..
author: Susie N.

description:
They really do serve the best tapioca in town here.  I was first introduced to the boba drink years ago here and it remains a favorite.  I almost panicked when I saw Quickly next to the old location and thought that Wonderful had somehow been pushed out of business by the chain.  Luckily, they had just moved to a new location a little further away.

I've pretty much tried the majority of the drinks.  A favorite is the fresh strawberry smoothie tapioca ($3.25) - better than the regular strawberry tapioca ($2.75), which is made of powder.  The tapioca is the perfect texture, chewy and firm, and of a wonderful flavor itself.

Overall, a great place to get tapicoa, some candy, and snacks.  I just hope that Wonderful will survive the competition from the various other tapioca places in the neighborhood and continue offering the best tapioca in town.
author: Angela H.

description:
First, get your mind out of the gutter. 

They have the best balls i've ever tasted! Tapioca balls, that is. I just HAVE to give them 5 stars for that. I hate it when the balls are too hard or too soggy. I'd say they make theirs al dente. I love getting tapioca from this place because I think they make it the best here.  There is just one bitchy girl who always gives unecessary attitude which makes me almost want to boycott. But the tapioca is just too good to resist! Try the almond tapioca.. it's mucho delicioso.
author: Jen Y.

description:
This place truly deserves the title of "Best Tapioca in City!" Their tapioca drinks are perfect! The tapioca balls are always soft and chewy (in a good way). I use to be addicted to the almond jello flavor. (Be sure to request for them to make it with "real" chunks of almond jello, otherwise they will just use the powder.) Then I became addicted to the Lychee. This is made with mild tea and bits of lychee and lychee juice. Now I'm hooked on the red bean tapioca. They blend tons of red bean and ice together and then poured into a cup of tapioca! YUM! I love this place.

BTW, don't be fooled by going to Double rainbow next door. Their Boba is not good at all! Plus, they are extremely RUDE! My friend bought boba at Wonderful foods and I bought ice cream at Double Rainbow and they kicked my friend AND me out just because she was drinking boba from next door! How rude! Talk about jealousy!
author: Denise L.

description:
I love their Milk Tea.  I haven't really had anything else from Wonderful Foods but their Milk Tea kicks butt.  But be warned, it depends on who makes it.  There's this one chick, the younger asian girl, who almost always makes it too sweet.  The owner (the lady) and the tall young guy with glasses make it the best, you can taste the tea in the milk tea.  You'd figure I would've learned their names by now but who knows.

I don't get the tapioca just because it's really filling, they used to charge only $2.00 for the milk tea w/out boba but now it's $2.50 for either, which is still really reasonable.  

COME HERE FOR THE MILK TEA!!
author: Winnie L.

description:
Wonderful foods wouldn't be so wonderful without the company of my good friend Rebecca L. This is our usual spot when we go out for random dessert drinks on an unexpected dinner night out in the middle of the week. You can't go wrong with cheap tapioca milk tea ($2.50 a drink if I remember correctly?). Their tapioca pearls are made just right... better than many other franchises such as Quickly's, Lollicup, or Tap Ex. It's not too chewy, not  too hard or tough, and not too jelly. I would give Wonderful foods an extra star if they had crispy chicken as well, but you just can't have it all. ;)

P.S. - Make sure you get yourself a scoop of chocolate gummie bears on your way out.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
In terms of tapioca, this place is the the best in Sunset. The prices are a bit high though, when you compare it to the Quickly's deals for $1.59. But the quality of the drinks at Wonderful Foods Co. is much better than Quickly's, so you get what you pay for. The only thing I really drink is Taro Milk Tea, which I highly recommend!

The Tea Eggs are good there too but its so expensive that I'd rather make it myself.
author: Jay L.

description:
OMG i cried a river when i thought that wonderful foods had closed, but THANK THE LORD, they only just moved down the street.  so everyone, put down your butter knives, it's all good, they are now right across from Walgreens!!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
this is the only place i know of that makes milk tea with REAL tea and REAL milk (half and half or cream).  none of that coffemate crap that i can't stand.

i just wish they would flavor up their boba a little (with honey perhaps?  like my favorite boba place in the whole world - volcano tea in west holllywod)

*update* - don't get the popcorn chicken here - it's soggy, salty, and over marinated.  get it next door at quickly instead (but hide your wonderful drink if you do, they won't let you bring it in)
author: Josie M.

description: Best place to pick up a milk tea! The reason... its more caffeinated! This is the only place with a milk tea that can keep me up! Anytime im around the area I would come here for a drink. Cant go wrong with their milk tea!
author: Bruce L.

description:
My go-to tapioca place. It did used to taste better when they were at the old location and there were 2 or 3 guys who made each one fresh in the shaker thing. But now, it's still 1 of my 2 fave tapioca places. Lychee tapioca or with lemon jelly is good! Try it hot, too!!

Tea eggs are also yummy. Sometimes it seems questionable how long the candy has been there, but it depends what you are getting.
author: Anita C.

description:
Probably one of the first tapioca shops to open up in the Sunset District, if not in the entire City of San Francisco, Wonderful Foods hits the mark with tapioca. My personal favorite is just straight up Tapioca Milk Black Tea; and it is done to perfection. 

I still remember the first day it opened, as I used to live a black away. Honestly, my family (my mom's from Taiwan) feels that this place is authentic as the ones served in the stands of Taiwan and it stays true to this date ten-plus year after its inception. 

It also has candies that I used to snack down on a lot ranging from gummy coca-cola bottles to some things that you can only see in Taiwan.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
With Quickly's popping up on every corner I do not know how this place has survived!  I am happy that they are still in business and i will continue supporting them.  

I like Wonderful Foods over Quickly because their stuff seems to taste better.  I would even say, that to me, their stuff tastes better than  every other place that I have had pearl drinks at.   Personally, I like getting the strawberry- banana with tapioca which always tastes mmm-mmmm delicious.
author: Jonnathan C.

description:
I have been coming to this place since high school and have always thought their milk tea boba was the best. I just decided to visit this place again after a long while and it's still the best milk tea I've had in the city, though I don't care for their other drinks since the flavored ones here usually contain powdered and artificial flavor. But here's one thing I researched about boba on line last night while trying to figure out how healthy these drinks were for you and was surprised by my discovery; did you know that one 16oz cup of milk tea with pearls can have as many anywhere between 400-1000 calories most of which coming from the boba itself as one little boba turd can have up to 14 calories in it? Yes, I know kind of hard to believe but it's true; just check out hungrygirl.com and type in Boba drinks. Or you can also view Lolly cup's website and see their nutritional facts page for the calories in each drink.

So, I was really surprised after all the Pilate's I've been doing every week, and was wondering why it seemed like I wasn't shedding a single pound even though I was eating pretty healthy, watching my carbs and drank zero soda or juice in nearly two months except for teas and of course bubble tea. But now I know where a lot of those extra calories came from, my beloved milk tea =( 

Guess I'll be cutting back on the pearls quite a bit, or getting it without. But anyway, thought this information might be of interest to others who have been wondering where all those extra calories they have been consuming were coming from. I honestly will say though, I can't see myself cutting those little rabbit "turds" (as one person previously referred to them as) out completely, but I'm definitely going to cut back on how often I enjoy them from now on. 

NOTE: We need to start requesting that these bubble tea places start offering healthier alternatives to the teas they mix with milk, because even if your having your milk tea plane, consider the fact that their either using whole milk or dairy creamer to make your drink which is adding quite a bit of fat into it. They should really offer skim milk and soy milk options as the many coffee chains and shops have been doing, because it's honestly not fair to have to chose between staying healthy or having to deny yourself your favorite food or drink because of it.
author: Petra S.

description:
The bubble tea here is the best in SF.  We tried the jasmine tea and the milk tea, but I preferred the jasmine tea.  They give you lots of tapioca too.  The container is covered with the clear top; I prefer the sealed tops.  They also have lots of candy for sale as well as lee hing muy and dried asian fruits.  
This place replaces my peninsula fav, Tea Era on Castro Street, Mountain View.
author: H G.

description:
My favorite tapioca place in the city.  I'm enamored of this place because:

1) Their balls are properly big gooey and chewy.  The way all balls should be (Tapioca balls that is).  
2) Family Owned!!!
3) Candy galore
4)  Tea eggs at the counter (I know I can make these at home, but I'm too lazy to)
5)  Pooh-bear machines at the door.  

That's all I got to say.  It fills in my cravings and it's open late.
author: Ke-Bear Z.

description:
I make my husband drive me all the way out to the outer sunset specifically for the bubble tea at Wonderful foods. I'm not too adventurous, I just get the basic tapioca milk tea... but let me tell you... it is So SO so good. I want one now....

And the big bins of candy are tempting too...
author: Melissa J.

description:
I've been coming to this place since college and have always loved this place.  

However, the past few times we've come, the food and service has been unforgiveable. Tonite was the last straw. 

The cashier lady was grooming her dog on a table near the front counter. GROSS!!!! probably not legal by SF sanitation standards. As we prepared to order, she came over to take our order, then promptly returned to cutting her dog's hair.

Okay okay, i guess i can look past that for some good boba.  We ordered our staple drink: taro tapioca. 

The drink was way too sweet, way too milky, and was lukewarm/cold. (we ordered it hot). 

It's weird to suck up the drink and to get first cold, then lukewarm, then sugar syrup, then cold again. We actually decided not to finish the drink and bring it home to try to salvage...  

I use to be envious of my cousins who live a block from this cafe, but not anymore!!!!
author: Geoff L.

description:
I've been going to Wonderful Foods Co. for my drinks since I was in elementary school. It's one of the few places that make the Lychee Milk Tea. A lot of places just make the Lychee into a juice or slush without the milk tea. 

Wonderful has a wide variety of drinks. I think they're better then Quickly. It is a bit more expensive, but well worth it. Other favorites I like are the Watermelon and Honey Dew. They are quick and fast even when they are busy during really hot days in SF. If you're looking for the best Lychee Milk Tea, this is the place to go.
author: Jerold C.

description: This place has some of THEEE best tapoica in SF and my friends and I come here often. They have a great selection of tapioca drinks and non tapioca drinks such as teas and fresh juice drinks. I like that they stay open late since thats the only time I ever seem to go there and sometimes it's very crowded and other times it's not. Would give this place 5 stars if they had some indoor seating.
author: Sara C.

description:
Okay.. So this is my friend's favorite spot to get tapioca/milk tea drinks. Not so much my initial preference, but I wouldn't degrade it at all. This place is legit for its size & ambiance.

Say you go in midday, this place is hella empty. On the left, you have popular candy, ones that look colorful & sweet. The other side, more bland colored, candies/jerkies, none of which are described in English. So I got a Taro milk tea with the boba & it wasn't upsetting at all. The taro was on point, but the boba started to become a nuisance the more I went on with the drink. I wish they had baby pearls. Haha.

If you go late night, this place is swarming with people. Becomes more of a wait to get your drink & becomes one of the more crackin' chill spots in Sunset.
author: Mike M.

description: More expensive than the other drink place on the block, but they use really fruit, so you really get what you paid for. I know for their Avocado shake, they use real avocado, and they're not being cheap, they use enough avocado to make the shake thick. Their popcorn chicken is different in a good way, but you pay double from what the other place offers. I like their Durian shake too.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description:
their dogs are so adorable! 

Candy and smoothies with boba. YUMM!
I think my friend makes the strawberry mango something smoothie. AMAZING!

GET A SMOOTHIE! mostly fresh fruit!
author: Vee 2.

description: I really wish I got the boba with my tea because the tea itself tasted like something I could have gotten at tapex... I'll try a diff tea next time.
author: Kim P.

description: This is my absolute favorite place to get boba! I stick to the basic Milk Tea.
author: Stella L.

description:
I ordered a Kumquat Jelly Tapioca drink.  A big mistake!  I had specifically told them "I want less sugar.'  However, my drink was so so sweet.  Kumquat drink is supposed to be like peach color.  This drink looks so yellow.  Basically, it tastes like sugar water.  Yuck!  

I also bought some candy and dried fruits.  They taste no difference with what you can buy in Asian grocery stores.  I spent like ten bucks here here.  But, the store clerk didn't even say 'thank you' when I paid.
author: J L.

description:
I order the lychee green tea, no milk, no boba, $3.25...
(mmm real cut up lychee bits...)

"LYCHEE GREEN TEA!!"

BAM!  Im outta there sub-3 minutes. Every. Single. Freakin. Time.  Speed, Quality, and Consistency folks, that's wat im talkin about...

I love you WFC!  But i hate Irving parking!  *fist in the air*

... and thanks for playing the asian hits im so familiar with...
author: Ethan L.

description:
It just so happens that I used to frequent a tapioca place in San Mateo after Chinese school every Saturday. One day it disappeared, and I was left with options such as Tapioca Express and Quickly. How depressing. I've tried tapioca at other Asian restaurants/markets and nothing compares to Wonderful Foods Co. I stopped eating tapioca regularly for a good 6 years or so--why waste money on something that won't be made perfectly every time?

It also just so happens that I recently moved to the Outer Sunset without knowing that there was another Wonderful Foods Co. only two blocks away! Fate! And the boba cravings return. Oh man. Time to relocate my tent to the sidewalk in front of the store.

Specific comments: I feel that mentioning how their pearls are always cooked to soft and chewy perfection is redundant (see other reviews below). So I won't elaborate on that. Favorite flavors? Lychee milk tea and lychee juice (it comes with jelly but I always ask for tapioca). Watermelon is also amazing and refreshing on a nice day. They use fresh fruit!
author: Liz L.

description:
Milk tea... with real fruit!?
I couldn't believe my roommate. In fact, I told him it was impossible!
The Quicklys of the world have established that powdered mixes and lightly steeped tea doused with a tooth-aching amount of sugar is the acceptable standard for milk tea. In the Bay Area only a small few have chosen to rise above this sorry excuse for a base line. Milk tea fans in the city have often lamented at the dearth of delicious tea shops, lauding the merits of South Bay institutions like Fantasia and Tea Era.
But, no more: there is a legit milk tea shop in town. And, it isn't in Chinatown.
A bit out of the way, my roommate had to convince me that coming here was worth the distance for a milk tea fix. I have over time deteriorated my standards to accept the artificial likes of Quickly and Quickly knock-offs but when I had my first sip of honeydew milk tea--with real frickin' honeydew--I was a believer.
Real. Honeydew.
The regular milk tea is also quite good, not my absolute favorite but it does remind me of a smooth coffee-tea I had in Taiwan way back when the fad was first starting off... But no, it's the fresh fruit teas that have me coming back. If you're a tapioca fan (I have my days now and then), Wonderful has your back with delicious, perfectly QQ tapioca.
The best part? I just found out this place opens till midnight. TILL MIDNIGHT.
Think of the consequences this might bring!!!
author: Jessica L.

description: This spot is old school! I remember going to the location across the street and a block away like 8 years ago. There drinks have a more smoothie like texture and not just straight iced, watered down in 5 mins. I always come back for the mango or watermelon with no tapioca balls. Ask for a large and for a $1 more you get a huge drink. I try not to come here too often but when you get that craving I'm usually grabbing one from here and not settling for a drink from Quickly like places.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Thumbs down to Quickly! Shame on them for driving out Double Rainbow and forcing Wonderful Foods to move across the street. Then again, with the whole Ed Jew thing, not sure if it's entirely their fault.

ANYWAYS... I'm not a big tapioca milk tea drinker anymore, but am still a huge fan of Wonderful Foods. The regular milk tea is perfect. Never too sweet or too bland. Just right. The tapioca balls are also good texture. My favorite... The Almond Milk Tea. YUUUUMMM....

Now, if only Wonderful Foods carried almond jello. The most perfect drink at Double Rainbow prior its closing was a regular almond milk tea with almond jello, no tapioca. *drool*
author: Teresa Y.

description: Yelp reviews brought our group of 5 here after lunch nearby and why this place is so highly rated remains a mystery to me.  Out of the 5 drinks, only one didn't need numerous repeats, unacceptable unless these employees are new hires which did not seem like the case. In general, these drinks were overly sweetened with minimal tea flavors. My oolong milk tea tasted more like jasmine and the pearls were soggy.  It makes me wonder if we did not order their specialty drinks but our orders were pretty standard for tea places and they really should've tasted better.. (Pudding milk tea, honey green tea, jasmine milk tea)  I was thoroughly disappointed.
author: Pei L.

description:
Best bubble tea in San Francisco!  

I am a Milk Tea with Boba kinda girl - mainly because I can't pass Milk Tea up to try another flavor!  The flavor, texture, and firmess of Boba is spot-on, the Milk tea is the right amount of milk and sweet, and enough ice to keep it cold without watering down the drink.

I only wish Wonderful Food Company would open another Boba spot down on the Peninsula near where I work!
author: Sadie S.

description: Ya' got some sweet balls (of tapioca) on ya'.  Wonderful Foods...it's not just a good name.
author: Laura G.

description:
Drink up!

Want Candy?

Buy some.

Unless you have a van without windows.

Then you are creepy.

$3.25 for a Thai Ice Tea
author: Po L.

description:
Some of the best damn boba in the city! Great place and you get that formaldehyde and sugar smell coming while walking down the street. Really good Avocado boba (if you've read my reviews before you'd know I LOOOOVE AVOCADO IN ICE CREAM AND SMOOTHIE FORM!!!) 

I've been here a number of times, since they've moved they're still the best!
author: Eric A.

description:
I have been a regular here for a great amount of time now... probably since my HS days! And if I still been getting weekly cravings... Wonderful is doing something right!

#28 please! (Lychee Tapioca with Coconut Jelly)
And if I really feel like splurging... a soy sauce egg and some salt & pepper chicken.

The candy here is almost always an impulse buy. I don't think many people go in there in the intentions of buying candy or asian snack goodies... most of the time its in the intention of tapioca.
author: Crystal S.

description: the original boba joint. ahh the days of shooting tapioca at passing cars (before i had one.) immature I know and now that i think about it, a waste of good boba. I've had it mushy here once, but i think the son or something let it cook too long...usually it's good, lychee tea, with lychee and lychee jelly (crystals)...also all the gummies/salted plums, dried fruit you could desire...or dried cuddle fish if you're into that type of thing (i'll pass). why are chinese, mexican and pretty much any other ethnic snacks way better than american...bleh pringles and skittles.
author: Lily G.

description:
It has been 14 years since the first time I've been to this place. And I have never stopped to come here. 
This is, plain and simple, the best tapioca place in San Francisco. With their high rating my individual opinion becomes pretty much a fact.

Large selection of different types of tapioca drinks, smoothies, teas, and snacks. This place is champ.
author: Mike S.

description: After finding a place to park we came here. Small little shop and no tables. The Almond milk tea w/ boba was really good. The wife had watermelon juice w/ bobas. She said it was good.
author: Don F.

description:
BEST TAPIOCA PLACE ON EARTH!!!! Not. 


LOVE THEIR MANGO TAPIOCAS!! I WISH TAPIOCAS didnt have all that syrup tho.. its great they use fresh mangos tho, thats the only reason why I go :)
author: Princess S.

description:
There are few things I REALLY crave for: sushi, raw oysters, cupcakes, and Wonderful Foods. But not just anything my friends, only their lychee milk tea with almond jelly, hold the tapioca please. 

I got some disgruntlements with this place though, but when I drink that - life is good and so is Wonderful Foods. For one, when I order tapioca with my drinks, I always get a lot of the syrup that holds it. That's a negative. I always order the same drink, but it's never the same price. I don't argue cause I don't know the real price is. It's more expensive when the boss lady rings you up. How do you avoid being overcharged?  Look out for the one talking loudly on the phone stratigically wedged between her ears and her shoulders.  

Once, I came here with my friend and her little brother. He wanted candy so he went to get some and ended up spilling a few on the floor. So the same lady comes and sweeps it up without saying anything. Nice right? No, because that swept up, floor germed candy went straight back into the boxes. So the next time you go to Wonderful, think twice before buying the candy. Just stick with the drinks. And hope it's not the boss lady ringing you up.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
The sign proclaims it the "Best Tapioca in Town".

Well, it's certainly the most popular boba spot in town (assuming review count = popularity), but I've definitely had better boba, if not in SF then at least in LA.  In a nutshell, good boba should have a very rich, layered, 3-dimensional taste.  The oatmeal boba here succeeds on that front with its bran-muffin-like overtones, but the almond boba tasted like they mixed equal parts almond extract and sugar and dumped it in some milk.  Way too strong and sweet--no subtlety at all.  Still, I'd like to see how they do on the uber-classic flavors like taro and green tea.

They also have an impressive candy (and jerky) selection, but note that there is nowhere to sit down.
author: Wes M.

description:
Poor San Franciscans. I think Wonderful Foods really is one of the best options for pearl tea in SF but it really isn't the best out there, esp if you compare it to some of the South Bay plces. Simple place with some candy/snack offerings on the side and the pearl tea counter in the back. Good variety of pearl drinks and other drinks (about 50 of them). 

The tapoica balls deserve honorable mention since they were good consistency (not too chewy and not too hard) but I couldn't really taste any green tea in the green milk tea. And when I asked for coconut jelly (which their board listed), they gave me lichee jelly.

Bottom line: Good pearl tea for San Francisco (3.5 stars) but shocked how I think this is the best SF has to offer with its huge Chinese population. For great pearl milk tea or boba tea, you GOTTA come down to South Bay and try Fantasia in Cupertino/Milpitas or Tea Era in Mt View- their milk tea and pearls are in a different league.
author: Jim C.

description: Coming here for boba is theeee best! I like that this place has a limited selection of boba tea, but their options are all good. I really like their "Lychee Tea", "Passion Fruit Tea" and their "Strawberry smoothie". I like the fact that their lychee tea has lychee chunks in it with the boba. Everything tastes so fresh and they give you a good amount of boba. Their strawberry smoothie is blended really well and the consistency is perfect. I also like how this place doesn't try to be like a frozen yogurt shop too like Quickly's or Tapioca Express selling fro-yo. The snacks they sell here are a bunch of asian snacks like Hello Panda, Pocki and a bunch of other candies. Come here at night time! It is a great fix for something fruity.
author: Katrina T.

description:
Oh thank goodness the store is just on the other side of the street - I thought it was really gone when I walked by today.  

I don't care how many of these tapioca stores there are in the bay area, this place still has the BEST BOBA EVER!

My faves are: Almond, Red Bean, Watermelon, Peach Tea.  Go with the fresh stuff.  I don't care much for the powdered ones.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
Okay so my old review was for their old location. There use to be 2 or 3 guys who made the drinks perfectly.  I guess they don't work here anymore. A couple weekends ago, it took me several minutes walking up and down Irving to find it's new location. 

Man.....I really miss their old place and their old workers, since it didn't feel quite the same. Surprisingly I asked several people in the neighborhood where did the Tapioca Drink shop was? Most of them had no clue. Of course the bright green sign...and I found my way....FYI It's across the street a block or so from it's old location. I must have not gone here in a couple years....wow. This place looks smaller and they condensed all the candy goodness. My tapioCa drink was alright, but still way better than most other places. 

I completely agree with Anita C. Sorry down graded to 4 stars.
author: Cathy D.

description: This was my first visit here, so i stick with a milk tea tapioca which was just alright.  What i liked about the store was the variety of candy and dried fruit snacks they offer.  I was so happy to see that they had chocolate gummy bears for i have not ate one in a long long time! soo i scooped some and it was delicious as i remembered.
author: Ann L.

description: awesome boba milk tea! chewy tapioca balls and strong tea. coconut, grass jelly, and green tea also are good choices. recently added a sweet red bean filled freshly made pastry. similar to the red bean goldfish shaped pastries served at May's coffee house in J-town. check them both out.
author: Jeff W.

description: good quality boba, it's also nice to hear people speaking Taiwanese =) not many of us in SF
author: Tiff W.

description:
I've search high and low for good pearl milk tea. I've had plenty of "thin" milk teas (and with mostly ice cubes). But Wonderful Foods has not disappointed me thus far (after a dozen or so times). The prices for their milk teas are reasonable, everything is fresh and they all have good flavor and consistency. The tapioca is not too soggy. I've tried the Thai tea, lychee, coconut, and almond, to name a few. I haven't tried their foods, but their bulk candies are usually fresh and they carry a good variety of western and eastern junk foods0.

I don't think you're supposed to keep dogs in a place that serves food, but I always love the bichon frises that are there in the late evenings when I get my milk tea.

After finding Wonderful Foods, I definitely can't go to a Quickly's any more.
author: Ellen S.

description: Yummers. I love this place. The tapioca drinks are super good. Made to order. The tapioca balls aren't hard or taste like they have been sitting around. They have bins of candy and bins of dried fruit. All so good! I feel like a kid in a candy store when I'm here!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Pretty yummy. Candy store as well so you can pick up some of that if you are craving even more sweets.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Since I was 10, I've been a fan of milk tea and have had a special place in my stomach for it..no matter how full I am, I can always have room for milk tea =P. So I've been to lots of milk tea places over the years, and I have to say this is one of the best, if not THE best milk tea I've ever had.
I've haven't tried a wide variety of their drinks, since usually I just always order a black milk tea with something added in it--I've only had pearls, lychee bits, and almond jelly. The pearls are good, just pretty standard I guess..but not hard and tough to chew like a lot of other places. I like how the lychee milk tea actually has little lychee bits instead of just lychee syrup or that artificially flavored lychee jelly. Right now I LOVE the almond jelly! I love how they use real almond jelly, which has the consistency of pudding.
I just really like the milk tea because they make it right in front of you instead of just scooping out pre-made milk tea that's been sitting around for a while, so it tastes very fresh. The milk tea is fragrant and you can actually taste the tea, unlike most milk tea places where it just tastes like pure sugar or cream. I've tried my friend's almond tapioca, which is just almond milk I think (no tea) with pearls, and that is delicious as well! It's pretty thick, not like the almond milk you can buy at stores.
TeaWay is okay, but I'd prefer Wonderful Foods any day. True, it's more expensive, but I don't mind paying a little extra for delicious milk tea :).
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
It may be one of the best tapioca in town, but definitely not the best.

They have an exciting menu, some of them are fresh fruit smoothies, so i guess it's ok to be pricey. I tried very hard to like it since it's owned by Taiwanese, which suggests authenticity, but still, the taste disappointed me so many times that I stopped going there, for good.

Once I paid almost $4 for a fresh taro tapioca, but the taro tasted like it's gone bad. The pearls always tasted weird to me, and I think it's from the cheap artificial sweetener.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
As far as I'm concerned this is the best Boba drink spot in SF. Unfortunately their menu isn't quiet as diverse as others(Quickly for example), the flavors they do have make up for it.

The flavors constantly blow my mind...they taste EXACTLY like they should, ridiculous.
author: Vilen G.

description:
Best pearl milk tea I've had in San Francisco. The tapioca pearls are actually soft, instead of hard and unfresh, which can be experienced at places that don't serve as much milk tea. 

The taro flavor is great here. The double Rainbow next door is pretty good too, but the tapioca pearls here are better.
author: Joyce G.

description:
BEST POPCORN CHICKEN PLACE! However.... on their milk teas..

So here's the story. I'm a sucker for trying new things. New drinks that sound cool that might be good. However, it was my mistake to try the mint green tea here. Barely any mint taste at all... barely any tea taste either. Perhaps just pure sugar? I also had their grass jelly instead of the boba and eh you can't really mess that up.

But, popcorn chicken here is the best! It's flavored with basil with just the right amount of spicyness. So lesson here, stick with the familiar boba drinks... and order the popcorn chicken!!
author: Helen H.

description:
I LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE getting tapioca from here. First tapioca store opened in SF. I remember coming here all the time when I was younger. Though the prices have gone up significantly, I still consider this place my favorite. I rather support a family owned place rather than a chain store such as Quicklys. 

My favorite is #1 tapioca milk tea (was $2.50 and currently $2.75) and #28 .. I think it's called lychee tapioca (was $2.75 now $3.99). Perhaps I will make a trip there sometime today or tomorrow. mmmm!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
I EFFING LOVE TAPIOCA WITH A PASSION.
This place will give you EXTRA.. yeah I MEAN A LOT... when you ask for more unlike QUICKLY'S that will charge you 50cents more for a measly scoop... they do it for free and they LOAD it.
author: Johnny T.

description: I Love this place. the workers are nice and they chat with you when they have time. the price is very reasonable, and it is pretty clean compared to other boba places. the tapioca is the right texture and the tea is not too sweet and not too bitter. its perfect =)
author: Jenni W.

description:
This is the place I crave whenever I was in Davis. Everytime I came back for work or the weekend, I'd always stop here. My favorites are the lychee milk tea and the avocado shakes. I'm not huge on tapioca, though. I think this place makes the best milk teas in san francisco. I remember when it was next to quicklys, people would come in and go out and go into quicklys because they weren't used to milk teas and stuff like that and would rather go into quickly for the blended powder/syrup drinks.
They serve fried food here too, if you like fish cakes and spicy food. They have fried tempura here, which basically is deep fried fish cakes, viet kind and they add chilli pepper and flash fried basil. Delish. However, it does take a while for them to make the food compared to the drinks. Another plus is they open everyday till like midnight. So, my cravings are always satisfied at night.
author: dI c.

description: Best tapioca in the city.  Balls are not too soft, not too hard, just right.  ;) Great FRESH ingredients instead of powders and syrups.  Mango is the absolute best.  They also have some beef jerky and candy by the pound you can buy, as well as tea eggs.  Wish it was not so far away.
author: Maxine S.

description: Most genuine and WONDERFUL! Don't settle for those fake cheap stuff down the block! Been their loyal customer for over 10+ years.
author: John W.

description:
4.5 stars. 

Been coming to this place since I was a little kid, when it used to be located down one block across the street and this place still continues to be my favorite place for boba because the consistency of their tapioca pearls are perfect and so is the milk tea, it's never ever powdery! 

I always get the strawberry and taro milk tea, but recently I've started to try other kinds of milk tea. It's either a hit or miss. Avoid the Cantaloupe Fresh Fruit Tapioca (just cantaloupe and too much ice) and the Lychee Milk Tea (it's just their milk tea with lychee strips?). However, the Avocado and Mango Milk Tea were superb! Too bad there's no seating.
author: Claire F.

description: Whenever I'm craving boba this is the first place I think of. Their green milk tea is delicious! It's not too sweet and the milk to tea ratio is done just right! Their tapioca pearls are some of the best I've ever tasted! It's not overly sweet or chewy and they're never clumped together like at some of the other places I've been to. I would give this place five stars, but the service is inconsistent. On multiple occasions the girl behind the counter just slammed my drink down like she were doing me a favor by letting me patronize their business. No thank you or even a smile. Rude!
author: Danielle W.

description:
This place is my favorite boba place in the city! I always get the coconut milk tea and it's always delicious!!!!! It's always very coconut-y, not too sweet, and served with perfectly chewy tapioca balls. The milk tea is also very good- made with strong, black tea, and not artificial tasting like some other chains in the area.

The place has a pretty good candy selection, too.

Let's support the locals, especially if they're doing a great job!!
author: Carmen L.

description: One minute before closing and I called in for an order of watermelon with one pump/scoop of sweetener and they didn't turn me down... Wth were they thinking... Thanks guys!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I've been coming to this place for tapioca drinks since 1997 when they were probably the only place in the bay area (at least from what i knew then) that sold them. Now, tapioca drinks (or pearl tea, or boba, or whatever else they call it) are all over the place. I have to say this place is still the best. I usually always go for the milk tea, but they do have a kick ass mango and honeydew as well. 

my best friend used to always say "i love sucking these balls..." right before we took our first sip...ahhh, memories ;-)
author: Pippi L.

description: My favorite place for tapioca drinks in the Bay Area.  I've tried many but always come back to this one.  My consumption of tapioca drinks has declined with age but when I have a craving, I come here.  My faves are the milk tea, coffee, fresh strawberry and the fresh mango flavors.
author: Christina H.

description:
Best tapioca place in San Francisco. I've been a patron for more than ten years and although my allegiance has faltered a couple of times, I always return back to this place.

1. Perfect tapioca - excellent texture and not too sweet.

Tapioca should have a chewy consistency, with the center being slightly solid. Wonderful Foods Co gets it right every time! The tapioca never clumps together (meaning that it's never ignored). Although the flavor is slightly on the bland side, I find that lack of sweetness better complements the drink. 

2. The drink itself is rich and flavorful. Not watery at all!

Many other tapioca places water down their milk teas but this place keeps it rich! I find the flavors very intense and well worth the $2+. Their regular milk teas have a hint of chocolate that people tend to enjoy. I always get the milk green tea and that has never disappointed me. Be aware that if you choose tapioca, some of the syrup will transfer to the drink, thereby sweetening it. 

3. Quick, friendly service.
