You order and within a few minutes it's done! Line moves very quickly and since tax is included in the price of the drink, the math is easy to calculate. 


I did not find out they had alternative toppings like grass jelly until a couple of months ago. Ask for their range of toppings if you'd like!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
-1 star: The young ish girl who made my drink yesterday was so bitchy.  Not only did she listen in our conversation and laugh at me, she also gave me this "look"  uhhh wtf mind your own business?
-1 star: She sloppily made my drink
-1 star: She slid the drink across the counter for me to catch...?
-1 star: She did not say thank you
+1 star: I got a decent green milk tea for $2.50
author: Natalie P.

description: I have a new found addiction for boba don't ask because I don't know why either, but since I have been back in the city I have been going over to teaway alot. Until at last one of my friends came back from sd and insisted on me retrying wonderful! So, went in and got exactly what he normally gets a number 3 with less sugar and boba (lychee milk tea?) and now I am a new believer in wonderful! and they have the buildables coin things here! AND they sell bomb candy!!! can't ask for more in a boba place! now only if they would open one near san bruno!
author: Christine Q.

description: I used to live in the Sunset and Wonderful Food Co is by far my favorite boba cafe. They are not expensive and the banana milkshake boba might be the best drink I have ever had. The candy is also really good and they have a lot of variety. If you're ever in the Sunset, you should definitely come here ^__^
author: Clara D.

description: Decent tapioca place.  I'm not exactly sure why this place has so many good reviews b/c I didn't see anything special about their drinks.  I got their green apple green tea with tapioca and I thought it was okay.  The tapioca was chewy and the drink wasn't all that sweet which I didn't mind.  I also got the crispy chicken which was a bit on the greasy side.  It got kind of soggy at the end of it.  Another down side about this place is that there's no where to sit.  It's just a chinese snack store that sells drinks.  It would be nice if they could set up some tables and chairs for people to sit and enjoy their drinks and snacks.
author: Joyce L.

description:
I'm totally digging their new spot!  As always, the boba is super yummy!  I usually get the milk tea with boba and grass jelly.  The boba is always the perfect consistency and the milk tea is never overly sweet.  On a cold night, they'll even warm it up for you!  Mmmmmmmmmmmmm!

Another favorite of mine are their soy sauce eggs...check them out in the big rice pot to the left of the boba counter.  

By far, the best boba place in town!
author: Christy L.

description:
Since I'm an ABC, I had no idea what 'boba' or 'tapioca drinks' were until this place opened up on Irving.  Every person that loves tapioca drinks knows that this is the birthplace of the boba explosion in San Francisco.  It still makes the best tapioca milk tea in town.  Forget about the chains in the name of Tapioca Express and Quickly (both of these chain store names allude to speed in preparing the drinks, but honestly, they're not that hard to make, so you can get it real fast ANYWHERE).  I just wished they made a sesame milk tea drink...

What's not on their menu anymore but they will make for you if you ask is their shaved ice bowl:  Shaved ice and 3 layers of anything you want..whether it's grass jelly, tapioca balls, red bean...etc.  It is so good, you can enjoy it even in this SF cold weather.
author: Liz C.

description:
It's all about the durian pancake things. Hot, steaming durian flesh. Those around me aren't so pleased when I order it.

And do I really need to tell you? Their drinks are all amazing. The pearl milk tea, always the benchmark, is fantastically strong, sweet, and frothy. Their shakes are thick, sweet, and flavorful. The service is usually rather pleasant.
author: Center J.

description:
Best milk tea and tapioca shop in the city.  They make fresh batches of tapioca, which is absolutely the key to get that 'al dente' texture and translucent color.  

Don't forget to try their Asian snacks as well, their popcorn (salt and pepper) chicken is quite delicious.
author: matt c.

description: The original boba milk tea place on Irving, this place is made of sweet cravings and diet temptations. Their boba is perfectly chewy with a hint of brown sugar sweetness. The tea egg aroma is what reminds me of warm childhood days at it's original location. Although Quickly and Tea way moved into the hood, the milk tea at this place is legit. The tea is not from a formula and you can smell the aroma of tea when sipping it through it's sturdy cup. Don't get me wrong, I love the novelty of being able to self serve different jellies/bobas/pudding in my cup with my milk tea but in the end the milk tea here reins supreme.
author: Wanster L.

description:
YUM! When I was little and my dad dragged me into this terrible salon and I'd come out crying cause they like sheared off my beautiful hair, he'd bring me here and buy me a tapioca drink and then I'd come out smiling again. 

Whooo.
author: M J.

description: This place has the best boba I've ever had! If you don't like the traditional milk tea, I would highly recommend the peach tapioca. This store also has a huge variety of Asian and American candies, but you can find the same for cheaper at the surrounding grocery stores. I would give it five stars, but the owners always have their dogs in the store.
author: Soo L.

description: probably the best boba place in terms of tea flavor in sf. This place also sells a bunch of chinese candies. The boba milk tea wasnt as good as fantasia in the san jose area but the boba was cooked and sweetened properly. The cost was $2.75 and they dont charge tax compared to $2.18 at teaway. Its a good alternative if you want to upgrade your boba milk tea but more often than not ill probably go to teaway for the variety of toppings and frequency card.
author: Robert Y.

description:
They are family friends, but I believe they still have the best boba/tapioca in the city, perhaps in the bay area. The family is from Taiwan and their tapioca and milk tea is spot-on.

A few years ago, you'd always find a group of asian kids standing/squatting outside in front drinking boba late at night. I would always have to squeeze between the highlighted hair, long guy bangs, and puffy jackets to get in. Aside from that minor annoyance, this is still the place to go for proper boba. Try the mango boba.. it's a little pricy but they blend real mangos and it won't keep you up if you can't hang with caffeine.

It's true, the decor could use a little work and a few tables & chairs wouldn't hurt, but I come here for the boba and I'm out.
author: Dave C.

description:
After hearing so many wonderful things about Wonderful Foods, I decided to wander over. Being one of the Bay Area's self-proclaimed leading pearl tea addicts, I sampled their black pearl tea, the pad thai of pearl teas. I was disappointed. It had a distinct coffee flavor to it. I suspect they used the same cup to mix my pearl tea drink as they had used to mix a mocha pearl drink. 

If I liked coffee, this would not have been a big deal at all, but alas, coffee is one of three things that I will absolutely not touch. I will try them again next time I happen to be in the neighborhood, on the chance that they gave me the wrong drink.
author: Frank B.

description:
This is the best tapioca to get in San Francisco. I have been getting it for over 5 years here! My favorite flavor is Honeydew milk tea. The pearls are always chewy, not hard and mushy. I recommend going here on a nice hot day. I go here whenever I happen to be on Irving St.

The drinks are made really fast too.

Good quality drinks!
author: Amanda S.

description:
My friend and I were walking to our car on the way back from lunch and passed this place.  I, for one, was a bit skeptical on getting tapioca here.  It looked a bit ghetto and there was a large open empty space that seemed sad; however, the candy lining the walls was very welcoming.  I was on a mission to get the sweet, sweet tapioca balls and ignored the enticing candies.  

I ordered the green milk tea with tapioca. Very quick service btw. When I got my drink, I was a bit dumbfounded as to why it looked so creamy and white...isn't it supposed to be green?  I had my friend try it first. Heheh. He said it was awful and I should not drink it, but he'd drink all of it FOR me. LIES! It was very good - sweet and yummy.
author: Dolores L.

description:
Quality:
The tapioca drinks at Wonderful foods are the best. I've tasted Quickly and Tapioca Express and they dont compare. Their milk tea formula is probably their secret to their success. If you like it rich and sweet, then you will like it here. If you like your tapioca drinks more bland, then go to Quickly or Tapicoa Express. She hardly does it but if you are really lucky, the owner will make it for you. She makes them the best.

Service:
They are fast but not as friendly as they should be. I go their every week and sometimes I dont even get a "hi" or a "thank you". Sometimes, I feel like they are a bank and we are there making deposits.

Consistency:
Very good. Over the past 5 years, I've only had them remake my drink twice. Once because their entire milk tea batch was bad and another time when some noob made it. But overall they make them consistently good.

What to order:
Cant go wrong with the following (numbers refer to the menu number):
#1 Milk Tea w/ Tapioca
#3 Milk Tea with Lychee w/ Tapioca
Milk Tea with Almond Jello w/ Tapioca (not on the menu) *drool*
author: Roger C.

description: The strawberry mango smoothie is a bit too sweet for me, coming from a person who does not have much of a sweet tooth. But for all the avocado lovers, you've got try their avocado smoothie with tapioca. The texture is rich and thick, and doesn't taste like a powered down drink. $4.25 for a drink may be a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for, unlike other places that sell smoothies with majority crushed ice in the drink. Next time you're in the area craving for a drink, definitely check this place out!
author: Karen L.

description:
3.25 for my favorite cup of Taro tapioca! There was this one chick that used to work the night shift - that girl makes the best blended tapioca drinks in the world. I wish I'd given her more credit for her amazingness.

Takes like, not even 3 minutes to make my Taro boba. There's no chairs though. But whatever, all the cool kids chill standing outside anways.
author: Bentley T.

description:
I always come here whenever I'm in the city for the best strawberry smoothie and milk tea tapioca.
I've tried a few of their other drinks but I always come back to my two favorites. They have a very large selection of drinks and a wall of candies that would satisfy anyone's sweet tooth. 

I don't have to admit to that fact that my high rating is probably due to loyalty but honestly, you can't really go wrong here.
author: Virginia C.

description:
WF probably doesn't need anymore review. With over 500 reviews & 4.5 stars...they are just that great.

I've been coming to this place for a little over 10 years whenever I am in the area or close enough to make a trip there. It has not disappointed me..at least not that I recall. I specifically go there to pick up their milk tea. 

With several competition on the same street, I still pick WF's milk tea over the other bubble tea place. 

Their formula of milk tea just hits my tounge so right that is irreplaceble. Everytime I drink it, I always try to figure out what they put in it...brown sugar..latest guess..they probably add a hint of coffee.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Perhaps my expectations were too high after reading so many positive yelp reviews, or maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but I was not impressed at all with my drink. I ordered some sort of peach drink with tapioca balls. I can tolerate a lot of sugar, but it was so disgustingly sweet that I could not finish it. Not worth my money.

The gummi bears I bought while there were pretty cool, though.
author: Bethany T.

description: Best tapioca drinks in the city.  This is going to sound weird, but keep your minds out of the gutter...the tapioca balls are perfect.  Its not too hard and has the perfect consistency.  I love getting their lychee milk tea.  I usually like to go to Irving Cafe to order the combo banh mi and walk over here while I wait.  It's my idea of a perfect lunch.  Yum!
author: Sandy J.

description:
tough to park but you should find some.

i come here for the almond flavored tapioca drink.  i also get the honey dew melon and whatever else catches my eye.

they don't make it powdery like some places do and its always tasty and right.

i also buy little treats like baby gummy bears or whatever else they have.  they have white chocolate covered gummy bears and milk chocolate covered gummy bears.  lots of candy and asian treats.
author: Bing D.

description: Even if there is a newer boba place a block down, I would still go here. They actually messed up our order and gave us a cold custard boba drink when we asked for a hot one. But when we told them of the mixup they made us a new hot one and let us keep the old one.  That was really generous and they were really nice and apologetic about making a new one. I would cross the bridge just to go here.
author: Chris T.

description:
Okay.  So, to commence my string of reviews I've decided to begin with the place that prompted me to be a yelper in the first place... Wonderful Foods.  

I love wonderful foods, and this place definitely lives up to its name!

A year ago, after living out of the area for awhile, I decided to take a friend to Wonderful Foods for the best boba in the city, while I was visiting. During the entire ride there, I raved about the place, and went down memory lane with all the stories I had associated with going to - eating at - leaving from Wonderful Foods. So we get there and to my dismay the windows to the place was all covered with newspapers. The signs were taken off. 

My heart dropped. 

I was SO distressed over the discovery that the place was shut down that I started bad-mouthing the boba place next door assuming that WF had closed due to loss of business.  

My friend tried to console me and said, "How about we try the place across the street?"

I was hesitant to entrust my tastebuds to any other boba place, but I gave in... At least it wasn't a chain.  So we mosied on over across the street, not really having a craving for boba anymore, and feeling really blue.... 

Then to my surprise, standing at the cash register before me was the owner of Wonderful Foods... Were my eyes deceiving me? Is God playing a cruel joke? NO! Wonderful Foods had MOVED. 

oHMygeeZus.   Why didn't they put a sign on their old location saying they'd moved?! 

Anyway, I was so excited to see the woman that she must've thought I was crazy or high. 

So, to make this already long story, short... I love wonderful foods.  

The only thing I don't normally order is the mango because they use fresh fruit, and I don't likey the stringy stuff stuck in my teeth.

Otherwise, Their flavors are always delicious, their boba ALWAYS the perfect consistency and sweetness.... Try the avocado. :o)
author: Joce A.

description: This has been my go to place for Boba, Watermelon smoothie/juice, or any other Asian dessert drink for that matter for years!! I LOVE their tea eggs and can't get enough of their Lychee Milk Tea. Plus, they are open till fairly late so they definitely have my vote!
author: S D.

description: Its the Best Tapioca in town. I love this place and its open late night. I usually get the the Almond Tapioca and its always good. I've been a fan of theirs for years. I know there are a lot of places on Irving that sell tapioca drinks, but theirs is the best. Love this place.
author: Theresa D.

description: I have been going there since they first opened back in 1994 or 95. Always great service and many selections of tapioca drinks!
author: William C.

description: One of the best places to go grab a tapioca drinks. This place is not as packed as Teaway. Like everyone else, I have to agree about their experiences with the tapioca..it's great! It definitely has a chewy texture that can't be beat elsewhere! On the plus side, they have an eye-popping aisle of asian candies and gummies you can choose from if you ever crave for some sweets. I definitely recommend you try this place if you happen to pass by Irving street =)
author: Nelson L.

description:
I've been coming to this place since Middle school (2004?) when it was across the street next to Quicklys. I love this place! Whenever I come back to the city, I never fail to getting at least one drink from here. The drinks are made in front of you and I'm pretty sure most of their drinks are made from real ingredients, meaning no powder added with water drinks. The drinks are always consistent in flavor. They're also ridiculously fast at making the drinks. 
The prices of the drinks range from $2.75 for milk teas and such to $4.75 (?) for smoothies. This seems kind of pricy compared to Quicklys and Teaway just down the street, but I guarantee that the quality of the drinks are much more worth it. I typically like to go for quality tapioca drinks rather than cheap ones like Quicklys (no offense to the Quicklys lovers)
Okay, so maybe my review is kind of biased because this is a family owned business and the fact that I've grown up going to this place, but this will always remain my favorite tapioca place! Some of my favorite drinks on the menu are grass jelly tapioca, watermelon juice tapioca, passion fruit jelly tapioca, thai tea tapioca, etc. 

Overall, the quality , service and pricing of this place deserves 5 stars. Oh, and this place is super clean :)
author: Sheila X.

description:
San Francisco is seriously lacking in tapioca joints if this is the best in the city..

Although I must say the drinks here were decent; they didn't blow me away. The pearls were soft and chewy but didn't have a sweet honey flavor to them. The lychee drink and pudding tapioca milk tea was okay; they barely gave me any pudding and the tea was a bit weak.



Even though Tea Stations service sucks, they serve better drinks there in my opinion.
author: X F.

description: I've been going to this Tapioca spot for over 10 years now ... it use to be on the other side of Irving and now its directly across from the Walgreens (in between 21st and 22nd Ave) My friends and i frequently went to this tapioca spot well before all these "Quickly"  spots started popping up on every Sunset corner...  Their tapioca drinks are AMAZING!!!  I use to only order coconut or green tea ...but once i ventured out to try honeydew melon and it was unbelievable...watermelon too!!  Out of convenience I have tried Quickly because its closer to my house and it just wasnt the same...  YUMMY!!!  These tapioca's are truly "Wonderful" !
author: Jessica C.

description: My fave boba place in SF. Always consistent and boba has a nice chewy texture to it. I usually get the honey green tea, regular milk tea is good too. They have sour belts too!
author: Andrea Y.

description: Oh man this place is good.  The tapioca is the best in San Francisco.  The fruit drinks are fresh and the tea is strong and  fantastic.  The only thing that kind of drives me is the weird smell.  But overall, this place is the best place on Irving St for Tapioca.
author: Praise C.

description: Have been coming here since the day I found out about it. Loyal customer for years even after all the new tapioca and dessert places started opening up in the neighborhood. Great milk tea, and I love the consistency of it.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Milk tea tapioca - simple and delicious.

Almond tapioca - tastes like almond jello, yummy!

Salt & Pepper Chicken - the only way to go is EXTRA SPICY. Otherwise, you don't deserve to eat it.

Also available are candies in bins and Asian snacks. The candies consist of American-style Sweet Factory fare to Asian savory/sweet delicacies. You also buy by the pound like at Sweet Factory and scoop into bags like Sweet Factory. But Wonderful Foods is anything but!
author: Christine C.

description:
Their boba had good texture! Chewy but not mushy....soft throughout w/o a yucky hard middle like some other places (like Quickly next door).

Having been spoiled by Alhambra & Monterey Park down in SoCal, I realized that people aren't as willing to let you order whatever you want. (my favorite is to mix taro with coconut or red bean with coconut). But the people here at Wonderful were...well....wonderful! They let me mix to my heart's content! : ) So I give them 4 stars...3 for good boba drinks and 1 for their customer service. : )
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Food: Eh...I really didn't like my green apple boba that I ordered. The boba was fine but the drink was way too watery and I was surprised that the drink was already made and was just poured from a container in the fridge after I ordered it. Ptoabably won't come back here...

Price: Drinks were cheap I think.

Service: Not very friendly at all.

Location: Right on Irving St, meter and street parking is available.

Atmosphere: A big place with candy also on the side. They should do more with all the space they have in there!
author: Miss H K.

description:
I think this is the place, along with Quickly, across the street, that helped to bring down SF County Supervisor Ed Jew.  

I try to envision the payoffs, scandal and shenanigans when I walk by, which is often. Their festive boba drinks have been sweetened with intrigue, so to speak.
author: Gopal R.

description:
This is my favorite place for tapioca...nothing else compares. 

My favorite is the Almond Tapioca with Almond Jelly! Wow if you have not had this before, it's amazing! It's not on the menu though...you just gotta ask for it. It's also like a little Sweet Factory inside as well...with candy you can purchase by the pound. It's cheaper than Sweet Factory but the chocolate covered gummies do taste a bit older...but I don't care! 

Don't go to those chains like Tapioca Express and Quickly's! Go to Wonderful Foods!
author: Allan M.

description:
- Almond Tapioca
- Milk Tea Tapioca
- Strawberry Banana Tapioca
- Strawberry Smoothie Tapioca

Those are the drinks I usually go for. They're the best! I tried the Taro flavor; it's really sweet and tastes kind of like vanilla ice cream, but not too bad. Also tried the milk tea tapioca with pudding. The pudding was only mango pudding, so it's more like jello. If you're into that, then go for it! I never get the candy there. It looks like it's been sitting there for awhile. But no doubt, the tapioca is so good. It's sweet and chewy! (That's what she said. HAHA. Just kidding.) My friend and I also find it hard to resist the Salt and Pepper Chicken there. It's pretty damn spicy if you order it that way. But I think it's spicy even if you get mild. I think they're conspiring us to buy more drinks...Oh well. This is the main tapioca place to head to! WAY BETTER THAN QUICKLY'S!
author: Bub B.

description:
Wonderful Foods never cease to satisfy my tapioca cravings. This place offers the best tapioca drinks. I've been coming here for ages. The workers are nice and the service is fast. Whenever I can, I always find myself walking out of this place (as it doesn't offer any seating) with a smile on my face. Honestly, it's difficult for me to try out the different drinks on the menu when I could have their amazing milk tea, but, on two occasions, I've tried their green milk tea and their honey green tea. I find that their green milk tea and honey green tea are more refreshingly light as compared to the milk tea, which is a bit more heavy. The green milk tea now has a slight edge. 

My only problem may be with the tapioca. While they are perfectly chewy and delicious, they overload the drink with tapioca, so much so that nearly half the cup is full of it! I'll be sure to remember to ask them to go easy on the tapioca next time. 

But other than that, this has got to be the best place to get tapioca.
author: Lily C.

description: Wonderful Foods has the best boba in the city! I love how they make the drinks to order instead of pre-made like Teaway or Quicklys (Yuck!). Also, you can actually taste the tea flavor in the drinks. There is usually a short line and the service is quick. My favorite drinks here are the milk tea and the green milk tea!(: I can drink it every day and not get sick of it!
author: Joy Y.

description:
Definitely the best tapioca drink in the City.  I have tried many different tapioca drinks in different cafes but just cannot find one that I will go back.  Definitely not Quickly which is just a fancy place but most of the shopworkers do not know what they are doing.  The drinks are either too sweet or too watery.  The fried chicken strips are either too small or too salty.  Anyway, I know Wonderful Foods now and I can tell that the owners are from Taiwan which is the origin of tapioca drinks.  The tapioca drinks in Wonderful Foods just contain the sweetness that I like and the choices available, though not as much as in Quickly, are really authentic Taiwanese, no somethings fancy and not really edible.

There is not table or chair inside Wonderful Foods, 100% take-out.  I enjoy the drink.  Who care about the table and the chairs?  In case that the food is good there, I will keep going back.

It's fun to go there at night time when the business is slow and see the 2 little doggies in the shop playing, chasing each other and fighting.
author: Roserrele W.

description:
Best Tapioca ever to enter my mouth!
There's also a Beautiful girl who makes the drinks super fast. I almost wish she'd take her time.
Only small thing I have against this place is they only take cash.
author: Roman R.

description:
Best. Tapioca drinks. Ever.

I've been going to these guys since high school for my after-lunch/dinner tapioca drink needs. Everything I've had here has been awesome. Milk tea, green tea, the TARO... all awesome.

I was surprised about the move a couple of years ago, but inside the new place, there's a lot more room to stand... I never really liked the table in the middle of the store at the old place.

Every time I'm in Irving and in need for a drink, most of the time, I end up here... and will probably do so in the future.
author: Chris S.

description:
Their pearls bounce !!!

I hate the pearls in my milk tea. Usually i order the drinks without the pearls, but every once in a while i forget to ask them to not add them in my drinks i'd spit them out and see if they bounce around or stick on the wall. i know the place suck if the pearls just lays there on the floor dead without any sort of bounce, because it tells me that their pearls aren't fresh. Here @ Wonderful Foods Company, their pearls bounce around a bit before it lays there dead. 

And they use real bean paste, instead of flavor powders, FUCK flavor powders
author: Yummy P.

description:
I haven't been here in years as my love for tapioca milk tea has waned.  There was one point in my life where I would get one every week because I loved them so much.  I always got the purple one... taro root.  Damn that was tasty.  The prices here were pretty good back then, even when they were pretty much the only game in town.  

I wonder if the lady at the counter is still tending to those eggs and if the candy bags still resemble to those of Sweet factory? I should go and find out.

Quicklys has moved next to them and there are a lot more competitors around now.  I'm sure they're cutting into their business but hey next time I'm feeling a milk tea, this will definitely be my first choice.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Wondeful Foods is not closed!  It is VERY open... and the milk tea is still as yummy as usual.

The new location is brighter and it sells fruit.  Kinda odd.  Along with paying $2.50 for a #1, you could snag a  Hass Avocado for $1.99.  

The only complaint is the new location has a small doorway.  I can't imagine walking through with someone by my side... we might get stuck there.  =P
author: Michelle W.

description:
First of all, they've moved.  I was worried that when Quickly's came it would hurt their business.  I was sad to see such blatant market saturation was hurting my daughter's favorite place in the world.  No worries, they just moved to the other side of Walgreens.  I will walk down there today and get the address and post it.  

Okay, my little one doesn't know the name of this place.  It's fondly called "the tapicoca drink". That's fine.  Whenever she asks for one, I make her march up to the counter, order her strawberry tapioca drink, and pay for it by herself.  She has been taught to put the remaining change that the cashier gives her into their tip jar which she happily does as she walks away noisily slurrping on her yummy strawberry boba.  It's the little things that make us happy.  Cheers~

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update, the address is now 2035 Irving Street. 
It's next to So Go's and faces Walgreen's now.  So in other words, it's almost diagonally across the street from where it used to be.
author: kim s.

description:
I have been addicted to tapioca drinks for years, and Wonderful Foods is the reason why.   Their tapioca milk tea is simplest the best I have had around the world.  I nearly teared when I heard Quickly has been messing with them and forced them to relocate.  (Do I care if the rumors are even true? )

Anyway, new location is bigger and nicer, but the new hires are not as efficient.  I miss the old crew!
author: Candice B.

description:
So, after Double Rainbow closed and Quickly's just became.....bad, I decided to switch over to Wonderful Foods. WTH was I thinking, I should've just gone here from the beginning!! 

I still love to have my tapioca, but maybe not as often as I used to have them. I've never bought candy here, but I guess most people come here for the tapioca. My cousin used to be a frequent here usually ordering the Lychee Milk Tea until she became lactose intolerance. Boo!! I normally order the Lychee Milk Tea (as a tribute to my cousin, don't you miss this?!?! Kidding! Naw, actually I really like it. They have bits of lychee in it), Strawberry, Mango or Watermelon (all use REAL fruit, YUMM) usually without the tapioca balls. My boyfriend ordered the Passion Fruit tapioca, but that turned out super sweet and we ended up diluting it in water to balance out the sweetness. The next time he ordered the Passion Fruit Green Tea and that turned out to be sweet, but the good kind!  ;D
author: Serena W.

description:
I think there is an addictive additive in these drinks. I just can't get enough! I get one almost everyday and each day I tell myself that I will not get one tomorrow but I end up getting it. #3 (lychee milk tea) with less balls but a little more than less is the best! There are other good ones too but this is my absolute fav. Sometimes I get watermelon with 5 balls or none but still ask for the big straw. They make my drink when they see me walking in already if there is no line. I'm in and out of there quick. The dried squid is good too or if you want something cooked the fish balls are awesome. They also have a wide selection of candy. I love love candy.

I will probably grab one tonight. They stay open late and even on holidays. They never fail me.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Their milk tea taste very authentic, almost as good as the ones in HK. Anyhow, I love their lychee milk tea because it has real lychee bits at the bottom. Their other drink such as taro tapioca or honeydew tapioca (not the fresh fruits one) are made from powder, but it's surprisingly good and don't taste too powdery. But yeah, even though they are made from powder, they really take their time to shake and make the drinks. 

I am not a big fan of tapioca balls, but this place make them just perfect. The chewiness is just perfect and not too mushy.
author: Mandy C.

description:
I love love love Wonderful Foods Co.  My favorites are the Pina Coloda and the Lychee with Coconut Jelly.  The pina coloda boba is rather frothy and there are lots of fresh pineapple.  Same with the lychee w/ coconut jelly - they blend fresh lychee in the drink.

You can definitely taste the quality.  It's much better than Tapioca Express and Quickly's (where they use powder instead of fresh ingredients).  

They take cash only.
author: Ring K.

description:
Best boba in town.

That is the claim they stick on their window and they deliver it. Wonderful foods has been in San Francisco for many years and they make the most consistant delicious boba milk teas in the city. You might think the prices are high for boba but it is quality over quantity. This is no quicklys quick style boba. Here your milk tea is made with quality and care. However. If you like snacks with your boba, Wonderful foods has yet to really expand their snack menu although you do have your usual salt pepper chicken nuggets.

If you in town in the Sunset district, you must definitly try Wonderful foods. Taste the difference!
author: David W.

description: When I saw the sign for Wonderful Foods, i thought it was going to be a health food store or something.  Nope, the place is loaded with candy.  Thank god I was in dire need of some peach gummies, which I haven't had in ages.  I also got some milk tea since I was there and had already betrayed Tea Way earlier that week.  The milk tea was okay and not too tea-based like The Sweet House on Balboa.  The lady who worked there was not thrilled that she had to help someone, even though the place was deserted.  I sat at the single table for a minute while she made the milk tea and it was sticky.  This place is definitely more grab-and-go than stay-and-enjoy.  Not sure if it's worth it over Tea Way though.
author: k h.

description:
Hands down, the best Tapioca in SF! Yes, sometimes their drinks are a little too sweet for my liking, but you can always tell them to make your drink less sweet!

It's a mom & pop establishment that I've been visitng since high school. Damn you Quickly's for moving a business who will trump your serving of "delicious" boba drinks any day, any time.

The tapioca itself is the best in texture, size and taste. I've tried lots of competitors, but always swing back to Irving.
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: Definitely have the best tapioca milk tea around. The places up and down Irving just can't compare! Need to come back to try their snack food.
author: Tiffany L.

description: This is one of my favorite boba spots aside from Share Tea. I've tried their milk tea and jasmine milk tea here and I loved them both! It wasn't too watered down and the boba was very chewy and delicious. The service was also very good. Will definitely come again.
author: Tida P.

description: Ok, i never liked the flavor almond milk tea but it is simply amazing here! it's SOOO GOOD i crave it all the time! It's a must try!! Everything else is ehh.
author: Maggie C.

description:
Best boba I've ever had! I think the environment could use some improving (not really any seating, the menu is just pieces of paper on the wall so it's hard to find some things).
 I had the strawberry mango smoothie with tapioca and it was so good. The boba itself was cooked to perfection and the smoothie was good too, made with fresh fruit.
author: Strid E.

description: Lots of milk tea boba choices on Irving.  This is the best one.  Easy choice.  Not the cheapest but the best flavor and best boba.
author: junk m.

description:
I almost cried when they moved but I didn't know and thought they closed. I realized that they moved when I was standing in a ridiculously long line for Quickly's. Too many HK hipsters.

Not only one of the first if not the very first tapioca place in SF, but THE BEST! I only go to Quickly's if I am desperate and nothing else is around. Who cares about those sealed tops? I always get Taro or watermelon if it is hot. They will mix things if you ask, too. I used to get watermelon/strawberry pretty often. And if you don't want it cold, you can ask them to warm it up. I think they will still do it.
author: Lola S.

description:
I really really like this place!

My fave is of course the lychee milk tea without tapioca. Yea, I don't like getting tapioca anywhere because I'm too lazy to chew that stuff lol. Well the lychee milk tea has little bits of lychee and it makes it ooo so good. The price is way cheap too! When people visit me from other cities, I bring them here and they all end up loving this place!

Their little snacks (chicken, tempura, and the pork blood thing) are good toO! Just expect to wait a while if you order that stuff. Other than that, you can get your drinks pretty fast. The people who work there are friendly too! The best time to come is after work when there aren't too many people around and when there is parking rifght in front!
author: Shu L.

description:
This place is an establishment!!!!  I've been coming here since high school (back in '97!), and the only things that have changed is their location (moved down the street), and their prices (just a slight increase since 11 yrs ago).  I believe this was the first "tapioca" joint that opened in SF...and the quality hasn't changed a bit!  Everything I have ordered here is good.  The only thing is the tapioca balls are pretty much flavorless compared to the newcomers (i.e. TapEx, Quickly, Q-Cup).  

#31.  Pina Colada with Almond Jello.  Can't go wrong my friends...
author: Daniel M.

description: Good snacks selection except for their jerky. The jerky has Strong MSG, was initially not informed, but later on told it was made from home later on. BEWARE.
author: Chloe L.

description: Outside of LA this place had the best bubble tea. I always order #10 (almond bubble tea) and it always hits the spot. This is the place I always recommend to my friends when I think of bubble tea.
author: L C.

description: Their tapioca drinks are by far the best! From their milk teas, to their fruit drinks, it is absolutely perfect. Their milk teas are not too strong and even drinking it at night, I was still able to fall asleep. Their fruit drinks are made with fresh fruit and they are sweet and delicious. They also have a variety of candy which is pretty good. I would say that their best drink is Milk Tea Tapioca. It is #1 on their menu and that's where it belongs because it beats the milk teas for both quickly and teaway hands down!
author: Christopher C.

description: The best tapioca pearls! The drinks are always so good here, and the pearls have the perfect consistency every time. And, what is better than getting a tea drink along with bulk candy!? The bulk candy selection is pretty extensive and there are also a lot of crazy snack items to browse through. I love Wonderful Foods!
author: Amanda D.

description:
Wonderful Foods, how I love thee. My niece and I usually make the 10 minute trip to Irving and 22nd just for some boba at Wonderful Foods, even though we pass about 3 Quickly's (one of them is about 2 blocks from my house, but I don't care) No other tapioca can compare. 

I also love how it's like a family-owned business, which is what San Francisco is known for. Businesses like Wonderful Foods is what makes San Francisco great. If you you want to settle for the mainstream franchises, aka Quicklys, then go ahead, but don't call yourself a true San Franciscan because you're basically selling out. 

I love how like half the drink is tapioca balls, so there is at least like 3 balls with every sip. You can never go wrong with their milk tea, which is my favorite, but every now and then I stray and pick-up a thai tea, which is also quite appetizing. Picking up a drink at Wonderful Foods is a great way to end a day.
author: Katrina C.

description:
5 reasons why Wonderful Foods is the best tapioca milk tea spot in the city:

1.  Hand-mixed drinks made by trained tea masters
2.  The salt & pepper fried chicken (spicy)
3.  The wonderful assortment of sour gummy candies
4.  Mom & Pop better than Chain (Quickly)
5.  Prices have not changed in 10 years

I heart wonderful foods for life.
author: Brandon C.

description:
I love this place!! This is like candy heaven for all those candy lovers out there!!!! They don't really sell a variety of candy but it's still good. =] 

I consistently order the Passionfruit and Lychee babo. Not to mention I also get some candy and some other things (such as sweet seedless plum). The candy that I get are mostly the coca cola gummy bottles (both sour and regular). I just love those things!!! =]
author: Maile W.

description:
They moved to a bigger place and I was hoping they would set up chairs and tables, but nope, they didn't. 

So you go there and buy a drink, but there is no place to sit and enjoy it. 

Their pricelist has changed, all the prices have gone up. Most drinks are $3.00 now. 

I feel they don't make the drinks consistently. I bought the Almond and Coconut and a lot of times they add too much milk, so you don't taste any almond or coconut.
author: Joseph F.

description: They've moved across the street and up a block.  I don't like the new location at all; the space is awkward and too narrow for the candy dispensers, and the whole thing has a temporary feel to it.  Still, the boba is just as I remember it, the tea eggs are hot and flavorful, and the candy and jerky plentiful.
author: Patty W.

description: Their milk tea tapioca is the best in town and they need to open a store in the Peninsula! I would drive from redwood city to inner sunset SF just to satisfy my milk tea tapioca cravings. The body of the milk tea is light yet rich in taste and the tapioca balls are perfectly chewy to the core. I have searched all over the Bay and have not found one close to what they make here at Wonderful Foods.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
best tapioca place. hands down.
so much better than tapioca express or quickly's.

i drive up all the way from san mateo to get tapioca here sometimes. yup, it's that goooooood.

their tapiocas are the best. very chewy. i really recommend their almond milk tea and honeydew milk tea. really good :)

everything is about 3 dollars. definitely check this place out the next time you're in the sunset area :D
author: Sachiko K.

description: Bubble tea that doesn't come from powder. At least it doesn't taste like it. :) Very roomy but not enough tables to sit at! The regular milk tea definitely has some reminiscent flavors of HK style - almost tastes like coffee. It definitely had a lot of caffeine in it!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Well, this place is obviously not the hidden secret I'd hoped it would be. I've been going there since their location on the other side of the street and nobody makes Tapioca like this place does. From L.A. to Berkeley down to San Jose or up to Chinatown. Not one place matches the flavor and I always end up spending $20 just on candy as they have a rare chocolate I almost never see anywhere else. It's also open pretty late, so if you're anywhere near the Golden Gate park area, it's worth the trouble to drive over and get a drink. It's kinda of a drive from downtown, roughly 1/2 hr each way but sometimes it's worth it. See you there!
author: Jon P.

description: only tried this place once but they get five stars for very good tapioca and their taro milk tea is the BEST i have ever tasted. i also tried their jasmine green milk tea and not much to say about it cuz it was made right but it wasn't the best i've ever had. didn't try their candies but i heard their chicken was good. i def wanna come here again for more of their drinks~
author: Kristine W.

description: If you want tapicoa milk tea and candy you have not seen in a while, do come here.  Great price for milk tea, and tastes good as well.  I definitely recommend this place over the hyped Purple Kow.  Just because the cup is bigger does not mean quality is the same.
author: Darrell K.

description: Wonderful Foods Co. is so much better than Quickly's.. or shall I say Slowly's. I like the environment in the store, there's candy to the left, some nasty chinese stuff that old people eat on the right, and cute workers. I'm not gay, but the two sons of the owners, Kevin and Justin, are quite the characters. They make the best tapiocas! Everytime I come here, I spend at like 100 dollars. Oops I meant 10 dollars
author: Doug W.

description:
The first place where I've gotten tapioca, and it's still my favorite!  I made several frantic calls to friends when I got back into down from college to find a Quickly at the old Wonderful Foods location.  Thank god I wandered around aimlessly and found the new location, or else there would've been tears, no joke.

The new store is definitely an improvement, with modern lighting and a classier feel (even if I did get a weird feeling that I was in starbucks...).  I'm also glad to say that despite the new look, their drinks are just as delicious as before!  Taro tapioca is still my number one favorite.  I suggest getting it warm, because the flavor is richer without all the ice diluting drink.  

All in all, an awesome place and I hope they stick around for a long time!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Wonderful is the place to go for tapioca. I started coming here in high school and kept going through college. Their boba is perfect and their drinks are tasty.

KEEP WONDERFUL ALIVE!
author: Tiff L.

description: The durian tapioca is TO DIE for. It's like a creamy heaven of unsaturated fatty goodness. It's some REAL durian!
author: Colleen W.

description: I remember my friend ordered the pudding milk tea tapioca once and it seemed interesting, so I got that the last time I went and wasn't impressed with the pudding addition.  The milk tea itself did taste good though and the servers were friendly.  I think I just have drink envy...where I always wish I had gotten what my friend ordered.  In addition, the place somehow manages to remain pretty clean and uncluttered in spite of how long it's been open, which is an incredible feat for a boba place if you ask me.  They sell chocolate covered gummy bears in the candy bins (something I'm always looking for)!
author: Jenn C.

description: Good tapioca. They have candy too which is a plus. Very popular place back when I was in high school. Tapioca unites everyone...fobs, Americanized Asians, even non Asians. Good stuff. =)
author: Jenny T.

description: Hmm...I really don't understand why the other reviews said the boba is really good here.  The pearls were barely sweet.  The jasmine milk tea was okary.
author: Cindy H.

description: According to my husband, this is THE  place to get a milk tea with boba. I think I read on sfgate that the owner imports the tea from Hong Kong. And I have to admit that their milk tea is the best I have tasted; however, I've never had the joy of drinking a whole cup as the caffeine gives me head aches. :( The bright side is that I've found yummy fruity flavors to drink instead. This place is so much better than those Quickly chains... their drinks always seemed too syrup-y to me. It's just a shame that their drinks are a little pricier than other places.
author: Jane H.

description: Lychee Tapioca is my favorite... and Im addicted! They have the best tapiocas .... LOVE this place!
author: linda L.

description: Mm Mm, the most addictive thing EVARH. My friend recommended it to me and I've been going there whenever I'm around the neighborhood. I love the Milk Green Tea, tastes like flowers! I am very tempted to try their Almond Tapioca because, hey, sounds great! Definitely the best place to get your fixings of milk tea.
author: Chia W.

description:
Strong teas, sweet, well made tapioca.  They are good people.  Good selection of candies line the walls.

Wonderful Foods Co gets four stars (from a base of three) because they are consistently good.  I also like the family that works there.
author: Amanibhavam K.

description:
Heh, sucked when they had to move because Quickly's showed up. Hmm... went there recently but didn't realize they raised the prices by a quarter (ooh well).

Like others said, can't go wrong with the tapioca milk tea here (although it somewhat resembles coffee more than tea). Parking's easy if you circle once or twice or feel like making a daring U-turn. It's also nice that they're open until midnight, right when you have a craving for tapioca.
author: Darren L.

description: BEST TAPIOCA in the Bay, no doubt! One of the original stores to offer it and still the best I've ever had! Their tapioca balls are always fresh and no one has yet to come close to replicating their awesomeness! I've tried plenty of others and no one compares to this family ran treasure.
author: S L.

description: Best tapioca in SF! They have maintained their business through many years of service and many competitors. Overall they still rise to the top on Iriving and in SF. Recently they have opened up a yogurt store down the street on Irving between 20th and 21st Ave. You should check it out, 50% off their yogurt right now!
author: Brady L.

description:
I love this place!  Even though there are a gazillion tapioca places within a few block radius, this place shines way above all of them.  Though I must admit, I was a Double Rainbow fan before it closed down and transform into the Orange monster, I vowed to faithfully support this small family-run business.  Their drinks are excellent.  The texture of the tapioca is perfectly chewy and never under or overdone.  But, truly they excel in the flavor of their drinks.  Our favorite at the moment is their Lychee Juice and Coconut Jelly tapioca drink - because it's real lychee blended to smoothie perfection paired with the gelatinous texture of the coconut jelly bits.  It's ideal for a warm sunny day!

Our favorites include the classic Milk Tea, Grass Jelly Tapioca (makes your teeth gray, but it's all worth it!), and my go-to, Honey Green Tea with Tapioca.  If you haven't tried it, try to swing by after you've had lunch at PPQ! ;)
author: Jana H.

description:
Tapioca drinks are delicious
service is quick
but the lady that works there behind the counter-middle age- w/ bangs
can give you a very cold stare that might give you an impression that she doesn't like you. no worries, It is not you it is her. Forgive and forget and order a tapioca drink. 
mmmmm my favorite is durian, many people can not stand the smell, but I love it=0)
author: Nancy K.

description:
I always love this place!!!
I love their milk green tea (or green milk tea??), taro, grass jelly, honeydew, etc.. The combination of whatever they put in the drink is always perfect. Service is always good.
author: Sailor M.

description:
Come here every Sunday and buy tapioca from them for the last 2 years consistently. Can't get enough of this stuff, can't stop drinking this stuff. I hope the Quickly's next door chokes on one of those dirty, infested tapioca that they made.

Wonderful Foods is the best, and you can;t get enough of their reasonably-priced, fresh, yummy-tummy drinks!
author: Hugh L.

description:
This place has the best tapioca in the peninsula!!!

They use real fruit, not like the powdered flavors from Quickly's.

Everytime I go to SF, i just have to get my tapioca here.

Renee
author: Ate quel l.

description: Best tapioca in San Francisco. Their tapioca balls are always consistently good, the right texture and chewiness. The service is okay, but what do you expect? The workers and owners usually talk amongst themselves while making your drink, not a big deal since it's a casual place. Avocado shakes here are tasty, and so are all the milk teas. The other candies and such here are a bit overpriced, but where else are you going to find the self serve containers in the Sunset. Anyways, tapioca drinks here are the best!
author: Rebecca T.

description: GOD BLESS THEM THEIR TAPIOCA IS GOOD. I'm a fan of the almond myself. Untapped menu item: watermelon ice slush. Ingredients are just watermelon chunks and ice blended together before your eyes - such a refreshing summer snack! Outside of the tapioca goodness, they have sweets and chocy galore. I hope someday to become bold enough to try the tea eggs or anything on the right side of the store...
author: Bailey R.

description: Still the best mango tapioca I have ever tasted! =D Fresh Fruit! nice consistency of boba as well!
author: Raymond H.

description:
The best passion fruit green tea I have ever had! Maybe it's the passion they put into it? haha jk! 

Anyway,  the only place that I found that had the best tea around in the bay area besides this place is ten ren and tea era.. everywhere is mediocre and just bypasses my palette by a little. 

Therefore, when I am in town again I will come to Wonderful Foods for yummy HARIBO candies and yummy passion fruit green tea with boba.. mmm delicious!
author: Mai H.

description:
My usual drink is #1 ($2.50), the black milk tea with tapioca. Sometimes I have it hot, sometimes cold (depends on the weather).  Today I had it served hot.  It seemed sweeter than I remembered, too sweet for me (though I've had sweeter elsewhere) without enough tea flavor.  They get the tapioca balls right though.  They taste very fresh with no goop on the outside of the ball. They're very chewy and softer than average.  Sometimes the balls are very sweet and theirs weren't.  So the balls were right up there with the best I've had.  Eggettes' pearls are very fresh too but sweeter and firmer.  I think I like the firmness of Eggettes' pearls and the lack of sweetness of the WF's pearls - so I'm torn.  I don't know which is better.  Tea wise, I prefer Eggettes but they also need to have a stronger tea flavor.  Like Frank B, I have not found the perfect PT yet.  I miss Ice House and the old Sweet House on Irving & 23rd (a spot taken over by Stars).  

The new spot looks nice, brighter and more open than their old shop on the other side of Irving St.  The candy and dried fruit bins used to take up most of that space.  Now the center part of the store is wide open (It would be a good spot for a few chairs.  Right now there is no seating.)  I spied an ice cream freezer on the right side but it was empty.

WF also has the bins of candy (gummies, jelly beans, hi-chew), Pocky(!), and bins of Asian preserved treat (plums, ginger, orange peel), several kinds of jerky and snacks.  Candy and pearl tea, that's a great combination in my book.

The pearl tea menu is lengthy and features unusual flavors like durian.  I just stick with three flavors though: black tea, green tea and red bean.
author: Lolia S.

description: My Boyfriend loves this place, but I rather go to Quickly. They only have the large tapiocas and so I always ask for my drink without them. Most of the time they get it right, but sometimes they silly add them even though they heard me and the cashier say no tapiocas. I'm too nice to tell them they are wrong and just take the drink. I also think the milk tea is too strong and sweet sometimes. Despite all this, I do like their pudding in my milk tea, the strawberry smoothie and the tea eggs.
author: Jess H.

description:
i've been coming here for about 2 years and i have to say that they have really good iced milk tea!  i usually don't get tapioca since it fills me up quickly and i can't finish my tea.  but the tapioca pearls are almost always incredibly soft and plump.  they don't have that yucky grainy mushy texture when you bite into them like some places do [i think it means they not fresh when you get that funky texture].

my iced milk tea is about $3.
bf orders strawberry banana smoothie with tapioca and that's also really good [i'm not a huge fan of strawberry banana anything lol - sue me  - i don't know what it is - i just don't like the combo that much unless it's the actual fruits are chopped up and mixed together in a fruit bowl]  his smoothie is somewhere around $4

definitely worth trying if you're a smoothie/milk tea fanatic.  they use fresh ingredients not the powdery crap like most chain places use and real sugar not that high fructose corn syrup that gets pumped into a lot of our drinks nowadays :[  i'm guilty of drinking things with hfcs in it
author: J K.

description: Overpriced, shitty service, and the drinks are blah! Not sure why they're always packed.
author: Jordan W.

description:
my favorite place to get tapioca.
ironically, my favorite drink is the milk tea with the egg pudding (great to have it hot on a cold day) without the tapioca balls. they also make a nice strawberry smoothie.
prices are a little steep, but i blame quickly for that. sigh.
i would have given them a 5 star if it wasnt for the occasional order mess up (left tapioca balls in there when i asked them not to) and the super long wait for when i want a drink hot (must have a crappy microwave back there)
author: Brian T.

description: They serve the best boba by far. I've been their loyal customer for over 10 years. All their drinks are legit. To seriously compare prices and quality. This place is only $1 more you get much better drink, faster service and place is clean! Sure I tried the cheaper stuff down the block. But I know I've done wrong and back to where I belong!
author: Kris K.

description: I've had my fair share of tapioca milk tea drinks.  From your mom and pop store to Lollicup and Quickly...Wonderful Foods has the best tapioca drinks.  The tapioca are big and chewy.  The milk tea itself is always flavorful and never watered down.  Highly recommend watermelon slush/juice with tapioca and tapioca milk tea w/ lychee.
author: hello k.

description: Upon finishing my lunch at a nearby restaurant, I was in the mood for some tea. So I stopped by this place. At first I thought it was a candy store with the row of candies and dried meat and stuff. Then I saw the menu for their teas. How can you not have strawberry green tea? When I ordered it they looked at me with blank faces asking me what's strawberry green tea. Sure the have oatmeal tea but not strawberry...weird. So I opted for a jasmine milk tea with pearls. It was okay. The pearls were a little too soft for my taste. All in all, I guess if you needed candy or something this place is the place to go. For the teas....I don't see anything special about it.
author: Kim B.

description: i rather get bobo here then quickly... remember when it was right next door too... but they move one block over... still my favorote bobo milk tea place, clean and fast... plus fresh if you order real fruits drink, you really taste... forget them power mixes, haha....
author: JessePanda C.

description:
number one: milk tea & tapioca
number two: milk tea, tapioca & pudding

and when i want some flavor, i'll have the taro (purple one), avocado, and honeydew.  the almond and coconut are good choices as well.

yuck on the strawberry milk (a little tart and synthetic tasting for me).

their fried pepper and salt chicken with fried basil is a great taiwanese snack very well done, especially when spicy.  great quick meal over steamed rice.  also the largest assortment of pocky i have ever seen, rotating flavors like dark chocolate, sesame, super strawberry, etc.

"best tapioca in town", just like it says in the storefront!  perfectly chewy, slightly sweet, very flavorful.

never disappoints, it's my standard for these types of drinks, everywhere i go.  

however, the newer generation of 'tapioca baristas'  tend to make the drinks not quite sweet enough.  be sure to taste your drink before leaving the counter, so they can adjust it if necessary.
author: Kimby T.

description:
I have been frequenting this place since my high school days and now that I am in grad school, I'm still going out of my way to get my #3 lychee tapioca fix. Even as an undergrad at UCLA, I made it a point to visit this place whenever I was home. 

My bf and I were a big fan of the Fried Squid Balls. Sure, it's loaded with MSG but we love it anyway. We always got it medium spicy and at first (as in a few years ago), it was okay. However, as we ordered it more and more, about once a week, it seemed to have gotten more spicy. It's the kind of spiciness that penetrates our tongues and stays there. When we soak our tongues with our own saliva, it just burns and burns until our tears come out. We soak our tongues with their milk tea to no avail. We swear that the lady in the back who makes the balls recognizes us! She's challenging us or something! We've already downgraded the level of spiciness to mild and it's still spicy! Maybe our tolerance for spiciness has gone down. I admit, while I love spicy food, I can't eat a jalapeno for fun. I can, however, eat a whole bag of Hot Cheetos without drinking water (I know all those spicy food lovers think Hot Cheetos are weak!)

Okay, back to my review.

I love this place. Tapioca balls - boiled to perfection. Soft and chewy but not too much. Definitely not hard like other places.
This place is really out of my way since it's in the Outer Sunset but I make my bf drive there anyway. =)  I see many others who drive there to get their tapioca fix, as well.  It's not uncommon!

Go there. Try something. You'll love it.
author: Tina T.

description:
Best Tapioca in San Francisco.  This is the original place to get tapioca in San Francisco back when I was in high school.  It's still the best in spite of the hundreds of Quickly's and Tapioca Expresses all over the city now.  

This place simply knows how to make the drinks the right way.  I always get the almond flavor here and it's my favorite.  The other flavors are also really good such as taro, coffee, and milk tea.  The thing that definitely differentiates this place from others is quality of the tapioca balls.  Every other place makes them too hard or too soft.  Wonderful Foods always gets the right consistency.  

I refuse to get my tapioca at any other place other than here.  Glad that they were able to find another place up the street even though they were evicted.
author: Scott L.

description: I like the tapioca drinks here but you have to watch what you get.  Don't get the Mango, it's nasty. It's a plus for being open late, but everytime my boyfriend and I come here, the service really SUCKS!  I'm all about service and the workers here are rude.
author: H. A.

description: i love this place! i used to come here when i was a kid when my mom worked a store near here, and i go every once in awhile now, the tapioca drinks here are the best! i also like to get those bulk candy that they have to weigh, pretty cheap per 1/4 pd i think? this place is good and the ppl at the cashier are nice [:
author: Bailey L.

description: This has to be the OG spot when it comes to Boba aka pearl aka tapioca drinks!  Ones that I would recommend, are the avocado, melon, milk tea, and the strawberry.  For those that are wondering what's cooking in that pot on the counter, it a tea egg.  It's a slightly salty tea flavored hard boiled egg.
author: Jason A.

description: I came to their old location.  I like their boba drinks it has flavors and is creamy.   The service is good, there are candy in bins and table to sit in.  They give fast t way better than Quicky.  I need to try their Popcorn Chicken,
author: John F.

description:
okay...so once you get in this place its kinda crazy looking because of all bins of dried foods...there's a lot of this and that, and some candy too!  but go towards the back of the store there's a counter where you can get bubble tea and snacks!

i think the bubble tea here is the best in the city and ive gone to a lot of bubble tea places.  i get the kumquat with rainbow jelly  (i like sour drinks) or the watermelon juice with bubbles.  a lot of places overcook the bubbles so they are all soggy and gross, the ones at wonderful foods are perfectly chewy.

try the popcorn chicken too!  its pretty good here!
author: Wendy S.

description: Im a fan of this place but some of there drinks is kind of over priced. If you think about it there is like five other tapioca place on the block and all there drinks is pretty much the same every where.  Recently, I cam to realize they give very little tapioca balls now. Before it was like a full spoon of it now is only half a spoon.
author: Jaden L.

description: The BEST boba milk tea in town, period.....  Always come for a drink at least once a week.  Do try their various favors, you won't be disappointed.  See you there............  ;-)
author: P. C.

description:
For some reason I find myself coming here maybe twice, sometimes three times a week. I usually get the #4 (green tea) and its refreshing and tasty. My wife insists on getting a drink and that is why I "have" to get one.
I have been coming here for about ten years and it seems so simple yet no one can come close to their tapioca drinks. 
Still the best in SF.
author: Carl C.

description: A place for someone with an ultimate sweet tooth. While waiting for my bubble tea, I couldn't help but eye the candies (helloo cavities!). Luckily, I was able to resist myself. I ordered the taro. WAY too sweet. Minus one star. Tapioca pearls = perfect.
author: Ileana H.

description: The sign outside their store says it all "Best Tapoica in Town!"  It's true!  The pearls are always of perfect consistency - chewy, soft and slightly sweet.  Never hard on the inside.  My favorite is the papaya milk shake with pearls!
author: Mick S.

description: by far the best tapioca + popcorn chicken ive ever had! i usually get milk tea with tapioca or egg pudding! if i want something fruity, i would get the watermelon juice w/ lychee jelly! and for snacks, i always get the popcorn chicken with extra basil leafs! so good. i love coming here after dinner for something sweet and often times even before dinner, just for a little snack!
author: Jo L.

description: Wow I can't believe I haven't written anything about this place and I go here all the time!  Well just so happens that I loved this place for so long and when I got married, I ended up moving less than a block away.  Now my belly is filled with boba (I just had two in a row).  Quickly doesn't even compare.  I like their new location, just because it's not next to Quickly anymore.  I can't write this without talking about the balls.  They are spectacular.  They're just so... ok I can't do it.  Forget it.  My favorites: lychee, almond, taro... yummy.
author: Stacey C.

description: Excellent tapioca quality.  the Mint Green is super strong and tasty.  Ask for it a little less sweet for pure tea goodness.
author: Rob K.

description: The best place for boba in the city.  Order the classic #1 milk tea.  I rate my boba based on how good the tapioca balls are, and they make them perfect here...not sticky hard which is just gross.
author: Yasmine G.

description: During high school, every time I am around Irving.. I tend to stop by this store. I come here for the candy and nothing else so that's my review on that. It's basically kind of like a Sweet Factory besides the other stuff the sell here. I used to get my hi-chews here before they were available at 7-11's, Target, etc.. basically before it was Americanized.. when it still had japanese lettering and the package was silver rather than white now. I came here a few days ago after getting some Tutti Melon and was surprised that it was still open past 11pm. Since there's no Sweet Factory around San Francisco anymore, this place is an alternative to my sour patch watermelons, sour belts, and mini gummy bears. I love mini gummy bears 'cause they just taste better IMO... still searching where I can buy mini gummy bears.. and someone should me sour gummy bears, they're super yummy when they're coated from the sugar/salt from the sour belts and watermelons. Mmmmm.
author: Jessica R.

description: good drinks good service....support you local mom and pop shops....
author: Lawton K.

description:
I used to be a regular and really liked this place.  I probably made 1 to 3 trips per week.  The drinks and tapioca are excellent.

However, the last time I went there, the woman that collects the money, an older woman maybe 40-50 years old, was sitting behind the register brushing her dog only a few feet from where they prepare the drinks.

You're not even supposed to bring dogs into restaurants or places where food is prepared and she brings her dog within 5 feet of the food prep area brushes it.  This is a blatant violation of of all kinds of health codes.  This is going to throw all kinds of nastyness into the area.  I don't care if that dog is bathed everyday (which I doubt) that's just disgusting.  

Just thinking about it is enough to send me a across the street.  I want to buy from local non-chain shops, but this incident has changed my opinion about Wonderful Foods permanently.
author: James Y.

description:
no doubt the best tapioca. been coming here since 1995ish.

but why why why does the owner guy bring his dog in here and put him on the counter?
sorta ick, right?
author: just k.

description: Ah... nothing more refreshing than getting my favorite..Honey green tea with grass jelly from Wonderful Foods on a hot ass day.  As I wait in the line.. the old maltese stares me down with his tired eyes... so stinkin cute.  This place is so far the best.. consistent quality and taste.
author: Alan N.

description: GO HERE FOR THE BEST TAPIOCA DRINKS---do NOT go next door to Double Rainbow! Perfectly chewy and not too sweet tapioca. Endless varities. My perennial favorites are honeydew and grass jelly tapioca, oh yeah and plain ol' watermelon juice for those hungover days.
author: kristin e.

description: after going down to san diego and falling in love with lychee green tea tapioca.. i have been searching all over sf for the best imitation.. but what i found at wonderful foods was way better! (plus its cheaper.. and damn closer than tea station in san diego.. lol) the lychee green tea (no milk) is my favorite drink here so far! and number 3.. i have a thing for lychee
author: JUDY L.

description: One of the best place for Tapioca drinks.  I also favor their spicy beef cubes, wished they didn't discontinue carrying them.
author: Kmaintl L.

description: My favorite tapioca place to go to. Their milk tea is great as well as their starwberry banana smoothies. The tapioca balls always seems to be just right. I love them and always ask for extra balls(:
author: Tee C.

description: I came here tonight because I was thirsty and wanted a drink. I got the banana strawberry smoothie with tapioca. It's hella good! Way better than Quickly's, no doubt about that. They give you a lot of tapioca also... But I think I'll skip out on the tapioca next time I come here. I don't think the tapioca here is good imo, but the drinks are!
author: Vivian L.

description: Their milk tea is one of the best. It has a strong flavor to it compared to other ones in the city. The tapioca balls are made perfectly, chewy and squishy. They give you a lot of balls. That would be a good thing except each ball can give you around 5-14 calories each. Your drink can vary and have anywhere from 25-75 tapioca balls making the balls carry 400 - 1000 calories not including the tea itself.
author: Armstrong B.

description: All I have too say about wonderful foods is that they have the best tapioca balls ever! BEST BALLS EVER! They're prepared to perfection! Great flavor.. and really chewy.... REALLY CHEWY BALLS! LOL ok... you guys are sick if you're thinking about something else! SICK!
author: Brian P.

description: I'm trying to calculate how many years I have been going to Wonderful Foods for Boba drinks and I think it's almost 10 years.  I don't think I've ever gone wrong with the Milk Tea or any of the other drinks there.  I've taken all my friends from out of town there and they agree that it's the best in SF or even their own areas in the Bay Area.  The employees there recognize me and I know who makes the better milk tea.  When the lady who owns the store makes the milk tea, it's the best.  She needs to train her employees a little better on the recipe.  But either way, you won't find better tapioca balls anywhere else.  If anything, try some of the Chinese candies or pick up some strawberry Pocky.
author: Chris C.

description: im so glad they relocated only a block away, probably because of the greedy Quickly (which is slowly taking over the tapioca world) that moved in right next door! Grrr! No matter what flavor i order here - coconut, almond, lemon jelly - my drink is always really fresh and the tapioca balls arent hard like some places that let them sit for a few hours. Their menu is not huge, but it is big enough and won't give you an eye cramp like Quickly's long menu does. And i'm glad that their drinks are still the same price (around $2.75 -4) after they relocated. Long live Wonderful food CO!
author: Douglas F.

description:
When this place opened up years ago, it was one of the first boba places in the City.  Now with other competitors, you'd think that they would shape up on service.

Came here on a Saturday during the day with a friend.  When we got into the line with 2 people ahead of us, the clock read 3:15pm.  The first person in line got her 2 drinks farely quickly.  The girl right in front of us proceeded to the head of the line and started ordering.  She ordered in mandarin, 2 total drinks.  One was a taro drink with jelly and no boba.  The other was a passionfruit drink with boba and no jelly.  There was one older lady taking the orders and a really young girl making the drinks.  The lady taking the orders repeated the girl's order SIX times before putting in the order.  Finally, she shouts out the order to the girl making the drinks.  The clock read 3:22.  It took the lady 7 whole minutes to get the simple order down and to repeat it to the person making the drinks.  The girl making the drinks took about 5 minutes making them because she kept screwing up on which drink and jelly/boba.  The whole time we were watching, I asked my friend..."How many Wonderful Foods workers does it take to get an order of 2 drinks right??"  We couldn't help but crack up.

FINALLY...we get to order.  We ordered two hot green tea milk teas with red bean.  By the time we walked out of the place with our 2 drinks, it was 3:40.  It took them almost 1/2 an hour to make 2 drinks before us and 2 of our drinks.  The next time I'm craving milk tea, I think I'll just drive farther.
author: Selene K.

description: MmmMmm...still the best boba in SF.  My favorite is the taro milk boba. It's totally hidden among all of the Asian businesses and low quality boba like Quickly with their icky and cheap tea.
author: Lan L.

description:
how does this place have 4.5 stars?? 

came here on several occasions because my brother loves this place.
i got some of their fruity tapioca drinks.  prices are a bit high but whatever.
their drinks may be real fruit & not powder but why is it that ALL their drinks have a hint of tea flavor??!  if i wanted tea i would ask for it!! 
this is totally unacceptable.  the only tapioca drinks ive had that are worse are the ones from sweet city in chinatown (which is now a quicklies) which smelled like old person spit.  

quite frankly i would very much prefer quicklies drinks.  
+ 1 star though because of the variety of pooh bear keychains & all the candy in the boxes like ichiban 

teaway all the way. 
i would come here and maybe try their milk tea but teaway has stolen my heart and their milk tea is supposedly really strong which i dont really like.... so it might never happen
author: R Y.

description: So after hearing all the rave reviews I decided to check this place out and was quite disappointed.  It was like every other soso boba joint I've checked out.  The tapioca was off and too mushy and the coconut was just off. Sorry, but I've had better, I definiitely will not go out of my way for this one again.  Customer service was good tho!
author: Syonora A.

description:
Living in Davis deprives you of all things Asian. Sure you have somewhat decent Chinese food and such, but generally, such things are few and far between, if not crowded to the brim with college students looking for cheap eats. 

So whenever I came home for the weekends, I began to crave boba. Why? I have no idea - I just wanted to suck and chew on balls (double entendre fully intended)  and I was in the Sunset so damn it, I was going to get boba! 

Now, I'm not new to the idea of boba. I've had quite a bit in my 18 years and I knew what to look for. Quickly was way too tired and "meh" after a few years and Teaway wasn't open at  the time. So i took a chance on this little shop that looked "clean." 

I looked at their prices and seeing as they were quite reasonable, I ordered the Watermelon boba. Wow. That was good. It wasn't sweet, so I need to ding them here, but given the weather (October?) you can't really blame them. 

Several months later, I tried Quickly.  Quickly tried to charge me an arm and a leg for the same drink, plus the cashier had seemed to be a bit confused. Hmm...not good. 

But I kept coming back to this place - even as I switched to Thai tea - their drinks were consistently good and they knew what the hell they were doing. Unlike TeaWay, who was cheap, these guys charged a bit more but at least they gave me the product, unlike the cashier who just asked me to choose another drink when she had trouble with Thai tea.  

So all in all, I'd give them a 4.5. But seeing as yelp won't let me give .5 stars, I'll have to give them a five. Grudgingly. Their prices are a bit higher, but their drinks (well, the Thai tea, at least) are pretty good.
author: Harrison M.

description: Their milk teas have improved by a whole lot, i've actually bumped the rating from 3 stars to 4 stars , however what drives me crazy about this place is that their TEA EGGS are SO Expensive.....its like 99 cents for each egg....WTF even i could make some myself and its so easy and simple....they really need to lower some of their prices.
author: Clementine D.

description: If I lived in the city I would definitely come here at least every other day.  As another alternative to Eggetes, I come here for their taro milk tea or their lychee milk tea.  The boba is just right, - not too chewy , and not to soggy. This place is always open until 12 am???  I love it!
author: leanna w.

description: The man (quickly) tried to keep these guys down by opening right next to them! But they're not going to keep the best tapioca place in the city down! New location bam! Right across the street...take that quickly! I'll always go to this place for my tapioca needs.
author: Terry S.

description: I've been going to Wonderful ever since it first opened and this is still my favorite authentic Taiwanese milk tea place. When it first open, the lines was extremely long and one of the worker had to go down the line to take order to expedite the wait time but it is no longer the case. The milk tea is very delicious and strong unlike the powdered milk tea that the other places have. My favorites: regular milk tea,lychee milk tea and the honey green tea milk tea without tapioca. I am not a big fan of tapioca balls but the one in Noriega has better tapioca ball. I would have given this place five stars if they have taro tapioca like Fantasia.
author: Allison H.
