description: Whenever I'm out here, I HAVE to stop by this place. Now what makes it a must go to place for me? CANDIED TAMARIND! I've been searching all over the city trying to find my tasty little treat but to no avail. Yes, I know they sell the packaged stuff in the store, but they never taste good (too sour, bitter, salty, etc) and how can you beat fairly fresh candied tamarind?! I ALWAYS get the larger containers and stuff it as full as I can. Those little morsels always brighten my day when I'm upset (and they're not as fattening as ice cream w/a more natural sweet than all the artificial sugars). They also have a wide assortment of other candied fruits such as the dried plum and mangos which are just as good, but I'll always be attached to my tamarinds. Maybe someday I should actually try some of the bobas they have there since I've heard they're pretty good..
author: Kitty K.

description:
How can little tiny balls create a sense of heaven?  Definitely the ones at Wonderful Foods can!  I absolutely think the boba here is the BEST around!!  They just do it right.

The milk-tea is the perfect blend of tea and milk.  Their avocado tapioca is actually made from fresh avocado and not powder.  And the watermelon is the most refreshing on a warm indian summers day!
author: Ruby F.

description: Even though you were my first (boba tea), and you have a loveable name, I've never loved you Wonderful Foods Co..  You teased me with beautiful gifts, but the attitude of your staff, the shrill lighting, and the thousand year old eggs glaring back at me from your checkout counter has always made your tea less enjoyable.  You didn't need my love, you were the queen of the Irving prom for years.  But now all the high schoolers are chasing the new hot exchange student next door.  What will you do?
author: San B.

description: Tea drinks are good here and they have all kinds of Asian treats and yummy gummi candy for cheaper than if you were to go to a Sweet Factory.  I recommend getting little or no ice in your drink as they tend to be overly generous with the ice so you get less tea.
author: Kit E.

description:
I love this place and have been going there since high school.  I don't go quite as often anymore because I've come to realize how bad the half and half they put in the milk tea is for me but I still have my cravings.  They never seem to disappoint me and no other tapioca store will satisfy my craving except for Wonderful foods.    

My favorites are the original milk tea and the green milk tea.
author: Amelia L.

description: The tapioca is so good specially the watermelon boba plus the green onion pancakes are as good as it gets!!!
author: Gigi M.

description: True BEST bubble tea in town. Custom order: mango pudding + extra sugar + no tapioca pearls + no ice.
author: Nancy T.

description: they have the best and the first tapioca in SF.  Its good and always been. the tapioca has the best texture and no one else does. no not even quickly, they suck!!!
author: GaLei J.

description: I am a fan of their fresh fruit juice smoothies with tapioca. My favorite is the papaya smoothie with tapioca. They use fresh fruit, milk, and some sugar syrup. The final product is just right and not overly sweetened. The prices here have gone up significantly. I use to pay $2.75, raised to $3.25 and now it's $3.75 for the papaya smoothie. I use to have this drink almost once a week, but when the prices went up this became an expensive habit. I go nowhere else for the fresh fruit smoothies. The parking in this neighborhood is terrible, so take the bus or just walk here if possible.
author: Candace F.

description: Compared to Quickly's or Tapioca Express, Wonderful Foods blows them away.  When Quickly's or TapX uses their syrup for drinks, Wonderful actually uses real fruits similar to lychee drinks.  Support the little guy over the franchises!
author: Wilson K.

description:
Had my first durian at Wonderful Foods. We had been going to Wonderful Foods for a while, and I kept thinking I wanted to try a durian boba. My boss had told me that the fruits are so vile that you aren't allowed to bring them on the plane, and hotels ban them. My wife sez that anything that is covered with spikes like that is nature's way of saying "keep away". But my curiousity got the best of me. I always said I would try anything that people said was food, no matter how challenging. The cute bobarrista didn't give me any warning--- if the gwai lo wants it, let him him have it. They pulled out a bucket of beautifull yellow chunks from the cooler. It looks appetizing. They went in back and blended it and presented me with a frothy yellow boba drink. They all watched with bated breath as I tasted it. To my credit, I didn't flinch. My wife, watching, asked me how it was. "Here, try it." She took one sip and cried out in disgust. When we would tell the tale later Alison would say how I didn't react when I first tasted it. Darned if I wasn't going to have her taste it. The Wonderful Foods people didn't crack a smile and we left. Who knows if they didn't crack up after we left. Walking down the street to the car I kept drinking the durian boba trying to decide if it was really the most disgusting thing I have ever had. It tasted like moldy socks soaked in kerosene and was starting to make me feel weird. We got to the car and the smell just filled up that small space. The first time we had gone to Wonderful Foods I had nearly choked on a boba, but this was worse. We drove a block, and finally couldn't take it. I finished it--- don't ask me how--- and I threw the cup away outside the car. Couldn't leave even the dregs of the disgusting stuff in the car. The rest of the night I felt weird. I said to my wife "I've never regretted eating something more in my whole life"--- not even the time I swallowed a dime and it got stuck. (What a nitemare that was.)

We went back to Wonderful Foods, and I stuck to the #1 milk tea. We bought the evil Chinese candy--- I particularly like the salted ginger soaked in battery acid. And I told the tale of the durian boba many times. After a year or so, I decided to have another one, just to see if it really was as disgusting as I remember. It was. But a few years have gone by, and I think it is time again.

And yes, Wonderful Foods has the best tapioca balls.
author: kenneth m.

description: It is the best boba in the city. I always get the almond boba, and it is the tastiest drink around. The boba is pleasantly sweet and has a nice bite to it. I do not partake in Starbucks/Peets or any other fancy coffee drinks, so this is really the only time that I indulge in calorie rich beverages. Totally worth the calories. I only wish they had a punch card for free tea.
author: Dana H.

description:
Good Shop.  A family from Taiwan who's always been good to me over the years.  The sons working at the drink bar have some attitude.  They act as if they'd rather be making Martini's for James Bond or something so they have to give me attitude.  Sorta like "Uhh, want do you want?......"  Because the owner is soo cool, I continue to buy there.  Quickly? opening up next door?  I can't believe they'd do that and I can't believe Asian patrons would "turn coat" and go there.  Some would say "that's business"....Well.....F*CK YOU!!!!!!!  I'm a strong supporter of family owned businesses.  I don't have the nerve to go to Quickly.  The owner treating me well over the YEARS goes a long way with me.  Quickly really sucks anyway....They are a "CHAIN" but they don't know SH*T about treating customers well.  
I'd give this place 5 stars if the sons would "lighten up".  Seriously,  over the past five years, they've never responded even after I ALWAYS say "Hello".  Pretty rude.  
Like I said, the owner has always been good to me.

Support your local businesses.  Keep Chains out of San Francisco.
author: Jubei K.

description: This is the original Bobba place. Their milk tea is so good and the customer service is superb--- much better than the service at quckly.
author: Sue L.

description: Honey green tea w/ grass jelly -- my new fave!!
author: Miss H.

description:
i come here for one thing and one thing only:

A L M O N D  B O B A 

they're open late (midnight?) and have a great array of traditional (dried salt plums, anyone?) and modern (coca cola jelly candy!) asian sweets. 

PLUS, they have a big display o' them capsule keychain toys. 

pooh bear, disney, helly kitty keychains- 
those addicting collectibles that leave you broke and miserable,
$6 worth of quarters later, 
you have EVERY single keychain in the series,
EXCEPT for the one you want. 

i'm not bitter. not really.
not when almond boba is there!!
author: Maihien N.

description:
This is truly the ultimate sunset "got nothing else to do but hang out with your asian friends" spot. I've been going here for honeydew, fresh watermelon, and sometimes almond bobas for about 4 years now.  Some of my friends come here to flirt/chat with the cute Taiwanese servers. The drinks are great, doesn't taste like the artificial drinks from Quickly's across the street, though it is much more expensive than Quickly. I think I'm attached to this business despite its priciness because its where everyone hangs out since high school. Other than that, the snacks are a lil over priced as well, but very tasty. A decent place overall.

P.S. they really need some damn chairs.
author: RJ C.

description: OMG so good!  I always get the sesame tapioca, and my boyfriend the almond tapioca.  Tea eggs are always good and yummy here, Black all the way through the white, just the way i like them.  The tapioca here is perfect! soft but not soggy, and bit al dente, but not hard. so good.
author: Mel H.

description: Best boba in the city.  You can try and argue that but you will be wrong.  I recommend the almond one.
author: angela k.

description: I like how their tapioca is nice and fresh . And pretty tasty too . I also like how their tapioca balls are perfect .. nice and chewy . My favorite is the banana strawberry tapioca . It was nice & thick and mm mm good =] It definitely keeps me coming back . The papaya milkshake tapioca was good too !! You can't even tell it's papaya . The taste of papaya is very mellow .. but a little too sweet . The lychee juice with coconut jelly & tapioca was okay .Good tapioca drinks , but certainly not the best so I don't think this place deserves 5 stars . However , Quickly's is nothing compared to this place . This place is sooo much better and only half a street away so next time you think about giving Quickly's a visit , think  again .. think about checking this place out instead . Btw , they sell candy too .
author: Eileen L.

description:
4.5 stars?? Are you people crazy?
The pearl tea at Wonderful Foods is not good!!! Seriously, mine was borderline gross, worth one or two stars. I got a lychee pearl milk tea and ugh. But I give an extra star because they have good candy.
author: R D.

description:
best tapioca, freal! 

this place gives you the real favor of how tapioca taste like. i like chewing the tapioca and its exactly how i wanted.
author: Valerie N.

description: Waaay better than the tapioca chains down the block. We drive across the city for their lychee milk tea. I like mine sans boba, but my brother (refuses to give up his lychee milk tea habit for a diet) likes to aim the big pink straw straight at my head and shoot the boba...while i'm driving.
author: anocha s.

description: Iced Coconut Lychee balls tea!
author: fivewordsorless ..

description:
The Salt and Pepper Chicken is the BOMB!!! enough said already hahaha

The tapioca is awesome there too!  I usually get the Honeydew Tapioca or Tapioca Milk Tea.  Both...grand choices!

The only complaint I guess is that the prices have gone up on a lot of things
author: Chris Y.

description: im not a boba fan but i do love going there for their candies!
author: Carol Y.

description: Boba galore on Irving! Wonderful Foods Co. is special in it's own way too. Their #1 Tapioca Milk Tea is their signature drink, while I usually go for their Lychee Milk Tea. For blended ones, I'd rather go next door to Double Rainbow.
author: Leroid D.

description:
if this place was any closer to me, i would turn into a walking talking boba...

that said, this place has gooood boba-- nicely textured, not overly sweet, and in plenty of flavors... just the way i like it.
author: Jill k.

description: I haven't tried a lot of tapioca drink places yet, but after giving the Quickly down the street from Wonderful Foods a shot today I can confidently give Wonderful Foods five stars. I will never go back to Quickly again for all of the reasons mentioned in previous reviews.
author: Megan S.

description: My taro drink was like a a pretty purple (white chocolate tasting) milkshake!  It was very rich and creamy, but it got to be a bit too sweet by the end.  Bonus points because this place also sells rock candy!
author: Krystle S.

description: #1 Tapioca place left, period. No discussion, no substitutes. It's sad that most of the tapioca places are chains now, all powder and fake jellies are thumbs down.
author: Matt C.

description: Tasty Boh Bahs  aka pearl tea. Chewy pearls and drinks are not diluted and full of tastes...papaya milk, taro and the list goes on and on. Also tried the tea eggs here and very yummy as well. They also sell dried fruits/fruit jerks and candy in the store.
author: Yan M.

description: I have to agree with the crowd, they have the best pearl drinks--all the fruits are fresh, not the powdered stuff that's used in other places.  I esp like their mango tapioca drink, man it always hits the spot.
author: Belle M.

description: So I'm sticking by this place.  Sure, it doesn't have the bright lights of the new place next door, but I'm quite content with the selection and quality of their drinks.  They have the best green bean drink ever!!!  I hope they stick around.
author: Joyce L.

description: I-LOVE-IT! I can't tell you much, but Boba and candy all in one selection OH BABYx3 It's the greatest thing when I crave for sweet factory!
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
ordered the honey green tea with tapioca and the honey green tea was alright but the tapioca balls were not as good as other tap places. 

3 stars...
author: Patrick T.

description: I love wonderful food co. I go here twice a week and the drinks are DEL-CIOUS... I get the Lychee Milk Tea and its perfect. The tapoica are very chewy. Also, they have a large selection of candy. I always come out satisfied. .=)
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I went there for the lychee milk tea based on another yelpers suggestion and could not believe my mouth.  How could a drink that tastes like medicine be tasty.  My niece who was with me said it tastes horrible.  I think i paid 3.75 plus 50 cents for pearls.  Highly overpriced.
Their pearls could not even compare to Sweetheart's.
author: lisa l.

description: almond milk tea with almond jelly!!!  it is sooo good here, and you can get lots of drinks cold OR hot! last time i checked, they said #s 1-21 or something like that. A bit pricey as a drink will cost you like $3.75 but I'd rather get quality over quantity any day. The store doesn't look like a normal boba store as the store is lined by dried fruits and assorted candies but the almond milk tea with almond jelly is the best. try it for yourself! the 4 bucks is worth more than 3 quickly's milk teas (at a dollar something each).
author: Joyce D.

description: I'm just adding to the broken record syndrome on these reviews but I love pearl tea from here!  I particularly recommend the taro flavor... mmmm.  I like watching them make them as well.
author: Sara S.

description:
best boba in Northern California. period. beats the crap out of Quickly any day.

not old enough to drink? get a drink here and you'll enjoy your night for at least a few more minutes. lots of candy in a wannabe-sweet-factory-bag is available, too.

always worth a return trip, and if you get bored you can shoot the balls out of your giant straw, it's fun to simulate different types of guns

[i.e. shotgun: line up 3 or 4 balls and shoot in one burst, machine gun: feed the balls into the straw and spit them out as they enter the chamber, et al]

as a bonus, the balls stick to the windows of all the rice rockets parked nearby, even as they drive past

Guppy Teahouse in LA is better, but not by much
author: Charles C.

description: Hubba Hubba- BOBA, BOBA... Okay so that place next door also has a sign that claims to be the Best in Town, but I am downright satisfied with my Boba here and I am not going next door for no boo boo boba.  Nobody makes a smooth, not overly sweet, avocado Boba like them.  Avocado is good for the skin you know.  The place constantly smells like the nasty eggs they got bruin in the cauldron, but you'll get over it.  And although I enjoy sucking the big tapioca balls out of my big straw, they also have a smaller size tapioca if you like.
author: sonia m.

description: A friend of mine introduced me to this place years ago, now he is the promoter of these parties at Icon and Fluid. Haha!! I didn't  know what  i was ordering, but i ordered it. A thai iced drink with round balls of jelly and supplied with a huge colored straw. Now I like this tapioca drink, it's very tasty and considered the best place to go to get one. You can try the one in the Stonestown Mall, but it is a waterly pale version of what comes out of this place on Irving. I recommend it highly!
author: herm p.

description: Wonderful Foods makes the BEST boba drinks!  I've tried many, many boba places all over SF, LA and Honolulu, and nothing compares!  My favorites are the almond and fresh watermelon boba drinks.
author: Teresa W.

description: I've been going to this place for years... try their   Honey Dew Tapioca
author: Sheenie L.

description: THANK GOD FOR WONDERFUL FOODS!! quickly is so over rated. i was sad when i thought wonderful foods had closed down but then i found it was a block down then i was happy again. I LOVEEEEEEE their popcorn chicken. they always make it at the perfect spicy level. yummm. i think im gonna go and get some now.. yumm...
author: Rhonda H.

description: The BEST tapioca in the city!! They have a good selection of flavors from teas and juices and jellies...I love this place because they aren't cheap with the tapioca balls (the guy there always gives me twice as much if i ask!). They are also really nice, actually understand english, and not as slow and annoying as those people at Quickly's across the street. I personally love the Lemon Jelly Tapioca and the Red Bean tapioca.....I knock off one star because they use Powdered-gritty-trans-fat-filled milk in all their milk teas and creamy drinks. (Which really disgusts me..) Thats about the only thing that Quickly has the upper hand on.
author: Jessica h.

description: The second best tapoica in town.  I usually order Honeydew tapoica and I love it everything.  Even though my friends complain about the price (compare to Quickly's on the next block), it's well worth it.  Always come here when I'm on Irving.
author: Joanna W.

description: Wonderful indeed!  After being terribly disappointed by bubble tea in Chinatown it was great to find Wonderful Foods Co where they make drinks with fresh fruit (amongst many other yummy things).  The kiwi was wonderfully tart, and the honeydew was also excellent.  As another reviewer points out the tapioca really is perfectly al-dente.  Oh, and the popcorn chicken is really good too, with lots of basil and garlic =)
author: Will A.

description:
I am going to have so say this is one of my favorite places for tapioca. I am quite picky when it comes to the perfect tapioca drink, esp the non-tea ones. 
I have been coming here for many years. MANGO SMOOTHIE WITH TAPIOCA is all I get and all I will ever get here. You can taste the real mangoes inside your drink and its always sweet (not sour or bitter). The tapioca is also cooked to perfection. I like my tapioca chewy and its exactly how they make it. Not once was it too soft or too hard. 
Next time Im back here, I should try something else and see if EVERYTHING is just as tasty but I doubt I will. Once I step foot into the shop, I cannot resist the power of the mango. lol
In addition to tapioca drinks, they also sell a variety of candy (like Sweet Factory) and Asian snacks.
If you want a quality tapioca drink, you know where!
author: Emily C.

description: Fresh strawberry smoothie with tapioca, how I miss you. Whenever I come home from school I always crave the deliciousness that is Wonderful Foods. A little on the pricey-er side but it's a local owned mom&pop shop so I will begrudgingly give them nearly 4 bucks for my fave. The boba are fresh and the smoothie is consistently tasty. I would definitely recommend everyone shell out a little more money and try Wonderful Foods over Quickly at LEAST once, so you know what quality boba tastes like.
author: Rayna L.

description: There isn't a better place in the city for boba, and I'm pretty sure I've tried all of them! Only wish there were tables/chairs--hope someone who works there is reading this!
author: Gloriane Y.

description: still the best milk tea in sf. quickly can't beat it. teaway can't beat it.
author: Hector W.

description:
wonderful foods is one of the best late-night options for quick snacks in the sunset. 

they make very fresh fruit smoothies (canteloupe, banana, kiwi, mango and taro are our favorites!) for their equally fresh boba. it's easily the freshest boba in san francisco. chewy and springy, never hard.

they also have a small selection of made-to-order hot snacks. their salt&pepper chicken (also known as popcorn chicken elsewhere) is hands down the best to-go snack you'll find! at $5 it's a little pricey, but the batter is flavorful, the chicken is fresh, and they throw in deep fried basil! so much better than quickly's version down the street. (i still love quickly for their 99c milk tea, though!)
author: julianne h.

description:
I LOVE this place. I go there every 2 weeks because of the delicious treats they have there. Out of all the tapioca shops I've been to, this one is the most fresh and delicious one. They don't usually use the horrible powder like other stores do. They use fresh fruits which is great (= The tapioca is always perfect. Not gooey, not hard, & most of all never stuck together with another tapioca making a clutter. 

Mango tapioca 4.25. WORTH IT.
author: Danielle Y.

description: Oh my gosh!! Wonderful Foods Co has the best red bean tapioca in the world. It is especially nice on a hot day... the red bean liquid has a wonderful texture (thick, creamy, and textured.. like a red bean should be) and the tapioca balls are sweet and chewy. YUMYUM!! I like to get it after school. By the way, the coconut tapioca drink is a little too sweet. Also, there is a really cute guy who works at the store!   P.S. Wonderful Foods Co smells really nice too :) like the sweet smell of tapioca
author: O K.

description: For those days/nights that I crave for a Pearl tea (aka "BBNC" for Bo Ba Nai Chai ...my friends like to call it that)...I go to Wonderful Foods.  In my opinion...the Green Tea is the best.  -- haha..yeah..I like "less balls" too.  I haven't been there recently...but the last time I went..they still did not have WARM ones.   -- I head next door for the WARM ones.  :)
author: Lise T.

description: Their balls are great~!!!!! My favorite would be the original milk tea tapioca...#1 on their menu. I tend to stay away from the honeydew tapioca because it tastes powdery to me.
author: Juli S.

description: My friends allege that this is the best pearl milk tea in the 'hood. Having now tried it, I believe they may be right. It is creamier and fresher-tasting than it's neighbor, Quickly, so if you are craving boba tea, skip the chain and go for Wonderful Foods Co.
author: Kathleen B.

description: I love this place!! I've been here since the store first opened and it started the boba craze in SF. I consistently order the Mango Boba, Passionfruit Boba, Lychee Boba, Honeydew Boba, Almond Boba, and Papaya Milk Boba. All are amazing, but the Papaya Milk, Mango, and Almond are my faves by far. The Papaya Milk is wonderful... it tastes just like the papaya milk I had in Taiwan when I visited. Prices are about the same as any other boba store, but the boba here is incredibly fresh. Wish they had a store in the South Bay, where I work.
author: Carolyn M.

description: Without a doubt, the most wonderful tea place in the Sunset and possibly all of SF
author: Arnold L.

description: BEST TAPIOCA IN TOWN!  So gooood.  I like the almond tapioca.  Now they even have fried foods.  Screw the chains, this is the place to go.
author: Kenton W.

description:
TARO TAPIOCA ftw!
I don't care if it's powder. 

The "fresh" strawberry smoothie is pretty yummy, but, and maybe it's just me... but I feel like it's a bit overpriced at $3.75? Okay so maybe it's just me.

They really need to add a seating area in the store.. I hate walking in seing so much empty space to the right. Too bare.. way too bare.
author: Diana W.

description: wonderful wonderful wonderful. good tapioca, prices are reasonable, fast service, watermelon slush tapioca!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Pearl tea with perfectly textured pearls, especially earlier in the day, and a delectably sweet fluid matrix.
author: Deb T.

description: Best Almond boba I've ever had!  I only wish we had one on the peninsula.
author: Julia W.

description: Really good boba drinks. The popcorn chicken was good, not all greasy. It was good but not the best that I have ever had :) Probably.. the best I have had thus far in SF.
author: Beach L.

description: This place absolutely rocks when it comes to tapioca drinks.  They have a variety of flavors and they make them all on the spot when you order.  The drinks here just seem to taste better than at Quickly, so I always find myself double-parking and sending someone in for a quick Strawberry Smoothie tapioca drink.
author: Polarg W.

description: The Bubble tea here is pretty good. I ordered the original milk tea without the tapioca. I really enjoyed the way they make the drink (not as good as the most of the places I have had in Taiwan - then again, this is not Taiwan :)~ ), but was not pleased with the service. I told them in Chinese that I wanted just the milk tea, but they put the tapioca in it. I had to tell them to remake it since I don't like the tapioca balls. The girl making my tea was not too happy even though I clearly said milk tea. Besides the bad service, I would still go back there for the tea.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Best DAMN Milk Tea and Tapioca I've had and will always continue to go here. The drive's all worth it, lol. Plus, they have all sorts of other goodies in there, candies and so on and so forth...it's heaven.
author: Sean E.

description:
one day i was going to get my haircut at salon de hong kong and was craving a watermelon drink... to my devastation wonderful foods was no longer there and in it's place, the quickly's that had opened up some time ago still remains... my first thought "VETO! VETO!" I don't like quickly! but luckily my heart was at ease after I walk out of the salon with a cleanly shaved head and I see wonderful foods accross the street from wallgreens! (cheers!) 
Not a huge fan of tapioca (something about having tiny brown balls in my mouth) but the drinks are top-notch.  total candy store, they have something for everyone!
author: Kevin C.

description: This place used to be my main source for good tapioca drinks. I have to admit, the grand opening special (that's been there for a year??) from Quickly's has drawn some of my business. But, I just recently went back and got a passion fruit slush (they made it especially for me) and fell in love again. mmmm, so good! they put jelly and tapioca in it! They're usually really nice and flexible like that, I'm sure if you ask, they'll do it for you. They also have a good selection of candies and asian snacks, though a bit pricey. And of course, this place is the only place with a bathroom on Irving, you know what I'm talking about.
author: Bridge H.

description:
They make the best bobba in the city and maybe the best bobba i've ever had. 

I love their #1 original bobba, it's so GOOD, one is not enough. The green tea and grass jelly juice bobba is very good, too.

I always come to this place for bobba eventhough i have moved across the bridge and even the next door Quickly can't beat their bobba.
author: sofie W.

description: I've been to Wonderful Foods Co. a few times for milk tea tapioca drinks, and the last few times I went there, the drink didn't taste as great as it usually does.  Also, every time I went into the store, there was also an odor of some kind that I am not familar with. I asked about it, and the people at the counter told me it was food of some kind, but, it made my stomach turn because it was such a strong smell.  For tapioca drinks, there are other places on this busy street that are yummier.
author: Lisa H.

description: Was this the place that Ed Jew accepted bribes from or was that Quickly? Anyway, extortion or not, I love this place. The best milk tea ever!
author: Jennifer C.

description: My favorite Lychee milk tea with coconut jelly - never fails me!  I've been coming here for the past 7 years... I hope they know how dedicated I am!  :P
author: Peter G.

description:
I love this store! It sucks how Quickly opened up next door to them but they have a new location now. It's only about half a block away from the old one (across from Walgreens, next to that rip off Pokemon cards store.) Quickly's tapioca will never compare to the ones they have here as Quickly's tapioca tastes cheap, rushed and just not the same to me. Try comparing their Lychee Milk Tea to Quickly's.

I also love their popcorn chicken (also know as salt and pepper chicken.) It's so delicious and the little leaf things they put in there are even yummy.

I heard they're trying to start a new desserts place too. That would be so cool! I think that's what the petition is for on the counter. I signed it. So the next time you stop by the store, don't forget to sign the petition by the counter!
author: Kon L.

description:
Expensive and terrible!   Everything tasted like powders.  
 Don't know why they're so freaking busy.  Those tapioca balls are deadly.  Almost choked on one.
author: Gina R.

description:
I used to be  regular at this place until recently. Whenever I ordered my drinks and asked to have less sugar syrup put in it, it always comes out utterly sweet!! 
And I think it's ridiculous that I cannot substitute the tapioca balls with something else... like jellies. That is only possible if I add an additional 50 cents to have something substituted.
author: Dianne I.

description: this place is just awesome.  the mango and strawberry are delicious.  quality and real ingredients instead of powder and water.  sure like them squishy balls.
author: thb t.

description: I love love love the watermelon tapioca and the green tea w/ milk, but what I really love THE MOST about this place is that their drinks ALWAYS taste the same. CONSISTENCY!!
author: Alice N.

description: Definitely one of the better places in SF to get boba drinks, though any boba place in SF pales in comparison to the ones in the Silicon Valley area. I'm a sucker for the tea eggs, but I think I got sick from theirs once. Their lychee milk tea has actual lychee in it, which is a plus.
author: Crystal L.

description:
1st of all, i can't BELIEVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE i'm THE FIRST to write something FOR SF.. wow... can i get some fireworks yelp?

this is my last review for the day, i wrote 3 as i promised since i'm limited on time, no i'm not at an internet cafe, i'm about to go to church // firearm crash course training.. yeeeeeeup!! =)

i think i may have found a boba place i'd prolly visit frequently, unless i find something else ... anyone?

great variety of boba drinks, lots of sweets on the side for you to pick up before you make yourself to the cash register ... great, friendly staff, and awful meter parking throughout...
author: Jennifer S.

description: Hands down, the best tapioca in the city! I've been a devoted customer for the last 9 years. Even if I'm within waking distance of 5 tapioca stores, I'll still go out of my way to drive over to Wonderful Foods to get a drink. Their tapioca pearls are always fresh and perfect in chewiness...not too soft, not too hard, not undercooked. (It takes skillzzzz to cook perfect tapioca...It's not easy, believe me, I would know!) Their Milk Tea almost tastes like it has a hint of coffee in it, so if you're a coffee lover, you might like it. I used to drink their Tapioca Milk Tea religiously, but now it's the Almond Tapioca. Most other stores seem to just offer almond milk tea, but not the plain almond drink itself (no tea). They also have a variety of candy, which I love because I can't get enough of those sour belts (the kind that you can't seem to get anywhere else besides Sweet Factory). WONDERFUL FOODS, I LOVE YOU.
author: Felicia C.

description: About four years ago, back when I lived in the Sunset district of SF, this was the place to be for some good tapioca.  They also sell candies, dried goods such as beef jerky and tea smoked eggs.  If you are a tapioca fanatic, make sure to check this place out.  I especially like the fresh watermelon tapioca.
author: Hung T.

description: They make the BEST tapioca drinks!!! They use actual fruits in their mixes, no artificial powder (ahem, Quickly), so it tastes sooo fresh and delicious! I especially love the watermelon and the strawberry/banana flavors. The boba balls are really good, nice & chewy & slightly sweet. YUM!
author: Ellie Y.

description: i love love boba and this is my favorite sf boba place to go.  i know their avocado, honey dew, red bean, taro and watermelon is good, but my favorite is lychee.  they have both regular or mini size tapioca balls.  there are so many choices, you'll definitely find something you'll enjoy.  check it out when you're in the neighborhood or when the weather calls for a nice cold drink.
author: Paulina C.

description: After coming here for years I can tell you that even though I liked the old Double Rainbow more, I would have to admit that they have the best tapioca in the city hands down. Why you may ask? It's because places like Quickly's seems to mass produce everything so you don't really get a sense of having a personally made drink. The place is quite small with no places to sit down at but that doesn't stop people from hanging out outside on a chilly San Francisco eventing. My two personal favorites has to be the Almond tapioca or the Lychee tapioca. Other things you may want to get there is their milk tea tapioca or their wonderful selection of snack foods (sorry for the horrible pun). The candy selections just like everyone else said before me can be a bit pricey but it does remind me of places like Sweet Factory. It's cool to see a wide arrangement of different candies and foods from Asian countries that you wouldn't normally find here. All in all this is a solid place to come to. I would rather spend a couple extra bucks for quality any day.
author: Jason Y.

description: Wonderful foods is the ONLY place I'll get a tapioca drink from. The tapioca is the perfect texture every time!!!!!
author: Denise C.

description: Best tapioca made with perfect consistancy everytime as well as excellent milk tea.
author: p a.

description: Absolutely the best - the right sweetness, the right tapioca consistency, big portions, great dried mango in their candy/dried fruit bins. I have tried boba all down the peninsula and nothing compares. I plan my trips to the city around getting to Wonderful Foods!
author: Allyson F.

description: I always go here for bubble tea when I'm down in sunset. Thirst quenching ice cold milk tea, chewy tapioca, and huge straws... just like they make it in Taiwan. Prices are high, but you are getting the best. Try the coconut flavor with coconut jelly to add a kick to your day!
author: M. W.

description: BY FAR the best tapioca in the bay area (I've tried hundreds). I've been coming to Wonderful Foods since the third grade, but the one near my home closed so I've been driving 30 miles to this one for the exceptional, uncomparable green milk tea tapioca. The owners have known me since elementry school and always give me extra tapioca or a discount. They are one of the few tapioca stores left that use real milk tea and not powder. Trust me, I've worked at a tapioca chain, and the stuff we used was gross. I know the drinks here are always fresh. Everytime my parents grocery shop on noriega, I don't mind tagging along because I know I'll be coming here. It makes my day. Nothing else like it!
author: J J.

description: I've been coming to Wonderful Foods Co for about 5 years! Way better than Quicklys. I LOVE THE #3 WHICH IS THE MILK TEA W/ LITCHEE.
author: Monica N.

description: Seriously the best tapioca place in S.F. At other places, you get hard frozen tapioca made with powder. But this place gives you fresh tapioca made with real fruits. In addition, they have a lot of sweet treats =).
author: Michelle J.

description: Best tapioca ever! I've been coming here for my whole life! My favorites are milk tea, strawberry milk, and honey dew. Quickly's sucks!
author: Ale x.

description: not to beat a dead horse but there are basically only two boba places in san francisco. sweet delite on clement and this one. the rest all pale in comparison. wonderful foods is a bit out of the way unless you live in the sunset but the boba is damn good. so well worth the trek. it's open quite late too. so if you get that post-dinner hankering for boba, head on out to wonderful foods. you won't be disappointed.
author: jen m.

description: hands down the best tapioca in the city.  i love the passion fruit tea and the taro (the purple mix version, not the real version).  i'll make the trek to sunset just for this place.
author: Swarup B.

description: I always go back from time to time for the red bean tapioca drink.  It is heavenly good!!!!  No where in the bay area I can find a better one.
author: Aggie Y.

description: best milk tea!! it has just the right amount of flavor & it's not too sweet like quickly's. get milk tea with almond jello!
author: Val L.

description: The freshest pearls of any place I've ever tried. Yummy! The red bean is my favorite but they have so many other flavors.
author: Christine N.

description: prefect chewy boba.... this is where i get my avocado juice fix. note: if the owner made it.
author: sherly A.

description: ooooo need to come back for the REAL good stuff!!!!  my first & the best tapioca milk tea i've had.............tapiocas do have the perfect soft texture & chewy consistency................watermelon juice is soooo refreshing on a hot day!!!
author: Cindi N.

description: moved to a new location across the street. from the (not so hot anymore because of the Ed Jew scandel.Quiklys) Love their Lychee milk tea. their mango and Kiwi boba is also a must.  Boba is very good. they use fresh fruit and the service is FF .. Fast and Friendly.Tell Norman I forced u to go there.  they got the cool capsule toys here too. Peek a pooh!!!
author: Mark F.

description: My absolute favorite place to get Pearl Mike Tea. My favorite is the lychee Mike Tea. ....They moved across the street from Walgreen's. So, no worries because when I walked to the old location on Saturday I thought they were gone. (I was so upset I missed the sign. LOL. I kept thinking.. stupid QUICKLY) Anyways, Wonderful Foods is still around. YEAH.
author: vernice l.

description: if you like asian type tastes like tapioca drinks and what not, this is the place for you. end of story!
author: Stanley C.

description: Love love love the pearl milk tea drink with less tapi and almond jello.  Yum.  Good thing I don't live in the city because I'd buy one of these every day!
author: shelly t.

description: Hands down, best tapioca-boba-bubble tea in the city.  I love the Honeydew Tapioca!  Get the popcorn chicken and you're set.  Great for an afterschool snack, post-shopping snack, whatever.
author: Connie P.

description: This place rules! By far one of the best places in San Francisco. Whether it be their milk tea, almond drink, watermelon juice, or what have you... you won't be disappointed. I love the fact that they are always working to improve their menu. I'm not into the pearls but the drink is well worth the money. Feeling nostalgic? Try a couple childhood favorites to jog your memory. The Red Bean or Almond drink does just the trick for me. :)
author: Kacey K.

description: I've been a customer ever since this store opened.  Yummy...lychee milk tea with lychee jelly *drool...*.  They have a huge selection on their menu and they have snacks as well as candy!  The pricing on the menu is what you pay, unlike the other tapioca stores *ahem...quickly's* that charge you tax on a drink!  Luckily they moved a block down from the newly opened quickly.  I would drink at Wonderful's over quickly's anyday!
author: Linda H.

description: I still love thier tapicoa the most. Didn't they start the whole tapioca business? Well, I like it a lot more than quickly.
author: bob k.

description: this place has the most bomb ass pearl tea you'll ever have....only competittion in the entire city is Sweet Delite down in clement
author: Brian Y.

description: This place has the best tapioca anywhere! Everything from the basic milk tea, to fresh watermelon, to the fresh taro, everything is amazing! Also try their spicy salt & pepper chicken!
author: Anne D.

description: The sign says best tapioca in town and its right I've been to this place ever since i was 4 or 5. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!! =)
author: Kim Y.

description: unfortuantly. they moved from their old location which is now a cellphone place. but it looks like business is good. milk TEA is Great. I go here when im in the sunset .but usually I go to eggettes in glen park. because they have egg puff and a place to sit and hang out..
author: derrick d.
